29.description: I love their chicken salad!!! However, I was bummed when I tried to order JUST the chicken salad w/o the bread and they still charged me for the entire sandwich and it's a very small portion. They could have at least taken $2 bucks off ...

42.description: Great sandwiches.  I enjoyed the Wreck and the Italian.  Toasted like Quiznos, but they don't skimp on the meats.  Very friendly staff and superfast service.  And cheap, too!

23.description: I'm a big fan of Potbelly's. That magic sandwich of melty goodness is enough to make my day!This location is quick with a lunch crowd, even the time I was stuck behind Mr. "I have a super specific order and you messed it up slightly so remake it." Sheesh, pack your own lunch dude. There are usually quite a few college kids in here, but in general the atmosphere is pretty quiet. Love that little bit of calmness on a lunch break :)

8.description: This place reminds me of Quiznos, if Quiznos had a more focused branding, better selection, and better ingredients.  It was a very atmosphere, great service, and deliciously fresh ingredients.  I'd go here over and over again!

31.description: A Potbelly's Haiku: Dreambar and a shake!Solerno Butter Cookie!Sandwich and a treat!

34.description: Awesome sandwiches!  For under 5$ you get a good size sandwich, and DANG is it tasty.  I had the Italian, the hubby had the Wreck and they were both wonderful.  The bread is not too overwhelming, I hate having to fight a piece of bread to get to the good stuff.  The veggies, sauce and meat are all high quality and in good portions.  The loaded baked potato soup was about $4 for a large portion and it was super creamy and delicious.  The staff was nice, service was quick.  Potbelly tops any subway, Quiznos or Togo's I have ever been to.  I would say besides a real deli sandwich, this is the best you can get.

16.description: Damn good sarnies!!Eat here for a nice sandwich with plenty of choices for a decent lunch with a classic styled cafe /deli feel.  Have vegetarian friendly choices too.In spite of the affordable menu the three locations I have visited actually have all provides a pleasurable dining experience and atmosphere. The sandwich comes warm...Yum!  The bread has the perfect light crispy texture to the crust and inside the different sandwiches have had nice overall flavor.  I always add the hot giardinera it's delicious!Helpful staff every time and condiments that are fresh.Great for a quickie lunch that's delicious. :)

13.description: How can you go wrong with a sandwich that you select the base product and then the toppings? Their soups and salads are equally good and their pricing is moderate, even in downtown Chicago. I try to arrive prior to 11:45a, just to beat the lunch rush because after that time the line can become very formative. If I miss this time frame I work through lunch and plan to go around 1:30p. One more tidbit; their cookies are too die for!

11.description: I love cozy sandwich shops. I love Printer's Row. I love Nantucket Nectars. I'm a history buff who likes old print material, and I usually take the train into the city. This Potbelly location is like a vortex of stuff that makes me happy. I can get off at the LaSalle blue line, walk over here, grab a meal, and continue on foot to another destination. The staff is friendly, they have live music on occasion, and yes, this location is one that has breakfast! Not all Potbelly stores serve it or are even open that early. This probably explains why this one always has plenty of OJ in the beverage case.One thing I would like to see different here: cleaner tables. The staff are not as on top of wiping down after customers leave as they should be. On two occasions I have set my book down in a puddle of soup that I didn't see because its color matched the table. Still, it's no worse than at some of the other nearby Potbelly locations, which also tend to be busier and therefore messier. (I'm looking at you, State and Lake Potbelly, with your mayo-coated napkin dispensers and Art Institute Potbelly, with your lettuce explosion chairs.) It's also not as bad as Subway, where I sometimes suspect the tables get cleaned twice a day--once at opening, and again at closing.Bottom line: this is an improvement over many other fast food options in the area. It beats most competitors, too. Get your sandwich here and tell Wabash Subway to eat your dust.

39.description: I love sandwiches. Actually, most of my reviews on here are probably for sandwich places. Anyway, Potbelly has great subs, and they're really cheap. I like the chicken salad with lots of mustard. Yummm. And with a can of Mr. Pibb, the total's only about $5.78 (approximately. ha.). Yeah, I'm a regular here.As for the atmosphere, well, it's Potbelly. They all look pretty much the same. It's good though. And I like when there are people singing up on the little stage thingy. It makes me happy.

37.description: This place is my usual hot spot for lunch.  The staff is great because they are pretty good at remembering my usual Italian salad. ohhh delicious!  But every now and again I'll get A Wreck sandwich made skinny.  This place loses a star because the cashier always rings up a regular Wreck sandwich instead of the skinny Wreck sandwich.  So basically, I am paying more for less bread and less meat. Its already happened to me twice. No more!  But overall, a great place to stop in for lunch. Especially since its right around the corner from me.

0.description: Came here for lunch with my husband who raves about this place. Unfortunately, I was not hungry enough for a sandwich so I opted for chili and a cookie instead. The chili was awesome. It was chunky just the way I like it and served at a perfect temperature. Also, I was given a good amount of crackers to put in the chili. The cookie was great as well. It was oatmeal chocolate chip (which is my favorite but is so hard to find!) and it was so good! It was perfectly baked so that it was soft. Only wish they had coffee to eat with the cookie! This is a great place to grab lunch or just a small snack.

38.description: I like Potbelly because it doesn't lie about what it serves and it's super cheap. Out of all the fast-food style sandwich joints I recommend this one for freshness, service, and mustard selection!

27.description: Excellent sandwiches, if you like it hot there hot pepper are awesome.  The service is fast and friendly.

32.description: My husband and I visited Chicago just last week and I must say I wish I had one back at home. I purchase the sandwich "A Wreck' with the works. Including their prized pickled peppers and olives. Much in the style of Quizno's where the heat the sandwich on a conveyor belt, but the bread and meats are way better. Very good price. Makes eating out affordable without having to subject yourself to McDonalds or Taco Bell (which I refuse to eat at for numerous reasons).

44.description: They make the best sandwiches in the world! Even if it's just a "simple" turkey breast sandwich filled with all the good stuff, there is something about it that makes me go back all the time!

24.description: I love Potbelly's! While at the Lit-Fest on Printer's Row, I opted to visit this place to get a light sandwich. While I would have preferred a wrap, those are a bit hard to find in Chicago. But the skinny tuna sandwich I got was out of this world! In fact, it was the best tuna salad sandwich that I have ever eaten! The bread was lightly toasted and the tuna and fixin's were just divine. You really can't beat their prices, the atmosphere is great, the restaurant design is really cool and the staff is great! Yeah!!

7.description: The Italian sandwich was delicious. It had a lot of flavor. I had it with tomatoes, lettuce, onions, mayo, hot peppers & Italian seasonings. I was going to get the chicken salad b/c people post that picture, but I'm glad I went for Italian instead.. I would get it again & it was so convenient b/c there's literally a location almost every corner of Chi-town lol

40.description: It was 2pm ish and I hadn't eaten all day. It was right next door so I thought I'd check it out.Way cool. for under $7 I got a can of diet coke and on a wheat roll a ham & swiss plus bacon + mushrooms (an extra fiddy cent each) then topped with mustard, hot peppers, diced onions and tomatoes. Simple but awesome. The sandwich artists were very polite, the second one was even like "oh damn dude, that smells good even" and the cashier even after I paid offered and extra bag to hold the sammie and can of coke (I had a backpack on and was gonna hop a cab).A nice solid place for quick and very delicious sammies. I'm a fan :-)

30.description: I will keep this review as simple as I can.  I know I can get kinda wordy with these things.  This is the first time I've ever been in a low-pro sandwich joint and after I was done I went up to the cashier and said, "Wow, that was a delicious sandwich!"To bad they aren't out in Southern, CA.

1.description: My boyfriend and I were visiting from SF and he insisted on eating there. I was skeptical in the beginning but it's probably the best sandwich I had tried. Compared to subway their bread is heaven. Tip: you can combine their famous a wreck and meatball, it's called the wrecking ball.

9.description: I had a great experience at this Potbelly Shop. After walking around for what seemed like 45 minutes I stumbled upon Potbelly. I had heard good things from friends and it lived up to expectations. They have a conveyer line style of assembly with a toasting oven in the middle. You order your meat and bread, toast it up and then choose your toppings. I went with the roast beef with everything. It was just warm enough to give that extra feel of indulgence. The ingredients all seemed fresh and tasted great.I think the number one thing about the location was the staff. Everyone who was working there was extremely friendly. I was in town for a test and was feeling a bit stressed out, so the little things really made a difference to me. I remember the cashier made an ever so slight little extra effort that really made me feel good. I definitely think fondly of this sandwich shop.

26.description: Everyone that eats at Potbelly's from out of town says.. "I'm going to steal this idea and open a place like this." ... I hate to break it to you but it's an improved and cheaper version of Quiznos.. Those aren't working out too well.Do it right and get yourself "The Wreck" with everything on it.  It's delicious.  They also have really good soups and cookies. At this location the staff is always cool and it's not as busy as other locations (think state and lake).Cheaper than Pockets and SRO in the neighborhood and defiantly better than subway. Living in NYC I miss grabbing the occasional sandwich from here!

25.description: I'm a fan. I've been here only once to check it out because I was told this was the go to sandwich place. It reminds me of Quiznos. Good selections and good sandwiches. Reasonable prices.

12.description: Stopped in for lunch on a blazingly hot day.  I normally gravitate toward the excellent toasted grinder sandwiches whenever I visit one of the Potbelly Sandwich Shops (it's a mini chain, started in the late 1970's on Lincoln near Belden in Chicago's Lincoln Park neighborhood).  But it was so blasted hot outside (103 in the shade) all I wanted was a cool salad, a bottle of cold Nantucket Nectars lemonade and a chance to soak up as much air conditioning as I could.  I opted for the excellent "farmhouse" salad, a variation on a chef's salad, with lettuce, chicken, bacon, crumbled hard cooked egg, tomatoes, cucumbers, red onion and crumbled bleu cheese for extra tanginess.  I chose the "Potbelly vinaigrette"--couldn't tell you exactly how this differs from standard vinaigrette, but it was good.The line at the counter was long, as it is at any Potbelly's at lunchtime, but it moved quickly.  The salad was assembled in front of me, and not premade, a nice touch.  There were enough booths and tables to accomodate the crowd.  I didn't see the usual Potbelly second floor seating or an area for live musicians, so this outpost may be slightly smaller than the Lincoln Park or Evanston shops I frequent more often.

21.description: I love cozy sandwich shops. I love Printer's Row. I love Nantucket Nectars. I'm a history buff who likes old print material, and I usually take the train into the city. This Potbelly location is like a vortex of stuff that makes me happy. I can get off at the LaSalle blue line, walk over here, grab a meal, and continue on foot to another destination. The staff is friendly, they have live music on occasion, and yes, this location is one that has breakfast! Not all Potbelly stores serve it or are even open that early. This probably explains why this one always has plenty of OJ in the beverage case.One thing I would like to see different here: cleaner tables. The staff are not as on top of wiping down after customers leave as they should be. On two occasions I have set my book down in a puddle of soup that I didn't see because its color matched the table. Still, it's no worse than at some of the other nearby Potbelly locations, which also tend to be busier and therefore messier. (I'm looking at you, State and Lake Potbelly, with your mayo-coated napkin dispensers and Art Institute Potbelly, with your lettuce explosion chairs.) It's also not as bad as Subway, where I sometimes suspect the tables get cleaned twice a day--once at opening, and again at closing.Bottom line: this is an improvement over many other fast food options in the area. It beats most competitors, too. Get your sandwich here and tell Wabash Subway to eat your dust.

17.description: I'm a big fan of Potbelly's. That magic sandwich of melty goodness is enough to make my day!This location is quick with a lunch crowd, even the time I was stuck behind Mr. "I have a super specific order and you messed it up slightly so remake it." Sheesh, pack your own lunch dude. There are usually quite a few college kids in here, but in general the atmosphere is pretty quiet. Love that little bit of calmness on a lunch break :)

10.description: The sandwiches here are pretty awesome. The selection isn't amazing, but unless you are super picky you will find something you like. I hear the shakes are real good, sadly, everytime I go they are finished with shakes. Which is weird, but whatever.It is just a good and quick place to eat. Oh and definitely toast your sandwich. Thats what makes it good.

5.description: Very good flat bread breakfast sandwich. 1 block from the blue line for those traveling and who need a respite with a comfortable atmosphere and quick service.Service was friendly

3.description: I enjoyed this restaurant. I heard a lot of good things about this place. My co-workers and I had a great time here. For the price not a bad choice. They have a lot of locations in the area. I'm not from this area but I see why they have so many locations.

35.description: Sometimes you take people that you love for granted.  I realized that you can take food that you love for granted as well, when I thought about how some of my favorite fast food (as in "fast food" outside the realm of McDonald's and Co.) places were neglected in my reviews.  I thought I should begin with Potbelly, since they have my all time favorite vegetarian sandwich, and I should review the place on Printer's Row, since I worked there for a whole year and miraculously bear no ill will.Well, all I have to say is this:  I LOVE YOU, veggie sandwich on wheat (as in "wheat") with extra pickles and giardanera.  I just love you.

19.description: I will keep this review as simple as I can.  I know I can get kinda wordy with these things.  This is the first time I've ever been in a low-pro sandwich joint and after I was done I went up to the cashier and said, "Wow, that was a delicious sandwich!"To bad they aren't out in Southern, CA.

28.description: awesome sandwiches and shakes.

45.description: Designed in 1891 by the architecture firm Holabird and Roche, the Pontiac Building is the oldest standing building in Chicago by them. It has several protruding bays that are wider than on other buildings in the area. This Printers Row building now has a Potbelly on the main floor.

33.description: It's been a few years since I've eaten here, but Potbelly is a must whenever I'm in Chicago.Love the bread, huge fan of their brown mustard (best mustard ever!), everything is fresh and the amount of filling/toppings is just right!  Once I was fortunate enough to receive a complimentary container of their mustard to take home to Miami.  I actually asked if I could purchase their mustard and the girl on the counter just gave it to me as a gift.  I thought this was an awesome gesture!  I treasure that mustard for special sandwiches only.  Even if I don't come anywhere close to replicating a potbelly sandwich.If i happen to see a bright, shiny star, my wish is that Potbelly comes to South Florida.  In all honesty, this is the only "sub-type" sandwich I actually like (love).Sheila's Dream Bars are just what the name implies.Now I'm craving a turkey-swiss sandwich....and I won't be going near Chicago any time soon!!! Boo hoo!!!

43.description: Sometimes I dream about The Italian and a warm, fresh oatmeal cookie.  By sometimes I mean every time I'm not eating one.  Best sandwich place ever!

2.description: The wreck is a must when you come to potbellys. This shop has everything you are looking for sandwiches or salads they are all very tasty. Would recommend to anyone who is in the area.

18.description: Everyone that eats at Potbelly's from out of town says.. "I'm going to steal this idea and open a place like this." ... I hate to break it to you but it's an improved and cheaper version of Quiznos.. Those aren't working out too well.Do it right and get yourself "The Wreck" with everything on it.  It's delicious.  They also have really good soups and cookies. At this location the staff is always cool and it's not as busy as other locations (think state and lake).Cheaper than Pockets and SRO in the neighborhood and defiantly better than subway. Living in NYC I miss grabbing the occasional sandwich from here!

41.description: Oh, Potbelly's, how I miss thee! The most delicious fast food sandwich shop- without the feel of fast food. I usually watch my calories, but here it's all about the mayo, melted cheese (that's right, their veggie sub has 8 slices), and drizzled olive oil.  And it doesn't stop there- their fresh chocolate chip oatmeal cookies are perfect.I guess it's a good thing they're not here in NY- I'd probably have a HUGE ol' potbelly if I didn't have to resort to eating moldy Subway sandwiches for lunch!

4.description: The food is great and the line moves pretty fast. Now here goes the problem...last week me and a friend go in and he's telling me what I should get on my sandwhich, Ciara(I was told is her name) tells him to be quiet and just chimes in on our conversation. We get to the register & she says, "you not even gonna pay for her food!" I just thought that was totally unprofessional and she overstepped her boundaries. But it doesn't stop there! Smh...The other day I go in and Catrell whom is a sweetheart is fixing my sandwich and I ask Ciara(employee) hi, how are you" she says fine now that I'm not making your sandwhich". My response is "Excuse me?" She says " no, you just always ask if I have everything". I couldn't believe she said that! Well excuse me Ms.Ciara, I didn't know it was against the law to make sure my sandwhich was correct. She was totally rude, again. Even if it were a joke it wasn't funny and a very asinine comment.

6.description: I came in here for a late lunch on Saturday to fortify me for the rest of my errands. I had never been to this location of Potbelly on Printer's Row. The menu was standard- I went with the roast beef original on flatbread- but I felt that that service really put this location over the top. From the order taker, to the person crafting the sandwiches, to the cashier, everyone was across-the-board competent and pleasant. The restaurant itself is laid out nicely, with ample seating. I am sure this location will be a veritable mosh pit next weekend, when Printer's Row comes to town, so I am glad that I had the chance to scope it out and enjoy a bite of lunch before then. Potbelly is always a reliable option and I will make it a point to return here.

22.description: Fantastic sandwiches, great live music, and excellent service. This potbelly, like most others I frequent, has it all and always provides a great meal and experience.

15.description: ordered tuna salad sandwich last night. same good as all other sandwiches. there was only one staff yesterday, but she is quite efficient.

20.description: Pretty good. The staff and personnel were interactive and friendly and helpful. One guy gave me a free dessert since it was late at night! They were fast and tasty. As this was not exactly my kind of place (I prefer more unusual or organic food), I give it 3.5 stars.

36.description: I love potbellys as far as generic sandwich places goes.  It's better than Subway, Goodcents, and even Quiznos, but they're ok too.  Sometimes the sandwiches are definitely better on somedays than on others, but that's normal.  It gets five stars because one time I came here with a bag from H&M and since I have to bring new meaning to the word scatterbrained everyday, I left my bag there.  Three weeks later the girl making my sandwich asks if I was here with an H&M bag and I leave with everything I bought three weeks ago.  The service here is ridiculously nice.

14.description: best hangover food I found in Chicago that was close to my hotel. Seriously yummy and those pickles...yum!

12.description: I don't know what to say about this salon.  I've always had bad experiences at salons as a whole.  This experience was very different.  I walked in there and no one speaks. It's so quiet with the exception of the blow dryers and water running.  People look at you and still no speaking.  It was creepy! LOL  They even make you get your own drape from the open closet/coatrack.  That was odd.  I had my hair washed and blown dry and flat ironed.  Let's say I left there looking uglier than when I went in.  My hair was a frizzy mess. Luckily I had my cap with me.

3.description: Where is the 0 star option? As a black woman with short hair it's very hard to find a good stylist. I was on the hunt for a good colorist and I was referred to Josef from a lady i met at the mall. And after seeing her hair I was excited to go here. I didn't know it at the time but it turns out to be the same salon my mom had been going to for more than a decade. So I figured that I was in good hands. I wanted them to die my hair from dark brown to blonde, which is a difficult process so I wanted it done professionally. I was shown a hair swatch of what my color would look like and I gave them the ok to proceed with the color. And now I'm walking around looking like a pumpkin by the head. My hair is the color of apricots. And to top it off the color is uneven. The roots are a orangey blonde and the ends are a really light orangey brown. And to top the top off Magid, who supposedly is good with short hair, had the worst technique in styling my short hair. Short edges + blow dryer + small barrel brush= electrocution hair style. When I informed Magid of my dissatisfaction I was told that I should just leave. The nerve of a business man to behave in an ill trained and ill mannered way. I would never go back. Magid has piss poor skills and horrible customer service.

1.description: I really didn't want to write a review but I am so upset about my hair cut. I even gave Magid a second chance after his first cut where I had to go back because he cut my hair so uneven that i couldn't take it. It was a bob where the front was longer then the back but apparently so was the left side from the right. When I drove all the way back downtown to fix it he laughed at me and said it wasn't that bad but proceeded to take over 2 inches off the left side to even it out. I still liked how he had straightened my hair and really enjoyed the lady who washes your hair so I tried again. I admit I wasn't very specific but I did say I wanted my hair shorter but still long enough in the back and I wanted to keep it angled. He said "I got it" very confidently so I trusted he knew what I wanted. But then his first cut took maybe over 5 inches off the back right side so there wasn't much I could do then to stop him. After he was done cutting I made sure the sides were even which they weren't and had him cut more on the left. He explained this was a different cut where he cut on an angel not straight like a bob. I was still worried when it was all done that it was not even and was shocked how short it looked. Then he tells me "don't focus on if u hair is even by an inch or so. You're young That's what 70 year old women do. " I laughed because I was shocked but how disrespectful!! What kind of stylist says don't worry if your hair is even!!! So my hair is way to short! It's cut unevenly all over. He didn't even ask where I wanted my part. And the worst part is it's too short and uneven in the back that all my new growth and neckline hairs are exposed.  It seems he does what he wants when styling hair. I should have never gone back after he didn't apologize to me the first time!!!!

2.description: Magid was my stylist.  I literally had some time to kill and I'm pretty laid back when it comes to hair cuts.  I needed a trim and was just passing by the salon.  The trim itself was average and I can't complain.  He got all the split ends in 15 minutes.  It was $35 so I bit steep for 15 minutes of work.  I guess fast can be good too.  Perhaps he's just that good but he also didn't seem very enthusiastic.  It was like he was restless and bored.  As I was paying he pulled out his cigarettes to get ready for his smoking break.  The place kind of smelled like smoke when I walked in but it was probably just te stylist.  I say this with respect, that I felt like I could of had the same or better experience at Hair Cuttery or Hair Clips.  Sorry to say.  The salon ambience and style looked meek as well.  Overall a sub par experience.  I doubt I'll ever return.  Now to look for a place to have some coloring done for the summer!

9.description: Just got my hair cut by Joseph and it is my favorite haircut I've ever had.  He gave me a very modern, youthful, bouncy 'do.  I feel like a million bucks.  Bonus:-- The staff is incredibly friendly and laid back.  I don't know how to describe it-- they just all seem like really cool, really nice people.-- The shampoo is amazing.  The first time I was there, there was a shampoo person, and this time Joseph did the shampoo himself.  They definitely take their time (in a good way). Both times I could've fallen asleep with my head in the sink.-- Joseph was thorough in asking me what I wanted to do with my hair before he started cutting (do I use a blow-dryer at home? what products do I use?).  I especially appreciate his taking the time to make sure it's a style that I will be able to do myself every morning before work.-- After we figured out what I wanted he gave me a really great haircut.  It's modern, it complements my round face, and it looks and feels great.  -- Took less than an hour.This is the second time I have been in-- the first was just for a trim, but a fabulous experience as well.  Highly recommend it!

10.description: Magid's is the best. I moved from Tennessee to the Chicago area two years ago and I've tried a few different stylists, but haven't been able to find THE ONE.  I was a little skeptical at first but I called anyway and got a same day appointment with Magid.  I was in need of touch-up, but he was able to shampoo, blow dry, and flat iron my hair to perfection! My hair looked exactly as I wanted it to with alot of body.  I was in and out of there in 1 hour and 15 minutes.  His prices are very reasonable and lower than what I expected. Looks like I found a new hair stylist!!

4.description: I've been getting my hair done by Magid and then by Joseph since 2002. I will never go to another place as they really know how to take care of my hair. Joe is not only one of the best hair stylists in the city, he knows my hair. Not sure about those having different experiences or leaving one star is ridiculous. As long as I've been coming here, I can say without a doubt that this is the best place for black hair care in Chicago. I get a million compliments every single time I get my hair done. Don't listen to anyone with a negative review. I am talking about 12 year's worth of experiences with these guys.

6.description: I'm a fan of Madgids for sure!! I am transitioning from relaxed to natural hair.  After I took my sew in out, my hair was pretty weak and damaged.  I was worried that he wouldn't know what to do with it, especially because it was already short and I wanted to wear it straightened.  Well guess what, homeboy did know what to do!  He cut me down pretty short and then got my hair the straightest its ever been!  I've been back once since and had a great experience.

15.description: Soooo I cheated on my hairdresser. I needed my hair done for Thanksgiving (a girl can't go meeting her boyfriend's family for the first time looking all disheveled), and my usual stylist was booked solid, so I  was on the hunt for a back-up. I was a little nervous in my search, as i have very thick, natural african-american hair, and am often times charged double what I'm quoted on the phone once i get in the chair. I called and spoke to Magid directly and described what I wanted done over the phone, and had an appointment for the next day. I got in early, and was immediately washed and blowdried by the two assistants. They were a little too chatty for my taste, but they both did a good job. Then I was off to Magid, who blowdried and styled me again to a silky shine, and trimmed up my ends. My hair looked fabulous, He charged what he said he would and my boyfriend loved it, so everybody wins! In the event that I can't get in to see my regular stylist, I'll definitely go see Magid again!

0.description: I had to update the update....BECAUSE...OMG! And add a star. This is one of those reviews, where you're not sure you want to divulge the information because you snottily don't want someone to have the same goodies as you (but I'm working through that selfishness people).JEROME CAN DO HAIR YALL!!!!! YAAASSSSSSSS! YAAASSSSSSS!Let me tell you, I woke up this morning a BRAND NEW WOMAN! Full thick hair, bounce, shine, style...that hair did everything but put my celebrity crush in bed next to me...and if I got my ass to CA, it could possibly do that too!I was super elated when I found an amazing eyebrow stylist...but now I have the "it" factor in the hair category, an amazing artist (hair is a true art). I'm not just looking for pretty hair. I want healthy, strong, and gorgeous hair. I can check that off the list. 2015...watch out!!!! So, run your happy asses to Magid's Hair Studio and ask for Jerome! ----------------------Okay there are so many conflicting views on here about this Salon. So as a long time client that has used three different stylists, let me give you my honest feedback: After 7 years, this salon is far from perfect and at times I've strayed away to visit other stylist to see if I could find better. The reason that I've comeback time and time again is because as a natural head, I needed long lasting results and for the most part I got that here. Magid aka "Magic": He's the owner and he was the very first stylist I went to prior to his current location. I believe that he's good at his craft for basic blow outs. Joseph (the brother): I love his personality, but more so, he is really talented with a flat iron. He listens to his clients and he cares about what they want. The case majority of photos on my yelp are blowouts from him! I ended up being Joseph's client for the last 5+ years. Jerome: On a recommendation from Joseph, I wanted more creativity with my natural hair. My hair had finally reached a really great length and constant blowouts for me were not a way of necessarily retaining the length. I really love Jerome's capability and understanding with natural hair. I feel so confident about having more control of my hair shed, my product knowledge, and making sure that at the end of the day I have the healthiest head of hair possible. He's now my main stylist and I'm really happy. The Cons: - I personally don't think this is the type of salon you come to for custom color or for any other style aside from a simple blow out. - if you want the latest cut, I don't think it's going to be here either. They really just specialize in natural hair. It's the bulk of their business. While individual stylists do varying degrees of stuff, recognize the overall capabilities of the salon. - I don't get perms/relaxers or any color from here. Wait actually once I did get color, but it was minimal and I honestly can't recall, but I was satisfied with the results. Honestly, I'd only go to a place that I KNEW specialized in it or did a significant amount of color in a week. - the one barber they have on staff is RUDE and HONORARY. He doesn't know how to respect women or keep a professional demeanor around clients. I literally took a star off, because I choose off days to avoid this man! This is a family owned business. The brothers are really great and they're kind. Advice: use sound judgement when deciding to get chemicals put in your head from a salon that has more business doing the opposite. You can expect to be in and out on time. The location is good and there's plenty of paid parking. Hair is a really finicky thing. Ask all the right questions before you agree to getting anything done.

5.description: I'm from LA just on vacation and I was looking to get some highlights done for new years. Magids took me in right away! :)I usually like to talk and ask many questions and I felt welcomed. I enjoyed listening to Magids' story about how his father taught him the craft of hair styling and is still  working well in his 70's. A family of talented hair dressers! The service was very fast and the highlights were the right tonality, being a filmmaker myself I can be very picky when it comes to color. I am very happy to have met a new stylist and a friend. Thank you.Happy New year Magids and Joseph!

13.description: This is the best hair salon I've ever been to. I was in and out within 1.5 hours and Magid was friendly and professional. This was my first trip to a salon after removing my dreads and Magid was up for the challenge. I left the salon with the blunt bob with heavy bangs I'd asked for--my hair looked EXACTLY like I hoped it would and he didn't pressure me to relax my hair (in fact, he told me I never should--a good stylist should be able to get my texture straight with a blow-out and flat iron only). Magid and the other stylist on staff (his brother, I think?) work wonders with a blow dryer and flat iron--my hair has never been straighter. Every woman who left the shop while I was there looked spectacular. I highly recommend this salon.

11.description: I enjoyed this visit...it was quick and my hair looked amazing. This is my second time going to Joseph. He is kind and a Good stylist. I have natural hair and its a new adventure so I appreciated the fact that he told me what to expect over the next few months.

8.description: It's been so long since I've been on yelp, that I forgot to come back and send an update to this review.  I haven't been going to him since April 2010.Magid is ridiculous.  Since he got his new shop, he became extremely arrogant.  He cut my hair completely uneven during a lunchtime appointment, and when I got back to the office, I noticed it, and so did my colleagues.  So I called to go back in for a fix later that evening, and when I got there, he never admitted to the fact that the cut was a butchered mess, and offered to fix it by cutting it another inch to even it out.  Heck NO!!  So, as I was a client for about a year, I expected some sort of consolation, like a discounted or free next visit.  Instead, he offered me back the $10 for the "cut," and I just balled it up and left it on his desk.  Everyone in the salon saw the exchange, and even his stylists saw that the cut was fudged up and just shook their heads.  I haven't been back since.  He's ridic.I've since then found a much better downtown lunchtime salon, and my hair has never been healthier.

14.description: Joseph did a great job and gave me a great hair cut! Cost me about $60 for both. Great service but the threading lady was HORRIBLE!!!!!

7.description: *sighs* You don't know what you got until it's gone.....Joseph how I miss you so much! I have yet to find a replacement since I moved to NYC. I would fly back home every weekend if I could just to get my hair done by your masterful hands.

58.description: Ordered delivery 3 times and been here once.  Great food and worth the 1 hr wait for delivery.  Love their agedashi tofu, order it every time.  Really tender pieces of tofu, covered in a crispy yet chewy shell, plus great dipping sauce.  It's my favorite agedashi in Chicago.  Saving their dipping sauce and trying to replicate the tofu part at home, not sure if I can do it as well!

56.description: excellent sushi very good service and a relatively quiet environment despite being very busy

29.description: My wife and I went here on our hunt to eat all the ramen Chicago has to offer. Umai was a great way to continue our journey. I went with the spicy garlic ramen and it was awesome! Not mega hot but had some great smokey heat to it. Their grilled pork was tender and delicious. The noodles were a little thinner than I'm used to, but still really good and chewy. Their sushi was awesome too. We only split a roll for an appetizer but seeing other tables made me want to come back to try more.

42.description: Had the dipping noodles, sushi roll and saki.  Solid!  I'd be back to try more.  and more and more...  Service was really good and I like the ambiance.

23.description: Umai is one of my favorite Japanese restaurants in Chicago. There are always plenty of Japanese dishes to choose from and the fish is always fresh. Furthermore, the vegetarian sushi options make it very easy to arrange dinners with friends who may not enjoy Japanese food otherwise.The best ramen I have had so far in Chicago, I have found at Umai. The soup base and noodle texture are on par with the Ippudo chain of restaurants, a personal favorite of mine when I visit the likes of Taipei and New York. The Nabeyaki Udon is also a delicious alternative during the winter time.The sushi and sashimi is always fresh. I enjoy anything from the spicy tuna, made with honey sriracha to the ama ebi, classically served with the shrimp heads.Umai is always a great place to stop in the South Loop and I always look forward to returning.

47.description: Slightly above average. Hamachi collar was good and so was the lunch salmon teriyaki. Lunch chirasi for $18 has only about 9 thinly sliced pieces of fish on top of the sushi rice. which is less in quantity and higher priced than other places that I have been to. Service was good so bumped from 3.5 to 4 stars.

8.description: Ate here with a friend, as I recently moved in down the street.  The food isn't bad (as stated by others, a bit steep for the neighborhood though) and they have great service.  Everything that we both ordered was good, fresh, and the Ramen was good also. Also has a fun atmosphere.

31.description: Umai is great.  The ramen is delicious and comparable to Wasabi or other solid ramen places around the city.  Sushi is hit or miss with more swooshes than air balls. Ambiance is decent and service is great.  Not byob.  Small/mid size, clean, and modern restaurant. No TVs in eating area. Good place for a date. Parking is a little tough in that area and this place can be packed on weekends.  Make sure you get a reservation.  This place is better than most in nearby Chinatown.  I definitely recommend.

34.description: Nice place, amazing food!!! Japanese food the way I like it!!!

16.description: Umai is one of my favorite Japanese restaurants in Chicago. There are always plenty of Japanese dishes to choose from and the fish is always fresh. Furthermore, the vegetarian sushi options make it very easy to arrange dinners with friends who may not enjoy Japanese food otherwise.The best ramen I have had so far in Chicago, I have found at Umai. The soup base and noodle texture are on par with the Ippudo chain of restaurants, a personal favorite of mine when I visit the likes of Taipei and New York. The Nabeyaki Udon is also a delicious alternative during the winter time.The sushi and sashimi is always fresh. I enjoy anything from the spicy tuna, made with honey sriracha to the ama ebi, classically served with the shrimp heads.Umai is always a great place to stop in the South Loop and I always look forward to returning.

13.description: Stopped by on a chilly day - which meant I was trying to decide between sushi (my original plan) and ramen. I ended up getting both -- a spicy tuna roll ($7) and the garlic pork spicy miso ramen ($14). The spicy tuna came in 8 pieces -- the tuna wasn't chopped tiny and there was no mayo, so +1. As for the ramen, the noodle texture were more like egg noodles (full disclosure: my guideline for ramen is Santouka). As other reviewers have noted, the spicy miso is not all that spicy (more like a layer on top of a miso) -- and the broth is not very porky, but on the plus, there were plenty of scallions and the egg was done perfectly. As for the meat, I think I would have preferred more of the spicy ground pork and less of the belly, which definitely felt out of place (probably placed in last?) and not as tender as I would have liked.My friend had a chirashi -- at $25, it was quite large -- the size of my ramen bowl -- and she had trouble finishing it. There was a good variety of fish (eyeballing it, probably 8 or 9 kinds with 2 to 3 pieces each?) and the salmon in particular looked quite fresh.The garlic pork ramen is good for folks who like lighter broths, and it hit the spot for that particularly cold day. That said, I think I would probably get a couple of rolls next time. This is a pretty good option for South Loop.

11.description: I came here with a colleague who studied abroad in Japan and we both really enjoyed our meal. I ordered salmon sashimi on sushi rice and the spicy roasted garlic pork ramen while my colleague ordered the soba noodles. The salmon tasted super fresh and the ramen was very spicy/flavorful. There was so much food, I could barely finish my meal.

39.description: Kitchen closed at 9 45... This has happened a few times before, they are not very friendly if you come late for a drink either.

37.description: Great place to have a drink and have some sushi. The ramen was good but nothing out of the ordinary. Would go back to try out the different ramen they have.

0.description: I made a mistake and forgot to make a reservation, (sigh) never again! So my boyfriend and I had to wait 30mins for a table which isn't that bad. When we got seated water was immediately brought to us. We ordered the Beef Hanger, the Chicago Roll, and the Winter Ramen.The Beef Hanger is so freaking delicious!! It's $6 for two skewers but I would definitely pay $12 for four skewers!! Which is ridiculous because it's pretty small but it's just that good! The meat is very tender and juicy, it just melts in your mouth! Probably my fave out of all the things we ate. Try it! The Chicago Roll has tuna, salmon, and white fish. I really liked it since I love raw fish and the roll tasted very fresh. (Free spicy mayo!)The Winter Ramen says rib eye, I thought it meant steak but they just give you fatty beef as the meat. It tasted okay and I can live without it. Overall, this place is nice for a date or just coming with a group of friends. The atmosphere is very cozy and not that loud.  We didn't really see our server but we didn't really need him anyways. The food came out pretty fast even though the place was packed. I'll recommend this place if you are close by the area! :)

38.description: Love their food and service! Ask for their fatty salmon that they carry occasionally. It's super good. They can even make that into a spicy salmon roll. It is the best spicy salmon I've ever got! Beef tongues are good too.

51.description: We had a great meal at Umai. We started with sushi. It was very fresh and flavorful. For my main dish, I ordered a bowl of udon noodles and loved it.

27.description: Love this place. I live a block away, so we get carry-out frequently. The sushi and ramen dishes are delicious. You can't go wrong here.

32.description: Ordered:    -Miso Ramen = Delicious   -Green Tea = On Point    -California Maki Roll = Good just a little too salty :/   -Lychee Sorbet = Good Overall I loved the food and you're given water free lol One star taken away because waitress wasn't the greatest, not very kind.

54.description: Great atmosphere, great food.  There's a reason this place is busy every day of the week!  Nigiri is fresh and generous in portions. Udon and noodles are very tasty.  Most importantly, wifey loves it so I can always bring her on a winning date and look awesome. Everyone I know loves it, I love it.  Share the love.

48.description: Stopped by on a chilly day - which meant I was trying to decide between sushi (my original plan) and ramen. I ended up getting both -- a spicy tuna roll ($7) and the garlic pork spicy miso ramen ($14). The spicy tuna came in 8 pieces -- the tuna wasn't chopped tiny and there was no mayo, so +1. As for the ramen, the noodle texture were more like egg noodles (full disclosure: my guideline for ramen is Santouka). As other reviewers have noted, the spicy miso is not all that spicy (more like a layer on top of a miso) -- and the broth is not very porky, but on the plus, there were plenty of scallions and the egg was done perfectly. As for the meat, I think I would have preferred more of the spicy ground pork and less of the belly, which definitely felt out of place (probably placed in last?) and not as tender as I would have liked.My friend had a chirashi -- at $25, it was quite large -- the size of my ramen bowl -- and she had trouble finishing it. There was a good variety of fish (eyeballing it, probably 8 or 9 kinds with 2 to 3 pieces each?) and the salmon in particular looked quite fresh.The garlic pork ramen is good for folks who like lighter broths, and it hit the spot for that particularly cold day. That said, I think I would probably get a couple of rolls next time. This is a pretty good option for South Loop.

44.description: Umai is my "now, where was that place" place. I've been here enough times that it really shouldn't be in my restaurant blind spot but I think that after last night, I've finally got it locked on my mental map - (Blue line LaSalle, walk to Polk) - though the exterior looks totally different without the summertime patio. (Quite possibly the noisiest, horn-honkiest intersection on which a patio sits, by the way.)Ramen!! It's delicious. I've tried several and so far, "winter ramen" tops my list ($14.00) It's "medium" spice but they can dial it upon request.  The broth is well-layered and the beef, so tender. Sushi I've had here has always been fresh and service has been easily five stars. (I've had same server three times over five months, inside/outside! and he is always smiling.)I find the prices slightly steep for the location though and also, there's no happy hour. I think it's ok to mention that a fun neighborhood bar "First Draft" opened not too long ago across Clark and "Sociale" just went in across Polk, so this area is definitely growing. When you want ramen though, you want ramen! I'm definitely locked on Umai.

24.description: I'm not a sushi fan...I took my boyfriend here as a surprise to him. He enjoyed himself immensely. He said the Ramen was great and the different types of sushi he tried was good. His favorite sushi was the mexicana. He did say they were a little pricey. But the great service was worth it. For someone who doesn't eat sushi there was a few choices. I had the hanger steak and that was pretty good. So over all great service and food. My only small complaint was the drink I had...I had a chocolate martini and it wasn't that good at all. Not horrible, just didn't taste like a chocolate martini should.

7.description: Umai is my "now, where was that place" place. I've been here enough times that it really shouldn't be in my restaurant blind spot but I think that after last night, I've finally got it locked on my mental map - (Blue line LaSalle, walk to Polk) - though the exterior looks totally different without the summertime patio. (Quite possibly the noisiest, horn-honkiest intersection on which a patio sits, by the way.)Ramen!! It's delicious. I've tried several and so far, "winter ramen" tops my list ($14.00) It's "medium" spice but they can dial it upon request.  The broth is well-layered and the beef, so tender. Sushi I've had here has always been fresh and service has been easily five stars. (I've had same server three times over five months, inside/outside! and he is always smiling.)I find the prices slightly steep for the location though and also, there's no happy hour. I think it's ok to mention that a fun neighborhood bar "First Draft" opened not too long ago across Clark and "Sociale" just went in across Polk, so this area is definitely growing. When you want ramen though, you want ramen! I'm definitely locked on Umai.

49.description: If you're looking for a good Japanese restaurant in the South Loop, Umai is THE Place! Ate at Umai twice in 1 week (lunch and for dinner) and both times had exceeded my expectations.  Good service, great ambience, easy parking, and of course... good quality food! They have Lunch sets ($10 - $15) & is enough food to put you into a food coma!Their soup noodles are all really good - Beef Sukiyaki, Tempura Udon & Pork belly Ramen are all a must try! The nigiri are very fresh and they are large cut, draping over the rice.The grill selection is not many, but the Beef tongue & Pork shoulders are very tasty.Will definitely come back!

40.description: Love the spicy pork ramen (get extra spicy pork for $2 extra- well worth it for the homemade goodness). Sushi is solid, appetized done on the japanese grill were fantastic. But I have come back just for that spicy pork ramen on a cool winter night twice already, since discovering it a month ago.

53.description: This was my first Japanese food experience and I loved it. I had the Udon Kare and Shrimp Tempura roll. Delicious! Fun atmosphere and kind servers.

30.description: I came here with a colleague who studied abroad in Japan and we both really enjoyed our meal. I ordered salmon sashimi on sushi rice and the spicy roasted garlic pork ramen while my colleague ordered the soba noodles. The salmon tasted super fresh and the ramen was very spicy/flavorful. There was so much food, I could barely finish my meal.

46.description: I eat here literally once a week. Being an Amli resident this place is not only convenient but tasty as well. Menu ranges from steaks to great ramen & of course sushi.

1.description: I absolutely LOVE the sushi here! When you first arrive you feel like you are in a hip, high end, Tokyo bar with calm peaceful lighting and nice artwork. If you are the kind of person who values atmosphere, this place is for you. On a first date? Go here. Taking your visiting mom out for sushi? Go here. Third wheeling on a friend's date with her boyfriend? Go here. This place has everything to offer you. The service is mediocre, but that's about the only thing I have to say about this place that isn't 100% positive. The presentation of the sushi is also very nice and the feel is authentic mixed with a classy feel. When I came here last Sunday I was treated to some really great sushi, I had the South Loop or Sloopin roll. It was excellent! It says it has spicy mayo, but it isn't even slightly spicy, and I normally can't handle any spice. I would highly recommend also the shrimp tempura roll. All delicious. All the time. PS - Make a reservation ahead of time, sometimes they are packed!

55.description: My husband and I order from here often, and the food never disappoints.  Last night, we had the tempura platter as an appetizer, which is one of my favorites here.  Mixed vegetables and shrimp fried to perfection with a tasty dipping sauce.  We then ordered one of the evening specials: the king crab miso ramen.  It was fantastic!  We each ordered one but weren't able to finish it because the helping was so large.  In the past, we've also had a variety of their sushi offerings, which have always been terrific.  The price is reasonable, and the service is good.  The restaurant is always full with other patrons, but we've never had to wait long to be seated.  We will definitely be eating here again.

9.description: Will definitely be returning here again. The sushi was very fresh, we were served promptly, and the ramen was great. We stopped in at around 530-6pm and were seated right away. Was surprised at how quickly the restaurant filled up considering it was Superbowl Sunday. We ordered the highly recommended spicy roasted garlic pork ramen, a half Chicago roll, a spicy scallop hand roll, and hamachi nigiri. The sushi was just mmmmmm =) so good. The hand roll was HUGE. Super stuffed with the spicy scallop mixture, and was very well balanced with the sauce and masago. The hamachi was so soft, and the Chicago roll was not as memorable, but was a great try off their menu. I really, really wanted to order more nigiri, especially after tasting how fresh and soft the hamachi was. But the ramen was quite filling, and the Chicago rolls are large rolls, not your avg size. The waitress was kind enough to suggest that the kitchen split our ramen order into two bowls after learning we were planning on sharing it, but I regretted this decision. The bowls are quite small, and the noodle amount the same, so you get a lot less broth than if you were to receive it in the original bowl. Next time, I'd just ask for a side bowl, and deal with splitting it ourselves. Also, the ramen was amazingggg just wished it didn't have SO MUCH bamboo shoots. I love them, the SO does not, so I usually end up eating all of them myself... and it was just way way too much.All in all, loved this little place.Excited that they're opening up a second location in the Lincoln Park area! Hopefully both locations are on par with one another.

26.description: Any sushi restaurant that has Hitachino White Ale is top notch in my book. You can't find that stuff everywhere!We ate everything. We drank beer and sake. I can't remember anything we ate that wasn't delicious. I would return in a heartbeat and would recommend this place to anyone.

25.description: Love this spot! Great ramen & sushi in one spot. Menu is big and never disappoints. Prices are reasonable for dine in and carry out. My favorite is the spicy scallop hand roll or the super white with scallions. Delicious!

12.description: Umai was a nice spot to dine on Saturday night! Pretty on point with most of the dishes - not too big or too small for the price. We did edamame, skewers of beef tongue and steak, fried chicken wings, sushi rolls, and sukiyaki. All tasty and served quick. This along with a few Kirins and it was a good night.

59.description: This restaurant may not be good for sushi (from other guys reviews, I haven't tried) but if you want to have other Japanese foods with a reasonable price, this restaurant would be a good choice. I like their Katsu Kare and ramen.

21.description: Yummmmmm! I love this place. Had the best variety of Japanese food I've seen, more than just sushi and chicken teriyaki. The katsu don is the best I've ever had in the US, and I love many of their dishes. Their sushi is not the best for me, but I'll admit, it could be because they are dressed minimally like you would find in Japan and not slathered in sauces and crunchy things (which I do love.) But at the same time, I do appreciate minimally dressed sushi and this still doesn't do much for me. Green tea creme brûlée is amazing though!! Wish they had some more dishes I love like yakisoba, but that's more of a street food, I guess and can't hold that against them. It gets REALLY BUSY here, so most of the time I get my food to go.

17.description: A few moments stood out to me last night as my husband and I went out on a double date with another couple:Pros: food was good! Lots of options. Very trendy place. Cons: -husband and I got there before the other couple. Asked if there was a reservation under their two last names. The woman checked and said no. And then we asked how long the wait would be, and she said "probably an hour to an hour and a half. You should have made a reservation, sorry!"  Then my friend gets there and says she DID make a reservation. Gives the woman the same name I told her. The woman apologizes and takes us immediately to our table. -I and the two husbands ordered beer. The waitress poured my beer into a glass and handed it to me. She then asked each man individually if they wanted their beer in a glass. So, do women not get to make this choice? Just a tiny bit of sexism to start off the meal. -the sushi wasn't timed right with the rest of the meal, as the two men ordered sushi. We got our food about 10 minutes before one husband, and my husband got his food a good 8 minutes after that. -I ordered spicy ramen soup. The waitress asked me "medium spice?" And I said, well I like spicy things. Can I go for spicier? She said that she recommended a 2-3 out of 5, but she'd bring me spicy powder for my soup. The soup was basically not spicy at all, which was annoying to me, since I ordered it and mentioned the spice as being important to me. Spicy powder wasn't even chili flakes or chili oil, so didn't help. -overall, food was fine, but I felt somewhat targeted as a white woman in this restaurant through tiny micro aggressions- though definitely unintentional, I didn't feel as valued as a customer.

10.description: I got to stop in here for lunch while I was in the neighborhood, and luckily there was no long wait though the restaurant was full! Right when you walk in, the amazing smell greets you, which you know is a good sign for things to come.I ordered the tonkotsu ramen and my SO got the spicy garlic pork ramen-- wow wow wow! The broth in both our our ramens was very intensely rich and had a sort of smoky flavor, which I had never had before. The chashu was grilled and very tender, and the rest of the toppings were on point- a nice serving of seaweek and corn in mine, which I loved. I of course had to steal a bite of the spicy garlic pork ramen, which was super flavorful. Full warning- they do not skimp on the garlic, and you will stink for the rest of the day... but I'd say it's worth it! The only thing I'm taking a star off for is the service- we did have to stand around and wait for a hostess to notice us, even though several waiters passed us by on their way out of the kitchen. It also took a long time for our check to come, even though we were one of only a few tables by the time we were done. Slow service aside, though, this place is great!

5.description: Compared to sushi places in SF, Umai was average but good enough to satisfy your sushi craving. Our hotel was on S Michigan Ave, right across the street from Grant Park, so Umai was within a nice walking distance. We walked in on a Thursday night and didn't have to wait to get a seat.I ordered the 10 pc omakase, and the boyfriend ordered a couple rolls. I think he had the White Tuna Jalapeno roll, Chicago roll and a hamachi roll. The fish was fresh and well-presented, but overall nothing super special.The decor was super nice. Umai is definitely trying to pull off a modern, upscale-ish, hipster-y atmosphere.If you're looking for some sushi while you're in the South Loop area, I would give this a try.

3.description: I've been here twice and both times had a good experience. It's a great restaurant to go to if you're watching a movie at Showplace Icon and looking for a place to eat since there aren't many food options near the theater. The first time I went there, I ordered the Katsu Kare. The portion was huge; I could only finish half of it. Hardly any of the Japanese restaurants I've been to serve Katsu Kare so I was pleasantly surprised to see it on the menu. I thought the curry had good flavor. It's definitely a comfort dish.Most recently, I ordered the Spicy Roasted Garlic Pork Ramen - spicy miso ground pork, wakame seaweed, fish cake, half boiled egg, Japanese leeks, braised pork belly and garlic chips. The broth had great flavor and the pork was cooked perfectly. I highly recommend it for people that love ramen. Overall, Umai has great food. It's a good option if you're in the area and craving Japanese food.

35.description: Umai was a nice spot to dine on Saturday night! Pretty on point with most of the dishes - not too big or too small for the price. We did edamame, skewers of beef tongue and steak, fried chicken wings, sushi rolls, and sukiyaki. All tasty and served quick. This along with a few Kirins and it was a good night.

19.description: Highly recommend the sukiyaki if you are looking for something warm and hearty and isn't sushi. Great menu overall - good balance of sushi, udon and ramen, don, tempura, katsu, and yakitori. Will be back next time I'm in Chicago.

28.description: I got the Winter Ramen and the veggie gyoza via delivery (until midnight!), and this meal has me choked up with happiness. I've had ramen from 5 or 6 places in Chicago, and this was the best (and this was delivery!). The broth was tasty and ever so slightly spicy. The poached egg in the ramen was perfectly cooked. The veggie gyoza are weird. They almost taste like they have pesto in them. Still, definitely the good kind of weird.

45.description: I eat at Umai at least once a month. I would highly recommend the Katsu Don and Nabeyaki. Entrees are served in very large portions for a decent price. Great atmosphere. Quick preparation if you are needing take out. +10% discount for online orders!

33.description: Fabulous restaurant...everyone was nice, efficient and helpful.   The food was great! I recommend it.

43.description: Ate here with a friend, as I recently moved in down the street.  The food isn't bad (as stated by others, a bit steep for the neighborhood though) and they have great service.  Everything that we both ordered was good, fresh, and the Ramen was good also. Also has a fun atmosphere.

2.description: Very good sushi spot downtown. Customer service was very patient - my card wasn't working and they must have tried it 6 or 7 times. Highly recommend the spicy garlic ramen - the broth was super savory with tiny bits of meat infused in it and the noodles were nice and chewy. The golden roe sushi was excellent, didn't have a strong fishy taste and came with a little shredded radish on the side - highly recommend. The eel and avocado roll was solid but nothing to write home about. All were a decent value at ~7 for a small roll or $14 for ramen. Would definitely come back here next time I'm in the mood for a Japanese bite.

18.description: The food is good, but the service is so bad!!  I went here for sushi and the waitress did not bring me a drink menu - totally fine, I look pretty young.  However, I wanted a beer, so as I ordered my meal I asked for the drink menu.  She didn't bring it over for almost fifteen minutes!  By that time, my food had already come, and I didn't see much point.  The sushi was very good.  I ordered the Chicago roll and it was beautifully presented and very yummy.  The fish and all of the ingredients were fresh tasting and well-prepared.However, once I said I didn't want a beer anymore, my waitress disappeared into thin air.  I am not kidding, I did not see her ever again.  I finished my food and sat with an empty plate for quite a while.  Eventually, the host came and removed my plate and gave me my check.  The one good thing I can say for the service is that I forgot my wallet, and as long as I left my bag with them, I was very politely and kindly allowed to go home and get it!

41.description: We were craving some ramen and sushi and found this gem on Yelp. The food was definitely delicious, and fish portions were great- nice and thick. Service was not the best though. Our waitress took a while getting our orders, and this was when the restaurant was pretty empty also. Nonetheless, we were very satisfied with our food:Chicago roll: a crowd favorite! We had about 3 orders of this roll- delicious with good portions of fresh tasting fish with nice additional flavors in the sauce.Mexicana roll: this was also good, I'm just not a big fan of jalapeño in my sushi. But it was a nice refreshing roll otherwise.Overall, food was excellent and the restaurant atmosphere was great, with good smells of ramen and sushi. Besides the slow service, we had a great experience!

52.description: Good sushi, sub par ramen.  Also, there were flies at the sushi bar which left something to be desired.  go elsewhere if you can.

50.description: I only ordered out...I want to eat in next time.Food - My wife and I got the Sloopin, Mexicana, and the Philly roll. It was delicious, the fish tasted fresh and the combo of flavors made every bite worth every penny. Every sushi bite stuck together and never fell apart which is a huge plus.Service - Host was extremely friendly and food was ready fast. Everyone seemed to want to help. I will judge eat in service next time, but it seems people generally feel the same way.Atmosphere - Nothing out of the ordinary and kind of in step with any other higher class sushi bar. Regardless, I still felt a desire to want to eat in.Food - 2/2Service - 2/2Atmosphere - 1/1

4.description: This place was fantastic and had it all. It's a hip and trendy restaurant that is great for date night because you can dress down or up and fit in. The service is wonderful as well. They have a gray cocktail selection. I had the lychee martinis and it was delightful. Not too sweet and it brings actual lychee to be able to eat!The beef hangar appetizer was my favorite!!! It was so tender and it had a great sweet sauce on it. The sashimi was very fresh. I tried the tuna and salmon. My friend and I shared several rolls and sadly I can't remember the names but they were all so good!! My friend had their creams brûlée. The initialBite was different, interesting. But as she continued to eat she really grew to appreciate the dessert and love it. The only dish that didn't taste like all the flavors went together was their salmon carpaccio.

6.description: We were craving some ramen and sushi and found this gem on Yelp. The food was definitely delicious, and fish portions were great- nice and thick. Service was not the best though. Our waitress took a while getting our orders, and this was when the restaurant was pretty empty also. Nonetheless, we were very satisfied with our food:Chicago roll: a crowd favorite! We had about 3 orders of this roll- delicious with good portions of fresh tasting fish with nice additional flavors in the sauce.Mexicana roll: this was also good, I'm just not a big fan of jalapeño in my sushi. But it was a nice refreshing roll otherwise.Overall, food was excellent and the restaurant atmosphere was great, with good smells of ramen and sushi. Besides the slow service, we had a great experience!

22.description: Highly recommend the sukiyaki if you are looking for something warm and hearty and isn't sushi. Great menu overall - good balance of sushi, udon and ramen, don, tempura, katsu, and yakitori. Will be back next time I'm in Chicago.

15.description: Any sushi restaurant that has Hitachino White Ale is top notch in my book. You can't find that stuff everywhere!We ate everything. We drank beer and sake. I can't remember anything we ate that wasn't delicious. I would return in a heartbeat and would recommend this place to anyone.

57.description: Sushi rolls are delicious and fresh. Ramen is a nice serving size but spicy one didn't have much flavor.

20.description: This place was fantastic and had it all. It's a hip and trendy restaurant that is great for date night because you can dress down or up and fit in. The service is wonderful as well. They have a gray cocktail selection. I had the lychee martinis and it was delightful. Not too sweet and it brings actual lychee to be able to eat!The beef hangar appetizer was my favorite!!! It was so tender and it had a great sweet sauce on it. The sashimi was very fresh. I tried the tuna and salmon. My friend and I shared several rolls and sadly I can't remember the names but they were all so good!! My friend had their creams brûlée. The initialBite was different, interesting. But as she continued to eat she really grew to appreciate the dessert and love it. The only dish that didn't taste like all the flavors went together was their salmon carpaccio.

36.description: This place was good! Service was friendly, sushi was yummy and fresh. The grilled cauliflower was lacking in flavor and they poured their beers with tons of foam, but my lychee martini was perfect, as was all my nigiri! If you need a sushi fix, this spot is a solid option.

14.description: Ordered:    -Miso Ramen = Delicious   -Green Tea = On Point    -California Maki Roll = Good just a little too salty :/   -Lychee Sorbet = Good Overall I loved the food and you're given water free lol One star taken away because waitress wasn't the greatest, not very kind.

58.description: OK, it isn't really anything that great, but I find myself coming here often enough that I need to give it at least three stars.  Everything is good and it is much better than a lot of similar spots, the quick sandwich/diner type place.  Everything I've had is good, well prepared, and fresh.  The sweet potato fries have a good flavor to them, their turkey chili is quite good, and for sandwiches you can't really go wrong with any of their chicken sandwiches or the turkey burger.  Yeah, it isn't high end food, it isn't anything all that interesting either, but for a quick bite it is a great choice.I will say though, for what it is it does seem to be a tad on the expensive side, only by about 10% or so though.

56.description: Been getting them for years.  Everything great especially SRO Burger, SRO Chicken, and the gyro.  Their delivery is a little expensive, but so are a lot of places downtown.

29.description: Basic lunch spot. Has great gyros and turkey burger though and everyone that works at SRO is very friendly. In the summer I enjoy sitting on their patio and grabbing a quick bite. Price is reasonable for downtown and if you're looking for lunch (or a lunchy dinner) in printers row SRO is a great choice

42.description: We placed a order online for delivery to our office. delivery was fast.The food was great. A lot of people got the cajun chicken sandwich which i would get again. The sandwich bread is so soft you just gobble it up so fast.The size of the sandwich was tad small but tasty.We would certainly order here again

23.description: I have been going to SRO for years.  I have used them for catering events and they couldn't be nicer and professional.  My favorite is the veggie burger and sweet potato fries.  I also enjoy the falafel and hummus plate.  Yes it would be great if they were open on Sunday, but I try to get there as often as I can.  Thanks Dino and Tom for the great neighborhood atmosphere.

47.description: Meh, nothing special. I had the Italian beef which was just deli sliced roast beef on a bun. I think I will take a pass next time.

8.description: I had no idea, after all these years. This review is solely for your bean burger, which is the best I've ever had.  Period.

31.description: Went here during my Lunch Break from work and I was STARVING!! I saw the special of the day was the Cod Sandwich. I asked the young lady working the register how she liked it, she stated she herself was not very keen on seafood, but that it was quite popular among the customers, and they only have it on Friday's, so I thought to myself, "why not?" After getting the sandwich, I thought to myself "Why did I do this?" I couldn't even finish the sandwich, it was so soaked in what was supposed to have been Tartar Sauce, yet the blandest thing I think I've ever had. This "tartar sauce" was so water and flavorless, the cod also had no flavor and the sandwich, which was to be a Battered Cod was so soggy. My French Fries were fried very hard and also, no flavor, even the extra $1 I spent on the side of Cheese Sauce couldn't save them. It was a waste of a very hard earned $8.48.  I left feeling very dissatisfied and disappointed.  don't think I'll ever grace the doors of Standing Room Only again.

34.description: Great food.  Love their chicken salads and mozzarella sticks.  They have the best French fries!

16.description: I've been to SRO a few times now and have found it to be decent. Nothing horrible but definitely not the best food I've eaten either.The first visit I had a hog dog and fries. The second time I tried the burger... I wasn't blown away either time. I thought the food was a little too greasy and slightly overpriced for what they are offering. I guess the prices are typical for the location though.Sadly, the atmosphere appears to be better than the food. I don't think I'll be returning to SRO anytime soon.

13.description: Standing Room Only is a good option if you're looking for a quick bite to eat or burger takeout. It's more than one step up from fast food, in my opinion-- although don't expect anything that's mind-blowing. Great service-- they are very kind and patient people.

11.description: When I first arrived, the cashier didn't greet me. Ordered a turkey burger the other day w/ fries.  At first, I wasn't sure if it was a turkey burger it was brown and looked like a regular one...anyways, it was just OK.  Their fries were the crinkled kind, no luscious steak fries here. I had the special that comes with fries and a drink for a little over $10.  I thought to myself I should've just gone to the place down the street.  Walls are adorned with sports memorabilia and signed autographs of various players.  This is a laid-back place where you can grab a quick bite with edible food and subpar customer service.

39.description: Came at 8:55pm. (close at 9:00)Ordered Burger and small fries. $8Taste is average.  nothing special. will come again and try more as its so close to my apartment.

37.description: There is a good reason why SRO has been in existence for over 25 years. The Rookie Chicken Sandwich and/or Turkey Burger and fries. Try it and you will see. The folks that work there are awesome, fast, and if you come here enough they will learn your name. Great place.

0.description: Decent spot with a fun atmoslhere.  Fast casual (think Flaco Taco, you order then they cook it and bring it to you) dinner spot with a Chicago sports theme.  Lots of fun Chicago sports photos, jerseys, and other odds and ends.  Also has fun jazz music in the background.  I got the gyro with fries and it wasn't bad.  Meat wasn't that hot, but fries were scalding and lightly crunchy.  Plenty of meat in the gyro and the lamb was thick cut, not the typical thinly sliced stuff.  Staff is friendly enough and service timely.  It is a little hidden, but next door to well known spot Sofi, so not hard if you know the area well.Prices are reasonable and worth what you pay.

38.description: The SRO chicken sandwich would be pretty good if the chicken didn't taste boiled.  Decent food, but too expensive for decent.

51.description: This is your typical burger joint. Nothing fancy or anything. The portions aren't too big and aren't too small.  It's a nice chill place and the food comes out very quick. But for the price i pay i prefer getting shake Shack or In-n-out.   However, i do like how my cheese was melted here. It does dripped a little, because it's very warm. so be careful not to get it all over you. The Zucchini fries were ok, but i like the carls jr. ones more.

27.description: This place is just okay. I'm a sucker for good advertising. The sign said "city's best turkey burger" which I thought was obscure enough a thing to brag about and perhaps true as a result. Not the case. The turkey patty was dry and flavorless. The bun was delicious and so were the cheese fries. Nice outside seating. But other than that...pass! Wouldn't spend the money again.

32.description: I am a fan of the SRO chicken sandwich with a side of sweet potato fries. It has a great sauce on it. Great pick up food when we don't feel like cooking.

54.description: Turkey burger and sweet potato fries for under $10. Enough said.This place gets pretty busy around the noon hour, but it's a great, fairly fast lunchtime spot if you're in the south loop. Lots of options, and you can usually grab a seat if you want to stick around and eat (so no, not really standing room only).

48.description: I've lived in this hood for years... I've only been to SRO like 3 times. Yea the grilled chicken and the burgers are ok... but... it is a little rich here for what you get... If you are going to spend 10+ bucks on food, go get a real burger from the Hack.. Or go get some Thai food next door. I want to like this place more. There is nothing here to make me an addict. Further, there are no specials to catch me while I'm walking down the street. I like the inside with all the sports stuff but why wouldn't I just go to Bar Louie to catch the games, sports center, etc. Meh is right...

44.description: SRO is in heavy rotation on my list of lunchtime places; co-workers and I eat there once a week at least, and sometimes more. It's a bit of a walk from the office for us, but we've never had a problem getting in & out of there in a timely fashion during the lunchtime rush. My friends come for the burgers, I come for the less traditional (but no less tasty) black bean burger and portabella mushroom sandwich. The sweet potato fries are also a guilty pleasure.

24.description: Nice walk down Printers Row, this place has a nice outdoor seating, very cool Chicago sports memorabilia stuff.  First time here, got the Chicken fingers and fries. Not bad, but nothing too outstanding. Prices overall are normal for the area maybe even a bit cheaper. Stop in for the atmosphere, but I'll definitely return and start go down the menu, to be continued...

7.description: Best Gyro outside of Greek town!

49.description: Overpriced, and its never open.Chicken sandwich+fries+soda=11 dollars---and it didn't come with fries. On my visit, the place was empty, and the tables weren't clean. Will not be back.

40.description: Braved winter storm to satisfy hot dog craving. Not worth that trip (maybe not so bad on average day) but their hot dog is better than most in the loop. They have the jumbo which I like. Most other places have the little skinny hot dogs. They say "oh, just get two" well I don't want two, I want one big one (what can I say, don't hate, I like it meaty!). The best I have had in the loop is from Cellars Market in the basement of the Board of Trade building.
