But they close at 2:30 (I eat lunch late) and for the past few years the taste of their dog seems to have changed for the meh. Cellars hot dog is a big one though! LOL.

53.description: Sitting contently on Dearborn awaiting your presence is SRO, Standing Room Only. It's polite, cozy and makes for good conversation. Its broad, awesome menu isn't flashy or gigantic, rather it relies on consistent, affordable food specifically crafted to satisfy you without invoking any strong reactions one way or the other.SRO is good food, don't get me wrong. Their grilled chicken sandwiches are decent, the sweet potato fries passable and their burgers non-offensive and very middle of the road. The prices are in line with what you'll find in the south Loop and the sports-oriented decor isn't distracting. Like this review, it's alright. Not ROTD material, just good enough to get the message across. SRO. Food for people, by people.

30.description: Standing room only is a solid diner.  Their burgers are great and the prices are on point.  Also their salads are incredible, the Ceasars salad comes with actual anchovies. Wonderful place to order or stop in.

46.description: This place has the most delicious grilled chicken burgers I've had in a long time - if you're scoping this place, their SRO burger will give you the best first impression.I was kind of surprised by how big their menu was, they've got a huge variety and plenty of healthy/vegetarian options available too. Management and staff are awesome and orders are fairly fast and less than 10 minutes. They've got a great decor and plenty of seating area too.*to all the reviews complaining about price - quality food doesn't come cheap.

1.description: So I've been going to this place for years and am finally able to write a review. Do Go...Go Again and Again and Again. Love the turkey burger. They will add anything you want on in (for a price) or take it the way they make it. It's still awesome! Small dining area but I guess that's why they call it Standing Room Only. A must on the burger list. You can now order online and pick-up your order, however they are a bit slow in that area and you may or may not get a confirmation email with your estimated pick-up time. I did not receive a confirmation time, however when I arrived, the order was ready.Burger Heaven

55.description: I know proximity has a lot to do with this, however I have eaten here an absurd amount of time the past 3 yrs I've lived next door and it still sounds good. That says something.I love the salmon burger and you cannot miss out on the sweet potato fries. Really, I am a critic of those and they make some humdingers!When they have the patio open its the perfect place for a yum and affordable outdoor meal before heading across the street to Kasey's for a beer.

9.description: Best Chicken Caesar salad in South Loop. Heads above Panera and so much faster.  And they serve it with yummy garlic bread.

26.description: Tried it about a few years ago.Not a bad place, If you want something fast.Or take a break from the Lit Fest.

25.description: I call this place "mini Portilllos" which, in my book, is a huge compliment.  Over the years I have tried everything on the menu.  The food is high quality and very consistent.  I would rather go here and pay a little extra, knowing that it's high quality, than some place down the street that's cheaper.  The SRO chicken sandwich is my favorite in the city.  Good size chicken breast, always cooked to perfection, with bacon, cheddar and garlic mayo. Served on a grilled and buttered Turano bun.  Try it!  Some other great choices include the chili, cheese fries and gyro platter.  The italian beef, turkey and italian sandwiches are average.  Surprisingly, the vegetarian options, like the trio platter (hummus, babaganoush, pita, falafel, cucumber and tomato), are solid.  The ambiance is quintessential Chicago hot dog joint with nice flatscreens airing local sports.  Lots of cool sports memorabilia on the walls to look at while you eat.  Whether you're from Chicago or just visiting, go to SRO's and order practically anything on the menu - you won't be disappointed.

12.description: This place is in my building so its very convenient for me to grab some fast food when I don't feel like venturing out or ordering delivery.  I've had their burgers, hotdog and fitness plate so far.  The food is decent but not mind blowing.  It's a good spot for a simple meal, but if I didn't live in the area I wouldn't make a special trip to eat here.

59.description: went here a week ago and had an ok time. Had a burger and some cheese fries. Burger was average and the cheese fries were pretty good. Although they dont have the best turkey burger its definetely cheaper than epic burger a few blocks away.

21.description: I've been to SRO a few times now and have found it to be decent. Nothing horrible but definitely not the best food I've eaten either.The first visit I had a hog dog and fries. The second time I tried the burger... I wasn't blown away either time. I thought the food was a little too greasy and slightly overpriced for what they are offering. I guess the prices are typical for the location though.Sadly, the atmosphere appears to be better than the food. I don't think I'll be returning to SRO anytime soon.

17.description: The friendly staff can't entirely save the slightly overpriced menu items and mediocre food.  My order of a black bean burger and sweet potato fries came to almost $12.  If you're in the area and are in the mood for quick American fare, give it a shot, but let it be known that you'd most likely be better served by just walking down the street to Hackney's.

10.description: Volunteers at the Printers' Row Lit Fest all received a $10 voucher to redeem for food at SRO.  I wouldn't have known this place even existed otherwise.  I'm so glad the Lit Fest introduced me to them!  Their food and service were both amazing.  I ordered the turkey burger, and it was delicious.  Great size, didn't take long to make, and just an all-around good burger.  I will definitely be coming back here as a paying customer soon.  Kudos to SRO for supporting such a great event.

5.description: Boss burger was delicious! Wish the patty was a little thicker, but still delicious. Would definitely grab another one.

3.description: the turkey chili is so good. Also try the turkey burger with all the trimmings. Nice area to eat at tlunch time in the summer time.

35.description: Is there anything better than an SRO burger?  It's odd, there is nothing out of the ordinary about them, but yet I crave  them every once in awhile!!There is also some great sports memorabilia hanging on the walls... White Sox!

19.description: This is a pretty decent American fare restaurant, and the hot dogs and burgers are alright. I have to admit I did not see what the big deal was about this place when I went. It was lunchtime and it was super packed, so I was excited to try their food because a place this packed has to have some delicious food.  To my surprise it was just average. Then as I looked around the place and saw all of the sports memorabilia I thought maybe they flocked there because there's always a game showing on their televisions. I would go back to give them a second try if I was in the area. But I would go out of my way to travel to them.

28.description: This is a pretty decent American fare restaurant, and the hot dogs and burgers are alright. I have to admit I did not see what the big deal was about this place when I went. It was lunchtime and it was super packed, so I was excited to try their food because a place this packed has to have some delicious food.  To my surprise it was just average. Then as I looked around the place and saw all of the sports memorabilia I thought maybe they flocked there because there's always a game showing on their televisions. I would go back to give them a second try if I was in the area. But I would go out of my way to travel to them.

45.description: It's kinda pricey for a burger joint but the food is very good.

33.description: service is just ok. Nothing special but also not bad.Fried zucchini is bland.Cod sandwich is AMAZING. Great fish, great batter, awesome bread.Fries are crinkle cut and very tasty.Turkey burger is all that, juicy and totally worth a try.Chili cheese fries are EXCELLENT. Very good chili!I'd go here for lunch again!

43.description: Deceptively awesome food, as it's somewhat easy to pass by as you're walking up Dearborn. Their turkey burger, as they claim, really is the best in the city. That and the fitness plate make up my staples, and they never disappoint. The outdoor seating in the summer is also great.

2.description: Brought the family here for lunch. Great chicken burger, good salmon burger, and good grilled cheese and chicken tenders. Crinkle fries were excellent and BBQ sauce was great!I really enjoyed the vast collection of sports memorabilia on the walls!

18.description: I call this place "mini Portilllos" which, in my book, is a huge compliment.  Over the years I have tried everything on the menu.  The food is high quality and very consistent.  I would rather go here and pay a little extra, knowing that it's high quality, than some place down the street that's cheaper.  The SRO chicken sandwich is my favorite in the city.  Good size chicken breast, always cooked to perfection, with bacon, cheddar and garlic mayo. Served on a grilled and buttered Turano bun.  Try it!  Some other great choices include the chili, cheese fries and gyro platter.  The italian beef, turkey and italian sandwiches are average.  Surprisingly, the vegetarian options, like the trio platter (hummus, babaganoush, pita, falafel, cucumber and tomato), are solid.  The ambiance is quintessential Chicago hot dog joint with nice flatscreens airing local sports.  Lots of cool sports memorabilia on the walls to look at while you eat.  Whether you're from Chicago or just visiting, go to SRO's and order practically anything on the menu - you won't be disappointed.

41.description: Very disappointed. I had the Tri Platter that included babaganouj, hummus, falafel, tomato and cucumbet and pita. It was disgusting. I couldn't even eat it. Well for one, it was all very greasy. Second, it was not fresh at all. Third, it was extremely dry. I was drinking water as I was eating it but I could tell it was not fresh at all and I've had heartburn for the past hour and chest tightness from it. Extremely disappointed and will not eat that again.

52.description: Mystified by bad reviews. However I keep hearing "you can get better at Hackney's" and I realize that there is some good and anti-good at war here. Thought Hackneys was by far the dullest meal I've ever had in Chicago. Seriously if that's your idea of a good burger, please find some kind of farm-to-table place at once for *good* beef.If you share this not-good opinion of Hackneys you might feel as I do about SRO:This is a freaking amazing grilled chicken, good enough to crave at times from far away,  and a FINE-ass falafel. Best ever? Not so much, but a solid four out of five.I swear, this grilled chicken is one of the best "this can't be THAT bad for me" options downtown and quick. I'm comparing apples to apples: chicken sandwiches under ten bucks that arrive in a plastic basket. Better? Where?I can't speak to the dogs, because frankly vienna beef is a vienna beef is a vienna beef and the chicago dog eludes me.

50.description: Fast food joint that caters to its neighborhood with lots of healthy options, like hummus, rice, tuna, salmon, veggies....as well as more common fast food, like burgers and fries.  Food is easy to carry from counter to table in round stainless steel dishes that look like dog bowls.  Coke products in the self-serve soda fountain, no Pepsi, but interesting bottled sodas like Mexican Jarritos.  The decor is sports-mad, with sporting stuff on all the walls, a faux chunk of ivy-covered Wrigley wall in one corner, all the TVs tuned to games.  Very nice jazz on the overhead speakers, a surprisingly good playlist for what seems to be a non-jazz focused place.  Friendly helpful service from the one guy behind the counter.  SRO is a keeper.

4.description: I have been here many times, we used to live across the street in Printers Row and recently visited a friend in the area. The food is pretty good. It hits the spot when you are craving something you shouldn't be eating. Good Turkey burger although my friend didn't think it was great. Maybe I was influenced with all the signs saying it was voted best turkey burger and is now famous. Couldn't tell you who voted it as the best though. Gyro was pretty tasty, that's one of my favorite foods so hard to not make me happy with one! Also like their charred chicken salad, Greek salad and steak salad.  While I never order them....big fan of the mozzarella sticks I steal off other people plates!

6.description: We live a minute walk from this place so it's very convenient whenever you feel like getting something quick.  My daughter LOVES the chicken fingers and fries.  Her cousin was in town this past week and I think they went there 3 times for lunch and paid for themselves as it's only $6.  The BBQ chicken sandwich and SRO sandwich are great but I usually only get it if it's on special which is $10 for sandwich fries and a drink.  If it's not on special, the sandwich is about $8 or $9 w/ nothing else.  I can do turkey burgers and had it once and it was good, not great in my opinion.

22.description: I've been here a few times, started off with the burger, turkey burger and then tried the gyros.  I've been sticking with the last because they put a ton of feta on it.  It's all good, they've got a patio, they're not trying to win a michelin star, they want to watch the game.

15.description: Yikes. SRO...Serving Raunchy Only. Their burger is wicker nasty. Yeah it is build your own but I seriously doubt my creation was the problem. There is nothing worth going back for. Maybe this place is called Standing Room Only because people are in there complaining about their nasty food. Do yourself a favor and walk a little further and go to Hackney's. Yet they have their problems too but at least their burger kicks burger butt! Sweet deco though. Thumbs up for that!

57.description: Very mediocre food.  My husband got a turkey burger and I got a beef burger.  The best thing about them was the bun.  Both burgers were bland and, I suspect, heated up from frozen.  The French fries were also likely from frozen.  The food is just okay - nothing special. I agree with another reviewer - go to Hackney's down the street instead.  It is a little more expensive, but fries are included.

20.description: Yikes. SRO...Serving Raunchy Only. Their burger is wicker nasty. Yeah it is build your own but I seriously doubt my creation was the problem. There is nothing worth going back for. Maybe this place is called Standing Room Only because people are in there complaining about their nasty food. Do yourself a favor and walk a little further and go to Hackney's. Yet they have their problems too but at least their burger kicks burger butt! Sweet deco though. Thumbs up for that!

36.description: I Love the food here!! Especially, the SRO chicken sandwich and the onion rings. I think it's way over priced for a burger joint and think the sandwiches and burgers should come with fries. Only certain things come with fries but the burgers do not. They are also closed on Sundays and I have come here during the week when they say they are open but they have been closed. I will continue to come back for the yummy food but definitely think they should have some kind of burger/fries/soda combo deal.

14.description: Really good cheese fries!! Super convenient location, fast service and the staff is very friendly.

58.description: The best thing about this restaurant is its atmosphere; a lot of Italian places end up feeling kind of dark and stuffy, even the nice ones, but this one has a lot of natural light and is generally really pleasant; I would definitely come for an early date -- it looks upscale and the food is going to work for almost anyone (can't vouch for vegans, gluton, etc). I came with a large group, (~10 people), and got to try a lot of the appetizers, entrees, and desserts -- without overwhelming the details my short story food wise was that it was solid but not special. For the entrees especially I really enjoyed the first couple of bites for almost everything but then got bored after that.

56.description: I got the mediteranian seafood risotto - rise and clams cooked seperately coming thru as rise putting with clams.... Probably not core to their repertoire. It is a nice place - risotto not.

29.description: We went to this restaurant as a group and the service, as well as the food, was disappointing.  As one member of our group noted:  "It tasted like it had come out of a Chef Boyardee can."The food came out at different times (10-15 min. apart) for different parts of our table (group of about 15) and one order was completely wrong so she ended up eating when all the rest of us were done.  Very disappointing experience.

42.description: Lovely atmosphere and nice staff. Unfortunately the food left a lot to be desired. At the recommendation of the waiter I chose the zuppa Livornese. It was a terrible disappointment.The soup itself was flavorless and uninspired. There was one prawn and one scallop (a 20#), a handful of mussels, a few small clams, and a single portion of baby octopus. I'm not sure why the soup was so bland other than it was woefully underseasoned.  It was an abyssmal disappointment. Maybe another selection would have been a better choice. I would try Sofi again at some point to give them a second choice.Chris

23.description: Fantastic staff and a menu with lots of choices but not overwhelming. Beautiful space with a warm ambiance. I was impressed with Sofi and I think the olive oil used for dipping was the best I have ever tasted

47.description: I'm always on the lookout for places that offer a decent Cacio e Pepe dish and wanted to cross this place off the list.  We took my brother here for dinner during his last visit a month ago.  I was 40 weeks pregnant and a few days past my due date.  Made reservations and were seated promptly.  It was pretty busy, crowded, and loud.  It took a while for the server to greet us and take our drink orders.  He was pretty no nonsense, skip the small talk kinda guy.  I ordered the Cavatelli Cacio e Pepe while Hubby had a lobster spaghetti dish, and brother tried the Orecchiette with broccoli rapa and sweet and spicy sausage.  The entire meal was so disappointing!  The pasta was overcooked, the lobster meat didn't taste fresh, and the cacio e pepe was the most disappointing of all.  There was barely any flavor or sauce (very little at the bottom of the dish) and too much pasta that wasn't tossed in what sauce was there.  I was thrown off by the pasta since cacio e pepe is usually made with a thin spaghetti.  I felt so bad that we took my brother here.Not sure how this place has an average 4.5 star Yelp rating.

8.description: Lived in the neighborhood for 2 years and our first time at Sofi.  Got here about 90 minutes for closing.  Roberto from Naples was our waiter.  He was really good.  He knew the menu and the wine to go with our selections.  We chose the 2006 Barolo and it was perfect.  Roberto aerated the wine for us and I never had to touch the bottle the evening.The orecchiette was prepared perfectly.Looking forward to the gnocchi, paccheri focaccia, ravioli and many many more.I am really happy Sofi is in the South Loop.  I feel like it's all mine.

31.description: I came to this restaurant on a weekend trip to Chicago with some friends. When you first walk in you get to see some beautiful decor even in a rather small restaurant. The menu is well sized and offers you plenty of options to close from. During the time that I was visiting they had a specials menu and I ordered a rack of lamb off of that menu. The rack of lamb was cooked very well and had a beautiful char on it. The sauce for the rack of lamb is what helped put the entire dish together. It was warm, fragrant, creamy, and balanced out the other components of the dish. It was a little pricey but was still an excellent meal.The service was great and everything was delivered within good time and together. This is definitely a place for people to check out if they get the chance.

34.description: Pros--the service was good and enjoyed the port and tiramisu.Cons-the food in general. The carbanera fettuccine  tasted "eggy," "fatty" from the bacon and too salty (to quote my son). I felt the sea bass was sliced too thin and overcooked. The cappuccino tasted like an instant coffee with steamed milk.I thought it should have been better for the price.

16.description: Great food on a quiet and cute street in Printer's Row - definitely recommend! The only thing I'd change is the glaring street light right over our table on the patio... Other than that, it was a great experience!

13.description: Food is amazing.  We ordered 3 appetizers including seafood, veal meatballs and Italian sausage.  Gnocchi dinner was best Gnocchi ever in both taste and texture.  Good ambiance and staff is very attentive and helpful.  Owner was personable and promptly greeted us upon arrival and talked with us before we left.  Highly recommend for anyone wanting great italian food in Chicago.

11.description: I came here for dinner on a Saturday evening (~8pm).  The restaurant wasn't too packed so we were seated immediately (note: I did make reservations as well).Atmosphere: nice and cozy place, good for dates (maybe dessert only?-at least desserts looked tasty).Food - NOT impressed at all!  AppetizersTegamino Polpettine ($10) - veal meatballs in a zesty tomato sauce.  The meatballs tasted ok, but nothing amazing.  I have tried better from potlucks that I have attended.Trofie Genovese ($16)- fresh pasta with pesto and diced potatoes.  The entree was very flavorless so if you like bland food go for it.  It tasted likecooked pasta mixed with watered down pesto sauce..not impressed nor will i pay $16 for pasta like this again.. :/Aragosta Porcini Risotti ($24) - lobster chucks and mushrooms in light fish broth.  I would stay away from ordering this unless you really like the smell of raw fish or something very stinky!! I felt like I was going to gag from the smell and after trying it....ek...I couldn't taste the lobster because something in this entree really smelled horrible!! I am pretty sure that 99% of the people I know will NOT enjoy this.. so this is just a warning...definitely not worth $24!!Ravioli Vitello Pasticciati ($18) - cream sauce and bolognese ragout (this is like meat sauce).  I would say this was the better tasting items of the night...how can you go wrong with meat sauce and ravioli?  It wasn't anything to die for though.  The price was a little overpriced here as well.Customer service - it was ok, we did end up waiting awhile to order and then waiting awhile to get our checks.  The waiter was friendly though.Parking - street parking right across the street (pay at meter), or better idea is the red line (Harrison stop)I don't think I'll be back here... unless maybe it was for dessert or the lobster bisque that I have yet to try..

39.description: Perfect night for al fresco dining. Terrific roasted beet salad in endive.  My fresh pappardelle with duck ragu was outstanding! Cavateli was light and delicious. Fabulous grilled veges. Professional staff. Reasonable prices.

37.description: Our first time there, on a short-notice whim when we needed a night to de-stress, and we really hit the jackpot.All the staff were friendly and welcoming. Just after the hostess seated us, the manager came over and offered a better table right next to the first one, which I appreciated.My Martini was nice. Not stand-and-applaud nice, but good. I'm a Martini snob and hard to please with my gin, so "good" is actually real praise. Gin selection was pretty standard so I chose Hendrix, the olives were crisp with no fillings, a cut above what I expect from most restaurants or bars. I didn't think to ask for it stirred so they shook it. Next time...Bread and oil clued us in that we'd made a good choice. The bread was fresh and firm but delicate, not fancied up with herbs and spices, likewise the oil. No nonsense, just quality.Our waiter took excellent care of us. There was a misunderstanding (or was it) about the glass of white my date ordered, so he comped us the first one he'd brought before bringing the one she did order. I have a hunch, no real basis for this, that the "mistake" was really more like, "nah, have one of these." The first one was the one we finished.We each had salad. Generous portions but not overly huge trying to make a point like at some places, just good bowls of veggies. Perfectly fresh, with just the right amount of dressing. Spot on.The menu is long and varied, thoughtful Italian classic. We'd both had stressful days after a run of stressful weeks and I just couldn't make up my mind. All I knew was that I wanted a good glass of flavorful red wine along with a meal to go with it, so I asked for our waiter's recommendation on the wine. He nodded and said "I'll bring you something nice." What to go with it, I asked? "Meat." Uh well yeah okay, but... Without hesitation he suggested the t-bone. Fine, I'll have that! I don't eat a lot of red meat these days but if that's the recommendation...And, oh my goodness.What a steak. Big. Excellent quality, well marbled just the slightest hair toward fatty, tender, seasoned brilliantly. I ordered it rare and it came out just right. The side of white beans were seasoned to complement the steak in a rare and wonderful way. This was not some fancied-up dish trying to get into a trendy magazine, it was a classic Italian meal meant to please a hungry appetite, and oh did it.My date said her pasta was just a hair toward hard but otherwise fine. I can't say much else about it because I didn't try any, had my face too deeply buried in my meat. She tried a few bites, and nodded along with me.Dessert: apple pie with vanilla ice cream, as good as everything else, not an afterthought like desserts can sometimes seem to be. Even the berries next to it were carefully selected.I had a shot of espresso that made me grin. Like with gin, I'm hard to please with my coffee and this was terrific, just excellent, deep foamy crema, flavorful but not at all bitter. Herself took a snapshot of me rolling my eyes when I tasted it.We had a good time. I'm eager to go back.

0.description: This is our go-to place before going to the Joffrey Ballet. I've been very impressed each visit, and usually find something from the "specials of the day" menu. This time it was a Linguini with large (whole) Scampi in an Imperial sauce -- a white wine with cream and saffron concoction that had great shrimp flavor and a touch of garlic. Really wonderful. My wife and daughter shared the classic Bolognese dish, another favorite. The soup and salad choices were also great, and we were pleased with the wine recommendation. Can't think of a better treat than Sofi plus Joffrey.

38.description: Very nice place with great fresh food. Quiet, small but a real gem. Staff was very friendly.

51.description: This is a great spot for authentic Italian food.  We came in and was seated immediately.  The entire staff was very friendly and attentive.  Food arrived quick and was over the top delicious.  Strongly recommend this place if your visiting Chicago and looking for great Italian food at an amazing price.

27.description: Great food and great service. I got the gnocchi bava & it was pretty good. The wine recommendation was good and the seafood dishes thst my sisters got was pretty good as well. I would definitely go back next time I  go to Chicago.

32.description: Lovely neighborhood place that is perfect for date night ... if you're already dating. It's romantic and intimate, but not dazzlingly obvious in a way you'd be looking for when you're wowing a new love interest.Service is exceptional and very genuinely friendly. The food is really good and they cook their handmade pasta perfectly al dente. The bar is not comprehensively stocked, but they had my second choice of drink.The small patio seating is nice and the clientele ranges from families to retired couples. Prices on the high side ($16-$20 for pasta), but not outrageous for the quality. Portions good, but you won't have much for leftovers. I'll be back, but if prices were a few dollars less I'd come more often.

54.description: I went to Sofi during a business trip, out of the 4.5 stars in Yelp reviews, and I was there without any specific expectations.The menu options were considerably large and all seemed very appealing. It was a hard choice, bur I ended up ordering a chef special: linguine with half a lobster and imperial sauce. Dish presentation was good and amount was just what I wished for. The pasta was perfectly cooked al dente, and the sauce was great, creamy with just the right amount of spiciness. The lobster was also quite good, but it didn't feel it was fresh because the meat was somewhat stuck to the shell. However, that was a really minor issue and didn't stop me from greatly enjoying the dish.I took the ricotta cheesecake for dessert. Ii was happy it wasn't one of those excessively sweet cheesecakes. It came lightly warmed, which helped me appreciate the slight saltiness of the cheese mixed with sweetness that makes it a cake. Just my type!The ambience is old style wooden tables and dimmed light, which makes it perfect for a romantic night out. Also, not excessively pricey considering the quality.Overall, I highly recommend Sofi.

48.description: I had the linguine jumbo prawns with imperial sauce last night and it was to die for. Staff was very friendly too, highly recommend coming here.

44.description: Sofi was a beautiful dining experience. Tastefully decorated and very intimate. They could use some soft background music bc at times it was too quiet but none the less, this would be a great date spot or a place to take clients for a nice meal. I ordered the Garganelli pasta special with peas and prosciutto in a cream sauce. Added the summer truffles bc...why not!!?! So good!!!  The bread and olive oil was a delirious start to the meal and kudos to the bartender for a delicious dirty martini with blue cheese olives. I'll be back!

24.description: Our server was very polite. Food was excellent. Souffle was divine (more like chocolate lava cake). I will def. come back.

7.description: I'm always on the lookout for places that offer a decent Cacio e Pepe dish and wanted to cross this place off the list.  We took my brother here for dinner during his last visit a month ago.  I was 40 weeks pregnant and a few days past my due date.  Made reservations and were seated promptly.  It was pretty busy, crowded, and loud.  It took a while for the server to greet us and take our drink orders.  He was pretty no nonsense, skip the small talk kinda guy.  I ordered the Cavatelli Cacio e Pepe while Hubby had a lobster spaghetti dish, and brother tried the Orecchiette with broccoli rapa and sweet and spicy sausage.  The entire meal was so disappointing!  The pasta was overcooked, the lobster meat didn't taste fresh, and the cacio e pepe was the most disappointing of all.  There was barely any flavor or sauce (very little at the bottom of the dish) and too much pasta that wasn't tossed in what sauce was there.  I was thrown off by the pasta since cacio e pepe is usually made with a thin spaghetti.  I felt so bad that we took my brother here.Not sure how this place has an average 4.5 star Yelp rating.

49.description: Authentic Italian! Wine is great, the food is better. Our waiter Roberto made the experience even better. Thumbs up. Next time I come back to Chicago its a definite must go.

40.description: Host was very nice. Outside patio was nice initially, but then I kept getting dripped on by some unknown water source. It was not raining. I think the building above had some condensation from something. Waiter was super slow. Quail and octopus were not very good. Server removed food from final bill, so that was appreciated. Won't be back. Disappointed.

53.description: I want to love this restaurant. It's in my neighborhood, and I enjoy a nice Italian meal. I've been here twice now, and each time I've felt like the food was good but nothing special and the service was curt and unfriendly. The first time we went, I ordered the Ravioli Aragosta (lobster ravioli), which was good but not great. We went again last night because I wanted to give the place another try. I ordered something different-- the Tagliatelle Bolognese, which again was good but didn't blow me away. My fiancé felt the same about his order of the Penne Filanti. What disappoints me most about this restaurant, though, is the service. Each time we've gone, we've had a different waiter, and both acted in the same rushed, curt manner. Meanwhile, however, we noticed that other patrons were treated in a more friendly manner. It seems that most of the clientele here are older. My fiancé and I are in our late 20's, and we can't help but feel like there's some sort of age discrimination going on with us being ignored while meanwhile the waiters joke around and chat with the older patrons. I understand that these people may be regulars, but the staff should recognize that other patrons (such as ourselves) have the potential to become regulars too--if we receive good service.All in all, it's not a bad restaurant, but between the just ok food, unfriendly service, and fairly high prices for pasta, I don't think we'll be returning anytime soon, despite the fact that it's nearby.

30.description: Very good Italian food. Pasta was cooked to perfection and had exquisite flavor. Waiter was very attentive and was a font of information not only regarding the menu, but of things we needed to check out in Chicago that were off the beaten touristy path. This is not one of those Italian places where you will be presented with so much food that your grandchildren will inherit some. It's definitely quality over quantity here. Our meal was impeccable from start to dessert. On par with the finest Italian restaurants that you'll find in the enclaves of the big northeastern cities that set the bar in the U.S. for this style of dining.Next time I'm in the Windy City, I'm sure to visit again.

46.description: We started with the veal meatballs -the sauce was very tasty, but not too rich.  My husband ordered the Tagliatana - Beef Tenderloin.  The portion size was a good-sized meal for him and he was very happy with his choice.  I had the Paccheri Focaccia with double smoked bacon/sage/garlic/ and creamy touch of tomatoes.  It was a nice sized portion.  I chose the lemon sorbet for dessert- the flavor was quite strong, but it was a good way to end a wonderful meal.

1.description: This place is a little gem that is a silent star.  I never hear any buzz about it but it is truly terrific!  Low key signage makes it easy to miss but don't!This is our favorite place to eat before seeing any production at the Auditorium Theater.  They offer refined friendly service and high quality food at really reasonable prices.On our most recent visit we were short on time and they were able to get us in and out (even with an appetizer) without us missing a note.  I began with a bowl of the cauliflower and mushroom soup.  It was outstanding and really hit the spot on a cold, windy winter's night.  For my main course I had the bolognese; a classic dish done perfectly!

55.description: On our last night of our mini-vakay to Chicago, we wanted a good Italian restaurant. Not one of those that piles huge portions of overcooked pasta on your plate, but something *good*. Sooo glad we made reservations Sofi! The first 15 minutes of our dining experience were marred by the group of six drunk and very loud people sitting right next to us. If I'd been the maitre'd, I would have seated a couple like us in a different section of the small restaurant to begin with, but they did offer to move us a couple times. The group was just finishing their dessert so we opted to stay put. After they left, the rest of the night was perfection. I found the service to be excellent but not overly attentive. The fried artichoke & mozarella appetizer was good, but the lobster linguini with Imperial sauce was to die for. Perfectly al dente pasta, half a Maine lobster and enough sauce to make each mouthful a heavenly experience.We were stuffed by the time our wonderful waiter thrust dessert menus in our hands, so we only ordered the hazelnut gelato to share. But the waiter surprised us with a complimentary order of creme brulee, saying "Happy anniversary!" (It was really our honeymoon, but I can see his confusion because we're firmly middle-aged. LOL) My husband happily gobbled the gelato all by himself while I dug into a surprisingly big creme brulee. It was way too much food but you can bet I scraped out every single bit. They were lucky I didn't lick each and every plate!

9.description: I am still high from the delicious meal we just ate.  How fantastic to be able to eat from the specials menu as a vegetarian!! Pasta tasted homemade and was fantastic.  I asked for a ginger ale cocktail, and the waiter/bartender made up something delicious that was easy going down ;-)  Dessert met the high standards set by previous courses.  Sofi is intimate without being crowded, and offers quality without pretension.  I can't believe Sofi has been blocks from us, undiscovered all this time.  Sofi is definitely our new favorite place to eat in Printer's Row.

26.description: Found Sofi while searching for Italian food the night before the Chicago marathon.  What an amazing find!  The food and staff are as authentic as anything I experienced in Italy.  I'm not a huge red meat eater but the spaghetti bolognese was outrageous.  The pappardelle with lamb stew was also amazing.  Portions were perfect size and like true Italians, we were questioned as to why we couldn't eat more (when our plate held the last morsel of food we couldn't finish).   The wine was equally as delicious and paired perfectly with dinner. We will definitely visit again when we're back in Chicago!

25.description: This place is an amazing find for any resident or non resident in the Chicago area.  I came to Chicago to run the marathon and of course, I had to carbo load the night before.  I found Sofi on yelp and surprisingly was able to get a reservation for 7 PM.  Upon walking up you'll notice both indoor and outdoor seating are available.   You'll also notice that the manager is speaking Italian, this to me told me I made the right call.  The restaurant has an extensive wine list and true Italian cuisines.  My girlfriend has a gluten allergy and they were able to accommodate her with gluten free penne on any dish of her choosing.  I got the Paccheri Focaccia w/double smoked bacon/sage/garlic/ and creamy touch of tomatoes.  The pasta is whole made and some of the best I've ever had.  After a great meal I awoke the next day feeling fully loaded and ready to run.  Thats Amore!

12.description: Sofi was a beautiful dining experience. Tastefully decorated and very intimate. They could use some soft background music bc at times it was too quiet but none the less, this would be a great date spot or a place to take clients for a nice meal. I ordered the Garganelli pasta special with peas and prosciutto in a cream sauce. Added the summer truffles bc...why not!!?! So good!!!  The bread and olive oil was a delirious start to the meal and kudos to the bartender for a delicious dirty martini with blue cheese olives. I'll be back!

59.description: Service was exemplary thanks to manager David and server Renee. Food was top notch. Highly recommended. Would definitely eat here again. No question.

21.description: A little gem in the south loop. Our group had the mussels and we all soaked up the broth. The pastas were exceptional, but the highlight for me was the rabbit special. Perfectly cooked with tender meat that feel if the bone and a side of polenta. It all wired beautifully together.

17.description: The best Italian food! Great vibes and even better wine!

10.description: My wife and I found this place on yelp and opted to try it out. Was definitely not disappointed. Very tidy restaurant, poliite waitstaff, quick but professional service, and excellent food. The waiter took his time to help us select out multiple courses, and he is really what took this rating to five stars. A good bottle of Italian wine was surprisingly inexpensive ($35). The braised boneless short ribs on polenta, and the ricotta cheese cheesecake, are to kill for. You can't go wrong with a cozy dinner for two to four people here.

5.description: I ordered spaghetti vongole and carbonara. They both were delicious, although it wasn't filling. Highly recommended. The service was excellent and very welcoming.

3.description: This place has delicious food. If you can avoid Roberto as a waiter you will enjoy it much more. The past few times  we have had him as a waiter he has failed us in a huge way. This time our anti pasta did not arrive to the table until well after our entrees. This was after he explained that we need to order everything at once so we didn't have to wait 20 mins btwn courses b/c they will be busy soon. The last time we dismissed his "fails" as "lost in translation" but I would rather not have to have him as a server again!

35.description: The pasta is very good, I've been their twice.  I live 50 feet away, so it should be my local.  However, it's a bit overpriced and the last trip did it for me.  I ordered a not inexpensive bottle of wine, and the waiter brought it over, showed it to me, and then said I should REALLY get this other bottle (in his other hand), it tasted better.......and it's $20 more.   And then just stared at me.I respectfully asked for the bottle I ordered, and never saw that waiter again until the check came.  Hi attitude definitely changed.  I don't need people upselling me when I'm trying to have a relaxing dinner.

19.description: My dinner was awesome. Staff was great. This is right by the Hotel Blake - you can walk there. The doorman from the hotel, Showtime, recommended I check this place out. I had the duck ragut pappardelle (great flavor); fingerling potatoes (loved the rosemary, garlic and bacon!) and the chocolate soufflé (like a molten lava cake). All that with a glass of wine really warmed me up on a freezing cold night and I slept so well. Dinner for one was about $60. Great spot for a good Italian dinner.

28.description: Great food on a quiet and cute street in Printer's Row - definitely recommend! The only thing I'd change is the glaring street light right over our table on the patio... Other than that, it was a great experience!

45.description: Amazing food, friendly service and a pleasant atmosphere. If they had a larger staff and better turn-around, then they'd definitely be a 5 star. That said, if you're not in a hurry, you will feel very content at the end of your meal. Still, without a reservation we were done within 70 minutes on the 4th of July. It was kinda like Italy meets comfort food. Enjoy!

33.description: Very disappointed. The atmosphere is great and the story behind the owner and the staff lead you to believe the food is authentic and fresh and delicious.  But it is blah. Salads were boring. Lobster ravioli did not taste like anything. Nothing ordered at the table was exceptionally memorable.  Oh and the Parmesan cheese was clumpy powder that I would swear was some kind of processed Kraft product.  Couldn't bring myself to order dessert. Very pricy and extremely slow service.

43.description: The restaurant looks  nice but I've had much better Italian food! I would not recommend this place to anyone and I will not be coming back. I thought because it was highly rated that it would be good but me and my friend were disappointed. And I told my waiter that my food my food wasn't good and he laughed and said he wasn't the chef.

2.description: This place is one of the greatest Italian restaurants I have ever been to. I took my girlfriend there on Valentine's Day for dinner. We were impressed and overjoyed at our dining experience. The bread and oil was perfect. We got the Lobster Bisque (was different than most Lobster Bisques, but tasty nonetheless) for an appetizer. For an entree I got the Rigatoni Contadina, which was absolutely phenomenal. My girlfriend got the Tortolini Ricotta, which was also quite tasty. We shared each other's dishes because we could not decide which was better. For dinner we split a canoli and some gelati. Both were perfect. Also, another classy sidenote that captures the class and ambiance of this place, my girlfriend along with every other female that attended that evening, received a fresh rose upon exiting the venue.This place is now my favorite Italian go to. Check it out, seriously!

18.description: Best al dente spaghetti in their seafood dish. Loved it so much I ordered a second portion but they must have gotten busy because the second time around the noodles were soft. Grateful they did it right the first time.

41.description: Some of the loveliest pasta I've had outside Rome.  Get the cacio e pepe with spaghetti (even better than in Italy -- is that possible?) and don't miss the bolognese.  I don't like meat, but that bolognese is out of this world.Perfect amount of gelato in the affogato (in the US restaurants tend to put way too much).  Warm, intelligent, friendly service and excellent cocktails, too.  A really lovely evening in a darling neighborhood spot.

52.description: I really enjoy the food here, it's just a bit pricey. I've had pasta dishes both times and been really pleased, especially with the tagliatelle bolognese.  Delicious.

50.description: What a gem! Great service, atmosphere & food. Took a short walk from the Palmer House Hotel on a rainy Saturday night at 7:30pm and was able to be seated immediately.  Shared a Cariofi Fonduta ($12) artichoke appetizer, then Cavatelli ($16) and a Risotto Aragosta Porcini ($24).  The risotto was the bomb with lots of tender lobster chunks.  The other two dishes were good but I'd have liked a stronger truffle flavor, since that was why we picked them.  For dessert: a scrumptious creme brulee ($8).  As noted in another review, the portions were appropriately sized so you can enjoy several courses and not be stuffed. Two glasses of Moscato ($10@) and Chardonnay ($9@) brought the total bill to $108 without tip-- pricey but this was the best meal of our 4-day stay in Chicago.

4.description: This is a fantastic neighborhood joint with delicious and authentic Italian cuisine. Every single thing I've had on the menu is delicious and you can't help but eat everything in front of your face. I would eat here all the time if I wasn't fearful of what my waistline would look like.My boyfriend and I always seem to end up here on holidays, having a great time enjoying dinner at the bar last NYE, and having gone there for Valentine's Day just last night. Of course, they were pretty packed on both occasions, and the space is pretty small, but they do a great job accommodating everyone, and last night as we left the hostess handed all the ladies a rose. A cute touch which made me smile. Recommend to anyone looking for a date night out or just a dinner with friends, prices are very reasonable for the food and ambience you will experience!

6.description: Incredible Valentine's Day dinner experience. I've travelled all around Italy (Florence, Rome, Venice, Bologna) & this place is AUTHENTIC. Our waiter was Italian & very friendly. I got the bolognese which was fabulous & like I said, very authentic. My boyfriend got the penne filante & loved it. Portions were typical Italian, hearty but not the healing piles of pasta we're used to in American restaurants. But nonetheless, it was just the right amount of food. For dessert we shared the vanilla ice cream with berries & it was wonderful. We made reservations, so on a weekend I would definitely recommend doing that because the place itself is kind of small. Dress is casual, more so than we were expecting. I would definitely recommend this place for anyone seeking an actual authentic Italian dining experience in Chicago.

22.description: Second time here, service was amazing, and the food was delicious. We ordered the Gnocchi Bava and the Tagliolini Boscaiola, they were both made very well, and tasted fantastic. The Gnocchi practically melts in your mouth, and the Tagliolini is a prefect vegetarian dish with all the veggies and lots of flavor. Our server, Frederica, was delightful and good spirited. She was attentive and helpful with our choices and was quick with any requests we had. We will definitely be back, still have to try the yummy looking soufflé!

15.description: Ate here during restaurant week. We picked this restaurant because of the variety of choices on their restaurant week menu. All three courses on the $33 menu were full sized. Everything was prepared perfectly and delicious. Pastas and desserts are made in house and it shows. Our server was able to answer my numerous questions about the menu choices and did not even get annoyed with me (I had a LOT of questions! ). The place is small, but comfortable. I looked at the regular menu too and the choices are many and prices are reasonable. Recommend the eggplant parmigiana-type appetizer...very particular about this dish and it was excellent!!

57.description: Last minute. Didn't need a reservation on a Saturday. Great food, price and service. Highly recommend.

20.description: Delicious, real Italian food and great service: attentive and thoughtful but not overbearing. I enjoyed a peaceful dinner that exceeded my expectations and left with a content smile on my face. Highly recommended!

36.description: One of my favorite restaurants in Chicago...never have had a bad mean here and this is real Italian food served by actual Italians. The space is lovely, making for a charming experience. My only complaint is one of the servers who has waited on me a number of times feels the need to complain about how tired he is from working so much, as he hands me a $180 check - it makes me want to tell him how hard I will have to work to earn enough for the bill. Beyond that, the place is excellent and recommend it to everybody.

14.description: I have been wanting to try this place for a while. Space wise its kind of cramp but I wasn't bothered in our small corner. Our server was so sweet, patient, and gave great recommendations. I wish I could remember his name but he had great locks! My only regret is that I was sick so I couldn't taste how good it was, it was good, but imagine if I was not sick! Though the spicy pasta was not spicy at all.... but it was still great.Only thing is that it was Pricey, and my pasta bowl was so small.. but high quality. Also my friend got the tropical salad and she couldn't stop staying how great it was.

58.description: Amarit is okay.  The food is okay, the prices are okay, the staff are okay.  Definitely a place where you can get food quickly.  Online ordering is very nice.  I have used a coupon once with them and they weren't sure how to approach that, even though I got the coupon off of their website seconds before ordering.  If you are in the South Loop, I'd give it a try.

56.description: Delicious and very fresh tasting.  The ambiance of the restaurant might be in the 3 star range, but this is top of the list for my thai take out.

29.description: I am giving it four stars and I will tell you my reasons why - 1) They have singapore sling on the drink menu - long story short but my 90-something granny has dementia and is always ordering singapore slings at restaurants which usually have no idea what she is talking about. No worries granny, Amarit has you covered xo ;)2) Prices were very reasonable for where it is located3) Food was not great, but it was not bad either and it came out quick4) Crab ragoons were pretty decent5) Atmosphere was a nice medium, not too posh, not a dump6) They have cashews in their pineapple fried rice!7) We were able to be seated quickly8) Service was fair in that kind of reserved asian style9) 15% off with Yelp checkin - this is the only fault of the experience, I do not believe we received our 15% off when we checked out despite showing to host at beginning of meal. An oversight I am sure. Calling now to see if they will honor.

42.description: Great place for classic Thai dishes and sushi. If you like red meat and spicy, crying tiger is the dish for you. My go to place for refreshing dishes and beer, especially when I'm longing for summer. Bring on the heat!

23.description: Pad See Ew. Awesome. Green Curry. Kang Karee Kai. Awesome. Bulls, bears, and dynamite roll. Amazing. I live a few blocks away and have ate here 3 times in the past 3 weeks.

47.description: The Crab Rangoon Appetizer and Mongolian Beef Entree are my favorite dishes. I highly suggest trying this restaurant out if you have not done so already.

8.description: My gf and I have found the best keep Asian secret  at this place...food is always consistently fresh and staff are great! Really chill place to hang late night or if ever you want to grab a smooth drink and good food with the lady friend during a snowy night. Thank me later ;-)

31.description: Here for appetizers and drinks. Huge portions of perfectly prepared rolled sushi. Try the saketini-it was really, really good!

34.description: Ordered delivery, and when my order came, it was incomplete.  When I called the driver, he tried to tell me my food was in the bag.  No kidding???  I opened the bag and unless there's a false bottom or it's the Tardis, my food is not in here.  When I called the restaurant, wanting a refund because paying 30 bucks for a bowl of Tom Kha and a side of peanut sauce is ridiculous, the woman was unhelpful and combative.  I have never had such a ridiculous reaction to calling in with a problem....  How are you going to treat a customer so poorly after YOUR mistake???   I also I tried a bite of the Tom Kha before giving it back so I could get my money back, and it was watery and thin.  Same with the peanut sauce.  Gross.

16.description: BEST PAD THAI YOU'LL EVER HAVE THE PLEASURE OF TASTING!I started eating here when the restaurant was located at the corner of Delaware and State.  Now I live in the north suburbs and will literally go out of my way to drive there for carry out.  I have this phone number saved in my contacts.  I dream about Amarit Pad Thai.

13.description: We orderd the chicken pad thai, chicken pad see ew, beef fried rice, amarit beef steak, chicken panang curry. I really love the panang curry and pad see ew. We ordered sushi too just forgot the names, but I was yummy too!

11.description: Sitting here now sipping on an ice cold Singhs awaiting my 2nd roll. Just finished a full Crunchy Spicy Tuna roll that was absolutely amazing.....edible art at a minimum.  Before getting my roll the sushi chef gave me some gratas shashimi...which was wonderful. My 2nd roll was a Spicy Rainbow which was delicious. This place is highly recommended.

39.description: We ordered delivery..took much longer than the time told, ill blame the rain that night... Food...it was OKWe loved the chicken noodle soup and the grilled chicken satay! I will probably order soup here if we dine again We also had the curry panga nue. The peanut sauce was a bit much for me. None the less we would go back to try other dishes

37.description: Amarit is a pretty good Thai restaurant that gives a discount to Yelpers who check in .I had a dish I've never had before which kind of reminded me of  Thai Chili.At Thai places I often order  Chicken with Basil and Chili and that's what I thought  I ordered.Well there was one difference , the meat was ground.I liked it ! My wife had Pad Thai which we both liked and fortunately the place had Tad Man Pla , the fish cakes , which I've always liked.They had a mid western touch , being made from walleye.You can order beer and wine.The service is efficient and friendly.The atmosphere is calm !Generally I like that.I've yet to figure out why people want a restaurant to be a party scene.Although I admit there was little kid grooving to the music and we and other patrons did bop along with him.

0.description: It's been a while since I have been here but its still simple and good!Can't tell you how much I have missed good maki (Sushi). Had Salmon and a Tuna avocado maki. The fish was excellent, melted in my mouth. I want to know where they get it! Also the avocado was perfectly ripe. Not a brown spot in site and nice and soft but still cut perfectly. The ginger was on pointed and pickled nicely.Also had their jasmine rice and chicken soup in a clear broth. Very light and what I was looking for. They make their soups to order so you have to wait a few minutes for it to cone out. The only negative on the food is the soup had a touch too much salt but probably good for most people.Service was also on point, not obtrusive, and there when you needed something.Bonus on checkin they offer a 15% discount. Not sure how long that will last so get it while its good.

38.description: Fast and they use very fresh ingredients.  Love the Crab Rangoon and Duck in Spicy Basil sauce is a must try!

51.description: Amarit Thai Restaurant was not special, but it wasn't too bad- it was pretty average Thai food.  The service was fast and friendly, and the prices were very reasonable.  We had fish cakes (not amazing) and potstickers (very good) for starters.  I ordered the Ram Chicken for an entree.  The chicken is served on a bed of steamed broccoli, covered in a very good peanut sauce, with a bowl of rice on the side.  The peanut sauce was great, but I enjoyed the broccoli more than the chicken, which didn't taste very fresh.

27.description: Fine if you want something quick and easy, a little underwhelming but it was okay.

32.description: I love this place. It is one of my top three go to restaurants for carryout when I don't feel like cooking. I'm surprised the portions are so generous as the quality of the food is great and the price is quite low considering the location of the restaurant. They are super quick too; my normal wait time is 10 minutes and the most I've ever been quoted is 20 minutes.The mongolian beef is delicious and my go to.

54.description: Ordered twice from Amarit and they've become my go-to Thai place.I had their Pad Thai and Fried Spicy Basil Leaves with Meat so far: will have Pad Thai again (it tastes like what you expect a Pad Thai to taste=safe choice).But I think I will be cautious of their meat dishes in the future since the beef in Fried Spicy Basil Leaves dish was super tough.

48.description: For a restaurant who labeled as "Thai Resto" it baffled me that I enjoy their maki more than their phad tai. So there.

44.description: The renovation is beautiful and addition of the sushi bar is awesome. You must try the shrimp in blanket and pineapple fried rice both of which are the best I have ever eaten. I host luncheons at clinics and use Amarit all the time for my catering needs. My account holders LOVE the food and the delivery is always on time. By far, they have the most delicious recipes I have ever tasted.

24.description: Living in the neighborhood I've been looking for a good Asian food restaurant, particularly Thai food. Amarit Thai is the best I have found and I intend on going back... Again and again and again!! It'll be difficult not to go a million times a week! We went last night for dinner and can't stop talking about it. They are incredibly well priced, and the portions are fantastic. My husband got the Panang Nu curry with chicken. It had really great flavor, it was perfectly spicy, and it was the perfect portion size for him. I had the pineapple fried rice and wow! So good! It comes served in a hollowed out pineapple, it's a generous portion (I took home leftovers which were JUST as delicious the second time around!) and has plenty of chicken, cashews, pineapple, and veggies. The BEST part about our dining experience was dessert. We had the mango and sticky rice. That dish is heaven on a plate. It's seasonal, so I'll take as much as I can get for as long as they have it. I would eat it every night if I could!! Love love love. Will for sure be back.

7.description: Decided to try something a little further from my office for lunch the other day and thai-inspired sushi sounded like a good option. I ordered a sashimi combo that came with some chef's choice cuts and my choice of a special roll. Overall, the fish was fresh and the roll was okay, but I just wish it had yielded more food for the pricetag. I may try some of their other rolls and dishes and re-assess the situation at a later date, but for now, it's just A-OK.

49.description: This food is flavorless at best and taste funny at worst. I think probably the worst Thai I've ever had. Tom kha gai was blah.

40.description: We live in the neighborhood, so this became our go-to out of convenience. After exploring the menu we have discovered that we have no need to go anywhere else.   Let me tell you, their tom yum soup became the standard, a high standard, for me and Thai food. And not just in the US but while we were just in freaking Thailand for three weeks I would often compare the tom yum to our good ol' neighborhood take out in Chicago. Of course the Thai food in Thailand was better at times but many times I felt it was equally delicious. Also, everyone told us we would be ruined with American Thai food after our trip to Thailand but as of last night I am here to tell you that amarit is pretty damn delicious still. Side story: awhile ago they accidentally delivered an extra dish of pad thai. We felt bad (what if someone else is missing their order now?) but not bad enough because we inhaled it. They created a pad thai monster! My hubby was obsessed with pad thai while we traveled and still is. Long story short: the best and most authentic thai food  around IMO. Never change, amarit.

53.description: 5 stars for service. 5 stars for food. 10 stars for the alcoholic beverages. Great food for reasonable price. Clearly this place is popular, since we were there, we saw 8 other tables fill up...The food was really yummy and the cocktails...O,M,G -- sooo good and only for $7 and it came in decent sizes. I would totally come back to this place again!

30.description: I really enjoyed everything we had at Amarit. I had crab meat fried rice, which was delicious. The portion was large-I wasn't able to finish it all. My husband also enjoyed his pineapple fried rice. It came in a pineapple, which was a nice touch. Good meal, especially for the price. We will definitely be back.

46.description: I've eaten at Amarit many times, but never reviewed it. Previously I would have given it 3 stars. But they recently remodeled the space and added a sushi bar.  The new space looks great, and the same great Thai menu is still there. While I love sushi, my problem is that the space smelled like a fish market when I walked in. It was very off putting.

1.description: I stopped by here for a quick and early dinner after work because I was desperately craving noodles (when am I not?). The restaurant was fairly empty since it was only 5:00, so the service was extremely quick and efficient! The menu had a lot of variety, which sometimes worries me at any Asian restaurant, but the pad see eiw that I got was good! This is not blow-your-mind food, but if you're in the neighborhood and want some Thai food, I would recommend stopping in.

55.description: Just ordered Sesame Chicken & Pad Khee Moa. Delivery was quick. But the food was Meh. Received very few veggies in the noodle dish & the chicken was bland. Boring meal.

9.description: I am giving it four stars and I will tell you my reasons why - 1) They have singapore sling on the drink menu - long story short but my 90-something granny has dementia and is always ordering singapore slings at restaurants which usually have no idea what she is talking about. No worries granny, Amarit has you covered xo ;)2) Prices were very reasonable for where it is located3) Food was not great, but it was not bad either and it came out quick4) Crab ragoons were pretty decent5) Atmosphere was a nice medium, not too posh, not a dump6) They have cashews in their pineapple fried rice!7) We were able to be seated quickly8) Service was fair in that kind of reserved asian style9) 15% off with Yelp checkin - this is the only fault of the experience, I do not believe we received our 15% off when we checked out despite showing to host at beginning of meal. An oversight I am sure. Calling now to see if they will honor.

26.description: I DO NOT understand HOW this place gets over 1 star. We ordered takeout of the fried calamari, 2 Mongolian Beef and the Shrimp Wonton soup. (~$39)  There is no reason why food SO DISGUSTING should ever be sold to the public, unless they are SUPER CHEAP!!!  The "shrimp" is just a soft rice-like mixture dyed pink ....and I have no idea how on earth they were able to make the "wonton" runny, but they did. It turned into a nauseating, gelatinous blob in the mouth. At the bottom of the container of tasteless hot water, we found 2 shrimp. The calamari tasted as if it'd been sitting in water for decades and was so bland that not even the over-processed sauce could save it. The chalky "mongolian beef" dish tasted like some over-salted buffet style garbage you'd get at Panda Express, and came w/a mini-me portion of white rice. Truthfully, you'd probably be better off spending your money at PandaEx than this place. What a rip off! Never EVER again!!

25.description: One of my favorite places to order from for lunch. They have great sushi -- I'm obsessed with their Cubs Roll -- and fast delivery!

12.description: Went there several times since we discovered this place. It is a more quiet restaurant which we love. They are good for families and they accommodate us with the stroller! Last time we ordered the FIRE DRAGON roll, it is a must have! Delicious and so beautifully presented!Will go back for more sushi! And their soups are great and portions are large.

59.description: Okay, so the beef curry didn't taste all that bad. But what kind of curry has no vegetables? Am i crazy to be minorly (yes, minorly is not a real word) outraged?

21.description: Best thai in the loop    Their noodle dishes are clutch        Plus, there's great service

17.description: Best thai in the loop    Their noodle dishes are clutch        Plus, there's great service

10.description: food is very mediocre, does not feel very authentic, and very bland. the mushroom is from a can, pad thai is quite sticky..and the portion is a bit small

5.description: I really like this place because the service is excellent. They are so friendly and nice. I've been there once for dining in and then to pick up an order. Dining in I had the pineapple fried rice. It was actually served in a pineapple. Ha ha... I got a kick out of that one. The quantity was huge. I think I made about 2 meals out of that.Server was super friendly and came to check on us and kept filling the water glasses.Next time I went there to pick up. I had the roasted duck. The order was ready when I got there and a very friendly guy at the counter handed me the order. Again everything was great.This remains to be one of my fav. Thai spots in the area.

3.description: I would consider myself extremely well-versed in ordering Pad Thai. Not only is it my favorite dish, I have ordered it from 100+ unique Thai restaurants in the Chicagoland area through my years. Quality can range from OK to amazing as it's a pretty easy dish to make right. Another fact I would like to point out, I don't really leave negative reviews on Yelp. I don't usually have negative experiences because I use Yelp to sift through the junk. Things didn't work out as planned this time...I ordered the Pad Thai and an order of crab rangoons for lunch on delivery. This Pad Thai was literally the WORST I have ever had. Flavorless, lack of presentation, and terrible consistency are ways you can start describing the abomination of food they call Pad Thai. I ordered spicy, and it was not remotely spicy. It was like the noodles were made of blandly-seasoned cardboard with 2 small pieces of chicken mixed in. I made it a bit better by dousing it with various hot sauces, but ultimately it was inedible. I can confidently say I have never thrown out anything I just ordered until now. This experience was a waste of time and money, and I hope this can help someone in the future. The crab rangoons were pretty good.UPDATE: The delivery was quick and the service was friendly.

35.description: Got carryout here and honestly wasn't impressed. Got the veggie Tom Yum and Singapore noodles. Tom Yum was pretty bland. $8 for a portion for 2 people which I didn't think was worth it. The noodles seemed like they were made out of spaghetti which was a first for me and also was way creamier than I've ever had--it was also like it had a coconut milk base. Nothing was spicy either which was disappointing given I was eating Thai. Don't think I'll be back.

19.description: Fast delivery and the food came hot and well packaged! The tom yum soup had a good blend of sour and salty but needs a little more spiciness. Nevertheless good.

28.description: Stopped in for lunch, the service was very nice & fast. I had my lunch within 5 minutes. I had the Mongolian beef it was well above average. I would definitely come back and I would definitely recommend it.

45.description: There's nothing bad I could ever say about the service here at Amarit. Bo & Pong are amazing! I work a block away from here & have been coming here for 3yrs. They always greet me with a smile, Wan thank you for such amazing service.

33.description: Rated for this 'class', genre of restaurant.  Dinner 4 ppl -- Down from 5 star lunch due to disappointingly Odd service: waitress immediately wanted appetizer order, before beverages (!?); needed water at times; would have ordered another wine...  Food arrived timely and hot tho.  Loved the sushi rolls 1) w/ tomago, tofu, etc 2) 'crunchy gommae'.. And massuman(?) and 2 noodle dishes were good.

43.description: It took quite a while for Amarit to win me over. The first thing I ever got there was pad thai and I was not a fan. Now that they have remodeled and revamped the menu, things are really looking up. I love love love the chicken/beef noodle soup. I've tried both and really enjoyed them (w/ extra bean sprouts) and also the veggie variety is good too. The spicy chicken curry is great, but the bean sprouts are super long and hard to eat. Great flavor though! I'm also a fan of the pineapple fried rice. The staff is very friendly and helpful. It's not the best thai in the world, but it's definitely the best in South Loop.

2.description: Clearly, this restaurant is a target for non-Thai customers. As I am Thai, eating at this Thai restaurant, I can immediately assure that. I came here on Christmas Day for dinner with family only because it's open and closest to our hotel, we ordered pad Thai, tom yum chicken, and crab meat fried rice. All of them were way below to our Thai standards. - Pad Thai was extremely sweet.- Tom yum was not made from scratch. It's so cheap that they just threw chicken, onion, mushroom, and tom yum flavored knorr soup ( I know this because I sometimes used it when I cook at home)- the crab meat fried rice was the only decent here but a little too salty. Overall, the service was friendly. Just extremely disappointed with the food. Again, this is coming from a Thai person. If you want authentic Thai food, this isn't a place for you.

18.description: Amarit is a pretty good Thai restaurant that gives a discount to Yelpers who check in .I had a dish I've never had before which kind of reminded me of  Thai Chili.At Thai places I often order  Chicken with Basil and Chili and that's what I thought  I ordered.Well there was one difference , the meat was ground.I liked it ! My wife had Pad Thai which we both liked and fortunately the place had Tad Man Pla , the fish cakes , which I've always liked.They had a mid western touch , being made from walleye.You can order beer and wine.The service is efficient and friendly.The atmosphere is calm !Generally I like that.I've yet to figure out why people want a restaurant to be a party scene.Although I admit there was little kid grooving to the music and we and other patrons did bop along with him.

41.description: I ordered carry out one afternoon for lunch.  It was my first time in and I didn't expect the interior to be as cute as it was.  It made me want to end my work day early have have a cocktail.  The Mongolian beef was pretty good, the pad Thai was not.  I will definitely try some other things on the menu in the future.

52.description: I've ordered from this place couple of times, mostly because it is really close to my office, but today was last time.I had sweet & sour shrimp for $9.89 with tax, and it was mostly sweet, 4 (no more no less) shrimp with tail on, not impressive at all! Couple of weeks ago I ordered another dish with shrimp, and the same amount was served. It's ridiculous!

50.description: I love a good thai place and this place has a great atmosphere, very awesome and welcoming staff. A good place to feel comfortable eating along or with friends. Saw several groups in there and the delivery guy was constantly on the run. I would say the place is a great local neighborhood spot and though the portions were huge and the food was good, it wasn't the best Thai I've ever had. Maybe I'm just used to a bit sweeter pineapple chicken curry. It's certainly worth trying if you live close.

4.description: We are from out of town & we enjoyed this place so much! The staff was so nice & patient. You could tell the food was really fresh! It was clean & cozy inside.

6.description: I'm unfortunately not a fan and will not likely order from here again. Placed an order for pick-up on a lazy, rainy Saturday evening. The Chicken Pad Thai was extremely bland and the thai noodles were very soggy. Arguably the worst pad thai I've ever had. It was super disappointing especially after all the rave reviews. Oddly, their Thai Iced Teas were amazing though. I wouldn't hesitate to order it again, but our entree was so abysmal that it's hard for me to imagine another item on their menu being any good.Another positive is their staff is super friendly and pleasant. BUT (like most of us) I'm in the business of devouring good food and did not find any here. :(

22.description: Sitting here now sipping on an ice cold Singhs awaiting my 2nd roll. Just finished a full Crunchy Spicy Tuna roll that was absolutely amazing.....edible art at a minimum.  Before getting my roll the sushi chef gave me some gratas shashimi...which was wonderful. My 2nd roll was a Spicy Rainbow which was delicious. This place is highly recommended.

15.description: Not a fan, pad Thai was very plain, springs rolls had no substance, will not order again.

57.description: I was very surprised at how great the food was here!  I've been searching for good Pad See Ew since I moved here from NYC.  Glad that I found the place!  The staff was all very friendly to us.

20.description: Really good consistent Chinese food. I have ordered from here 6 times and every time been so happy. The Pad See Eiw, wonton soup, spicy tuna rolll & chicken curry are all so good!

36.description: We orderd the chicken pad thai, chicken pad see ew, beef fried rice, amarit beef steak, chicken panang curry. I really love the panang curry and pad see ew. We ordered sushi too just forgot the names, but I was yummy too!

14.description: Always great food for a great price! The sushi is artistic. I recommend the fire dragon. I generally stick with the curry chicken or Kung Pao chicken.Decent assortment of beers, wines and cocktails.

58.description: Really good food. I had the wet burrito (Burrito Suizo) and it was a little spicy but good.

56.description: Great tacos for good prices! Love going here.

29.description: Best tacos in the South Loop! Waaaay better than Spanglish(especially on the service side of things).

42.description: Dang, Flaco's reminds me of the Mexican food I miss in Chicago. The Al Pastor Burrito ($7.45) is HUGE and so delicious. I split it with a friend, and we were thoroughly satisfied. I couldn't stop saying, "Wow, this is great."On Monday, there were also $3 margaritas. The mango went down easy.There's some nice though packed outdoor seating on Dearborn, but the inside is also pleasant and more spacious for seating. Be sure to get some of the squeeze bottles of hot sauce.Very solid and was a food highlight in my latest trip.

23.description: Ridiculously overpriced taco joint inundated by knit-hat wearing hipsters that wouldn't know authentic food if it slapped them in the face with an Echo And The Bunnymen record.But seriously: $13 for three tacos the size of my wallet? What a joke.

47.description: I grew up in LA so when it comes to Mexican food I can be pretty picky, however, I know most places aren't going to live up to what I've grown up with.  That being said, Flacos is pretty good.  Don't expect mind blowing creativity nor some great tacos that your best friend's grandmother used to make.  Go on Taco Tuesdays as you can get specific weekly special taco for $1 each.  They don't make them any smaller than normal so you'll be full on just a few.  They also have weekly specials for beer/margaritas/sangria as well.  My only wish is that their burrito w/ cheese sauce didn't cost another $2 more just for the cheese sauce as it makes your burrito nearly $11 w/ tax.

8.description: I really liked the vibe of Flacos, an eclectic atmosphere with some interesting art on the walls. I was surprised at how busy it got on a Sunday night. Seems like a lot of people from the neighborhood. Even though I didn't get anything to drink, I always like to see Mexican restaurants with liquor licenses because they are hard to find in Chicago. As for the food, I felt it was just okay. The two taco dinner is a good enough deal. Unfortunately the fish taco had too much sauce and the steak taco was over seasoned as well. I also felt the rice/beans were dry. Next time I would try something else.

31.description: I am obsessed with this place.  The south loop was in dire need of a Mexican eatery and they scored big time with Flaco's Tacos!  (I'm sorry Taco Burrito King but the truth hurts, OK, I'll still visit you when I am hungover)  If you are feeling all fancy, you can hit up their other location at Water Tower Place.You know what they call Thursdays?  THIRSTY THURSDAYS!  Yep, on Thursday you can get yourself a yummy horchata with rum for under 4 bucks.  They have a clever name for every day of the week and the names all revolve around alcohol.  Be still my beating heart!I rotate between three items when I come here, their bowl with either chicken or just veggies, their fish tacos (so fresh, grilled), and when I'm being naughty I have their carne asada smothered fries.  Great drinks, great food, and cute place to boot.
