34.description: bombass tacosthe cowboy and al pastor tacos were on POINT! def coming back

16.description: I am obsessed with this place.  The south loop was in dire need of a Mexican eatery and they scored big time with Flaco's Tacos!  (I'm sorry Taco Burrito King but the truth hurts, OK, I'll still visit you when I am hungover)  If you are feeling all fancy, you can hit up their other location at Water Tower Place.You know what they call Thursdays?  THIRSTY THURSDAYS!  Yep, on Thursday you can get yourself a yummy horchata with rum for under 4 bucks.  They have a clever name for every day of the week and the names all revolve around alcohol.  Be still my beating heart!I rotate between three items when I come here, their bowl with either chicken or just veggies, their fish tacos (so fresh, grilled), and when I'm being naughty I have their carne asada smothered fries.  Great drinks, great food, and cute place to boot.

13.description: We came here after a race for a few tacos and a few beers. Reasonable prices and okay tacos.

11.description: I'm a strong endorser of flavorful Mexican food. Authentic Mexican food has a kick and spice to it above all else. This food was a little watered down in terms of flavor but still great overall. I ordered the Combo Tres and tried the "Puerco Tamale", the "Cowboy Taco", and the Mini Chicken burrito. It came with a side of rice and beans. The Tamale was very good and very authentic tasting. Not at all Tex-Mex. The Cowboy Taco seemed good on paper but didn't have the flavor profile I was anticipating, but it was still alright. I ate the mini burrito too quickly to judge because I was pretty hungry in the beginning but ordering all three of those plus the side of rice and beans (which was delicious and everything I anticipated it tasting like) it's enough to keep you full for a while. I'm a small person, but a big eater and I couldn't finish it all in one sitting. As someone who comes from a town where the best "Mexican" food is Chipotle, this was a much appreciated and pleasant surprise for lunch while on a business trip. The seating at this location is horrific. Very crowded and not too much wiggle room. Come during off hours for some space and a little less noise. Lunch time they are packed!

39.description: I live right down the street from this place so it's really convenient for me . That being said I have to honestly say that I prefer eating at Chipotle. I've order tacos here before and they aren't anything special. Tonight I thought I'd try something different and ordered the Flaco Bowl. I ordered steak was very uninspiring. I could immediately tell that they are using cheaper cuts of meat evident by the amount of gristle. The quality of beef at Chipotle is much better.  Another much better alternative to Flaco's is Spanglish on State & Harrison.

37.description: Plentiful, Cheap Eats, LaidBack Interior - We were quite surprised by the quantity of food, as well as the quality. I'm not a big fan of Mexican, unlike my spouse, but I really loved my chicken burrito. I mistakenly ordered two, and it was so much that I gave the second to some street people to share. A bar-like interior, plus they serve alcohol.

0.description: The price and portions are pretty darn good of a downtown restaurant. The food was fresh and delicious. The only reason I gave them one star less is because they messed up our order and didn't even inform us about it. We waited 20 minutes for our  3 tacos to be made. Note to the chefs: Don't make your veggie tacos with mostly rice and beans when those are already the sides. Add some fresh veggies.

38.description: Fucking great tacos          They're the best in the south loop                   Nice and fast service

51.description: Love this place! Food is awesome. Good vibe in a good location. Prices are great and specials are so good, such a value.

27.description: Cheap? Check!  Good quality? Unfortunately not. I got the cowboy taco and was disappointed with the meat quality. I guess it makes sense given the price point.         Cute little place though.

32.description: Felt like some nachos.  Ordered the steak.  Pretty safe bet usually, worst idea ever tonight.  The meat was cut with the grain with a flavor that reminded me of Old El Paso.  Every piece had a flavor and texture that offended.  Takeaway outside their delivery zone, so I pushed the steak to the side.  On to the guacamole, which consisted of larger than normal chunks of tomato and unchopped cilantro leaves.  Very little avocado to be found.  Strike two.  The beans are passable but my quest for cheese ended rather abruptly.   Supposed to be nachos, right?  Salsa also mysteriously absent from the bag.   This is Friday night at 8:30 service.

54.description: blech.  been here a few times and i've never been impressed.  i leave grossed out.  the best thing i've had was the french fries, and their specialty definitely shouldn't be french fries.

48.description: This is some of the best Mexican food I've ever eaten, and I'm not a big fan of Mexican food! Flacos Tacos is one of the best quick good tasting restaurants I've ever had a meal at. Definitely would come back again. Very affordable.

44.description: I've lived in the South Loop for 3.5 years, and by default Flacos has been my go-to Mexican food joint. Not because the food tastes great, or its a great deal, or the great sevice,  it's just my go-to place because it's close and the next closest Mexican place is about 4-5x farther away. I wish it was better, and each time it go I hope that the food is better, but it's not. Tonight was the straw that broke the camels back though. I ordered a beer twice but the cashier never got it. I ordered a chicken taco, but instead I was given a "steak" taco that had some pretty tough low grade meat. I think if there weren't so many students in the area that would patronize them regardless of their crappy food and service they would have already gone out of business. For me, this is my last visit to Flacos.  From now on when I get a hankerin' for Mexican food, I'll make the trip to other nearby places or just go over to Pilsen. Goodbye Flacos.

24.description: I guess if you go to this place around lunch time on a Friday, it might take a little longer than expected. A lot of people show up for take out, and single people take up a table for 4.  I can understand if that's the only place to sit, but eat your food, don't sit there writing in a notebook or messing around with your lap top.We had a party of 4, and it 36 minutes from order to delivery of our food at the table.  I suppose that's okay for "fresh" food, but I wasn't impressed by the food quality overall.  Just pretty average. If it takes longer to order the fish tacos, you might want to tell people that or have it on the menu. I had no idea, and I would have probably gone with something else had I known.Service was friendly.  I think it was really busy when I was there, though.  Maybe avoid the 11-12:15 timeframe on weekdays.

7.description: They're a pretty good lunch place, relatively cheap, and affordable. Their drinks aren't as strong as I'd like but who can truly complain at the low cost of them? They have a small cozy store, perfect for a lunch date or otherwise. Their customer service is relatively good and food came out quickly. It was overall a great experience. Will definitely go again.

49.description: Overall really good experience if you're looking for quick and cheap Mexican food at a casual place. What I ordered: Combo #2 with two vegetarian tacos and rice and beans. Chips and salsa as appetizer. Pros: Very quick service, friendly staff, tasty food, outdoor seating, great specials (went on Taco Tuesday) Cons: Not too much space to move around

40.description: They had their last chance. We have lived in the South Loop for 6 years now and visit several of the restaurants regularly, but not Flaco's Tacos. Here's why... several years ago, the 1st visit in which food was horrible, service was bad, and was one of the worst experiences we had ever had. A couple years later, we thought OK we'll try again. Hmm... pretty much same results. So once again last night we tried again. And this will be the last time. As we walked in 1 1/2 hours prior to closing, we were immediately told "Take out only" before we even got to the counter. Well, we had wanted to sit down to have a beer or Margarita with dinner, but OK. We are less than 5 mins away so we would just eat at home. Our food was ready, we checked to make sure it was correct (it was), and on the way we went. When we started to eat... everything was cold. not a hint of warmth. The Chicken in the tacos was over done, almost burnt, the only thing acceptable thing was the rice and beans, which also were barely luke warm. It's pretty hard to mess up the type of food Flaco's Tacos serves, but they have seemed to do it on every visit we ever made. Never again.

53.description: It's fast and cheap to eat in the city and open late when out on the town. Only thing I dislike is the lack of room to sit and move around. The tacos are good but not outstanding. So 3 stars cause of lack of room and not amazing tacos

30.description: The place was packed but tables were available outside. The food was very good and price decent. Not much room inside if you have a stroller.

46.description: Came here recently after a long hiatus, and this place is even better than I remembered! It's a friendly, bustling spot with great food. Nice variety without being a completely overwhelming menu. I've always enjoyed their tacos, and they have a special for different days of the week that switches things up and makes it affordable. Their margaritas are amazing (and a steal at ~$5/glass) and they have wonderful salsa as well as tables indoor and out. Ambiance is fun, bright and cheery, and the food comes out very quickly. Anytime I'm in the South Loop, I'll make my way to Flaco's!

1.description: First off, food is ok, but it depends on what you get. I love the menu items, it tries to catch on to a modern twist of Mexican food but doesn't go too far. The steak fries is like a nacho grande just with fries instead of nachos. The tacos and tortas are also very simple. What I don't like too much is the steak, it almost tastes like roast beef and is too saucy and has a huge flavor kick that gets old after a while. The meat feels grainy, and personally I don't like the sauce.Service is ok, it takes a while to get your food; one time we waited 30 minutes for our food. I guess that could be good if the food tastes fresh, but it does taste frozen. The staff at the registers really don't act like they want to be there and are not too inviting. Well if the staff don't want to be there, why do I want to be there?There is a cool vibe and it is a fun spot. Every time I go there is different music playing. The first time I heard Salsa, the second time I heard Hip-Hop and the last time I heard top 40. Personally I didn't enjoy the music the last two times and so I chose to get the food to go. Other than music, Flacos Tacos has a Spanish decor that resembles the food they are trying to make.Overall, this is a good spot to go if your in the mood for Mexican flavors, and it is definitely good the first time, but the shotty service, inconsistent music, and long wait for food is enough to make me want to choose another spot, or get to-go.

55.description: Usually the food here is good, but beware! I've had some really awful not fresh take out, so I think they need to have Gordon Ramsey come in and go through their freezer and pantry and chuck food that's out of date. The first time, it was a tamale with serious freezer burn, hard crusty and nasty. The second time it was a big cookie that was so stale it was ridiculous. I've had both of these items before and they were great, but it does make me think twice. Big sellers are the burritos and tacos, so they should be safe.

9.description: Best tacos I have ever tasted. Great hangover food, that is actually delicious. Great prices, although super tiny sitting area. While we were there, just about everyone had the frozen sangria, and we wished we had gotten one too.

26.description: I don't know what I'm missing here, but I did not have anything extraordinary here. I LOVE Mexican food and tacos but I was very disappointed in my chicken tamale, fish taco, and beans and rice. Everything was super dry and the seasoning had a weird taste. Even the refried beans and rice were dry. I ate it because I didn't want to waste my money, but it wasn't very enjoyable. I feel that everything was heated in the microwave, and nothing tasted fresh. Maybe ppl love this place because of the margaritas (I didn't order any, just a to-go order on a Wednesday night), but I didn't experience anything to write home about.

25.description: I'm a strong endorser of flavorful Mexican food. Authentic Mexican food has a kick and spice to it above all else. This food was a little watered down in terms of flavor but still great overall. I ordered the Combo Tres and tried the "Puerco Tamale", the "Cowboy Taco", and the Mini Chicken burrito. It came with a side of rice and beans. The Tamale was very good and very authentic tasting. Not at all Tex-Mex. The Cowboy Taco seemed good on paper but didn't have the flavor profile I was anticipating, but it was still alright. I ate the mini burrito too quickly to judge because I was pretty hungry in the beginning but ordering all three of those plus the side of rice and beans (which was delicious and everything I anticipated it tasting like) it's enough to keep you full for a while. I'm a small person, but a big eater and I couldn't finish it all in one sitting. As someone who comes from a town where the best "Mexican" food is Chipotle, this was a much appreciated and pleasant surprise for lunch while on a business trip. The seating at this location is horrific. Very crowded and not too much wiggle room. Come during off hours for some space and a little less noise. Lunch time they are packed!

12.description: Ordered a strawberry margarita. Apparently that just meant strawberry syrup poured into the bottom of the margarita glass with frozen margarita poured on top. Not stirred or mixed or anything. OK, whatever. Not a big deal, tasted fine.Then, I tried ordering queso and chips - which was still on their online menu. They don't make queso anymore? Why wouldn't a Mexican place make queso... So, I just went with chips and salsa. The 'salsa' was impossibly hot (and I can handle a fair bit of heat) and more like the red sauce you get w/ eggrolls. The chips were crispy/fluffy but overwhelmingly oily and not all the way fried - so the middle of some of the larger chips were gross and chewy.The homemade coconut bars were on point, though.

59.description: Staff is nice and place is cool.  Great location.  Awesome margaritas.   The Only thing is the steak is not that great.   The Pozole is excellent but steak tacos and burritos are not the best.   It's close to home so we visit often.   Price is a little overpriced     Enjoy!

21.description: Was looking forward to trying this place for awhile, this place packed during the Lit Fest. Sadly it was an unimpressive experience.  I tried the combo tres, 3 items with rice and beans for $11.  I ordered 2 mini-burritos - 1 Al Pastor and 1 lime-grilled steak, and a fish taco. The regular price of a mini-burrito is $2.95 and I thought it would be at least a third of a full burrito, I wish I was that lucky!  Those suckers are TINY!  Maybe 2 bites, I honestly laughed when I saw them.  The Al Pastor had good flavor but I couldn't really taste much besides the tortilla on the steak one.  The fish taco was just ok, not much flavor there either. The rice and beans were just standard, I didn't eat much of those and walked out still hungry. I have no problem paying for food but I'm kinda used to getting more than a bite when I order a plate.  I shoulda listened to the reviews on this one, I won't go back.

17.description: I had never actually tried a sangrita before visiting Flaco's Tacos. I'd never even heard of it, actually. But it sure it tasty. It's dangerously tasty because you may not realize how much alcohol you're crushing until you start feeling tingly and invincible. Moving along, I also thoroughly enjoyed the food. I went with the al pastor - a personal favorite - and was not disappointed. The meat was nice and juicy, which doesn't always happen with al pastor tacos. And as an added pleasant surprise, the chips and guac were really good. Simple things like chips and guac sometimes get neglected, but these were very good.Staff was cool, wait time was about what you'd expect for what we ordered, and the prices were more than fair. We enjoyed the meal and will be returning soon.

10.description: Dang, Flaco's reminds me of the Mexican food I miss in Chicago. The Al Pastor Burrito ($7.45) is HUGE and so delicious. I split it with a friend, and we were thoroughly satisfied. I couldn't stop saying, "Wow, this is great."On Monday, there were also $3 margaritas. The mango went down easy.There's some nice though packed outdoor seating on Dearborn, but the inside is also pleasant and more spacious for seating. Be sure to get some of the squeeze bottles of hot sauce.Very solid and was a food highlight in my latest trip.

5.description: Just went here with boyfriend and it was a mix of good, okay, and very bad.The good:The Monday special $3 margaritas.  I got the "Jamaican" (hibiscus) and boyfriend got strawberry.  They were both good frozen fun margs that had a GOOD amount of alcohol in them for three dollars and tasted yummy.The southwest salad.  Yummy, creamy, great flavors.  Everything blended nicely.  There was a little too much dressing but this can be fixed easily.  They are liberal with the meat and all of the toppings.  Boyfriend got this and I ate half of it.  Luckily he's generous with his food :).The okay:The carne asada fries.  The steak was the least fun part -- they had a ton of cheese, guac, tomatoes, and jalapeños.  Quite good.  Fries were kept crispy, which is hard when they're doused in toppings.  Really the only bad part was the overly tough steak.The BAD:The fish taco.  So boring and bland!!  Oh my goodness, fish tacos are usually my favorite things and this one was so bad.  There wasn't much in it and what was there was bad tasting.  Never getting this again -- I'll get the salad next time, because it was great.

3.description: Felt like some nachos.  Ordered the steak.  Pretty safe bet usually, worst idea ever tonight.  The meat was cut with the grain with a flavor that reminded me of Old El Paso.  Every piece had a flavor and texture that offended.  Takeaway outside their delivery zone, so I pushed the steak to the side.  On to the guacamole, which consisted of larger than normal chunks of tomato and unchopped cilantro leaves.  Very little avocado to be found.  Strike two.  The beans are passable but my quest for cheese ended rather abruptly.   Supposed to be nachos, right?  Salsa also mysteriously absent from the bag.   This is Friday night at 8:30 service.

35.description: Just went to this small little taco place tucked into printers row recently and had some great tacos. The service is fast but not sit down. The tacos were good but not as good as Rick Bayless. They have both indoor and outdoor seating and more then just tacos. They also have tamales which I can never seem to get enough of. Over all it was okay.

19.description: I really like this place.  The tacos, tamales, and enchiladas are great.  The frozen margaritas are good to.  The taco of the week is usually outstanding.  But, it does not compare with places like Big start and Antique Taco that seem more authentic in the way they make their food (and have more flavor).However, the staff if pretty rude. Which is why I rated them less stars.  I have been going here for years and am almost to the point I don't want to bother coming in anymore.  Especially this one girl with blue hair.  Every time we go in she just looks mad at the world and is pretty short with us.  Never mind asking her questions about the menu like you are inconveniencing her while she is at her job.  The other register employees are not much better.Be careful if you come on Margarita Monday ($3 Margs) or Taco Tuesday ($1 taco of the week) because it will be packed, there will be a long line, a wait for food, and most likely no where to sit.  But, that is expected because of the daily specials, so you have been warned!I have also tried catering once.  Bethany is great.  She is probably the best and nicest person I have every interacted with at Flacos.  I was also very happy with the catering - the mini sambraos were a cute touch!  I would just not get quesadillas for catering - all the other food was hot and yummy but those were cold.  However, that is to be expected with quesadillas as you need to eat them as soon as they are off the stove. Overall if you want fast, cheap Mexican food, and a delicious margarita and don't mind the occasional wait or care about friendly staff interactions this is the place to go to in Printers Row!

28.description: Pretty solid taco joint. I'd have to visit again to grant 5-star. I'm a fan of a big over stuffed taco and that's what I got. The rice and beans were a nice accompaniment but definitely sauce them up. The chicken taco was very good but the tilapia taco was super bland. The sauce didn't have much flavor. Thankfully the sauces they provide are pretty decent. For the price this place is great!

45.description: Living in the South Loop, your restaurant options are pretty limited. I was sick of my old standbys so ventured here for dinner on a summer night, envisioning myself enjoying a balmy summer evening with a cold margarita. We ordered margaritas, and I was really bummed to see that it was basically a slushie-- not on the rocks. Is it just me, but doesn't that require an explanation? When I see "traditional margarita" on the menu, I definitely was picturing on the rocks. Oh well. We asked to exchange it for a beer and they allowed it. The tacos are fine-- they're good but nothing revolutionary. Good prices. Would come here again if I had a hankering for Mexican, but otherwise I'm not dying to.

33.description: Me and a friend had chicken tamales and steak tacos. the steak tacos were seasoned throught the meat and it was juicy. The tamale was also seasoned good. the place was really nice.

43.description: Can you say "overrated"?  Went there with a few guys.  The tacos were about 1 step below what you would get from the local taco truck.  One guy really liked his margarita though, saving the place from the dreaded 1 star review.

2.description: We lovvvvvved Flaccos tacos. We were typical tourists, shopping on Michigan Ave and wanted to grab a quick bite to eat. Nothing too heavy. We used Yelp to find this place and are so glad we did!Flaccos tacos is off the street in a small space. It was crowded when we arrived. I ordered a cowboy taco and he ordered a fried fish taco. Cheap and perfectly priced for all the ingredients. They were amazing!!!! I kept wanting to go back and get another one. If you want a quick light bite, go here. Soooo good.

18.description: Went here for dinner yesterday.  It's a delightful little restaurant with great food and even better drink specials.  It was margarita Monday - $3 for any type all night.  I had a Flaco's bowl, vegetarian, which was pretty good overall.  It would have been nice to have tofu options though.  The best part of the restaurant was the price.  Dinner for 2 with drinks was only $22.  I definitely anticipate that I will come back here!

41.description: I've been to this place three times and the food is always fresh and flavorful. Service is good plus they have a nice selection of desserts - all yummy! I've had their margaritas and was extremely pleased. They feature drink specials too so check the board when you arrive.

52.description: We were in town visiting and needed a late night bite. This was perfect. A good mix between chipotle and Baja Fresh. Food tasted very good and left us feeling satisfied. Highly recommend it if you are looking for something quick and casual while in Chicago.

50.description: I get to eat here 2-3 times a year and each time I'm never disappointed.  Started out with guacamole and chips and was impressed!  The steak taco was tender and perfectly spiced. My favorite. I had seen other comments on here about them, so I went into it being a critic. I also had a "cowboy taco" which was fine, but my least favorite.  The chicken taco was great. Beans and rice were good and a great side to go with the tacos. Wash it down with a $3 margarita and life's good!

4.description: I have been here a few times now for their tacos of the week.  Sometimes they are amazing (Village Taco) and others they are almost flavorless.  They either hit it perfectly or not at all.  Service is decent and a fun atmosphere.

6.description: People that bash this place must be confused. Every taco I tried here was absolutely amazing.  I'm telling you, people that say otherwise have to be some kind of snobs with nothing better to do than bash a restaurant. Find a hobby people!  Anyway, it was great. Haters gonna hate I guess. Spending a little time south of the border does not an expert make. Clearly they are offering a more contemporary take on the whole taco thing. Anyway, and one last time for the people in the back row, screw the naysayers. Margaritas were great too by the way. And I'm out.

22.description: We lovvvvvved Flaccos tacos. We were typical tourists, shopping on Michigan Ave and wanted to grab a quick bite to eat. Nothing too heavy. We used Yelp to find this place and are so glad we did!Flaccos tacos is off the street in a small space. It was crowded when we arrived. I ordered a cowboy taco and he ordered a fried fish taco. Cheap and perfectly priced for all the ingredients. They were amazing!!!! I kept wanting to go back and get another one. If you want a quick light bite, go here. Soooo good.

15.description: Ridiculously overpriced taco joint inundated by knit-hat wearing hipsters that wouldn't know authentic food if it slapped them in the face with an Echo And The Bunnymen record.But seriously: $13 for three tacos the size of my wallet? What a joke.

57.description: Just went here with boyfriend and it was a mix of good, okay, and very bad.The good:The Monday special $3 margaritas.  I got the "Jamaican" (hibiscus) and boyfriend got strawberry.  They were both good frozen fun margs that had a GOOD amount of alcohol in them for three dollars and tasted yummy.The southwest salad.  Yummy, creamy, great flavors.  Everything blended nicely.  There was a little too much dressing but this can be fixed easily.  They are liberal with the meat and all of the toppings.  Boyfriend got this and I ate half of it.  Luckily he's generous with his food :).The okay:The carne asada fries.  The steak was the least fun part -- they had a ton of cheese, guac, tomatoes, and jalapeños.  Quite good.  Fries were kept crispy, which is hard when they're doused in toppings.  Really the only bad part was the overly tough steak.The BAD:The fish taco.  So boring and bland!!  Oh my goodness, fish tacos are usually my favorite things and this one was so bad.  There wasn't much in it and what was there was bad tasting.  Never getting this again -- I'll get the salad next time, because it was great.

20.description: I just ordered the chips and salsa, but it was pretty good. I loved how it was homemade chips that was actually fresh. The salsa was a bit spicy for my taste, but still yummy nonetheless.

36.description: The food is delicious, plenty of vegetarian options. The service could be better, I have been overcharged my last few visits. The first time they could not refund money so they gave a gift certificate. The second time, the manager inspected the gift certificate as if it was counterfeit then overcharged me. After I asked for the receipt, he opened the drawer and refunded my money minus tax.I am not a fan of establishments counting my pennies...

14.description: Came here recently after a long hiatus, and this place is even better than I remembered! It's a friendly, bustling spot with great food. Nice variety without being a completely overwhelming menu. I've always enjoyed their tacos, and they have a special for different days of the week that switches things up and makes it affordable. Their margaritas are amazing (and a steal at ~$5/glass) and they have wonderful salsa as well as tables indoor and out. Ambiance is fun, bright and cheery, and the food comes out very quickly. Anytime I'm in the South Loop, I'll make my way to Flaco's!

58.description: After running around in the cold we were extremely pleased to have come around Gino's. We were seated promptly, given our drinks and enlightened on the specials.  Pizza did take a while to arrive, but it was worth the wait.  Wonderfully fresh and saucy, nicely topped with a ton of cheese and sausage patties it was irresistible and full of flavor.  The deep dish dough was soft and crunchy in all the right places.  Unfortunately we didn't have a chance to visit any other locations, but this one was very good. Give them a shot if you're in that neck of the woods.

56.description: As one who frequents Giordano's and Lou Malnati's, I have very high expectations for Chicago pizza. I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of pizza provided by Gino's East. We ordered the Chicago Fire, a sausage pizza with red peppers and onions (deep dish, of course). While it did take forever to cook (quoted that it would take 45 minutes, but took a full hour) it was worth the wait. The pizza is very similar to a Giordano's style with a different crust. For dessert we ordered the beignets. I was not overly enthused. It took an additional 20 minutes to cook. It came out piping hot but rock hard. My impression of beignets is soft dough which this was not. It was essentially just a bunch of cinnamon sugar. I'll also mention that I used a Groupon which helped and made it dirt cheap. While maybe not my favorite Chicago pizza, I would come back.

29.description: I came here on a Thursday night. It was pretty crowded because there was a game later that night, but we were seated right away. We ordered a build your own deep dish pizza with fresh garlic, artichoke hearts, black olives, pineapple, and spinach. Our waitress informed us that the pizzas take a while to bake, so we decided to get the spinach and artichoke dip too.The spinach and artichoke dip comes with toasted crostini which came with some parmesan on top. Seriously, this stuff was SO good. I definitely recommend it. Our deep dish pizza came out a while later, and we were excited to try it for the first time! We weren't disappointed. The crust was light and there was a generous amount of ingredients. Yum!

42.description: The 4 topping large deep dish pizza arrived soupy. It was the worst experience ever. I took a friend who was in town for the first time, imagine the horror! Had to leave halfway through it.

23.description: Best pizza in Chicago! This was our first Chicago pizza on the trip. We loved it. However, after visiting some of the competition we realized how much we REALLY loved it. The crust is made with cornmeal, which makes it yellowish and slightly sweet. Since my hubby and I have different tastes in pizza, we had Chicago Fire and Spinach Margharitta. Both were delicious. Down side is they don't have a personal portion. If you are staying in a hotel where you don't have an in-room fridge and microwave, like us, it will kill you to see all the pizza you can't eat go to waste.

47.description: "One yummy version of famous Chicago pizzas"The east side downtown location of Gino's East has both table dining, outdoor dining and sit-at-the-bar dining. I dined solo this visit so I chose sit-at-the-bar. Ordered the thin crust pizza small pizza (12-inches) with mushrooms. Took about 30 minutes to arrive at 6PM on a Saturday. Very tasty, very good, sauce and cheese. The bar doesn't serve conventional beers like Miller, Busch, etc; they only serve craft style or local beers. I tried the Metropolitan light beer, a local brew -- it was a-okay. My pizza was not cheap, but it was a cheap meal for downtown Chicago, running $17.50 for the small with one topping.

8.description: Let me start right off the bat by saying that I much prefer New York style thin crust pizza over Chicago style open-faced calzones (oops, I mean pizzas), but for what it was, Gino's East has the best deep dish I've ever had.I think the Chicago Man Vs Food episode said it best - New York style is for people on the go, while Chicago style is more of a sit-down experience. And while visiting Chicago, we had quite the sit-down experience as we got to eat their signature food while watching a Black Hawks playoff game on TV (which they lost, by the way).It was a nice taste of Chicago and a really good deep dish pizza, but it wasn't quite enough to convert me over from my beloved New York thin crust.

31.description: I'm a newbie to Chicago pizza, but I have to say it was excellent. But it must be eaten fresh. My husband and I went to Chicago for the day and of course we have to try pizza. A friend suggested this place and it definitely did not disapoint. Really great atmosphere, got to try local beers and the pizza was AWESOME! We only had time to eat one slice each because we had a megabus to catch so we took it to go.I ate a piece on the bus and it definitely was not as good. We arrived at our destination and I heated it up and... same... not great. I will never forget the slice that I had when it was fresh out of the oven.Thanks, Ginos for making our trip to Chicago awesome!

34.description: I was originally going to give this place 3 stars but upon more reflection I feel like it was a 2.   For an appetizer we had calamari which extremely rubbery stay away from the calamari here!  The entire reason we came here was for the deep dish pizza. We ordered the bbq brisket which I was really looking forward to, but the meat wasn't evenly distributed. Some pieces had so little I first questioned whether it was even there. Other slices had big gobs of it.  The service was ok.  Nothing to either complain about or give a positive recommendation for.  All in all I wish the food was better, especially for the price.

16.description: I heard great things about this place.........Not everything that people tell you is true.  It is an OK place.  We were ignored a bit from our wait staff, all the beers they have are the hoppy craft beers, of which I am not a fan of.  Give your self some time if you order the deep dish pizza, a small took 45 min, my fault, because I should have called ahead to order.  The staff was nice, and it was a bit noisy.

13.description: Nope.  In the past year I've given Gino's East two shots, and boy how I pine for the Gino's of the 80's and early 90's.  This is a pale, wan imitation of what was once a great Chicago pie.  An extra star for the bartender who was very nice and didn't frown upon my iced tea ordering.  Both the deep dish and the thin crust are just lame.  Last visit I decided on the thin supreme, and ordered it well done, asking for char and a crispy crust.  Apparently this is not possible here, as the pie clearly had no contact with the oven surface, but came out on an aerated metal pan of sorts.  Crust was white, it was so devoid of evidence of a hot oven, or even baking.  Please deliver a charred crust if that's what the customer wants.  Will not return, but word to the wise if you go, take your pie to go and scorch it in a cast iron pan at home, then give it a few minutes under the broiler.  It will be better than at your table, I promise.

11.description: I came here on a Thursday night. It was pretty crowded because there was a game later that night, but we were seated right away. We ordered a build your own deep dish pizza with fresh garlic, artichoke hearts, black olives, pineapple, and spinach. Our waitress informed us that the pizzas take a while to bake, so we decided to get the spinach and artichoke dip too.The spinach and artichoke dip comes with toasted crostini which came with some parmesan on top. Seriously, this stuff was SO good. I definitely recommend it. Our deep dish pizza came out a while later, and we were excited to try it for the first time! We weren't disappointed. The crust was light and there was a generous amount of ingredients. Yum!

39.description: Terrible service, can't speak for the pizza as we could not get any servers or managements attention. This is a Sunday night, I wonder what happens on a busy Friday or Saturday night. Sorry to say we left after 20 minutes at our table...no water, no server, no pizza!

37.description: Nope.  In the past year I've given Gino's East two shots, and boy how I pine for the Gino's of the 80's and early 90's.  This is a pale, wan imitation of what was once a great Chicago pie.  An extra star for the bartender who was very nice and didn't frown upon my iced tea ordering.  Both the deep dish and the thin crust are just lame.  Last visit I decided on the thin supreme, and ordered it well done, asking for char and a crispy crust.  Apparently this is not possible here, as the pie clearly had no contact with the oven surface, but came out on an aerated metal pan of sorts.  Crust was white, it was so devoid of evidence of a hot oven, or even baking.  Please deliver a charred crust if that's what the customer wants.  Will not return, but word to the wise if you go, take your pie to go and scorch it in a cast iron pan at home, then give it a few minutes under the broiler.  It will be better than at your table, I promise.

0.description: Seeking the quintessential deep dish Chicago experience, Gino's East does not disappoint.  Really enjoyed the Supreme deep dish, Caesar salad, and Mozzarella sticks.  Some things to note for deep dish newbies- even for a guy, generally 2 pieces is all you can muster.  Also - plan for about 45 minutes for the pizza to cook after ordering.  Pretty good selection of local beers.  This location was not very busy on a Saturday at 5pm, albeit it was snowing and not many people were out.

38.description: Wasn't a big fan of Chicago style pizza until I ate here. The meaty legend was on point. So so good. The spinach dip app was savory and delish. 2 thumbs up!

51.description: I really did not enjoy the place, I waited an hour for my  Spinach Mozarella sticks and the 9' Thin pizza with mushrooms, hot sausage and pepperoni. I was disappointed that I waited too long to get my food the mozzarella sticks were dry and the pizza had little meat and cheese but a lot of uncooked dry mushrooms  and the sauce tasted like it came from an old can of tomatoe sauce. The waitress never came to check on me ,and the place wasn't packed.

27.description: My boyfriend & I came here after a Cubs game. We sat at the bar & ordered a few local beers. Ordered our pizza and waited patiently for 45 + minutes for our deep dish to arrive!!!! Flavors were good but there was a slight cheese overload. Maybe next time I visit Chicago I will have a better pizza experience. 2.5 stars!

32.description: This is a review of average food but TERRIBLE service. We came in after the Cubs game so we were hot, tired, and hungry. We were told that the wait was going to be 45 minutes to an hour. That's what we expected. That was not a big deal to us because, as out of towners, we were told we just had to come here. About 5 minutes in we decided that since we were very close to our hotel, we would just order our dinner to-go. Before we ordered, we double checked that the wait was in fact still long and they confirmed that the wait was about 40 minutes still for us even though there were 5 empty tables. We placed our to-go order, payed for it, and waited outside. Seriously 5 minutes (we checked our watches) after that, they called our name to be seated. We were shocked that this all happened so quickly! Excited, we were ready to go to the table but then they told us they were going to refuse to seat us because we "preordered" our meal. What?! Preordered?! We explained the situation and they still would not seat us. When my husband spoke to someone in charge, we were seated. When our dinner came, the pizza was just average. We ordered a regular crust cheese and pepperoni.

54.description: I have been craving pizza for a while and I mean months, have been fighting the urge. Today I had to drop my husband off downtown and fail to my cravings. I run in to Gino's East and bought a lunch size pizza, I was sadly DISAPPOINTED. This pizza crust was tasteless, the sausage was big chunks of meat, sauce horribleDONE WITH GINO's

48.description: Went here for the deep dish and not impressed, wife said it tasted like vegetable soup on a crust which I tend to agree.  Service was excellent just not the pizza.

44.description: I came in today 5/9/15 with my family. I graduated college today and I was really looking forward to having a good dining experience at Gino's east. Crystal was our server and she went above and beyond to make sure our time was special. She was an exceptional server. I am a server myself so I really appreciate great service. I would just like to say thank you to crystal and Gino's east for making my graduation so memorable.

24.description: Second time here.  Always get the thick pizza with pepperoni ads sausage, always forget how filling it is. Gino's is the corn meal based crust, always delicious.

7.description: The location is so cozy and warm with the retro Edison lights and dark wood furnishings. We got a supreme deep dish which takes 45 min to cook, but in the meantime started off with the mozzarella sticks and Caesar salad. The beer selection was quite nice and it was an excellent stop to warm our frozen toes and fingers. I liked the fact that this place has less of that big chain feel such as Lou malnettis and Giordano's and enjoyed my meal there. The pizza was excellent and the star of the meal with a rich deep hearty sauce that was excellent. I ordered a thin crust to go for a friend which took significantly less time and he loved it. Great spot to go if you're in the area and looking for a smaller city spot.

49.description: Everyone has their thing to do when they hit Chicago... Mine is Geno's!  With over 200 reviews... there's not much to say... so I'll say the other stuff.1.  Get an appetizer; it will take some time to cook!  2. Skip right over the deep dish, and really enjoy the menu!I think the thin crust here is stellar, especially on the veggie pizza.  2 employees mentioned it is their favorite!Also, the cheese and charcuterie board... delicious!The mozzarella sticks are homemade, on the premises.  Some of the best I've had.  While I would never hold it against the Texas boys (Uno, Due'), I can get that in Fort Worth.  Although it's a chain, it's a local chain.  Geno's gets my vote as the best!5 STARS (because I know how to order right!)

40.description: Delicious spicy deep dish! They messed up our second pizza - they gave us pepperoni when we asked for the BBQ brisket pizza and then proceeded to tell us that it was somehow cheaper than the barbecue brisket and didn't really apologize. The service was less then great. I was unimpressed by the hostess and the front of house manager's handling of the messed up order. Our server was excellent! Overall I give it 3 stars for the whole Chicago-deep-dish-experience.

53.description: This was my first time ever having Gino's East, and I had a nice experience at this location.Interesting side note: It was a bit odd that the doors were locked at 11am on a Saturday when it was supposed to be open. I called, and they weren't aware that the doors were locked. Thankfully they quickly let me in.LPT: Order an appetizer, salad, and some drinks while you wait for your order of deep dish. It takes 45 minutes!I had the asian sesame wings buffalo wings, and they were certainly bigger than normal sized wings, but not sure about the "giant" label. :) This order was large in quantity... I think somewhere between 8-10 wings?The service was nice and attentive at this location. When the pizza came, it's a nice experience to be served table-side by our waiter! Gino's East deep dish pizza has become one of my favorites in Chicago right behind Lou's. Get the patty sausage!

30.description: Nice atmosphere,  good food.  But horrible service

46.description: I had to be a tourist for food while I was in Chicago. Ginos was right across the street from the hotel so I went for it. For those of you from not Chicago, like me, be prepared. It actually takes about 45 minutes to cook up a deep dish pizza. All told though it was very worth the wait. I took the sausage and cheese deep dish back to my hotel and proceeded to savage it with reckless abandon. As it was take out, I don't know much about the bar/restaurant, but it looked pretty typical. They also had a really wild beer selection. I really wanted to try one of the couple of local brews in the fridge, but I really didn't want to drink alone in a hotel.

1.description: Rounding out my tour of deep dish chains in Chicago, I found myself at Gino's East on a Friday night. I was pleased to see that there was plenty of seating and it wasn't too crowded, so my group got a table right away. They have a good beer selection and plenty of appetizers (I recommend the spinach sticks), and our server was very nice.I ordered a plate of the spaghetti with mixed veggies, and while I did have to be generous with the salt and pepper, there was a great garlic flavor in the sauce and they did not skimp on the vegetables. However, the veggies seemed like they were pickled? so there was a strange flavor there, and I'm not ecstatic about the fact that I paid $15 for vegetarian pasta. As for the deep dish pizza, I'm a fan! The sauce could be a little more sweet for me, but I love love loved the crust. I'm glad that Gino's East has options for those who might not feel like pizza, but I'd say only the pizza is really worth it.

55.description: Coming for the renown deep dish pizza. Many people I saw were also ordering this. It tastes nice to be. And one 9'' is actually too much for me....

9.description: I was originally going to give this place 3 stars but upon more reflection I feel like it was a 2.   For an appetizer we had calamari which extremely rubbery stay away from the calamari here!  The entire reason we came here was for the deep dish pizza. We ordered the bbq brisket which I was really looking forward to, but the meat wasn't evenly distributed. Some pieces had so little I first questioned whether it was even there. Other slices had big gobs of it.  The service was ok.  Nothing to either complain about or give a positive recommendation for.  All in all I wish the food was better, especially for the price.

26.description: Nice new-ish location in the South Loop. The space is relatively classy, and I love the high ceilings, and the booths are comfy.On a Sunday PM, my friend and I waited about 15 minutes to be seated. Our waitress was a-ok with our taking our time to order. I suggest making our own deep dish, as their signature options all seemed pretty heavy. (I think spinach makes the crust too soggy, too.) We got patty sausage and mushroom - a winning combination. A small deep dish was definitely enough for us two. Definitely did the trick and satisfied my deep dish pizza urge. Our waitress reminded us when we ordered it, but it takes ~45 minutes for a deep dish pizza, so be sure to budget for your hunger levels.

25.description: Took a solid 50 minutes for a small deep dish pizza to arrive. Unsure if that's the usually for deep dish but seemed like a while that's for sure. Pizza was great though.

12.description: We had a great experience at Gino's East. We already knew that the deep dish pizza would take an hour to cook, so we showed up at 4:45pm to put in our order. This seems early, but we settled in, ordered some beers from their wonderful draft beer list and were nice an hungry by the time the food was out at 5:45pm. We actually ordered at 5:00ish, so it was more of a 40 minute wait than an hour. The flavors of Gino's pizza are unrivaled. It is definitely one of my favorite deep dish pizzas in Chicago. We go the spicy sausage special and it was very good. It wasn't really that spicy but had excellent flavors. The wait staff were very friendly and the location was clean. Will go back next time we have the chance!

59.description: So appreciate this place!  I went with a few coworkers to Gino's and as a vegan, I didn't really expect to be able to order much.  However, they will make vegan deep dish for you.  Also, they have butternut squash soup that is vegan.  The waiter was really sweet and helpful.

21.description: This place is in a spiraling downfall. I remember when it used to taste good. Really. But now, the pizza is a disaster. Deep dish comes out mushy, soggy, and just a plain mess. Don't know how they managed but they served us a pile mush. The crust was completely soaked through and in no way bread form. The time we waited was the usual 45 mins almost an hour, even tho there were only three tables in the whole place. The service was poor, the staff were so busy chit chatting that it seemed like we had to beg for attention or maybe we were rude to interrupt. Sadly and needlessly to say, I won't be coming back or referring anyone to this place. Please reflect.

17.description: This place is very yummy and I really like the atmosphere. I came here with a friend from out of town and was introducing her to the iconic Chicago deep dish pizza. We got the spinach marghertia deep dish and I highly recommend it. Deep dish pizza is very heavy on its own without the sausage or pepperoni, so the spinach marghertia pizza (fresh mozzarella, spinach, basil, tomatoes, and garlic) is perfect if you want something a little lighter (at least as light as deep dish pizza can be). It also lets you taste the sauce a little more since it isn't so heavy on the cheese which is a real treat. Our waitress was really nice, but not very helpful when it came to beers. They had a nice list of local beers they serve on tap and I told her my preference. I prefer lighter beers that aren't very hoppy and she said she had the perfect beer for me. However, the beer she served me was dark and very hoppy. It wasn't that bad, though, so I drank my glass, but I feel the staff should be more knowledgeable about the beer since it is a sports bar. I enjoyed my experience and will come again!

10.description: Came to visit Chi town from SF, CA. Wasn't sure which restaurant is famous for deep dish pizza in Chicago so I just yelped something near my hotel.I got a groupon $16 for $30. We got spinach mozarella sticks and chicago fire 9". Im deducting 2 stars because the wait was really long for the pizza to come out like almost 1 hour. And the pizza itself was aight not alot of meat... and I'm not a big fan of the crust. 9" was a good size for 2 people. Service was 5/5. The waitress suggested the 9" for us and explained the menu. Thank you! :)

5.description: This was my first time ever having Gino's East, and I had a nice experience at this location.Interesting side note: It was a bit odd that the doors were locked at 11am on a Saturday when it was supposed to be open. I called, and they weren't aware that the doors were locked. Thankfully they quickly let me in.LPT: Order an appetizer, salad, and some drinks while you wait for your order of deep dish. It takes 45 minutes!I had the asian sesame wings buffalo wings, and they were certainly bigger than normal sized wings, but not sure about the "giant" label. :) This order was large in quantity... I think somewhere between 8-10 wings?The service was nice and attentive at this location. When the pizza came, it's a nice experience to be served table-side by our waiter! Gino's East deep dish pizza has become one of my favorites in Chicago right behind Lou's. Get the patty sausage!

3.description: I loved my jalepeno bleu (or whatever it was called) pizza. Seriously amazing!! Bf got the meaty pizza which wasn't as good(but still pretty tummy). We also had two of their house beers, the witbier and the ESB, and they were pretty good. I'd definitely recommend this place.

35.description: Shitty reception. Told us to wait forty five minutes but we waited ONE and half hour instead!!!  We asked several times during the wait. They only told us to wait a second. At last we knew that there was a party of 24  before us. However the receptionist wouldn't spend her precious time to tell us. Even the best pizza wouldn't make up for the reception.

19.description: Tried their 6inches pizza for one- but it was not that attractive as others described. I was a little disappointed but I guess maybe that's because I didn't try the specialties.

28.description: I could write forever but I will keep this simple: Best pizza I have ever had! Service was great and atmosphere was awesome - AMAZING beer selection!

45.description: Gino's East deep dish sausage patty pizza has always been one of our faves but our last couple visits to this location and the Streeterville location have been disappointing. You can read details on our still unresolved, negative Streeterville experience under that location on Yelp. Our last pizza at the south loop location was only half the normal thickness (so bizarre) and we had to track down our server to order and to get our check. We'll probably just go to Lou Malnatis exclusively from now on.

33.description: So we're driving thru the area and I was determined to eat legit Chicago style deep dish pizza... After the disappointment of the ridiculous wait time of the first place we were going to, and then walking blocks to find a different pizza spot, I was happy to stumble a pond this place. After awkwardly being told to stand and wait 10 mins, even tho there where plenty of visible empty tables, we were seated to a very sweet waitress who took our whole order and informed us of the exp. 40 min wait for deep dish. That was ok tho cause that what we came for. In the meantime tho we made sure we had apps: calamari, way over cooked which was a shame cause the seasoning was very good, and buffalo wings that were really good. They have a great beer selection and their Little Sumpin' Sumpin' hit the spot! In less than 40 mins, the pizza came. And here's where I'm torn... Cause Im a jersey girl living less than 15 mins from the city all my life... I just can't... It was "different". We got the BBQ brisket one, the brisket was absolutely delicious, except there could have been more. The funny thing is... The more I ate the deep dish, the more I liked it... Messy, but good... It went from 2 stars to 3 and the 4th for the service. I'm happy to have my Chicago experience!!

43.description: This place is very yummy and I really like the atmosphere. I came here with a friend from out of town and was introducing her to the iconic Chicago deep dish pizza. We got the spinach marghertia deep dish and I highly recommend it. Deep dish pizza is very heavy on its own without the sausage or pepperoni, so the spinach marghertia pizza (fresh mozzarella, spinach, basil, tomatoes, and garlic) is perfect if you want something a little lighter (at least as light as deep dish pizza can be). It also lets you taste the sauce a little more since it isn't so heavy on the cheese which is a real treat. Our waitress was really nice, but not very helpful when it came to beers. They had a nice list of local beers they serve on tap and I told her my preference. I prefer lighter beers that aren't very hoppy and she said she had the perfect beer for me. However, the beer she served me was dark and very hoppy. It wasn't that bad, though, so I drank my glass, but I feel the staff should be more knowledgeable about the beer since it is a sports bar. I enjoyed my experience and will come again!

2.description: It was decent, but no rave reviews. We got the Chicago Fire and the Gino's Supreme. Chicago Fire was fairly flavorful (not as spicy as menu implied but still pretty decent)... there was a token jalapeño atop the pizza, so can't complain too much. This pizza was a little heavy on the slabs of meat, which did a disservice to the crust (the meat slabs shielded the unfortunate crust from the other toppings so crust seemed quite brittle). The Supreme was remarkably better because of the less cumbersome distribution of meat. Overall, the crust seemed less brittle on this pizza so it was much less burdensome on the cutlery (and one's dentition).Big picture: other than the touch of flavor in the "hot and spicy" sausage of the Chicago Fire, honestly couldn't find much to distinguish these two pizzas in the pool of sauce and cheese.

18.description: We got there promptly at 11:00AM on a Saturday, knowing we had a little over an hour and the deep dish reportedly takes 45 min (normal for a well prepped deep dish).  I got the small Meaty Legend.  It was very good, and I could only eat two slices.  Crust was crunchy with a touch of corn meal.  Sauce, cheese and meat were all very good.  My son opted for the spaghetti with meatballs (I know..I know...spaghetti at Ginos).  Spaghetti was solid, nothing spectacular - but again, don't come here for spaghetti.  Will definitely repeat when we are in Chicago again.

41.description: I don't feel I can give a good review of this place since their kitchen closes at nine. Yes, NINE! WTF? Major metro area? Seriously? I was staying across the street and wanted eats and drinks. Oh well. Their loss. They didn't need the business, not did the wait or bar staff need the decent tip, I guess. Too bad. First time in Chicago and won't be returning to Gino's. We went to Blackie's instead. Blackie's is a short walk and pretty good service with decent food.

52.description: Staff was great.  We came in with a big crowd to watch MNF and they did everything they could to fit us in.   Super nice and excellent service.

50.description: I see that most of the low star reviews are because the deep dish pizza took an hour to come out.... But when you come into the place the waitress told us that. Gino's is know for the deep dish pizza and it is know for taking 45 minutes to an hour. So don't let those reviews turn you away. In my opinion the pizza is so good waiting an hour (which they tell you when you show up... Is worth it) I would recommend the cheese sticks and the nachos. They are both great. Great place to hangout and watch sports with friends.

4.description: Everyone has their thing to do when they hit Chicago... Mine is Geno's!  With over 200 reviews... there's not much to say... so I'll say the other stuff.1.  Get an appetizer; it will take some time to cook!  2. Skip right over the deep dish, and really enjoy the menu!I think the thin crust here is stellar, especially on the veggie pizza.  2 employees mentioned it is their favorite!Also, the cheese and charcuterie board... delicious!The mozzarella sticks are homemade, on the premises.  Some of the best I've had.  While I would never hold it against the Texas boys (Uno, Due'), I can get that in Fort Worth.  Although it's a chain, it's a local chain.  Geno's gets my vote as the best!5 STARS (because I know how to order right!)

6.description: Nice new-ish location in the South Loop. The space is relatively classy, and I love the high ceilings, and the booths are comfy.On a Sunday PM, my friend and I waited about 15 minutes to be seated. Our waitress was a-ok with our taking our time to order. I suggest making our own deep dish, as their signature options all seemed pretty heavy. (I think spinach makes the crust too soggy, too.) We got patty sausage and mushroom - a winning combination. A small deep dish was definitely enough for us two. Definitely did the trick and satisfied my deep dish pizza urge. Our waitress reminded us when we ordered it, but it takes ~45 minutes for a deep dish pizza, so be sure to budget for your hunger levels.

22.description: Delicious. Pretty sure it just ruined all other pizzas for me. The service was ok. There were a few times when we had empty glasses and when we were waiting for the check. Other than that the food was amazing.

15.description: I remember loving Gino's but alas it was the other location and long ago.  Look - compared to WI pizza it's awesome but compared to Giordono's or Lou's - it's just ordinary.I want to Gino's I remember from my childhood.....

57.description: Tourist trap but Great people watching! Love the jalapeño sausage pizza. Go on the weekends to avoid the long lunch/afternoon waits but we'll worth it. Try the mozzarella sticks, they are great.

20.description: Let me start right off the bat by saying that I much prefer New York style thin crust pizza over Chicago style open-faced calzones (oops, I mean pizzas), but for what it was, Gino's East has the best deep dish I've ever had.I think the Chicago Man Vs Food episode said it best - New York style is for people on the go, while Chicago style is more of a sit-down experience. And while visiting Chicago, we had quite the sit-down experience as we got to eat their signature food while watching a Black Hawks playoff game on TV (which they lost, by the way).It was a nice taste of Chicago and a really good deep dish pizza, but it wasn't quite enough to convert me over from my beloved New York thin crust.

36.description: my first deep dish experience...  it was intense, very filling and tasty, although the crust was not entirely satisfying.  the service was pretty slow.  it took a while to get seated and the pizza took about an hour, so get appetizers if you're hungry.

14.description: Everytime we are in Chicago, my husband has to get deepdish pizza. So he had it delivered to our hotel room, this time it was Gino's.  His choice is a cheese only deepdish. I have tried to like chicago deepdish, and I fail each time. This time was no better.For one, the sauce was akin to tomato paste. IT didn't even taste like it had seasonings on it....just tomatos paste spread about. Below this, was a huge slab of molten greasy mozzarella. The crust was too thick and dry, but greasy where the cheese soaked it. It looks like a mess too. It doesn't cut well, and just ends up looking like afterbirth on a plate.

58.description: I am a semi-regular, but hadn't been because of the cold weather, and a bit far to go for me at lunch time.  So went today, and a whole new menu!  And not one I was really excited about.  I too loved some of the old stand-bys.  It was one place you could get a real BLT Club sammie and good fries.  I had the onion soup which was really good, and not too salty.  The the Margarita flatbread which WAS TOO SALTY, but good mozz and good tomatoes.  But the salty marinara sauce (from a jar??) was disappointing.  Then I saw a chef making pasta from scratch and thought they couldn't possibly use jar sauce, could they??  If not, please remember you can always add salt, but can't take it away.  And for some who are on low sodium diets, this is not your place, at least what I ordered.  And I know BLTs and fries are not low sodium, but once every two months, not so bad.  Anyway, this place has changed, for the better?? not sure.  Glad Paul is still there, will miss Ora though she was a dear.  Will be back.  Chef, easy on the salt shaker ok?  thanks.

56.description: Man I used to LOVE this place.I live less than a block from here and I used to go there 2-4 times a week for a burger, salad, or just drinks. But after the menu change I can't bring myself to go there anymore. The burgers were amazing, easily the best food and deal in the South Loop. But after the menu change the burgers became very mediocre and overpriced. A lot of the menu items don't make sense in my opinion too... Duck tacos? really? I had a HORRIBLE encounter with the owner on Twitter and it was the most unprofessional conversation I have ever been a part of. I couldn't believe someone would seriously handle their business like that. Be prepared to pay $15 for a burger that tastes like it should cost $7.

29.description: I haven't been here for food, and not sure I would necessarily eat here, but for a bar option in the Printers Row area of the South Loop, Blackies isn't too bad afterall!I had been hesitant to try this place because it doesn't look the most inviting from the outside, despite the fact that it has actually been in business a long long time according to their signage. Inside, however, they actually have pretty nice looking wooden tables and a full bar and a friendly bar tender, which is really all you need for a little neighborhood spot. They have different drink specials every day too, like $12 house bottles of wine on Wednesdays I think? And then $1 watermelon shots and other bottled beer specials too. We were here late in the night and there was a large group of people who clearly had been there for quite some time, counting down all together as a happy group for their group shots which I loved. And on game days, this bar is also usually pretty packed as people eat/drink on their way to the game and there is a decent after work crowd here too. Plus in nice weather time, their patio is set up which is dog friendly, which is also something you have to love about the printers row area of the southloop.

42.description: Blackie's is a bar. An old bar. No more than a bar. An "old-fashioned bar. A traditional bar, with traditional drinks and traditional bar style, stick to your ribs food. While the menu has been updated to include several more chic food items, there's always the cheeseburger and waffle fries that has been a staple for decades. It's been in Printer's Row for what seems like forever; long before I was born. My mom's Bachelorette Party with the stereotypically annoying stripper was at none other than Blackie's, in the mid 1980's. Blackie's is so chock full of nostalgia and fun memories for my family. My mom lived in the neighborhood after college and Blackie's was one of my parents' favorite haunts when they were dating and wanted a bar away from Rush Street. Funny thing is, I like Blackie's now as much as my parents liked Blackie's in the 1980's. The salmon burger was pretty fantastic, as were the waffle fries. Really fresh, crunchy yet savory and flavorful. The portion of both is so ample, there was more than enough to gorge and have enough to take home for later or the next day. Bread is fresh and tasty, fish is moist and delicious, fries are just plain wonderful. Blackie's is one of the few places that remains fabulous and consistent and open for business. I hope they're around for the next several decades. The way they do A Bar, I think they will be!!

23.description: Grabbed breakfast here today - it was pretty solid. Great old fashioned breakfast, solid french toast & pancakes. Quick service and available seating.

47.description: My husband and I recently "tried" to eat here.  We entered into a very dark bar and waited for someone to help us.  No one approached us or looked at us.  It was the most bizarre experience I've ever had in a bar or restaurant.  Most places like it when people want to sit down and order food and drink and then pay.  We ended up walking up to Hackney's and were greeted right away.  Sad this neighborhood joint didn't work out since we live close by :(

8.description: We went here Thursday night for light meal , we order grilled cheese , was fabulous .And Sunday we take a brunch , the food again is nice , delicious , service great , price wonderful .

31.description: We moved to printers row about a year ago, and Blackies has been our spot for breakfast most every weekend. Never disappointed....not once. I have a weird thing about coffee refills...seems like you have to beg for them in most places these days.  Not at Blackies. The staff is great, the food is great...walking in on Sunday morning feels like going home.  We just bought a place in the Fulton River District, and will miss Printers Row....but Blackies will remain our spot (via the pink line!)

34.description: As a Columbia student, I spend most of my time down in the South Loop. I had passed by the place HUNDREDS of times, but only experienced it once, three years ago. I'm incredibly loyal to my favorite restaurants, and usually frequent Hackney's down the street. It was planning my best friend's 21st birthday celebration that brought me back to this fine establishment-- and I was thoroughly impressed. I contacted the owners approximately a month in advance via email, and was pleased to find how kind, helpful and speedy her responses were. Susan was incredibly willing to and eager to accommodate all of my requests for the dinner (a reservation for 15), and very flexible with splitting the tab 15-ways. The atmosphere is excellent, the menu is OUTSTANDING (try the salmon sandwich), and the bar is sexy as all hell. The place was hopping the night of our reservation because of the Blackhawks game, and it really brought a lot of brilliant energy into the room. Our waiter was ridiculously helpful and patient (our party was there for a looong time), and I was able to meet the owner, Jeffrey. Bar Louie is known as the "college bar" on campus-- however, I strongly recommend that you stay far away from that overcrowded joint. Support this local gem! Blackie's is one of my new favorites, and will be my first choice for my holiday staff party in a few weeks. Thanks Jeff and Susan!

16.description: This is easily one of the best places for food and drink in the South Loop, and one of the best patios in the city.  "What's so special about it," you ask.  "It looks like just a normal sidewalk seating area."  Let me tell you:  It's the service.  You'll get excellent service out here, no matter how long you're chillin' with your chums.  Sounds so simple, but so few places can deliver like Blackie's.  Plus, the patio is so inviting, other patrons are liable to join your little sidewalk chat.  It's like they moved the fundamentals of a neighborhood pub outside!  If you're drinking, the prices definitely entice you to prolong your afternoon chill-session.  Highly recommended, for brunch, lunch, dinner, and chill-sessions!

13.description: Ha, this place knows how to survive a storm and reinvent itself! kudos to the owner of this place. *raises glass*First, they have better drink specials a bottle of wine for only $12 makes this a fine place for a quick date. Shot specials for a dollar seriously are you kidding me? Second, the menu was updated. The food is significantly better! Blackies now has the best calamari - ever! In the past they didn't season it now it's beautifully seasoned and ugh - (insert curse word here) good! The other food items are made fresh, so you can taste the difference asap. When I took a fork full of fresh spinach I had that moment - the yes moment! :) (Meg Ryan voice - restaurant scene) yes, yes, gawd yesssssss! Ha ha Third, the menu has been updated. It looks good, hip and people are coming in this means a better environment. Last but not least the new waitresses are fab! Great service will do wonders... (Insert curse word here) wonders for the entire atmosphere of an establishment! Someone who can confidently make recommendations, is polite, and socially aware of when to stop by the table and when to stay away- Perfecto! I rarely give out five stars, but here's my prediction... In less than six months this place will be packed daily! You are on the right path Blackies... as you can see, I'm  a fan of the revamp... previously not so much, but now yes!Areas of improvement: Never run out of broccoli, ever! Advertise that the menu makes adjustments for food allergies. Have dessert that includes fresh fruit. There's nothing like fresh fruit desserts to encourage people to have dessert.You will find me by the window a bottle of wine, appetizer, and dinner. Go ahead and say hi.... I don't bite unless you are on my fork! Grrrrrr ;) ha ha

11.description: I haven't been here for food, and not sure I would necessarily eat here, but for a bar option in the Printers Row area of the South Loop, Blackies isn't too bad afterall!I had been hesitant to try this place because it doesn't look the most inviting from the outside, despite the fact that it has actually been in business a long long time according to their signage. Inside, however, they actually have pretty nice looking wooden tables and a full bar and a friendly bar tender, which is really all you need for a little neighborhood spot. They have different drink specials every day too, like $12 house bottles of wine on Wednesdays I think? And then $1 watermelon shots and other bottled beer specials too. We were here late in the night and there was a large group of people who clearly had been there for quite some time, counting down all together as a happy group for their group shots which I loved. And on game days, this bar is also usually pretty packed as people eat/drink on their way to the game and there is a decent after work crowd here too. Plus in nice weather time, their patio is set up which is dog friendly, which is also something you have to love about the printers row area of the southloop.

39.description: I've always thought Blackies was a good neighborhood bar, but they just introduced an AWESOME new menu and the food is delicious!  They usually have some good drink specials too, making this a great place to stop in.  I live a block away and will definitely be stopping in more often now.

37.description: Just moved down the block and decided to try Blackie's.  Ordered dinner to go Sunday and loved it!  I had the salmon and shrimp!  I went back Wednesday with a friend.  Calamari was amazing as was the spinach dip.  Also had the flatbread, that too hit the spot!  Service while dinning in was good but not amazing.  Regardless the food was great so I will be returning.

0.description: Coat Hooks: YesAlso: I recommend the watermelon shots.

38.description: I'm very disappointed that Blackie's did away with the $8 burger special. My girlfriend and I stopped in a few months ago, both hoping to get the burger, fries, and draft beer for $8 anytime before 8 PM -- like we had several times since we moved to the neighborhood last year.Instead, we learned that the special is gone, and the half-pound burger is now $9.95. The beer is $4, so the meal that used to cost us about $21 (that's including tax and tip!) now costs $36.I agree that the changes to the menu and the dining area are an improvement, but a 75% price hike for the burger special is too much to take. Blackie's previously filled a niche for us -- a solid meal at an amazing price. We would often decide to make the short trip to Blackie's when we didn't want to cook.Now that it's just like every other restaurant out there, we find ourselves trying other places far more often. We'll still stop in from time to time, but the days of this being our go-to place for a quick, cheap dinner are gone.

51.description: Breakfast/Brunch is my thing. We've been coming here for over 10 years and they never disappoint. Our 4 year old lives the Mickey Mouse pancakes.

27.description: I absolutely love Blackies and can't even count how many times I have been here! Love love love this place! First off the food is great! They have changed their menu and it's even better!! By far.. My favorite for an appetizer is the pork/polenta! You have to try it! I also really enjoy the baby arugula salad! As for entrees.. Honestly everything is very good! My favorite is the burgers!As for ambience it is casual/ bar/ restaurant. It's in a perfect location! In the summer you can enjoy eating outside and bring your dog! This is truly a Chicago Gem! There is something about this place that I just absolutely love!

32.description: This place is awesome!! Great food, great service, and great atmosphere ! I love coming here when I am downtown!!

54.description: Never waited longer for a waitress (in this case) in all my life. I've gotten faster service at Jamaican joints in Brooklyn...but at least they have good food. Under or improperly staffed.

48.description: Definitely a neighborhood bar with simple american fare. I have been here twice and have been impressed with their dinner specials and the bartenders. The service is pretty top notch.However, there are a few male servers who seem to have an attitude at times and once, I saw a pair of them fighting...in front of guests. That's a big no-no in my book...keep it behind closed doors.All in all, I'd say its a cute corner bar. I wish they had a dart board, then I'd be there all the time :)

44.description: So disappointed. The food is terrible now; inedible to a certain degree. Once happy staff are miserable or nowhere to be seen. And the staff that replaced them don't know how to do their jobs. (Saw a customer, who was drinking at the bar, seat customers, answer the phone, go into the kitchen, behind the bar, in the office...?)I also love the lack of respect from the owner for his regulars and their opinions. Go ahead and hire a fancy chef that can't cook a medium well burger but would rather post his food porn on Facebook...gross. Looking forward to my nasty reply.

24.description: We dined here on a Friday night as we moved into the neighborhood that day and needed a place close by that was within walking distance. Who wants to unpack pans to cook after moving? The food was good, but it wasn't 'I have to let the world on yelp know how awesome it was' good. The Calamari was very tasty but the burgers were average. Nothing that really stood out. I had the tacos and there wasn't much special about them either. The pork belly taco came out as a cube. Hard to eat. But not lacking in flavor. The presentation could use some thought and reworking. The beer prices are good though. We'll be back for beers, but we'll either cook before we go or have a bite elsewhere. Closer to a 3.5 than a 3. Just not good enough to bump to a 4.

7.description: Food was okay, beer menu was poor, and service was terrible! Probably twenty minute wait for our server to pick up the tab after he gave it to us. Also forgot the diet coke I asked for.

49.description: Blackie's is a really nice neighborhood sports bar.  The staff are always the same and friendly, the food is alright, but the beer and atmosphere is why I go!  The customers who go here are also very laid back and just want to hang out with their friends.  This is the type of place you can sit at the bar and not worry about anything.

40.description: Ha, this place knows how to survive a storm and reinvent itself! kudos to the owner of this place. *raises glass*First, they have better drink specials a bottle of wine for only $12 makes this a fine place for a quick date. Shot specials for a dollar seriously are you kidding me? Second, the menu was updated. The food is significantly better! Blackies now has the best calamari - ever! In the past they didn't season it now it's beautifully seasoned and ugh - (insert curse word here) good! The other food items are made fresh, so you can taste the difference asap.
