I did not argue or complain due to being with my mother but not happy with my experience here one bit. Antico posto in Oakbrook is actually worth  their price, quality food and service. Check them out if you're in search for a good Italian restaurant.

7.description: The food was bland/tasteless, the bread brought out was stale. We ordered fried calamari,  chicken fettuccine, a pizza with chicken and spinach and a pasta with shrimp/rice. Waiter was not great,  the waiters helper was amazing though, never once had to ask to have my water refilled, it was always topped and had a change of napkins before we even asked, props to him.I had purchased the groupon special. I paid with my credit card. The waiter increased the price on everything slightly and automatically put himself 18% gratuity for a party of two. Which from my understanding is only done on large parties and optional depending on the service received for small parties. I did not argue or complain due to being with my mother but not happy with my experience here one bit. Antico posto in Oakbrook is actually worth  their price, quality food and service. Check them out if you're in search for a good Italian restaurant.

49.description: I can only think of one word to describe the Rigatoni Paesano....dank (that's a good thing btw). Tutto Italiano is a hole in the wall Italian (obviously) restaurant right on the corner of Wells and Congress.  Every once and a while, we have a "premium" lunch day at work and hit this place up.  I haven't been dissapointed yet.  When walking in, there is a bar to the left and the dining room to the right is an old converted train car.  I haven't dined in before, but the staff seems very professional, and my to go orders are always ready 15 minutes from the time I call. The food is good, and always still hot by the time we get back to the office. Like I said above, the Rig Paesano is money, and a favorite amongst our group...pasta, with sausage, mushrooms and broccoli, with a thick tomato basil/mozzarella sauce. One time I will man up and have a beer during my pickup without worrying about seeing another coworker/boss....damn, I'm inSANE!!

40.description: Went back for dinner today, got the same order as last time was equally good.The groupon i had expired and our server  Mante threw in free dessert(tiramisu) to makeup, which was a very nice gesture!!

53.description: Pretty good lunch option for the area if you want to have a nicer lunch.  Eating in the train car is very interesting, though the decorations are tired.  Eat outside if it's a nice day.  Their blackened salmon salad special is quality. Perfectly spiced and a really good sized portion.  The bar also looks nice (but dark) for an after work drink, but I haven't checked it out yet.  Service is a bit slow so only go if you have time to spare.222/365

30.description: great spot, great people and great food

46.description: Bad service. Dirty place. We could not even order food because everything looked awful , from the decoration to the atmosphere

1.description: Came here with the hubby for dinner. The places is really cool. The main sitting area is in an old train  that use to be part of the CTA.  The staff were very friendly and attentive.The food was delicious, it was well seasoned. The prices were about average for what we expected to pay.  I will for sure come back,  because it took me forever to decide what I wanted to eat due to all of the delicious options. They also have a good selection of wines and beer to pick from.

55.description: We should have known better when we were immediately seated at 7 on a Friday without reservations.The food was adequate and unremarkable, although it's difficult to screw up bolognese.  The service, on the other hand, was poor. First, my wife has a food allergy. As she was explaining this to our server, he acted as though he had never heard of such a thing. Then he just responded that, "you'll be fine" without writing down a single allergen or checking with the kitchen. After our food arrived, we had to flag down the joker several times for such major requests like water, another drink, etc since he never took the time to check back in.Don't get lured in by the $20 for $10 yelp deal. You can find the same uninspired menu, and likely much better service, at your local Olive Garden.

9.description: This space was a weird one! But ended up being delicious savory Italian food. Dining in the railway car made it seem like an entirely different restaurant from the front bar. The waiters were friendly and helpful, suggesting entrees for us. The food was hearty portions and kept us full!

26.description: Below average Italian food compared to olive garden and maggianos. I came here with a groupon and as soon as the waiter heard "groupon", he had a bad attitude. Didn't seem like he wanted to serve us or talk to us. Very dissapointed! The food was very light, the flavour wasn't enough and the place was deserted. Would not recommend!

25.description: Nice little place that has pretty good food.  It's reasonably priced and the food is done well, good selection and no complaints about the service.  A good option for a business lunch.

12.description: Great little place!! Randomly walked by & was attracted by the train car that people were sitting in. Then we looked it up on Yelp & saw they had a Yelp deal AND what looked like good food so we just decided to try it. Such a good find! Cute atmosphere, good servers. It was a shame that it wasn't more busy on a Saturday night but we enjoyed it because it was quiet & we could enjoy the music & relax.

59.description: CHi town offers lots of great autmospheres for eating out that are amazing. this place on a tuesday night was empty in the "caboose" area and it had the feel like i rented the whole place out for me and my date :) I loved the service, and the food was very timely, and very good for the price, i HIGHLY recommend!

21.description: This review is for the BAR area only.Totally great. This is one of those smallish "Grotto" type bars that look like they should be crawling with Playboy bunnies. Or lawyers. Or both. And it also looked like it hadn't been updated since the 70's. Yeah, now we are talking!I only went here for drinks, but it was a blast, and by the time I left, the bartender felt like a friend. Super cool for after work, cozy bar for a cold winter night. I sampled some of the pizza, and it was GREAT. I look forward to returning for the food.

17.description: The food was bland and tasteless. I expected the bread to be warm like other Italian restaurants, but the bread was stale and cold. My wife ordered pasta with shrimp and creamy pesto sauce, it was very bland, she had to order red pepper to give it some favor.The Waiter was very inattentive, he never said what his name was. He took a long time to come by each time we needed something even though the dining room was less than 10% full.   The place was dead when we were there during dinner time, 7:30pm on a Saturday evening, prime time which was ominous sign.The only reason we went was because I had purchased a coupon, the only rules on the coupon was the bill had to be over $50, with tax and tip not included in the $50 total. I satisfied the requirements, but the waiter came back and said my alcoholic drink (glass of wine) could not be included in the $50 total and I was $10 short. I told him there was no requirement stating alcoholic drinks could not be used. He still said I was $10 dollars short, I ask to speak to the owner, but I was told he was not available.I felt they were trying to jack up my bill, I did not argue or complain but not happy with my experience here one bit. I did not order any more food, just paid my bill and left.I tried calling the restaurant several times over the next few days, the owner I was told, was never available. I left message, no one called me back, so it seems they don't care about the poor food and bad service. I will never eat there again.

10.description: It's a bit of a crazy looking place--half is a happy hour type bar but then they seat you in an old train dining car. It was very comfortable in there despite the summer heat of Chicago, and we liked it. The menu is pretty basic old school Italian. We had the calimari and it was cooked perfectly. Very good. The pastas we ordered were OK. The server was very pleasant and great. I feel it was a little expensive for what we ordered but maybe not for the area.

5.description: Damn, I saw that I forgot to use my Yelp deal. We came here for a coworker's birthday lunch. I love how they have the grated parmesan cheese and oil for me to dip my bread in. The blackened salmon I had was fantastic. The portion of fish was huge and the server was right on the money about it being filling without me feeling stuffed. Shamelessly, I might come back another time just to try the tiramisu as it looked fabulous - the birthday boy didn't even offer to share or let us have a bite so it must be that good!

3.description: Hey, you're eating in a dining car. You're on vacation! It can be the Orient Express, the City of New Orleans, Hogwarts Express...whatever you conjure up.  You just need to travel with someone who's a lot of fun, has a vivid imagination and who won't grimace when the food comes and you say "chew chew!" instead of "bon appetit."The food is good, though nothing to telegraph home about. Definitely not what I'd imagine the Orient Express to serve, but it's no Amtrak Dinette car either. Much closer to Amtrak prices too.One reviewer mentioned that all the servers were women with long hair and low-cut tops. Somehow I missed that scenery passing by, but maybe it was because I was watching the world go by outside. It's mainly gentlemen who have served me here, and they've been very friendly (and, luckily, appropriately attired).

35.description: Nice romantic Saturday night dinner with my girlfriend. The food was great, the wine was delicious, and the atmosphere was comfortable and we could easily carry a soft conversation. Our waiter was not especially kind or helpful, but he did not add or take away from the overall experience one bit. I would certainly recommend.

19.description: Surprising good, especially considering all the mediocre reviews. The highlights were the asiago stuffed gnocchi and tiramisu. A couple of my faves for Italian cuisine and these were both great! The service and the ragu sauce on the gnocchi were both good but nothing special. The atmosphere and the bread were the areas of opportunity.

28.description: I found this place on Groupon and I'm so glad I did. You would drive right by it if you're not looking (which happens to be my favorite places, go figure). The side of the building is an old train car converted into restaurant seating. When you first walk in, it looks like a typical bar and then BAM! You're transported back in time. It was cozy but not overcrowded.The service was excellent and the food was delicious. I'm always nervous trying out Italian places because you walk out feeling like a bloated water buffalo. This was just the right amount to feel full without the indigestion. Try the spinach and cheese ravioli - you won't be disappointed. My friend had chicken and it was well cooked and moist.The only negative aspect, which really isn't negative but more like an annoyance, is that they REALLY want you to drink your water. It seemed like every 2 minutes they were filling our glasses. Kind of overkill but thoughtful.

45.description: Came here with a Groupon, looking for a cute Italian eatery for our anniversary dinner in the loop, we were not disappointed one bit.Toasted ravioli to start was phenomenal. I got chicken fetticine and my beau got himself something with italian sausage and marinara sauce. Entree portions are huge! We stuffed ourselves, and I am fairly confident that there's currently enough in my fridge for one if not two more meals. We also got a side of seasoned fries, which are amazing (crispy on the outside, perfect on the inside) and we got a huge plate for $5.Service was decent, but the waiter was friendly and water glasses were filled often. We went for dinner and there were only a few other diners in the place, I'll absoluetly be telling everyone I know about this gem!

33.description: Had lunch at Tuttos with my husband and son today.  Atmosphere is charming as we dined in the railcar under twinkling lights.   Shrimp pappardelle was scrumptious with absolutely huge shrimp in a light cream sauce.  Hubby had a chicken breast layered with spinach and a cream sauce and son had a shrimp in Diablo sauce that was to die for.  This restaurant is definitely on our lets go back list.   Service was great and timely.  Definitely would recommend this to anyone.

43.description: After a long while, I had a business lunch and a business late lunch at Tutto this week. :)  The food was as tasty as ever. The ambiance is always cozy and the service is perfect.  You feel you are valuable guest there.  It is within a couple blocks away from my work, and I should take my business lunches there more often. The restaurant is cozy as it is a converted railway car, but it defines its character.  Enjoy it!

2.description: I can't believe I lived in Chicago for 30 years and this was my first visit to this charming spot. The dining car decor is fun and the food is excellent. Loved the special - crab risotto. Yum! Won't wait another 30 years to go back!

18.description: I found this place on Groupon and I'm so glad I did. You would drive right by it if you're not looking (which happens to be my favorite places, go figure). The side of the building is an old train car converted into restaurant seating. When you first walk in, it looks like a typical bar and then BAM! You're transported back in time. It was cozy but not overcrowded.The service was excellent and the food was delicious. I'm always nervous trying out Italian places because you walk out feeling like a bloated water buffalo. This was just the right amount to feel full without the indigestion. Try the spinach and cheese ravioli - you won't be disappointed. My friend had chicken and it was well cooked and moist.The only negative aspect, which really isn't negative but more like an annoyance, is that they REALLY want you to drink your water. It seemed like every 2 minutes they were filling our glasses. Kind of overkill but thoughtful.

41.description: Came here with a buddy and was seated in the back room which felt like an old train car. This was kinda cool actually. The bread that came was not hot...never understood why a restaurant would not have hot bread. That being said, there was FRESH parmesan cheese and olive oil to dip it in which was nice. The veal dish a had was pretty good but would probably have been better with a more traditional marsala sauce then the one it had which was a play on marsala. Eggplant appetizer was decent.

52.description: The food is awesome!...but the Service was even more wonderful!! This place exceeded our expectations. With that said, please read other reviews. This place is really two establishments in character - the local "sports" bar with a nice dining car attached. The decor is on the oldish side but we where "charmed" by all of it. We are tired of "chains" and really love to visit "owner" establishments! This one is a WINNER!!

50.description: Location of the Restaurant is a bit of a walk from downtown State Street in a busy highway (Congress/290) and Wells. It was a bit noisy when we entered the restaurant because their bar is located by the main entrance and it was a Bears Game night. We were greeted as we entered and lead to their dining area which was pretty neat because it's an old train car which they've converted. Air-condition was better there. We were given water, french bread and freshly grated parmesan. Could've been better if the bread was a warmed (photo attached) but it was okay. We ordered Margherita Pizza and Chicken Fettucine. My pasta was great (although a little bland) and the serving was of medium size. I had some leftovers that I've brought home. I had a lot of chicken in the pasta that's why I somehow liked it compared to other Italian Restaurants that puts a little of the meat. My husband had the pizza and he said he also liked it. The pizza crust looked like it wasn't a hand tossed pizza. It wasn't crowded on a Thursday dinner night by their dining area so there was only one server and an assistant which was okay. Food was served fast and server was polite and nice.  What we were surprised was the cost of pop which is $3. Think it's a little high that's why we only gave it 4 stars rating. Overall, it was a nice dining experience so we might come back since hubby works downtown.

4.description: This is such a cute little place! Food was super delicious and not too expensive. Everything was wonderful. Their shrimp is TO DIE for. Will definitely be back again soon!

6.description: I've had nothing but negative experiences with this restaurant. I think they need to work on their customer service. My boyfriend also raved about Tutto Italiano and having never been there I was so excited to try their food -- they have this cool dining section that's in an old train car! First time we tried to eat there, we just missed their closing time by 2 mins ( parked but had trouble getting to the actual place). Totally our fault but when they see me running in and out of breath and I look at the owner with pleading eyes.... All he said was we are closed, kitchen was actually closed by 9:30p anyway. It was just sad.... Empathy was definitely missing there. At least pretend you care so that I'll actually want to come in next time?Anyway next time we tried going I called ahead to make a reservation and he told me none needed. Then when we arrived the same person made fun of me and smirkingly said "you're the one who called". Mmmok I guess it's funny that I just really wanted to make sure you guys would serve me. The overall experience/ambience was nice. Train car was nice. The food was bland. We ordered chicken fettuccine, gnocchi con gambri, bruschetta and the cheesecake. The bruschetta was really good, it was delicious! The two pasta dishes were just blah --- I definitely expected more. At the end when we mentioned we had a restaurant.com certificate to use they tacked on an automatic 18% gratuity. I have no qualms with paying it except it was never stated anywhere as a requirement, reading the other reviews they do this for groupon users too. My boyfriend wasn't even arguing about it just asked why it wasn't disclosed anywhere including restaurant.com (we checked) and the server became argumentative stating how that is clear company policy and that the loop area it's at least 18-20% gratuity and that we should be grateful we weren't getting charged 20%. I was shocked. This is how they treat their new customers, I am surprised people keep coming back because I will not be.

22.description: Great, great food! So many great options to choose from, and pretty reasonable pricing for a nice Italian dinner. Very cute atmosphere in the train car dining area. Definitely will be returning!

15.description: I went here for Dinner with the boyfriend after a long day of traveling. I was starving! We yelped the closest Italian place to his apartment and we walked into this beautiful gem. In the front area there's a bar with some tables. We were led to the back of the restaurant to this cute area, designed as if we were about to eat in a train, curtains and all! It was so romantic. We ordered two glasses of wine, and were given excellent pours. For meals, I ordered the chicken fettuccine and he ordered the cheese ravioli. The cheese ravioli was absolutely delicious. The reason I give 4 instead of 5 was becaus the chicken fettuccine was a little bland. I had to doctor it up with salt, black pepper and red chili flakes but after that it was pretty good. There's a yelp offer-- $10 for $20 but we forgot to use it! Next time.

57.description: Quickie review: 3.5 stars rounds to 4Quaint rail-car dining room and broad Italian menu. Service was quick - we needed to get out in an hour and were done in 45 minutes. Pasta was fresh and well-prepared, flavorful and in large portions. At $15 a fair price for downtown. BIg basket of good bread could have been tossed in the oven to crisp it up. Wines were just OK, so that's an area they could improve on. With a Yelp deal or Groupon it's a good choice.

20.description: I've had nothing but negative experiences with this restaurant. I think they need to work on their customer service. My boyfriend also raved about Tutto Italiano and having never been there I was so excited to try their food -- they have this cool dining section that's in an old train car! First time we tried to eat there, we just missed their closing time by 2 mins ( parked but had trouble getting to the actual place). Totally our fault but when they see me running in and out of breath and I look at the owner with pleading eyes.... All he said was we are closed, kitchen was actually closed by 9:30p anyway. It was just sad.... Empathy was definitely missing there. At least pretend you care so that I'll actually want to come in next time?Anyway next time we tried going I called ahead to make a reservation and he told me none needed. Then when we arrived the same person made fun of me and smirkingly said "you're the one who called". Mmmok I guess it's funny that I just really wanted to make sure you guys would serve me. The overall experience/ambience was nice. Train car was nice. The food was bland. We ordered chicken fettuccine, gnocchi con gambri, bruschetta and the cheesecake. The bruschetta was really good, it was delicious! The two pasta dishes were just blah --- I definitely expected more. At the end when we mentioned we had a restaurant.com certificate to use they tacked on an automatic 18% gratuity. I have no qualms with paying it except it was never stated anywhere as a requirement, reading the other reviews they do this for groupon users too. My boyfriend wasn't even arguing about it just asked why it wasn't disclosed anywhere including restaurant.com (we checked) and the server became argumentative stating how that is clear company policy and that the loop area it's at least 18-20% gratuity and that we should be grateful we weren't getting charged 20%. I was shocked. This is how they treat their new customers, I am surprised people keep coming back because I will not be.

36.description: Good italian in the Loop - service and food were both excellent.

14.description: Below average Italian food compared to olive garden and maggianos. I came here with a groupon and as soon as the waiter heard "groupon", he had a bad attitude. Didn't seem like he wanted to serve us or talk to us. Very dissapointed! The food was very light, the flavour wasn't enough and the place was deserted. Would not recommend!

58.description: Basically the best pizza in Chicago!!!! Pat's pizza has a special recipe that no one knows because their pizza is sooo good!  No idea what they do differently than other places, but whatever they are doing it's amazing! I always ask for my pizza to be extra sauce and extra crispy! The sauce is delicious!!!! If your in the south loop area looking for a pizza place ... Please try it out!!! They r good for thin crust! If your looking for a deep dish just head over to Lou's on State.

56.description: I've lived in Printer's Row for about a year now and finally decided to give Pat's a try, after reading all of the great reviews in here.  What can I say, I was not all that impressed.  I got the Pat's Special and the pizza was nothing out of the ordinary.  The crust in the middle was not crispy, the flavor was just average.  Honestly to me it was pretty darn close to stuff you can get at Papa John's or Dominoes.  I'm a little upset that I spent $22 on a pizza at Pat's when I could've gone to Lou Malnati's on State and paid a little less for much better quality & flavor; Lou's thin crust sausage pizza is amazing!  Sorry Pat's, your prices are too high for the quality that I experienced.

29.description: I have ordered the thin crust from here a couple of weeks ago, I fell in love with it but today I ordered the same pizza and it was like having an eraser! Dry, cold and tasteless. Don't know if I will order again.

42.description: Fantastic pizza place, the best in the South Loop.  I get delivery only (always fast) and always order thin-crust.  Pepperoni & Mushroom, and Sausage & Spinach are both fantastic combinations.  The sauce is what makes the pizza.

23.description: Falling out of love....Used to think the pat's pizza was the best after my office ordered it for lunch and have been getting for years.  But tonight their thin crust was a little too thin, it was kind of soggy.  Wonder if they changed their recipe?  Also, kind of expensive.  Almost $23+ tip/deliver for a medium pats (sausage, pepper, mushroom, onion).   I think they are using frozen crust now....wonder what is going on?

47.description: During our little outing in downtown chicago, we were still on a pizza craving even though we had pizza the day before.  Wherever we were, there was a pizza place in walking distance so we just wanted to grab a small bite to eat.  We found this place that made pizzas but it wasn't too big.  We ordered the Pat's special, which came with sausage, mushrooms, green peppers, and onions for $7.50.  It took about 15 minutes to cook which I thought was pretty long considering how small the pizza was.  The pizza was decent but it wasn't anything to spectacular.  Good find to eat if you want to hold your stomach for a delicious meal forthcoming.NOTE:-Free drink included-no bathrooms-small place (walk up to counter and order)

8.description: I don't give 1 star reviews often.I wanted to ordered pizza delivery last night which is a rare occurrence for me. I didn't realize finding a "regular" pizza that wasn't deep dish or thin crust would have been so difficult, so I searched Yelp for places in the South Loop and just called around asking who had what I wanted until Pat's said yes. I knew I wanted a regular Papa John's-type pizza that wasn't Papa John's, but in hindsight this was my mistake and I should have just ordered from there and been totally satisfied. Instead I got a super thick pizza from Pat's... the sauce was about 3 times the necessary amount and there were gobs of cheese everywhere. It looked like a heart attack waiting to happen. The pepperoni was visibly on top of the pie, but the sausage was imbedded somewhere within, among the sauce and cheese ridiculousness. If that's your thing, great, but it's not mine and I was highly disappointed... especially for $28! Seriously, I almost choked when the lady over the phone gave me the cost for ONE pizza delivery which should have been my sign to hang up (again my fault) but I figured it must be good given the solid star ratings... Nope, not worth it a dollar in my mind. But hey, this is my review and my opinion. Take it with a grain of salt.

31.description: I don't give 1 star reviews often.I wanted to ordered pizza delivery last night which is a rare occurrence for me. I didn't realize finding a "regular" pizza that wasn't deep dish or thin crust would have been so difficult, so I searched Yelp for places in the South Loop and just called around asking who had what I wanted until Pat's said yes. I knew I wanted a regular Papa John's-type pizza that wasn't Papa John's, but in hindsight this was my mistake and I should have just ordered from there and been totally satisfied. Instead I got a super thick pizza from Pat's... the sauce was about 3 times the necessary amount and there were gobs of cheese everywhere. It looked like a heart attack waiting to happen. The pepperoni was visibly on top of the pie, but the sausage was imbedded somewhere within, among the sauce and cheese ridiculousness. If that's your thing, great, but it's not mine and I was highly disappointed... especially for $28! Seriously, I almost choked when the lady over the phone gave me the cost for ONE pizza delivery which should have been my sign to hang up (again my fault) but I figured it must be good given the solid star ratings... Nope, not worth it a dollar in my mind. But hey, this is my review and my opinion. Take it with a grain of salt.

34.description: What a great surprise! This Pat's is not related to the one I used to know on the North Side so I wasn't sure what to expect. Our options for delivery in the South Loop are pretty limited so we were excited to find a place that would come to us on a cold, snowy winter's night. They told us 45 minutes and it was 45 minutes. They have coupons online, and there was no problem redeeming it. The delivery fee must be baked into the price, which was also nice. But the main thing, of course, was the pizza itself, which was excellent- super thin crust, crisp and a great taste. Definitely not greasy. We had to warm it up a bit and I could have used more mushrooms, but overall, this was a very favorable experience. We will definitely be ordering from Pat's again. I noticed that they also have sandwiches and pasta, too!

16.description: We order pizza pan with pineapple , ham and cheese ,we just love it . The pizza was delicious

13.description: I love Pat's. Being in the neighborhood and walk past here every day after work, I have to fight myself from getting a pizza daily. This is the staple of a walk up counter pizza joint. They do not have slices, but no worries, they are usually quick. I typically don't even call ahead, but just stop in and order. 25 mins later, my large pizza is ready to take home (have been in here during lunch and it's even quicker with their individual pies). There is very minimal seating; more or less counter space to grab their special on your lunch break. The owner is extremely friendly and accommodating. I've only had their thin crust pepperoni and sausage, but I'm afraid to try anything else, because I enjoy it so much. The crush is thin and crispy with a great balance of savory sauce, toppings, and cheese. Most importantly, the flavors just work together. I have no complaints or critiques. Pat's is a no frills spot cranking out pizzas for all to enjoy.

11.description: Ordered a medium thin crust, as others have mentioned it's definitely not on the cheaper side of pizza (as compared to other chain stores). Sauce was good, on the sweeter side, and contrasted nicely against the saltiness of the pepperoni and mushroom we ordered. When craving some higher quality pie, would definitely order again.

39.description: Pat's was alright, I don't have too much to say.  The giardinera and sausage combination was good don't get me wrong but man it was expensive for thin crust.  If i'm paying that much for pizza, it better be chicago style deep dish!!!  The quality and quantity did not justify the pricing but if you're not worried about the budget, it's a decent place to get some thin crust pizza. It's the kind of place i'd go back for with a coupon.  Service was nice and fast! : )

37.description: I got a coupon mailer in the mail (If you are advertising a restaurant, the mailers apparently work. I never thought much about this until I used this coupon - but - print advertising worked for my uncle's dentistry in the 90s so I guess my 'revelation' is moot - I am not sure where I am going here). All of the coupons came out to saving three dollars. Except the one weird one where if you buy 15 large pizzas, you get a case of soda. I wonder if they meant a 12-pack of cans - I'll never know - I don't plan on buying fifteen large pizzas. I get the feeling they are nice enough that they might give you that free pack if you buy only fourteen or thirteen large pizzas.Well, I ordered over the phone. It came in about 20 minutes or so. I forget. it was very hot when it got here. The delivery person was nice.  After tax and delivery fee and tip it was kind of expensive, part of that was getting three toppings. I don't get toppings pricings.Okay, my review:The pizza was as good as this picture looks to you:yelp.com/biz_photos/pats…

0.description: So happy to find a great neighborhood pizza delivery spot!! We ordered 4 thin crust (well done and easy cheese) pizzas on valentines day and they delivered our pizzas exactly at the time we asked! The pizzas were still hot and crispy. Pizzas we had:GiardineraJalapeno, Garlic, Green pepper onionSpinach, Onion, Garlic (THIS WAS THE GROUP FAVORITE)Super fresh and great service. Highly recommend it!

38.description: I have yet to find another non-chain pizza place in the loop for lunch.  Small 8" thin crust pepperoni pizza is good!  The only problem is the 8" isn't on the menu.  There's nothing special about the pizza but it is good.

51.description: My boss ordered delivery from here for lunch today, and here are my thoughts.- thin crust: crispy- sauce: I think there was sauce- cheese: there was definitely cheese- sausage: there was sausage on the pizzaAll the elements of pizza were there, but it just wasn't very flavorful. Overall, very "meh." Unfortunately, the boss said it was significantly cheaper than Giordano's so I think we will be ordering from here from now on. I'll have to request the stuffed or think crust next time and see if that's any better.

27.description: Good place to get some quick pizza near the South Loop. Was dinner time and heard they had great thin crust pizza so I called and spoke to a guy who was relatively patient with me despite all the questions I asked about costs.Went ahead and ordered a Large (16 inch) 2 topping thin crust pizza with pepperoni and sausage and paid about $23 to go pick it up. It was ready in 20 min.Pro: The pizza tasted great, the thin crust was the type that wasn't cracker thin but soft and thin. Great combo for me. Healthy amounts of toppings, no shortchanging there. Good stuff for a hungry dinner/late night situationCon: A little bit pricey though in my opinion, $23 for large 2 topping, and the 1 topping wasn't that much cheaper like $20-$21 if I remember correctly, and it doesnt stop there, the Medium or one size down at 14 was only a few dollars cheaper at like $19-$20. Anyway, good tasting pizza if you are a high roller in the south loop willing to dish out some money for a good tasting pizza.

32.description: Tried it for the first time today. This is how thin crust should be done. Paper thin crust. Good flavor all around. Ordered a medium sausage and jalapeño, extra sauce well done. It was perfect and ready for pickup in 20 min.

54.description: Husband and I are new to area, walked in here to find out what the hype was about. Definitely worth the 20 minute wait!  Nice staff. We got a thin crust and it had delicious buttery crust! Also got the loaded salad which I wasn't a huge fan of but the pizza would of off set anything it was that good.This will be our new Friday night pizza

48.description: This is a small place you'd probably just walk past without giving it a second look, but let me tell you, have the pizza here and you won't miss this place again. I'm from out of town so I'm not sure how popular this place is among the locals but you've got a fan in Minnesota that will be back. Not only for the pizza but for the customer service the owner is such a nice guy and makes every customer feel welcomed.

44.description: Part of a taste test when my family came into town, we put Pat's up against County Inn from Elmhurst (others were Due's and Pequod's for deep dish).To make it a true taste test, we just got pepperoni and onion to match the County Inn pizza. The crust on this one was incredible, cracker thin, crispy and delicious. Hands down a favorite among our group of 7, including one who has been biased towards County Inn his whole life.The toppings were good but may be able to be spiced up a bit.Always a great option if you're looking for something quick, or for some great thin crust pizza.

24.description: Best thin crust pizza in Chicago - no frills just good food. We ordered pizzas for a party and were able to taste a variety of toppings which were all fresh. We liked it so much that it has become our new go to pizza delivery place.

7.description: We were happily surprised that this is our favorite pizza place here in Chicago! It's just good and has been consistently delicious every time we order.   I'd order this before Malnatis(also good...), Gino's(yuck), pequods (yuck)... And all of the others around downtown.  They also have fresh salads, yummy pasta, and have been friendly when we order and pick up. Thanks Pats!

49.description: Great thin crust pizza. Everything looks very clean. It is a take out place but quality is good

40.description: IMO, this is the best thin crust cheese pizza in the city.  Their sauce is on the sweet side, but that's probably what makes it so delicious.  For whatever reason, their + toppings pizzas are just OK (still better than average); but, if you're in a purist's mood for cheese only?  Pat's every time.

53.description: I've been ordering from Pat's for 18 years and today I'm sad to say, I'm done with Pat's.  I've had so many bad experiences with orders being correct, wrong credit card #'s etc. and today the pizza was awful.  The usual crisp thin crust was almost deep dish style.  it was terrible.  I called Pat's and the manager Danny blew me off and said sorry.  Well, here's sorry.  I'm done.  I wash't looking for anything other than how can I help you, but that won't in the cards.So long Pat's, I can no longer recommend you with such passé attitudes and bad service.

30.description: By far the best thin crust in the city of Chicago. Their pizza is so thin, greasy, and cheesy. It is heaven. I only wish I lived within their delivery area.

46.description: Probably one of the best thin crust pizzas ever. A small hole in the wall place but well worth it.

1.description: Super yummy!! The cost was higher than listed but still worth it.

55.description: I've been eating pats for a number of years as I work about a mile away and have never been disappointed. Several of my coworkers regularly order from here as well. With all the excellent choices for the best food around Chicago in the area my staff and I always find ourselves going back to Pats. From pizza,  to pasta, burgers, chicken strips, mozz sticks, and an amazing grilled chicken sandwich it's hard to go wrong with Pats. The staff has gotten to know me over the years and is always very helpful and friendly. I couldn't think of a bad thing to say about this place and I've ordered from here at least twice a week for the last several years. Give them a shot, you will not be disappointed!

9.description: Part of a taste test when my family came into town, we put Pat's up against County Inn from Elmhurst (others were Due's and Pequod's for deep dish).To make it a true taste test, we just got pepperoni and onion to match the County Inn pizza. The crust on this one was incredible, cracker thin, crispy and delicious. Hands down a favorite among our group of 7, including one who has been biased towards County Inn his whole life.The toppings were good but may be able to be spiced up a bit.Always a great option if you're looking for something quick, or for some great thin crust pizza.

26.description: great pizza and fast delivery

25.description: I order pizza from Pat's often both pick up and delivery. The price of an individual pizza comes with a can of soda. I didn't realize I was missing soda until I received my order. Then I remembered that the woman that took my order didn't offer soda. When I called to see why I wasn't offered pizza the same young lady said soda comes with pick up orders only. Please note that there is a $2.50 delivery fee. So I said to the young lady...I paid a delivery fee for a delivery that was a 2 minute walk and I couldn't get a soda? She said I'm just telling you what the manager said. Rude! The manager then confirmed and also said they don't give fries for sandwich deliveries. When I said that's horrible customer service the manager said its up to the customer to ask for these items. Sooo...If you decide to order at Pat's be sure to ask for soda or fries...otherwise you'll feel cheated for OKAY food.

12.description: Beware that this is not the same Pat's Pizza as up North. I looked at the online Menu that redirected to the northside location assuming they were owned by the same people. Ended up ordering a meat lover's pizza, which they knew how to make, but cost me like $35, for a medium. The sausage was so greasy that the pizza fell apart and it just tasted awful. This was a regular crust pizza. It kinda sickens me to live in Chicago and have knock off pizza places like this. Maybe I just ordered the worst thing on the menu, but never returning here again.

59.description: I work in the loop and when craving a Chicago style pizza, I won't hesitate to rally up my co-workers to pitch in the pot for a thin crust pizza with sausage, onions, light bell pepper, extra sauce and cooked well done!  This has become a monthly craving around the office and when we get a hankering for good pizza, Pat's is definitely on the top of our pick list.

21.description: Solid quality pizza. Perfect blend of saucy and cheesy!  We came here on a rainy night and did not leave disappointed!

17.description: Good place to get some quick pizza near the South Loop. Was dinner time and heard they had great thin crust pizza so I called and spoke to a guy who was relatively patient with me despite all the questions I asked about costs.Went ahead and ordered a Large (16 inch) 2 topping thin crust pizza with pepperoni and sausage and paid about $23 to go pick it up. It was ready in 20 min.Pro: The pizza tasted great, the thin crust was the type that wasn't cracker thin but soft and thin. Great combo for me. Healthy amounts of toppings, no shortchanging there. Good stuff for a hungry dinner/late night situationCon: A little bit pricey though in my opinion, $23 for large 2 topping, and the 1 topping wasn't that much cheaper like $20-$21 if I remember correctly, and it doesnt stop there, the Medium or one size down at 14 was only a few dollars cheaper at like $19-$20. Anyway, good tasting pizza if you are a high roller in the south loop willing to dish out some money for a good tasting pizza.

10.description: I love the sandwich menu, great value for money, quality is there too. Im also a fan of the pizza

5.description: Best thin crust Pizza in Chicago.  No debate.  My boss ordered from here about 6 years ago, and I never looked back.  The Pat's (sausage, onion, green pepper) is my fave.  Not really a dine-in place, just some counter space.  Probably great for a quick lunch. I always order delivery, always tip big because I never want this place to go away.

3.description: During our little outing in downtown chicago, we were still on a pizza craving even though we had pizza the day before.  Wherever we were, there was a pizza place in walking distance so we just wanted to grab a small bite to eat.  We found this place that made pizzas but it wasn't too big.  We ordered the Pat's special, which came with sausage, mushrooms, green peppers, and onions for $7.50.  It took about 15 minutes to cook which I thought was pretty long considering how small the pizza was.  The pizza was decent but it wasn't anything to spectacular.  Good find to eat if you want to hold your stomach for a delicious meal forthcoming.NOTE:-Free drink included-no bathrooms-small place (walk up to counter and order)

35.description: Went to the Bears game for Monday Night Football and stayed at the Hilton on Michigan Ave. Thank god for this place because it made me forget about the disaster that happened at Solider Field! Awesome thin crust pizza! Order it "well done" and it'll come crispy but not dry or burnt! Well done Pat's!

19.description: Best thin crust pizza in the south loop area. My favorite is pepperoni with extra cheese well baked.

28.description: Horrible customer service. I placed an order for pick up and when I got there the woman who was behind the desk was so Unbelievably rude. She clearly couldn't handle answering the phone, helping customers who walk in and packing up to go orders.  She couldn't be bothered to take care of me when I first got there just brushed me to the side and said its not ready yet. I waited for 20 minutes for her to tell me they didn't put in my order and if I was sure I called the right pats pizza. I must look like an idiot to her. Then a cook put my pizza on the counter so I guess they "found it". She didn't apologize or acknowledge anything. The pizza was just ok. But thanks to that woman I'll never order there again. Why do people work In Customer service if they are miserable and mean? I don't understand.

45.description: Ace has a coupon for Tuesday special that has no date on it for expectation.  Called to place order and would not accept.  Maryann needs to take some management/customer service classes and print date on them if they are going to tell you no.  One star but you can take that away too

33.description: The staff is absolutely wonderful! I stopped in on the way home from work one night and was not disappointed. I highly recommend this place!

43.description: Best customer service I've seen for a small pizza shop. Their wings are some of the best I've had in the city and their pizza is top notch. Highly recommended!!!!

2.description: I have been looking for a good thin crust pizza place since I moved into printers row and I found it.  It is better than the place my family always eat at in the burbs and any other thin crust i have tried in the city.  It is nice, crisp, the sauce is amazing, and PINEAPPLE is a topping!Staff is always very friendly and I like that they have such a variety of soda to choose from.  I mean a ton of options.  For those who complained there is no where to sit and eat, its a pick up or delivery place what do you expect?  There is a counter with a few high level chairs however if you need a place to eat. It is a little pricey but that is because it 100% worth it.  I found my new go to pizza place and could not recommend this place enough.

18.description: Visiting Chicago for training... this is the best meal I've had yet! Delivered super fast, and so hot it burned my tongue, the way it should be. I would have given 5 stars but the kid who took my order wasn't exactly friendly, and there were no plates or napkins with the delivery even though I'm in a hotel. Might be my fault for not requesting them. Would order from here again in a heartbeat!

41.description: Excited for our order to get here!! The thin crust pizza and fried raviolis are AMAZING!!

52.description: This is our Sunday night staple.  By far the best thin crust pizza in the city.  Jalapeño and bacon is our favorite. Just ask for well done if you like the cheese brown and the crust crunchy. We get it delivered and it always arrives hot and in a timely manner.

50.description: Worst pizza I've ever had in Chicago! 50 bucks for two large pizzas and the box probably had more flavor than the pizza did. Never again!

4.description: I love this place. Best pizza in the city. But when they charge me $26 for a medium pizza and take close to two hours to deliver, I may have to reconsider my options.

6.description: I got a coupon mailer in the mail (If you are advertising a restaurant, the mailers apparently work. I never thought much about this until I used this coupon - but - print advertising worked for my uncle's dentistry in the 90s so I guess my 'revelation' is moot - I am not sure where I am going here). All of the coupons came out to saving three dollars. Except the one weird one where if you buy 15 large pizzas, you get a case of soda. I wonder if they meant a 12-pack of cans - I'll never know - I don't plan on buying fifteen large pizzas. I get the feeling they are nice enough that they might give you that free pack if you buy only fourteen or thirteen large pizzas.Well, I ordered over the phone. It came in about 20 minutes or so. I forget. it was very hot when it got here. The delivery person was nice.  After tax and delivery fee and tip it was kind of expensive, part of that was getting three toppings. I don't get toppings pricings.Okay, my review:The pizza was as good as this picture looks to you:yelp.com/biz_photos/pats…

22.description: I'm a Pat's fan!  In my opinion, it's the best thin-crust pizza in Chicago.  The crust is nice and crispy and the sauce is perfectly tomatoey and a little sweet.  They deliver to our house in River West.  Our usual order is a large pizza with sausage and pepperoni.  Soooo good!

15.description: Pizza is alright.   Thin crust is the go to here.   Toppings are not thick really.   Not exactly a cheap pie.   Deliveries will take over an hour easily.   I've never had mozzarella  sticks be delivered warm .  Honestly, go to your regular thin crust spot.   I wanna try to like the place because it's close, but it's just the worst service I've dealt with in terms of pizza.   Place needs to figure it out.

57.description: The pizza at Pat's Pizzeria is pretty good. Many of the other things on their menu are worth trying as well, such as their pasta dishes and sandwiches.

20.description: My go to pizza spot in printers row. Comfort food without the grease. My favs include personal 8" pizza(mmmmmm...Thin&crunchy!!), house salad, fried mushrooms & zucchini, eggplant parmesan.

36.description: Whoever the woman is answering their phone over there is very rude and disrespectful. It was if taking my order and answering a question was a huge problem for her. I have been ordering from Pats for 3+ years, the pizza is very good, but based on how I was treated on the phone I probably won't be going back.  Horrible.

14.description: I came here for dinner one night and ordered the Pat's special with cheese fries.  Preparation took a while (25-30 mins) but the owner was very friendly and chatted with me during the wait.  When I received the food, I was very impressed with the quantity.  The pie had pretty good size for the price and came with a free soda, assorted crackers, and probably half a dozen packs of grated cheeses and other seasonings.  The order of cheese fries was also huge and filled an entire takeout box.  Both tasted pretty good and I'd recommend a visit if you're hungry and craving pizza and/or fries.

28.description: I have spent about a year now as a patient of Dr. Knox, working through my chronic lower back pain. The evaluation she provided after my first visit really gave me the insight and understanding other doctors did not. She spent a good deal of time ensuring I knew what my degenerative disc disease meant. She was motivated and convinced she could help strengthen me in place of recommending back surgery like so many others jump to do. I knew the minute she said, "80% of your disc is gone and there is no fixing that but what we will do here is focus on getting that 20% strong enough to make this condition a great deal less painful and tolerable", that she was exactly the Chiropractor for me. Her program, advice and adjustments have really improved my condition which previously, with other Chiropractors had not subsided at all. And it's through her treatment I got a real education on balance and all that it means to back conditioning and strengthening. The kind of service and personal attention she provides is hard to come by and I'm big on great customer service. To give an example, there was once a Friday I was still at her office after which she had closed and a patient of hers arrived when the doors were locked. It seems he needed some sort of letter for his job and she took the time to let him in, write and sign this letter, instead of turning him down. This spoke volumes to me! She's hard-working, personable and sincere. She knows her craft extremely well and talks you through everything she's doing. Her massage therapy team is fantastic as well!

1.description: I bought a groupon for a prenatal massage for my sister and she had to leave 8 messages over a two week period before they would call her back, then they were talking to someone else while on the phone with her and still told her she couldn't get in for awhile because they like to spread out their groupon bookings. Awful customer service. I'm returning the groupon.

39.description: I'd been suffering from earaches for almost 10 years.  In the months leading up to my visit to Dr. Creevy, I was experiencing horrendous ear pain almost every day.  Even when the pain wasn't excruciating, it was still there, vaguely and annoyingly.  My doctor offered little help and never made mention of chiropractic care. Olive oil in the ear was my only salvation.  The oil helped, but only temporarily and who wants an oily ear all the time??Finally a co-worker suggested I try chiropractic.  The first practice I visited impressed with their teachings of how the spine affects every part of the body, but the cost for treatment had me in tears.  My x-rays showed that I had a problem and here I was unable to afford treatment.  That is a feeling I wouldn't wish on anyone.  Another co-worker referred me to Proper Balance for a second opinion.  Cost aside (because chiropractic is expensive any way you slice it) Dr. Creevy's more advanced equipment was able to better pinpoint the source of my problems and the treatment has been outstanding!  After 3 months of treatment my ear aches are almost completely gone.  When I started I would have given ANYTHING to not experience that pain every day and here I am feeling great.  It's really amazing.  Dr. Creevy's method of treatment is unlike many others.  Her staff is great and I hope that I can continue to make chiropractic treatment at Proper Balance a part of regular medical treatmnet.  If you are in any kind of pain I urge you to seek chiropractic care and recommend Dr. Creevy!

9.description: Wonderful service, very helpful and love how they get to know you and not just as a patient.  They take the time to figure out what other items could help in your recovery.  Also the massages are the best!

29.description: I actually followed Dr Creevy from another chiropractor.  She has helped me to overcome some back pains from a car accident earlier in my life and even helped improve the curve in my neck.  I go once a month to maintain and am thinking about making that twice a month.  I feel so much better after an adjustment.Thanks Doc!  I'll refer you any day.

23.description: I went to Proper Balance because a girlfriend of mine had a Living Social deal that was about to expire and she could not use it.  As I walked in the receptionist was on the phone so I could not fault that but I did not even get a smile or get acknowledged when he was finished.  Someone in a white coat came out and gave me a form to fill out and stated that my insurance may be able to take care of future visits.  That interested me as my doctor suggested that I get a massage because of tightness in my back.  I was led to a massage room and asked what needed work.  My shoulders are the focal point but I mentioned some other things on my form.  I felt the difference in my shoulders and really felt the therapist did a good job on a difficult back but would have liked some attention paid to my legs and arms also.  After the massage was over I left the room, was given a warm cup of water and sent on my way.  I stopped by the reception desk and his main concern was that the massage therapist receive the proper tip.  (Yes, I tipped on the total cost and not the coupon price.)  I was a little disoriented after leaving and felt light headed.  I remember at other massages you are usually led to another room to relax a little before leaving.  Anyway, 3 stars because the massage was pretty good but the customer service could be tightened up a little.

5.description: Beautiful facility but HORRIBLE at keeping appointments!  I went in for a groupon massage and was excited thinking it would be great!  However after waiting 55 minutes I went from relaxed, to annoyed to angered!  One person said it would be 15 minutes, not 55 minutes!  That's insane!  I'm sure it's a great chiropractor but scheduling and appointments they are lackluster.  My appointment was at 10:30 am Saturday morning, and it didn't start till 11:30 am.  Just what I wanted to do is wait for 60 minutes before I start.  I'd much rather run errands, sleep, anything besides sit around for 60 minutes.  To add to there horrible service, there bathroom is broken, I had to go in the alley like a bum because there's nothing open around there.  In regards to the massage, this is the only reason why they got 2 stars.  The massage was very good!  The therapist was clearly trained and very professional.  If it was not for the horrible service, then I would absolutely return.  Next time just be honest and tell people the actual wait time.  I would have gone and came back or just rescheduled.

31.description: I was very thoughtfully given a gift certificate for a 60 minute massage at Proper Balance Healthcare; to try and accomplish the goal of de-stressing me. Most people would opt for the relaxing Swedish, but not me. I have knots in my back that taunt me on a daily basis...and I want them out of there. I scheduled an appointment and since I didn't have anyone specific to request, they paired me with Stephanie. I should send the receptionist a thank you note, because it was great. You can tell that Stephanie is a pro and knows exactly what she is doing, she even nicknamed one of my knots "The Headache Monster". Now, I still had knots in my back...but it would take a miracle worker (not a professional massage therapist) to get those out in an hour. Although I was expecting the massage to be mostly painful it ended up being mostly relaxing and I walked out of there feeling like a subdued version of myself (equivalent to me after a glass of red wine). The best part? The 5 minute head massage...it was incredible. I am tempted to make another appointment just for a full 60 minute repeat of that. Keep in mind that this place is NOT a spa. It does not look or feel like a spa...and that is not their goal; it feels like a nice West Loop chiropractor. Don't get me wrong, I love plush robes, lemon water, and soothing tunes as much as the next person, but if what you're looking for is some serious help with your body...this is the place to go.

25.description: Thanks to YouSwoop my back is nice and sore. I mean that in the best possible way. I apparently was storing industrial rope with knots that any Cub Scout would be proud of, in my back. Mid-way through my massage I began thinking, "These knots aren't so bad... I can live with them... please let me keep my knots!" The pain eventually melted away a few hours later and I am coping with life after my Cub Scout knots. Fully recommend to those who also suffer the ailment of ratpacking ropes and knots in their backs as well.Pros & Cons+Health insurance is taken (PPO I hear is the way to go)+Lots of those bouncy balls+Large Staff for easy to make appointments-Not the easiest place to get to

12.description: Thanks to YouSwoop my back is nice and sore. I mean that in the best possible way. I apparently was storing industrial rope with knots that any Cub Scout would be proud of, in my back. Mid-way through my massage I began thinking, "These knots aren't so bad... I can live with them... please let me keep my knots!" The pain eventually melted away a few hours later and I am coping with life after my Cub Scout knots. Fully recommend to those who also suffer the ailment of ratpacking ropes and knots in their backs as well.Pros & Cons+Health insurance is taken (PPO I hear is the way to go)+Lots of those bouncy balls+Large Staff for easy to make appointments-Not the easiest place to get to

37.description: A lot of reviewers talk about injuries that precipitated going to Dr. Knox. For me, I found that just working at a computer about 5 hours a day is enough to push your body to the limits. I'm a 30-year old healthy woman but my posture was so-so and it was straining my lower back, feet, and knees. After a fair amount of easy-to-learn and non-strenuous exercises, my core became stronger, my neck was straighter (instead of nerd-like forward head posture) and my knees didn't click anymore. They are incredible in their knowledge and in their manner. Dr. Christina Knox has a soothing, approachable quality and Dr. Steve Knox helps to push you further with a great sense of humor. Beyond the classic training of this chiropractic office, they also improve your overall health with cutting-edge awareness of 'alternative medicine'. I wish it wasn't called alternative; especially since it works!  Long story short: I have been 100% impressed with the quality of treatment from Proper Balance Healthcare and have thoroughly enjoyed the personalities and professionalim of the entire staff.

21.description: Got in on LivingSocial deal for a massage.I saw Morgan.  She no longer works there, but she was one of the best masseuses I have ever had.  Listened exactly to what I need and worked those areas longer.  Too bad she doesn't work there anymore.  I haven't yet gone back there, but it's close to where I use to live.

16.description: I had never been to a chiropractor previously and picked this one based on yelp reviews  (which is why I'm reviewing this now) and because it seemed like they had a good 'whole' approach that included physical therapy and massage along with adjustments.  I knew that I would need more than the average "crack and go' since I had been experiencing lower back issues for quite some time, without too much success with other treatments.The staff was always very nice and accommodating throughout the months that i went to PBH, with the physical therapist truly being the best part of the three headed approach.  Massage was good, but it was a revolving door of staff, which wasn't the best thing when you're trying to build on the last session.  Starting over with someone new, especially some of the less experienced people right out of school was totally a waste of time.  There were a few therapists there however that made that 30 minutes of the visit worth it.One thing that was pretty annoying was having to actually tell the massage therapists what to do each and every time you had a massage.  There should have been more communication between the doctors and the massage therapists.  I understand how important feedback is, but I shouldn't be directing you at all in a place that prides itself on a complete 'treatment' - if i knew what to do, my pain would have been gone long ago.This part of my experience, just smelled like is was built for people to milk their insurance into paying for a massage that made them feel good, but not something that was actually part of a recovery program.  A couple therapists were really fantastic and knew what they were doing when it came to muscular structure and how it played a role in your ailment, the others were barely different than getting a massage school session at Cortiva for $40.Anyway, from the beginning, the doctor laid out a plan and assured me that there was no reason that she thought I wouldn't see relief if i committed to the schedule she laid out (which miraculously, lined right up with the exact amount my insurance would cover for 'one instance' of treatment).That's fine, all I'm looking for at this point is a solution.  So i committed, and three months later, I was not all that much different than when i walked in the door for the first time.That said, I get the fact that these people aren't going to be able to solve every problem, everyone has.  It's just the nature of what they do.  If you're arm is broken, no matter how much massage, PT and chiropractic 'adjustment' you get, you're arm is still going to be broken.  What bothered me most about this place, was that by the time we were coming to the end of my treatment plan, the input from the doctor was less and less frequent.  It was as if they could smell the well drying up.  To the point, where we actually scheduled and followed through with an MRI to get a closer look at my problem, that was met with indifference on the part of PBH.  When i came in for my last session, i had my adjustment, my massage, and that was it.  No exit consultation, no real suggestions on what next steps for me could be, seemingly, and truly, absolutely no concern for me and my recovery.  A very nice smile and see you later, but nothing that I expected.  After working with a small group of folks for that many months, seeing them 3 times a week, there was one massage therapist and one physical therapist that were great and seemed to have true concern about what i could do there, and outside of there, to help my situation.  Other than that, including the two main doctors, you're just a number...and that number coincides with what your insurance is willing to cough up for you.If you're looking for some sort of surface level massage/chiropractic type session, that is more relaxing than anything and your issue is slight or basic maintenance, this place is probably fine.  If your issue is a little deeper than something a basic massage can't clear up and you're looking for someone to really delve into your issue and spend time and effort trying to find a solution with you, you should probably look to someone that will actually spend the time to find a solution with you instead of just putting you into the same routine they put everyone else into, hoping it'll fix your issue.To PBH, if you can't fix someone's issue, it would be nice for you to put together some sort of exit consultation where you could outline some potential next pathways.

17.description: I have seen Dr. Knox on a monthly basis for maintenance since going through my correction program back in 2011.  It is time for me to provide an update because the treatments really do have a profound impact on the way I feel.  I am getting married in the near future and because of all the craziness I kept pushing back my monthly maintenance appointment this month.  With each week I could feel the old pain slowly coming back in my lower back/hips/neck and I found myself having pain in my hand.  Yesterday I finally went in for a massage followed by an adjustment (I think my adjustments are more effective after the muscles are loosened by the massage).  I told Dr. Knox what was going on and she performed my adjustment and went over where the issues were showing up on the fancy machine (she always does this).  Sure enough, my upper neck and hip area were out of whack, but then I could see how it was corrected after the adjustment.  She gave me traction, manually adjusted my neck and hips and then I told her about my hand and she said it was likely a result of the misalignment of my neck and did a small hand adjustment.  She told me it would likely feel better the next day now that I had my adjustment.  Here's the thing...she was exactly right!  I was definitely feeling the adjustment after effects last night, but this morning I felt great!  My neck wasn't stiff, my hand didn't hurt and my hips felt so much better when I walked the dog this morning.  I really believe if you go through the proper balance program as suggested in your initial visit and follow up with monthly maintenance you will see a huge LASTING improvement.  I speak from experience!  I cannot thank Dr. Knox enough for the improvements she has made to my quality of life and I will continue to keep up with my maintenance (on time) because it is worth it, plain and simple.

10.description: I went to Dr. Knox from March to July of 2013 to treat a shooting neck pain which affected my upper back and mobility. I subscribed to her full plan of treatment which was weekly, then bi weekly then monthly adjustments in addition to physical therapy. I spent over $1000 and still have the issue. She did no final check when the regimen was complete. Only suggested  I continue to get adjustments and add massages. During the course of treatment I expressed concern I wasn't improving and she only told me it takes time.When I requested my records to take them to a doctor at the rehabilitation institute of Chicago, they said they would have to charge me $60. I offered a thumb drive to transfer them digitally and he said that was cost even more due to some record policy.Insult to injury- literally.I rating massages only, 5 stars for Ellen who was amazing.

11.description: I was a first time client recently with a Groupon, for a one-hour massage. It was a good experience overall. The therapist (Cassidy, I think) was just excellent. The only downside is that it was very noisy. Even with a wind machine going, I could hear phones ringing, conversations in the hallway, and a baby wailing.

26.description: As another review stated, "WOW" is right!  The only regret I have now that I've been to PBH is not having given chiropractic care a chance sooner.  I never knew what "normal" was in terms of back and neck pain and now I do - it's no pain!  I've spent 10 years of my life with back and neck issues and for the first time since then I can sit comfortably, sleep through the night and walk around feeling 100% awesome.On top of the top notch care, the staff is incredibly kind.  I actually look forward to my appointments (even ones that don't include massage :)).  I feel stronger and happier.  Thank you so much!

27.description: wow Wow WOW!  Had a Youswoop deal for a 1 hour massage.  PROs- My back feels brand new.  Best massage I've ever had.CON- I may have started a new addiction to this place!I was assigned to Diandra.  She asked some questions.  I told her I preferred more pressure versus less.  I opted for the full body massage (instead of lower or upper body).  I'm a dancer and also have a stationary 40+ hr job at a computer, so I told her I have a lot of tension in between my shoulder blades and mid to lower back.  Diandra started on my back and...D@MN!  Diandra is a knot master!  My back even felt pretty good that day, and she dug out knots I didn't even know I had.  Every single knot in my back was tackled, not necessary untangled (b/c that's impossible), but thoroughly tackled.  She worked some sort of magic where just when it hurt maybe a bit more than preferred, she eased up and smoothed out the surrounding tissue.  It was a short bittersweet pain followed by extreme relief and relaxation.  I found myself on the brink of drooling every couple minutes.  Gross, but I'm serious.  My back has never felt better.The leg, arm, hand, and feet massage were also very good.  But next time, I will simply have Diandra focus on the back/upper body (my trouble areas).This massage was just what I needed after a long day of work.  I left Proper Balance Healthcare happy, relaxed, and feeling like a million bucks.  I'm already saving money for my next appointment.

35.description: I was routinely getting massage treatment while living overseas for neck tension as well as residual issues following a car accident and after moving to Printers Row I decided to give these guys a try.  I am very skeptical of chiropractors from time working at a major insurance company many years ago so I came in with less than an open mind.What I like about this place is that they utilize massage therapy, traditional PT exercise / training / ultrasound, and chiropractic care.  As a result of this combination approach I have been able to greatly increase my neck's range of motion and core body strength.  Its a work in progress but definitely making it.Everyone there is a pleasure to deal with as well which is important in a long term relationship such as this.

8.description: I came to Proper Balance Health and Wellness Center because of neck and upper back pain due to sitting at a desk all day. I had a consultation with Dr. Elliot Jordan. Dr. Jordan was very thorough asking a lot of questions about my day to day activities so that he could get an idea of what may be the cause of my back pain. After that he did an x-ray scan of my back that used low radiation. And explained the results of the scan in detail and what could be done help alleviate the pain. The equipment they use is state of the art and Dr. Jordan explains what's going to happen so that you're not surprised by anything. As great as the electro-massager is, having Dr. Jordan crack my back manually was awesome. I could feel the tension release immediately.I'll definitely go back and see Dr. Jordan again.

0.description: Very close to Marina City on Wells, I was not expecting a massage place here. I needed a fix on my back and saw that they offered massages. I called them for an appointment and the only thing I did not like was the 24 hour prior to appointment cancellation fee of $25 other than that I enjoyed my time with them. I arrived 15 minutes to sign a few documents with the receptionist (which was rude) she was strict on having me sign all parts of the insurance agreement even though I did not use insurance on my massage. Chastity, my masseuse was very polite and did a great job on my back. I would definitely come back to Chastity again and not the receptionist.

38.description: When I first came into Proper Balance, my back was really tight, I leaned towards my right side and was putting almost 12lbs more weight on my right leg and had a tough time sleeping.  Years of distance running, sitting on airplanes and in front of computers really took a toll on my body.  Dr. Knox (formerly Dr. Creevy), performed some tests to show me where I was out of alignment and developed a plan to help fix my problems and prevent future issues.  Now my weight is more evenly balanced, my back has more flexibility, and I sleep throughout the night without waking as much from back pain!  My health improvement is directly related to the amazing team at Proper Balance.  Dr. Knox, Steve and her staff do an amazing job at listening to what is hurting you and focuses on reducing the pain (without the use of medicine) as quickly as possible while showing you how to prevent it long-term.The combination of Physical Therapy/exercises, the manual alignment (AKA massage!) and the normal alignment (when your bones crack and you feel this amazing sense of relief) and the periodic tests to measure your improvement have a high impact on the rate of your health improvement.I will cut out cable TV and a few nights out to dinner before I stop going to Proper Balance, that is how beneficial they have been to my health.PS: Try the water in the funky Nikken gravity water filter in front lobby, it is the best water I have ever had!

20.description: The nice people at Proper Balance gave me another chance to experience a massage with a different therapist, and I will say that it was much, MUCH better. I believe that my therapist's name was Chastity (pretty sure), and she definitely provided the deep tissue, stress relieving massage that I was looking for. She also did a few techniques that I had never experienced before. My tip is to be really clear about what you are looking for when you book, b/c it seems like they have a lot of different techniques that they do, and they should be able to match you w/the therapist that is best at what you are looking for.  Its also a good deal vs. going to a spa, as they charge $70/$75 vs. $100+ at a spa. Just know that it is not a spa environment (i.e. with the robe, quiet room etc.) but it is still very nice, as it is in a relatively new building.

19.description: In response to the owner's comment and update what happened to all future users. Basically, Dr. Knox called and offered to waive the adjustment cost for me to remove the review. I REFUSED and paid the entire charge in full and took the receipt because I don't trust her or the business and does she believe my integrity is worth so little?. I have high doubt about her ethical standard. Seriously, she is one of the most hypocritical person I have ever met. Earlier when I said I wanted to switch to another Chiro practice, she did this entire routine of how she is hurt, she opened early for me (seriously, the opening time is 7:30 on Friday, and there s other people there already) and how it is only 40 bucks with my insurance, aka why would i make her upset when i only have to pay so little. Hello, this is my money and my time. Seriously, I dont want to work with her and you can go find out for yourself and I wrote to the board of Chiro practice informing them of the business s unethical behaviors.Also she called me, I didnt call her, wasted another 20 mins of my time. Also, who is Christina? the reviewer? Steve said, "it is not worth my time to argue with you, I will just call our biller and bill u and u can decide to pay or not" That is what he said, please stop misrepresenting yourself.And also I know you dont offer free service, just don't give ppl "free" adjustments then charge them for it, made under the pretense of not knowing their insurance, which u called the insurance company 3 months ago and somehow the bill from the other chiropractitioners got delayed for that long. I don't think so. And seriously it is what happened afterward that made me angry or else who has the time to write such long comments. Anybody who posts on yelp knows how long this takes and i have better things to do with my time than arguing with ppl like these if not for the fact that I don't want them to get the last word on this and pretend like they are who they say they are.

33.description: I've hurt my back a few times in the past and my doctors always just gave me pain relievers or muscle relaxers, but the problem just kept coming back. I was very skeptical of chiropractors but after a friend convinced me to go to for a consult I looked on Yelp for a suggestion. I found Proper Balance and made an appointment. They got me in right away and gave me a full assessment within 24 hours. Because I was in so much pain they were able to get me in multiple times over the next two weeks until the pain had subsided and started me working on a regular PT exercise schedule immediately. I have been going for about two months now and have no pain at all. My core is much stronger than it ever has been and they keep giving me tougher exercises to do so I am constantly being challenged. I just go in for a minor adjustment every week or so and some PT. Soon it will be a monthly visit or calling them if I need to come in. As everyone else on Yelp writes, the best part about Proper Balance is the people. They obviously go out of their way to hire nice people who really care. The atmosphere is relaxed and fun and their brand new office across the street from the old one is spotless and beautiful. It is also easy to get appointments that fit your schedule. The other thing I love is that they do not overbook! When you get there for your appointment you either go straight in for massage therapy or start on your PT. I am always there an hour at the most compared to most doctors' offices where you sit for 45 minutes past your appointment in order to see someone for five minutes. They appreciate the business and understand that your time is important to you. I would recommend them to anyone!

2.description: I was gifted a Groupon to Proper Balance for a Prenatal Massage and am thoroughly impressed with the massage I received. I like a deeper pressure, which is hard to find in a prenatal massage session, but Chastity was phenomenal and used the perfect amount of pressure.
