She found all of my many knots and was able to work out a lot of the aches and pains that I have been experiencing due to pregnancy. She was professional and attentive, and kept the environment very comfortable for me. This was one of the best massages I've had, hands down. My only complaint is that I don't think I could afford her on a regular basis since I'm a pregnant student! :-( However, I know that in the future if my budget allows for it, I will be visiting her again and I would definitely recommend her to any pregnant women needing a therapeutic massage.I have an appointment set up soon with Dr. Knox for chiropractics--she seems very professional and like she will be able to help prepare me well for childbirth. I hope that I have as wonderful of an experience with her as I did with Chastity!

34.description: One of the few good youswoop purchases I made!  They moved to a new location across the street 733, so I've never been to the 800 building.  So, it's pretty stark and bare, and I wasn't sure what to expect.  The receptionist was warm and friendly, and got started on my massage appointment with Stephanie.  She was amazing!  I don't think I'm a massage snob or anything, but I have gotten enough to know what I like and she does deep tissue like no one's business!  I don't like massages where I'm just getting rubbed massage lotion on me.  I want the knots worked out, and she found them and has very good techniques as to get them out.  I was amazed at how much she got done in the one hour.  When I got up I felt so much stress lifted off my shoulders and just in a state of bliss and euphoria - like you just got great news about something.  It's been a while since I've come across a massage where I felt anyone has done some real work.  I would like to come back here for more of these massages, but worry of what that cost would be.  It's unfortunate that the youswoops are only good for one visit per person, otherwise I would have gotten more.  You can purchase them as gifts for other people, but I'm sure it's a way to get more new patients.

32.description: I came here with a groupon for a massage.  While the atmosphere was not very spa like as it is a chiro's office, Stephanie did a great job of working my knots out.The downside- the location.  It's a rather barren spot in the south loop with no meter parking and not easily accessible from public transit.

18.description: Let's be honest, I know nothing about chiropractic care and had always been a little nervous about trying it out.  Dr. Jordan was great with me and made me feel so comfortable.  He answered all my questions and really explained everything thoroughly.  It's so important to me to be treated like and person, not just another nameless patient or customer wherever I go, and Dr. Jordan surpassed my expectations.  I would absolutely recommend him to all my friends.  I feel awesome and can't wait for another visit!

13.description: I've had back pain for about the last two years. I'd slipped a disc and completed several months of physical therapy. That helped with the actual injury, but not with the additional strain on my back that my pregnancy brought me.I'd avoided chiropractors out of fear of having my neck and back "cracked". Then, I was referred to Dr Martinez by a friend of the family...She was FANTASTIC! She took the time to better understand my history, and actually listened to the various activities that help, or hurt me. She did a complete and comprehensive exam, which also included ON SITE X-rays. Dr Martinez put my nerves and worries to ease with her kind nature. I'll definitely be returning. That's saying a lot, since I live an hour away.

4.description: I haven't had an adjustment here or any services for that matter. However, I've been there many times as an accompaniment. I think the facility is spacious, appears clean, with a variety of equipment. The doctors and therapists appear to know what they are talking about (again, I haven't had any services). The massage therapists are friendly and professional.HOWEVER, I am only writing this review (and giving my 3 stars) in hopes that the facility sees it and does something about their receptionist, Nancy.Not sure if the place is making good money, but for a couple more bucks an hour, I'm pretty sure they could afford a friendly front line person that actually greets people when they come in and is not always looking down to avoid eye contact. While people are in the waiting area, a good receptionist can/knows how to make small talk or at least ask people how they are doing. Nothing!Not sure if maintaining appointments (on a computer system) is difficult but seriously, she seems to struggle with it, can't communicate exactly when the upcoming appointments are, or what the appointments will be for (and assumes everyone has all the time in the world to hang out here). I'm saying this because after several appointments of JUST adjustments, all of a sudden we walk in one day and she said "you have adjustments, massage appointments, and a re-exam today". Um, excuse me?!?!? We thought this was another 15 minute appointment like the last three have been. Had we known, we wouldn't have made plans for after the 15 minutes. We can't reschedule without paying a $25 fee, you say?!?!? Oh, sure, you'll mention THAT, but won't mention that the appointment was going to take at least an hour when we booked it. I see. That's world class customer service if I ever saw one.She evens goes to state that they overbooked the number of adjustments because "she didn't keep track". Ok, I'll give her points for knowing she's incompetent.Dr. Knox....if you're reading this...please do something about Nancy. Either send her to customer service training or replace her!!!! I may someday want to get services done there myself but there's no way I can deal with Nancy and scheduling appointments at this point!!! Front line and customer service is a foundation to any business. This place definitely has potential for being five stars.

24.description: I just had a 60-min swedish massage here a couple of days ago, using my youswoop. The space is pretty big, they have a area for physical therapy right by the front door, and then individual rooms I assume for massages and adjustments. At first I thought this place might not have the massage ambiance I'm used to at a spa, I was wrong, the small room that I had my massage was cozy and quiet. Now onto the service, I really liked the massage, the amount of pressure was just right and it definitely ease my shoulder/neck muscle pain. My massage therapist asked me which areas bothers me and unknot some of the knots by my shoulder blades. I was instantly relieved from the tension on my shoulders. Good stuff! Now since I have insurance and it's walkabl, I think I will be going back for a chiropratic exam and more massages!

6.description: This review is for the experience I had with my groupon massage only.I was excited when I saw a groupon for here because I live in Printers Row so this was a close option for me! But wow, I am shocked with how TERRIBLE they were with customer service. I purchased a groupon and emailed/called several times to try to schedule it. NO one called me back or emailed me back. Uhhhh.... okay. So a week went by and I continued trying to schedule by filling out a general form on their website to have them call me to schedule it, or to schedule it via email. Finally someone emailed me and with a curt response.... "call us". Not helpful WHEN YOU DON'T ANSWER* your phone! *note, all caps indicates dramatic tones in voice, not yelling.So yeah, first impressions: annoying that I couldn't get through to schedule it, which I found odd but whatever. Finally I did connect with someone and they told me there was a two month wait for massages! WTF? Well, that was unfortunate because my groupon expired in three weeks (note: the group on does say to call at least a week in advance.... not two months in advance!). I mentioned this to the receptionist, hoping they could schedule it for after the groupon expiration and her "zero f**ks given " attitude inspired me ask Groupon for a refund. I don't want a massage or my money going to a company that is so unaccommodating. Yeah, no. BYE.

22.description: I had never been to a chiropractor previously and picked this one based on yelp reviews  (which is why I'm reviewing this now) and because it seemed like they had a good 'whole' approach that included physical therapy and massage along with adjustments.  I knew that I would need more than the average "crack and go' since I had been experiencing lower back issues for quite some time, without too much success with other treatments.The staff was always very nice and accommodating throughout the months that i went to PBH, with the physical therapist truly being the best part of the three headed approach.  Massage was good, but it was a revolving door of staff, which wasn't the best thing when you're trying to build on the last session.  Starting over with someone new, especially some of the less experienced people right out of school was totally a waste of time.  There were a few therapists there however that made that 30 minutes of the visit worth it.One thing that was pretty annoying was having to actually tell the massage therapists what to do each and every time you had a massage.  There should have been more communication between the doctors and the massage therapists.  I understand how important feedback is, but I shouldn't be directing you at all in a place that prides itself on a complete 'treatment' - if i knew what to do, my pain would have been gone long ago.This part of my experience, just smelled like is was built for people to milk their insurance into paying for a massage that made them feel good, but not something that was actually part of a recovery program.  A couple therapists were really fantastic and knew what they were doing when it came to muscular structure and how it played a role in your ailment, the others were barely different than getting a massage school session at Cortiva for $40.Anyway, from the beginning, the doctor laid out a plan and assured me that there was no reason that she thought I wouldn't see relief if i committed to the schedule she laid out (which miraculously, lined right up with the exact amount my insurance would cover for 'one instance' of treatment).That's fine, all I'm looking for at this point is a solution.  So i committed, and three months later, I was not all that much different than when i walked in the door for the first time.That said, I get the fact that these people aren't going to be able to solve every problem, everyone has.  It's just the nature of what they do.  If you're arm is broken, no matter how much massage, PT and chiropractic 'adjustment' you get, you're arm is still going to be broken.  What bothered me most about this place, was that by the time we were coming to the end of my treatment plan, the input from the doctor was less and less frequent.  It was as if they could smell the well drying up.  To the point, where we actually scheduled and followed through with an MRI to get a closer look at my problem, that was met with indifference on the part of PBH.  When i came in for my last session, i had my adjustment, my massage, and that was it.  No exit consultation, no real suggestions on what next steps for me could be, seemingly, and truly, absolutely no concern for me and my recovery.  A very nice smile and see you later, but nothing that I expected.  After working with a small group of folks for that many months, seeing them 3 times a week, there was one massage therapist and one physical therapist that were great and seemed to have true concern about what i could do there, and outside of there, to help my situation.  Other than that, including the two main doctors, you're just a number...and that number coincides with what your insurance is willing to cough up for you.If you're looking for some sort of surface level massage/chiropractic type session, that is more relaxing than anything and your issue is slight or basic maintenance, this place is probably fine.  If your issue is a little deeper than something a basic massage can't clear up and you're looking for someone to really delve into your issue and spend time and effort trying to find a solution with you, you should probably look to someone that will actually spend the time to find a solution with you instead of just putting you into the same routine they put everyone else into, hoping it'll fix your issue.To PBH, if you can't fix someone's issue, it would be nice for you to put together some sort of exit consultation where you could outline some potential next pathways.

15.description: I got a few treatments after discovering the place via a Groupon massage.  The chiropractors and massage therapists were nice (which is why this is a 2 vs. 1 star review) but I'd give a 1 star primarily in response to the billing process.  When paying my balance due, I noticed that I was being charged for services I had already paid for (via Groupon and my HRA/FSA).  It was a $200 discrepancy which is why I noticed and I must have gone into the facility/called to inquire about the matter at least 5x but each time was told someone will look into it and get back to me.  They were nice about it but alas I never got a call back.  After a good 2 months of this back and forth I finally decided to go through my insurance to look into it/call proper balance on my behalf which seemed to resolve everything.  I've never experienced this sort of billing discrepancy with a medical practitioner before and I completely understand things happen but the lack of communication/responsiveness re the issue is what got to me.  Not sure if I'm a one-off case but just writing this review as a heads up for patients to maybe double check your statement here.

7.description: Had a massage here on a Groupon, not bad not great. Its a clinic that offers massage so do not get that confused. You can tell the associates are encouraged to promote the bodywork & wellness portion of the business, which is fine but id help them find the passion in that aspect of their employment. Clean, spacious, easy location.

36.description: I've been to several chiropractors in my life, and I've always been nervous when they lay me on the table and crack my neck... I've never felt that way with Dr Creevy-Knox. She does a holistic approach (not as hippie as it sounds) that involves massage therapy, physical therapy, and chiropractic work. On top of that she encourages an overall wellness lifestyle.I love her office too! Its open and spacious with lots of light, it makes going there a pleasure (as opposed to an office with lots of walls and low ceilings). It sounds like an insignificant thing, the office space, but it really does effect how you feel when you walk out of there. I've never been so happy with a chiropractor. I'm always walking out of her office with a smile on my face

30.description: I used to be dubious about chiropractic care, adjustments and the like.  But not anymore -- after an efficient combination of massage, physical therapy, exercises and adjustments -- i feel better than ever and have zero knee and hip pain - absolutely amazing - the doctors, therapists and LMTs are top notch here!  love this place -- caters to your schedule, teaches you life-long habits for a more balanced lifestyle and future--

3.description: I had a spectacular massage here and would return again if they could get their reception straightened out. The woman who answers the phone (Nancy) and checks you in is exceptionally unfriendly and unprofessional. She instills no confidence when you make your appt and again when you ask questions at the check in.My appt was on time and I believe Jenny was the therapist who did such a great job. It's really close to my house and I was introduced to them via Groupon, but don't think I'll be going back.

14.description: wow Wow WOW!  Had a Youswoop deal for a 1 hour massage.  PROs- My back feels brand new.  Best massage I've ever had.CON- I may have started a new addiction to this place!I was assigned to Diandra.  She asked some questions.  I told her I preferred more pressure versus less.  I opted for the full body massage (instead of lower or upper body).  I'm a dancer and also have a stationary 40+ hr job at a computer, so I told her I have a lot of tension in between my shoulder blades and mid to lower back.  Diandra started on my back and...D@MN!  Diandra is a knot master!  My back even felt pretty good that day, and she dug out knots I didn't even know I had.  Every single knot in my back was tackled, not necessary untangled (b/c that's impossible), but thoroughly tackled.  She worked some sort of magic where just when it hurt maybe a bit more than preferred, she eased up and smoothed out the surrounding tissue.  It was a short bittersweet pain followed by extreme relief and relaxation.  I found myself on the brink of drooling every couple minutes.  Gross, but I'm serious.  My back has never felt better.The leg, arm, hand, and feet massage were also very good.  But next time, I will simply have Diandra focus on the back/upper body (my trouble areas).This massage was just what I needed after a long day of work.  I left Proper Balance Healthcare happy, relaxed, and feeling like a million bucks.  I'm already saving money for my next appointment.

58.description: This review is for the massage service at Spa Anjou.Got the yelp coupon and used it for the massage. The pillow where you put your face during the massage (face down) has a plastic warp which is awfully uncomfortable. The massage therapist didn't really know how to massage, just rubbing you and killing the time. I definitely won't be going for the massage there again.

56.description: Had a wax appointment with Amy. She is very thorough and meticulous. Also she is an absolute sweetheart. As a bonus I got in the same day I called. Definitely going back.

29.description: Spa Anjou has a relaxing atmosphere and the receptionist is super friendly.  I went to this salon several times because it was just a few steps from my apartment and I enjoyed the quite, calming atmosphere. I've only had no chip manicures and one time I received a complimentary pedicure because they were running about an 45 minutes behind on my appointment. The manicures I received were always disappointing, most of the time they didn't trim my cuticles and extra skin around the nail beds and my NO CHIP always chipped within a few days. Sometimes, I would go back to have them fix a nail or two but I felt like they were annoyed with me and I don't have the time to go in between appointments. If you want a manicure that last don't go here.

42.description: LOVE THIS SALON!!!!Pretty pricey but the owner is an eyebrow wizard. My brows have never looked better.Very nice decor and very clean.

23.description: Love, love, love this place. Very friendly, professional staff and they are always playing something new to watch. They have great colors to select from and if you ever need some advice they will direct you in the right direction. There is parking (pay to park) available right in front and I have never ran into an issue of not finding a spot. I have received the mani/pedi, both regular and no chip mani. They have specials from time to time and I have gotten those as well, they are worth it. The chairs to sit in are comfortable, I do wish they had a massage capability. Sometimes while your nails are drying the technician will massage your back and neck for about 2 minutes. Oh and this place is BYOB. love. it.

47.description: I came here for a wax and pedicure and was pleasantly surprised. The atmosphere was very relaxing and calm, I'd love to know what Pandora station they had on because it was good relaxing mix. The two estheticians were very detail oriented and professional, prices are reasonable. I left feeling more relaxed that I have in a while. I definitely will be back. Thank you!

8.description: Very professional, sanitary and friendly. They all take pride in their work and schedule mainly by appointments, which I love. Their establishment is so clean and neat with very relaxing music playing over the loud speaker. They charge a little more than what I'm accustomed to paying, but it's worth the extra money. Their no chip mani lasts for weeks and they actually give you a real foot and hand massage. Many nail salons don't do that anymore and if they do it lasts for five seconds.  I'm hard to please and I've been going to the same nail salon for ten years, but after coming to Spa Anjou I'm never going back to my old stomping grounds. I recommend Maria and Duku. But, I hear they're all really good here.

31.description: Came here for a gel / no chip manicure last week. Pros: the spa is nice; receptionist very friendly; dog mascot adorableCons: my gel manicure started chipping the VERY NEXT DAY! I went back to get that nail fixed, which they were nice enough to do, but then the next day, ANOTHER nail came off!! For $40, I would expect a manicure that lasts more than 24 hours. :( I don't think I'll be returning.

34.description: One of the best manicures I have ever had! They have a large high-end nail polish selection, and they use a nice scrub and lotion to leave your hands feeling extra soft. I highly recommend this place to anyone!

16.description: My no chip manicure chipped on 4 of my nails the very next day. I came back to get it fixed and instead of taking the no chip polish off my whole nail she just polished over the spots and you could clearly see it. What needed to be done was the polish needed to be taken off the whole nail and re-done. 3 hours later the polish came off the spot she re-polished! I wasn't doing any cleaning or anything that would cause the polish to come off. I get no chip manicures all the time and never have I had it chip the next day what's the point of paying $45 versus a $15 regular manicure. Many other nail places that do a great job and are cheaper. Also, they have very few no chip color options. The place is cute and staff is nice but don't think I would come back.

13.description: Spa Anjou is my go-to place for a pedicure. The atmosphere inside is very relaxing, quiet, and warm. They play good music and have comfy spa chairs. I always get a nice leg massage as part of the pedicure. There are lots of OPI and Esse colors to choose from. Be sure to make an appointment - they don't take walk ins!

11.description: Great place with a very relaxing environment but I felt for a $45 mani/pedi it was very very basic but no perks at all.Also now three days later and I have three chipped nails. And all of the nails look like I got the manicure two weeks ago

39.description: Very friendly and courteous.  Nicely decorated and relaxing environment.  The prices were good @ $45 for a mani/pedi and it includes a quick shoulder massage.  Would return.

37.description: This humble nail place has great prices and a slightly old hollywood vibe.  A standard manicure is only $15, but the work is great.  They have a great selection of colors including the newest rollouts from Essie and OPI.   I love that you can see the sanitizing machines too!  No tools will be dropped on the floor and re-picked up here.There is a bit of a language barrier with the manicurists and my nails were cut too short for my liking, but I'd go back again.  Nice little salon in Printer's Row hood.

0.description: THE. BEST. manicure in the city. I've hunted for 3 years for my "spot". I have found it in printers row. My manicurist did an impeccable job. She took extra time to make sure everything was perfect and was efficient with my time. I got a no chip and she helped me pick the perfect shade after I gave her a vague idea of what I was looking for. The staff is friendly, the space is very clean, it is relaxing and organized. I will be back and can't wait to get a pedicure! The price is kind of high but definitely worth the money!

38.description: Got a no-chip manicure and pedicure that was already chipping a few days after !!! Would not recommend this place.  Colors are limited and staff can be very rude!!! Especially Kima/Nima, avoid her if you can. She was so unpleasant.

51.description: I was looking for a place to get a Brazilian wax and decided to try this place, because it's right near my office. It was my first time ever getting waxed and I was super nervous. The woman who took care of me (middle aged Asian lady; I'm horrible with names) was super professional, talked to me the whole time, and made me feel comfortable. She tweezes off any stray hairs, too. I've gone back several times, and will be going back again soon!

27.description: I used to frequent this salon and was generally happy with the results, and I like that they play movies on mute, so it can be more of a relaxing experience. I'm taking a break, though. I most often get no-chip manicures and during the last visit, the nail technician buffed my nails down to nearly skin level. I already have weak nails (that's why I get no-chip) and my fingers were in pain for days. I haven't been back since.

32.description: Lovely!  Stopped in with my coworker during lunch.  My new favorite spot to get a lunch time mani.  Very cute, very clean.  The staff was nothing but friendly.  They played calming (but good) music so you could sit back and relax.  While my nails were drying they surprised us with a neck and shoulder massage (all for $15).  My nails look fabulous.  The attention to detail was wonderful.  I cant wait to go back and get a pedicure!

54.description: Got the yelp deal here after a long fourth of july weekend. I felt grimy, unshowered, and had time to kill before my flight out of Chicago, and visiting this place was a great idea. It was a very relaxing atmosphere, had many chairs available to accommodate a same-day appointment, and the people were very nice. I had a good massage and pedicure. The paint job wasn't bad, but it's only been a few days so I'm not sure how long it'll last. I'd go again if there were another deal!

48.description: The yelp $75 for $50 deal was great. I got a manicure, pedicure, and waxing service. All staff were very nice and professional, clean environment. They also have a great waxing deal for regular maintenance. Enjoyed all services and will definitely go back!

44.description: Got a mani/pedi and eyebrows waxed, wax room was clean and well lit. She did an ok job, left one brow shorter. I wasnt thrilled, but I dont have a lot of hair..I probably wont get waxed here again.  Place looks cute, nice decore, clean, but unfortunately it was 15 degrees outside,everytime someone opened the door the temperature dropped inside. I was really cold  I asked them to turn up the heat,they disregarded my request,  I asked if they had any tea, I would think they'd be attentive, or considerate, since I was a first timer and it was cold inside. They weren't!  Overall pedicure was good, manicure was thorough. They didnt help me put my boots on or spray me with fast drying spray. Like I said, if you're not going to be attentive with your customers,why should they come back!

24.description: I have been here a couple of times. For pedicures it's pretty good. Comfortable seats, but they're not massaging seats, however it's quiet and with the movies on, it's very relaxing. Although a pedicure is very quick and the massage component maybe lasts 60 seconds. For manicures I've had no chip here twice. First time with OPI products was OK, and the second time with CND Shellac. The second time the shellac started lifting within 3 days. I came back and they dutifully re-did them all. But annoyingly they never apologized and were really annoyed at me for having to re-do work. Well it's not like I wanted to sit there for another hour to have a job I'd already paid for done again. I won't go back in a hurry. And this place is not exactly cheap. For mani and pedi with tip it's $95.

7.description: Best no-chip I've ever had. Hands down.Went back again and can confirm it was not a fluke. Got an awesome no-chip + pedi. Bottom line, Nima is awesome and does a beautiful job.

49.description: I just moved to the South Loop and was looking for my new go-to neighborhood nail salon. I bought the Yelp deal ($75 of services for $50) and figured I'd try this place out. First, I didn't realize that the Yelp deal has to be used all at once (it's not like a gift card where they keep a balance - if you don't get $75 worth of services, that's too bad). So that was annoying, but the girl at the front was really helpful and suggested a reflexology foot massage ($15) to add to the mani/pedi to hit the $75 total. The atmosphere is really clean and appealing and the music is soothing. I love the leather chairs for the spa pedicure - so much nicer than the big, bulky massage chairs (though, those have their moments too). I also noticed that a couple of people had brought their own wine - so apparently it's a byob nail place, which is great. The lowdown:Spa pedicure - Fantastic. She did a good job on my toes and getting my feet to feel closer to normal. At the end of the pedicure, they put some kind of chocolate mud mask on your feet and lower legs. Awesome. Reflexology foot massage - Save your money! It was terrible. It didn't hurt or anything, but at the end of a long day, if I'm getting a foot massage, I want my feet massaged. Paying $15 for 10 minutes of someone to very gently rubbing my feet to the point that I can barely feel it is not worth it. I've have better leg/foot massages from people just giving me a regular spa pedicure. Manicure - Looks good so far. I'm not sure how long it will hold up, but one day in it still looks great. Polish Color Selection: Good, not great. I didn't have any problems finding a color that I wanted, so I have no complaints. They have a good range of colors, just not every single color that has come out in the last two years (which can be overwhelming if you're not sure what kind of color you want to go with). Time - It took about an hour and a half, which I appreciated. It made the whole thing very relaxing (probably because I didn't have somewhere I had to be) and I didn't feel like they were rushing me back out the door.

40.description: Accommodating and friendly. I got a walk-in mani + spa pedi. The spa pedi was thorough and really relaxing. The front desk woman helped me to choose a color and she did a nice job, I'm very happy with the color. The nail technicians were perfectionists. No little spots of polish on my skin to wash off tomorrow. Zero. Perfect.The chairs are comfortable and cute leather armchairs. Not recliners or robo-massage chairs. The ambiance is nice. Not uber-girly, if that makes sense. There's a wooden moose head on the wall. Sort of hipster-girly, like a chic lodge or something. Everything was very clean. They play movies on mute with subtitles on. I saw the last 20 mins of "Some Like It Hot" and the first 30 of "How to Lose Friends and Alienate People," which I thought were good picks. Nice to be at a salon where you feel like they have really good taste. I thought the price was fine for the level of service. My total was $60 before tip.

53.description: The deep cleansing facials are great. Prices are standard, and it's a great way to treat yourself :)

30.description: I got my nails done and eyebrows waxed. Everything was pretty slow (spent about 2 hours there) and my eyebrows were done in a very mediocre way. I don't think I will go back.

46.description: Overall, 4 stars. Great addition to the neighborhood. I have had mani/pedi, waxing and massage . I cut one star because the massage and waxing room could be more private and the manis/pedis require an upgrade and more $ for a massage. The receptionist is wonderful, very welcoming.

1.description: Most of the reviews here are for manicures, but what brought me into Spa Anjou was a Brazilian wax. I had to cancel my appointment at the spa I usually go to get waxed the day before, so the next morning I booked an appointment at Spa Anjou to get a wax just an hour after I called, so availability seems to be great! I have gotten Brazilian waxes many places around the city as I would just go to mostly anywhere that offered a good groupon, so I have had my share of terrible experiences to really great ones, but I would actually say my wax today at Spa Anjou was the best I have ever had. Amy took her time and was very meticulous to completely get everything but did it in a way that was still fast and a lot less painful than most places I have been. She also has a very sweet personality and conversation was very nice the whole time which made the experience much more comfortable.I paid $55 as a first-timer here, but if you get waxed regularly you MUST go here as a regular because if you come back within 40 days, the wax is only $35!!! I booked my next appointment right after for that reason. I'm extremely happy I came into Spa Anjou today.

55.description: I loved this place. I got a yelp coupon and used it with a special. So it was a lot for my dollar. They were very thorough and took their time. People even walked in the door and because they were taking their time, they told them that it would be a while and they couldn't take them. Awesome. Highly recommend it!

9.description: I visited this location on 1/31 for a pedicure and a no chip. The spa was very cute and clean and the staff was very professional. However my no chip started chipping and lifting yesterday (2/3). No chips are supposed to last more than 3 days.

26.description: i went for a no-chip manicure & pedicure.  It was expensive ($90), but I've paid that before so the price wasn't a big issue for me.  PROS:This place is CLEAN. Most nail salons are dirty.  This place isn't. And it's relaxing.  The woman who did my nails was a perfectionist, which is good.CONS:I had the no-chip manicure on Saturday and by Tuesday night, it was chipping.  NOT GOOD.  This was my first time going to this place; however, I've had no-chips at other nail salons and they didn't start chipping until after 2 weeks.  So, I won't be going back.  $40 is too much to pay for something that chips after 3 days.  That's ridiculous.

25.description: Very nice, relaxing environment to get a manicure (the only service I've received here.) My no chip mani was great- the technician was very thorough, attentive and careful. My nails look great and aren't chipping or peeling anywhere, which is the first time I've had a no chip last this long (over a week good as new!) I'll definitely be coming back. (I didn't give 5 stars because my go-to nail salon goes above and beyond when I get a mani/pedi by offering a free neck and shoulder massage while my nails are drying, hot tea/ water with refills, and more personalized service. I didn't experience this here, but was very satisfied overall.)

12.description: This place seems great for mani/pedis. Unfortunately, I had the first layer of skin removed in three rather significant chunks from my upper lip due to a lip wax (photo with patch dimensions posted).I've visited three times for similar services and never had this problem before. I think the aesthetician just left the wax on too long and ended up ripping skin off, too.I called and explained what happened when I notice after getting home, they had me come back in to see what happened. She thought it was because I use acne creams, (no retinoids though) and apologized several times, mentioning that she should have asked before my appointment services began. I've been using acne creams for almost a decade though and have Never had this happen before! These ladies are super sweet, but I think she just left the wax on Way too long, or the temperature was too cold? They did give me my money back, apologized for the incident, and thanked me for coming back in, but I probably won't be coming back.

59.description: I have been here twice. The first time I bought the yelp coupon which was a $75 gift certificate for $50. On that visit I got my eyebrows waxed, pedicure and 30minute massage. The eye brow wax was quick and easy the pedicure was great I love the comfy chairs and style of raised seating over the sinks-very cute. The massage is AMAZING. It prompted me to go back one week later for another one. My only complaint was the nail people don't do any type of nail art. I don't like anything crazy but I like some polka dots. I was able to show the lady what I wanted but if you want anything more exciting you won't get it here. Anyway I really recommend this place especially the massage.

21.description: This place seems great for mani/pedis. Unfortunately, I had the first layer of skin removed in three rather significant chunks from my upper lip due to a lip wax (photo with patch dimensions posted).I've visited three times for similar services and never had this problem before. I think the aesthetician just left the wax on too long and ended up ripping skin off, too.I called and explained what happened when I notice after getting home, they had me come back in to see what happened. She thought it was because I use acne creams, (no retinoids though) and apologized several times, mentioning that she should have asked before my appointment services began. I've been using acne creams for almost a decade though and have Never had this happen before! These ladies are super sweet, but I think she just left the wax on Way too long, or the temperature was too cold? They did give me my money back, apologized for the incident, and thanked me for coming back in, but I probably won't be coming back.

17.description: I didnt get the name of the girl who did my nails but she was a young girl with cute freckles on her face. She was very impersonal with no words, which I didnt really mind but when I asked for wifi password or to take off my cuticles more thoroughly she just answered "ok" and didnt really follow through. I paid $45 for regular mani and pedi and extra $10 for taking off my previous gel polish. After drying my nails I took a good look at my nails and I couldnt believe i just spent 2 hrs sitting there to get such a nasty mani..my cuticles were still intact! but before I could say anything she was out the door. Its the shottiest mani job I've ever paid for and it was not worth spending my $60 or time here. Never coming back.

10.description: Attention to detail on my pedi - and the music adds. Relaxing touch - thank you

5.description: I went to this place this week since it is in my moms building and was convenient. I needed a mani. I hadn't been to this place in a year and thought I'd give it a try. There are about 4 mani/pedi places within a 2 block radius. Bad move.Come to find out there is a reason this place is always empty - one of the manicurists was so rude!! I was waiting in the waiting area and had a couple of bags - the woman called across the room and flagged me over (I think her name was Kelly)  no help getting there from her. Then on my way there I dropped a polish since my hands were full. She scoffed and reminded me to pick it up once I sat down. No offer of tea or water - she did not introduce herself or even smile. Then, she asked if I wanted my nails short or long - I told her before I decided I wanted to see the colors. She curtly stated "I asked you if you wanted them short or long." At that point I said, "that's it, I want another nail tech or I'm leaving." At this point she finally looked at me and said "fine, whatever." Someone else did my nails - unremarkable.When I left I complained to the receptionist. As I walked by the place when I left the woman was looking at me and laughing. Wow.Also, when I paid cash. I gave $25 for a 20$ bill. I expected to be brought back 5 singles. The manicurist kept all. I'm a good tipper - I did find that a bit presumptuous.Never going here again - just walk up the block to pure rain like usual. Good luck with bad service Spa Anjou - you'll need it.

3.description: When I walked in and saw a dog I should have seen that as a sign.  I could smell the dog too, gross.  I'm animal friendly but this is a spa like environment, I was so excited about my mani and pedi but now I'm just so disappointed.I won't be back.  There wasn't an Introduction of my technician, I have no idea what her name was.  She spoke in her language throughout my whole pedicure to the technician next to her.  In America this is considered an insult.  The girl to who she spoke kept looking at me.  This made me feel very uncomfortable.  She massaged my first leg for about 1 minute and I got a 30 second foot rub on the other, I guess she got bored.  I work hard and want to feel pampered.  I'm in the service industry too, I recommend this place put forth some better etiquette, however I doubt my technician even cares.  I felt rushed.  Onto my manicure.  I requested bond aid for my nails and she said they didn't have it.  So I spotted it on the nail table and I pointed it out.  She then got very nervous.   I wasn't given a hand massage either.  She didn't  even offer.  I called her out on it and she offered, but by this point I just wanted to get away from this girl and her bad energy.  What the heck?  I will never come back here.  What a shame because I live across the street.  I will visit Pure Rain down the street from now on, they are a little further down but they are very professional and friendly.  They also offer nail specials, I always add extra gratuity when they do so.  My mani and pedi took "what's her name," only one hour and I felt like it should have been priced at $25.  I paid $45 and a 10% tip added onto that.  WOOF!

35.description: I had my first experience with massage with Spa Anjou. The overall experience was great! My friend and I went in at 7 for a pedicure and half hour massage each. In total it required 1.5 hour.  Even though they close at 8, they still welcomed us. The service was great and I loved the massage. The only reason that I did not give a five star was because I felt like the pedicure was expensive, $40. I have received bother manicure and pedicure for $40 at other locations. Plus, the owner has a cute dog, maybe if you go by close time, you can play with the dog too! :D

19.description: Very nice, relaxing environment to get a manicure (the only service I've received here.) My no chip mani was great- the technician was very thorough, attentive and careful. My nails look great and aren't chipping or peeling anywhere, which is the first time I've had a no chip last this long (over a week good as new!) I'll definitely be coming back. (I didn't give 5 stars because my go-to nail salon goes above and beyond when I get a mani/pedi by offering a free neck and shoulder massage while my nails are drying, hot tea/ water with refills, and more personalized service. I didn't experience this here, but was very satisfied overall.)

28.description: Amy is excellent.  She is my go-to when I'm back in Chicago.

45.description: The decor is modern but still inviting. They also have the softest chairs for when you get a mani. There are a couple of TVs around the store, as wells as magazines on the coffee table to keep you entertained. Prices are reasonable - $40 for no-chip/gel mani that lasts. I am pretty pleased with the results. The girl who did my nails wasn't chatty and got right to business. There were so many steps that I don't even remember, but that must be a good thing right? Clip, file, wipe, file more, cut cuticles, lotion...etc. rinse and repeat. Very detail-oriented and careful. In fact, my nails are still holding up 2 weeks later. Although there are tiny chips, it's in good shape considering how often I wash my hands. (see the 0 weeks and 2 weeks picture below)

33.description: I had an amazing time at this spa today! Everyone is super friendly and the space is comfortable and clean! I had a facial with Amy who took her time with me and provided me with both a relaxing and enjoyable facial as well as a very thorough treatment. She really cared about providing a great service! I will be back in a month.

43.description: I have received waxing in multiple places. I travel far if I have to, and I never try to skimp on waxing as I like to make sure I am receiving a safe, hygienic and skillful service! Finally, I've found the right place. Amy is absolutely trustworthy and she is highly knowledgable on what she does. Waxing is done very quickly and painlessly! I love visiting Anjou, it is always a nice stress reliever. I look forward to my next visit! (..which I hope will be tomorrow if I can book an appointment in the morning. My nails are looking freaky from this horrendous weather, aahhhh)

2.description: I visited this nail salon first for a brow wax. Amy did a great job! The following day, a pedicure and gel nails. They did a good job but the service is very basic. The staff is friendly and the establishment is very clean but it's a bit over priced. Usually anywhere else I've visited through out the U.S, 65-75 dollars with tip gives me a gel set and pedicure. This includes (hot towels for your legs, callus removal and lotion). Gel nails included detail cortical removal and nail shaping once the gel is applied.This is a nice place but the service doesn't match the price.

18.description: Didn't want to give me service that I was requesting for even though I got there 1hour and 10 minutes before they were closing.

41.description: Very clean and sanitary.  Cute touches here and there and fun movies playing.  Technicians are friendly and do a good job.  Spa Anjou is a little too pricey for me visit frequently though.  Color selection is somewhat limited.

52.description: Solid ($12) eyebrow waxing here. Not the best but solid.  Nice small, spa so I'd love to go back and try more services.

50.description: I love this place. It is rare to get ambiance, relaxation, customer service and quality service all in one place for fair and moderate prices at one location. Usually you have to give  up  at least one of these attributes.  Normally I do not consider smaller businesses as a "Spa". But Spa Anjou has changed my mind and re-educated me on the definition of the "Spa experience" . Call me snobbish if you want to, but this place is magnificent, and the staff cannot be more warm and nice upon your entry.  The young lady that works at the desk could not be nicer when telling that that were all booked up for when I wanted  have my No Chip manicure.   That is finesse as I was given an appt 30 minutes later.  It is relaxing, clean, inviting, and the best no chip removal and application that I have experienced. I will be back this week!

4.description: I alway feel so relaxed when I'm here.  I love being pampered. The ladies here always seem so attentive. Which is a plus.

6.description: I had a wonderful experience here. I must say my manicure looks great and the my manicurist was fantastic. I truly felt like I was at the spa and felt relaxed. They have low key music playing and its so quiet, no loud talking or anything. I can't wait to return to this place.

22.description: More like an upgraded nail salon than a spa. But this place is nice. Clean, tasteful décor and movies on silent with subtitles if you forgot your book. No massage chairs for pedicures but they have clean supplies and did a great job on spa mani-pedi. The woman was so patient while I figured out color combo I wanted to get (pre-wedding jitters). I could have used more massaging of the feet and arms, but maybe I'm spoiled by the west coast/Cali. I also got a facial and they did all sorts of nice things to my skin. Again, more neck and scalp massage would have been nice, but that was not specified in description so I can't be mad.  I was worried that I was breaking out a bit after but by the next day I was hydrated and glowing for my wedding!

15.description: This humble nail place has great prices and a slightly old hollywood vibe.  A standard manicure is only $15, but the work is great.  They have a great selection of colors including the newest rollouts from Essie and OPI.   I love that you can see the sanitizing machines too!  No tools will be dropped on the floor and re-picked up here.There is a bit of a language barrier with the manicurists and my nails were cut too short for my liking, but I'd go back again.  Nice little salon in Printer's Row hood.

57.description: Good Place, Ambiance is good. Freindly Staff.Facial consultant was good, looked at my skin and suggested a good facial , for 1 hour good hour clean up,applying all good products, well massaged & loved it.During and after facial I felt a looooooot of difference, feels like HEAVEN.

20.description: Never been to a nail salon where they don't soak your fingers for a manicure. Very strange. She didn't do a very good job. Hardly trimmed the cuticles. Kept talking in Japanese with coworker the whole time. Pedicure was better. Never going back. I do like how they have the pedicure station set up though makes for a sanitary clean up in stainless bowl. $45 for mani pedi. I've gotten much better service for the money.

36.description: Received a gift certificate and had a really nice facial with Amy. At $85 for a deep pore cleanse, peel and resurfacing, plus an arm massage, it felt like a great deal. Relaxing atmosphere that is different than most nail salons. I will definitely be back often.

14.description: This is such a cute place and so close to my apartment I was hoping the Brazilian waxing would be better. She was so friendly but I think that the entire top layer of my skin was waxed off. One of the most painful experiences ever. I went 2 times to see if the first time was a fluke, but it wasn't. I will not return for a wax, but will for other services!

29.description: This place is all over the board - some days the 'cue is dandy, other days, just so-so. And there's no consistency with the "bbq delivery systems" - I've had my pulled pork sandwich arrive on pretzel rolls, sub sandwich rolls and even a sesame seed hamburger roll. Folks, plain white bread would be just fine.Recently, I managed to score one of the best pulled-pork sandwich I've had since moving from North Cakalacky! Juicy, tender, with a subtle smoke ring. And while I usually prefer eastern North Carolina 'cue - historically a vinegar-based pepper sauce- this was topped with a somewhat sweet tomato-based barbecue sauce that packs a smattering of heat. On my last visit, the meat came piled atop a huge pretzel roll - total overkill.The pulled-chicken sandwich is also pretty good, and the full rack of ribs ($20) was the size of an infant. I've never had an issue with the speed of the service and the crew behind the counter appears friendly enough.

42.description: Mac and cheese lacks flavor! It's almost like eating plain noodles, though you can smell nutmeg or some other similar spice. It's clear they attempted to layer the flavor, but fell short. The pulled chicken sandwich was actually quite tasty. The chicken was a bit dry, but overall it had a nice smoky flavor and the sauce was very rich and flavorful and nice accompaniment to go on a pretzel bun. Having lived in the south, it's not reminiscent of any of those little hole in the wall bbq joints, but a nice try for a big city. If in a pinch and super hungry, I might try the sandwich again. However, never again will I do that terrible Mac and cheese.

23.description: Meh.  $16 and change for a meal that was less tasty than a fast food value meal. 1) The pulled pork sandwich was dry.  There was bbq sauce on the bread but the pulled pieces of pork were very dry and bland without the sauce2) The gumbo had the consistency of chicken noodle soup.  In this case, looks were NOT deceiving; The gumbo tasted like chicken noodle soup with sausage substituted for noodles.3) Lastly, the mac and cheese was also a bust.  The cheese sauce was tasty but it didn't stick to the flavorless macaroni pasta very well.

47.description: Was wondering what was going to replace Pockets after it closed at the end of the year.  What a surprise - Tasty BBQ!  I work in the area and had lunch there the other day.  The menu is small but covers the 4 major BBQ food groups (ribs, brisket, pulled chicken and pulled pork) and offers a few salads and sides.  I think the brisket is the best barometer for the quality of a BBQ joint and Porkchop really delivers with theirs.  Brisket was moist with a solid flavor ring and smokiness.  The ribs were meaty, fell off the bone and had a solid rub.  Lightly sauced with house BBQ, which I found to have a good balance of sugar and spice.  I tried my brother's smoked chicken wings, which were decent (note I am not a wing fan).  I'm glad to have a BBQ option in the south loop and will definitely go back to try the pulled chicken, salads and sides.  Pricing is reasonable and consistent with the area.

8.description: Meh.  $16 and change for a meal that was less tasty than a fast food value meal. 1) The pulled pork sandwich was dry.  There was bbq sauce on the bread but the pulled pieces of pork were very dry and bland without the sauce2) The gumbo had the consistency of chicken noodle soup.  In this case, looks were NOT deceiving; The gumbo tasted like chicken noodle soup with sausage substituted for noodles.3) Lastly, the mac and cheese was also a bust.  The cheese sauce was tasty but it didn't stick to the flavorless macaroni pasta very well.

31.description: LOVE this little place. I've tried the pulled pork sandwich and the BBQ chicken salad. Both are fantastic. Ironically, I gave up eating meat last August, then got cancer in February. During chemo, I was encouraged to eat whatever I had an appetite for. So I began eating meat again. In July, I finished chemo and am having a hard time giving up meat again. And Porkchop isnt helping!

34.description: After losing Pockets I was happy to see they didn't wait long before finding something to fill the void, and Porkchhop did the trick! I had the Beef brisket on a Pretzel bun, and it was better than I expected . The brisket was tender the sauce had a delicious spicy yet  tangy taste. This place has a real scaled down menu compared to it's other stores, I was kind of disappointed at first  they didn't offer fries as a side dish, and the price of the sandwich was little expensive to not include anything with it but a pickle but after tasting the sandwich I decided it was worth it. I will definitely be back to try those ribs.

16.description: This place is all over the board - some days the 'cue is dandy, other days, just so-so. And there's no consistency with the "bbq delivery systems" - I've had my pulled pork sandwich arrive on pretzel rolls, sub sandwich rolls and even a sesame seed hamburger roll. Folks, plain white bread would be just fine.Recently, I managed to score one of the best pulled-pork sandwich I've had since moving from North Cakalacky! Juicy, tender, with a subtle smoke ring. And while I usually prefer eastern North Carolina 'cue - historically a vinegar-based pepper sauce- this was topped with a somewhat sweet tomato-based barbecue sauce that packs a smattering of heat. On my last visit, the meat came piled atop a huge pretzel roll - total overkill.The pulled-chicken sandwich is also pretty good, and the full rack of ribs ($20) was the size of an infant. I've never had an issue with the speed of the service and the crew behind the counter appears friendly enough.

13.description: Seriously the worst BBQ I've ever had. Go to one of their other locations if you can.Food seems to get trucked in from another location - the brisket I had was simply reheated in the old Pockets calzone oven, rather than smoked on-site. Brisket was tough, and flavorless. Coke machine was also busted.I've gone to their location on Randolph, and had a great experience. The food tasted great, and actually appeared to be smoked on site.Of course, it'd be rather difficult to get a smoker into a small space, especially in the Printers Row neighborhood... but with that being the case, why even open a barbecue joint in the area?Great idea, just poorly executed.

11.description: I've tried both the Adams/State and Dearborn/Harrison location twice. All 4 times I was disappointed for a variety of reasons. Both neighborhood locations are in desperate need of a quick and affordable bbq place that has good food. The bbq is average at best. All the sauce in the world won't make dried out meat moist. When a staff member walks out of the bathroom and see's you standing in line to place an order, it's probably best to hang up your phone call. Literally, the person stayed on their phone while I placed my order, why she made the order, and then the entire time it took me to eat my food. I just can't conceive a scenario that this would constitute good service and a welcoming envrionment. I've tried the brisket, rib tips, pulled chicken, mac & cheese, and the fries. All were very bland at best. Until they can address the food issues, as well as the service issues, I'll not be returning.

39.description: Our order was take away, we had a good feeling about the service over the phone. The food was tasty. We had the brisket sandwich and the ribs. The one disappointing note is that for a BBQ place you cannot order in large quantities. We wanted to have a couple of meat items to accompany some side dishes previously cook at home and did not necessarily wanted to buy a sandwich but an order of brisket.

37.description: I am still trying to figure out how this place is called pork chop with NO pork shops on the menu.

0.description: Excellent beef brisket! Very nice mac and cheese. The bread like "Texas toast" used for the sandwich was lightly toasted and good. The bbq sauce was a little smoky and a little spicy which is a very good combo.Rahsaan did a great job preparing and serving my meal too. I will be back.Don't tell too many people but there is parking available on Plymouth CT.

38.description: Although not typically yelp reviewers, this place has frustrated us both times we've been. Poor service, strange environment, less than quality, cold food, and expensive. Completely unimpressed.

51.description: Oh my, what awful barbecue. Gave this place two tries. Had the brisket and pulled chicken sandwiches. Both had been in the smoker too long and were dry. The brisket was sliced too thick and served on Texas toast. The chicken was on a sub roll but could not be picked up because the bottom was a soggy mess, like an Italian beef. Extra sauce did not help, because that was lousy too. Way too hot. So save your money and suck on a burnt match dipped in hot sauce and you'll have the same experience.

27.description: Pulled chicken sandwich was a bit spicy. I fell in love with the Mac and cheese tho! I would go back specifically for just did that. Saw this place from my hotel room and checked out the site, I was disappointed when I looked at the menu and went over there with the know of what I wanted and they didn't have it. But girl behind the counter was super nice! So for the Mac and cheese and staff I give 3 stars!

32.description: Sucks.Bbq chicken was horribly drySalad had a lot of pretty mashed up greensAt least they used a pretzel roll.Tortilla chips, stale.

48.description: So far we have a trifecta of "one star". We did take out from this Porkchop on Saturday evening, and I'm hurrying to write this review since this place won't be around long. We actually wanted to try the ribs, but at 7:00pm they had been erased from the board. They were sitting there, but apparently the salamander had been turned off for the evening, or was broken or the generally clueless help just didn't care, so no ribs for us. Instead we picked up the pulled chicken, which was overcooked and dry as dust. This was served on a sub roll and had some so-so BBQ sauce sort of thrown on it with the chicken then plopped for in the middle. It was only saved by a liberal dose of our own BBQ sauce at home. We also got the mac and cheese as sides. To call this gooey mess "library paste" would be doing a disservice to the library world. Just horrible, no discernible cheese taste, the mac was overcooked to a total mush and the entire thing just blended into one mass. All this cost $24!!! Avoid this place at all costs. Any upside? Well, the dog loved the mac and cheese.

44.description: really good ribs and spinach salad.  fast service and good location.  the rub in the ribs was very tasty and I enjoyed the sauce.  it!

24.description: Came here for a quick lunch on a Sat.  The one person who was working was incredibly nice and helpful.  I tried the brisket sandwich (which is served on texas-style toast) and it was solid.  Not the best BBQ I've had in the city, but was just fine in a pinch. The restaurant itself was fine... a little dirty, but about par for upscale fast-food establishments.  I'm happy I tried Porkchop out, but I'll continue to explore other places before I come back.

7.description: Don't go here unless you 1. like spicy hot BBQ and 2. have all the time in the world. I've never been to a BBQ place that did not give you a choice of sauce. I like a mild, sweet sauce. What I got is still burning my mouth after one bite so I'll be throwing out the pulled pork sandwich I bought. Also, the place is staffed by ONE person and the wait was so long as she filled orders one by one that I had to just give up. The sandwich was ready but I couldn't keep waiting for the side of mac n' cheese which I would expect not to require preparation time. Too bad, maybe I would have gotten something decent to eat if I'd left with the mac n' cheese instead of the pulled pork.I felt so bad for the girl stuck in such a horrible job all by herself that I put the refund she gave me for the mac n' cheese into a fishbowl on the counter. So, a total of $11 completely wasted and I have no dinner, here at a client's late.Also, there's no porkchop on the menu. Go figure.

49.description: I wish I could give zero stars.  First of all this place is in the old Pockets space and that came into play during my experience.  I ordered the pulled pork sandwich and mac.  The worst pulled pork I ever had!  It was so hot, you could barely pick it up and when I did the hot dog bun (seriously!) it comes on fell apart from the steam.  The sauce?  What sauce!  There was no seasoning on the pork, not even salt.   When I asked the girl how they cook the pork she points to the old calzone oven from Pockets and said, "We smoke it."  Come on!! The only smoking going on is what ever she does on her break!  There is no way this pork was smoked, no bark, no smoke ring.  There was also no evidence that cooking of any kind is occurring at this location.The mac was ridiculous!  It made Kraft look like a Michelin winner!  I was so excited for this place as a south looper.  Do us a favor Porkchop, don't ship your leftover, dried out scraps from your Randolph location so they can be reheated in warming pans and pass that off as bbq,  With all of the amazing bbq in this city, this place is a shame!  Run, run away!!

40.description: Stopped in for lunch today and ordered the pulled chicken sandwich.  I wish I had eaten there so that i could have taken it back.  It was really dry and had way too much pepper.  The sauce was okay but couldn't compensate for the dry chicken.  Also a little disappointed that it didn't come with any sides, just a pickle.  They do offer sides but they are $3 extra and looked pretty large, more than what I wanted as a side.  Overall, it was pretty disappointing and I don't think that I will be back.

30.description: Decent food, but I swear this location is cursed with bad service. I ordered a salad with no onions and chicken and it came with no chicken and onions. They just picked the onions out of the salad.

46.description: I'm glad I went before checking reviews because I might have stayed away and missed out. Porkchop needs to improve the restaurant flow and operations to be smoother, I will chalk this up to just opening... However the lunch I had was very good. The ribs were flavorful with a good balance of being very tender towards the center with a little chew at the rib tips. They came with the right amount of BBQ sauce on top, not soaked, so you could enjoy the meat and not taste only sauce. I also tried the chicken wings. They were smoked wings (not fried) that were in a tamer buffalo sauce. The tame sauce let you taste the smokiness of the chicken without overwhelming the meat and next time I may just get sauce on the side to enjoy it more.

1.description: 5 stars for flavor of food. I got the chicken sausage gumbo and the flavor is out of this world amazing!!! There is a good spice to it! I also got the pulled pork sandwich on a pretzel bun, also delicious, be cautious, the BBQ sauce is spicy!! Service gets 2 1/2-3 stars. We walked in at 11:30am, it was empty, the girl was on a personal call and didn't greet us. She was the only employee working, taking orders and prepping our food. They were also out of mac n cheese, but clearly we were the first customers, so they didn't make it. The soda machine was out of order and you dont get chips or anything but a pickle with your sandwich.I will go back again, and hopefully they have mac n cheese.

9.description: Where to begin.... I live down the street from this location and have wanted to try it for a while now. My vegetarian wife was out for the night so I decided to give it a try. Boy was I disappointed... The rib tips were mainly burnt and dry and my chicken wings were room temperature and dryyyy, which is strange because I saw her take them out of the oven and I live about 400 feet away so I can't blame travel nor being late to pick them up. It's disappointing because they had good flavor they were just cooked poorly. Despite the potential, I just spent $30 for bbq for dry meat so I don't think I'll be taking a chance on Porkchop again. Save yourself the trouble and walk 200 feet to First Draft on Clark. They at least know how to make wings.

26.description: Not very good experience. -Food doesn't taste that good. People here are very nice. They started to provide discount to students.

25.description: Mehhhh. Unfortunately, not impressed. The cornbread was not very fresh...the mac and cheese was nothing to write home about....and the pulled pork sandwich was doused in BBQ sauce...probably because the pork itself had no flavor. Disappointing, as we can always use good new restaurants in the neighborhood.

12.description: Wasn't feeling too well today so wasn't really interested in cooking or trying new foods.  My son came by and ordered delivery for me.  But Hey!  Rib-Tips!  This was a very pleasant surprise, although I wasn't able to eat much. The servings are gi-normous and food arrived piping hot!  Great sauce! Great flavors to meat which was succulent and tender.  Will have to eat all week for leftovers.  Baked beans were okay with nice chunks of meat in them.

21.description: Great pulled (breast meat) chicken on a fabulous bun. Good beans and slaw. Fast and friendly service. I look forward to going back and trying more.

17.description: Came here for a quick lunch on a Sat.  The one person who was working was incredibly nice and helpful.  I tried the brisket sandwich (which is served on texas-style toast) and it was solid.  Not the best BBQ I've had in the city, but was just fine in a pinch. The restaurant itself was fine... a little dirty, but about par for upscale fast-food establishments.  I'm happy I tried Porkchop out, but I'll continue to explore other places before I come back.

10.description: Wow! This was spectacular BBQ! I stopped in on my way home Saturday night and will definitely be going back.The rib tips fell off the bone, the sauce was vinegar based with pleasant sweetness and the spinach and bacon salad was a great compliment. The salad had oranges, pecans, cherry tomatoes and tangy red onion. Fresh and crispy like I'd make at home.Thanks Porkchop for the perfect food to eat while watching the Bears lose!

5.description: Rib tips are on point! I've ordered from the Yelp app several times, but I always have to wait for my food, even when I arrive for pickup in the allotted time frame.

3.description: When the heck is it open? I came by at 11:20 and it still wasn't open for lunch? Didn't have posted hours on the door.

35.description: Finally Yelp has added an entry for this location.  I was super excited to see this place open in my neighborhood and was looking forward to trying it out.  Unfortunately I was shocked at how bad it was.  I went in and ordered a half slab for take out.  I got home and the ribs were cold (I live right down the street); un-f'inbelievable!  I was starving and didn't want to have to walk back to return it, so I ended up just eating it. It's obvious that this place just serves up pre-cooked food from their other location and simply reheats the meat when you place your order.  That would explain the other bad reviews about dry meat.  What is the owner thinking?!  They might as well pack up and close shop now, because it's not going to last long if they think they can survive by serving re-heated food and charge the prices that they do!

19.description: Meat was good sauce was clearly ketchup based. WAY to expensive for what you get $11 for a sandwich & soda (fountain was broke) no sides! This is clearly a chain trying to cash in on bbq fad and doing a poor job. No ambiance ok food and decent service I expect Smoque level quality! My choice was this or the sub chain across the st. I wish I went there!

28.description: Very tasty. Best BBQ in the vicinity. Love their pulled chicken and brisket. Try their Mac & cheese.

45.description: PorkChop provides a decent pulled pork sandwich, but not for $9.  This location had a single person yesterday, so she was acting as cashier/manager/cook/etc.  The sandwich was fine, but without any beer/bar or atmosphere, I doubt I'll be back.  I will say the gal was very pleasant and it's probably worth trying if you live in the neighborhood, but it's nothing special and I'd predict they close this location within a year.

33.description: I don't get how many reviewers gave this place such low ratings.  I've always been a fan of Pork Chop Randolph location and this sandwich spot does a decent job.  The Beef Brisket sandwich I ordered was huge, tender and it had a great tangy BBQ sauce.  The Mac and Cheese was a bit bland, needs more flavor but the portion was almost too big. The counter lady was polite and she worked fast which is an important part of Fast Food for me.  I deducted one star because of the price. Sandwich, side and a bottle of Coke is $15, this may cause me to go somewhere else if money is tight for me, but the good service I received and the filling meal I ate will make me a repeat customer. The reviewers who gave this place 1 star are a bit harsh in my opinion.

43.description: Had the FAT ELVIS sandwich on a limb, and I am SO glad I did!  Awesomely delicious sums it up for the sandwich and my experience here was great as well.  Very friendly customer service and helpful too, the girl gave me an industry card.  FOLLOW UP: I had them cater my son's birthday this past weekend, and it was equally delicious.  BEST BBQ IN THE CITY!

2.description: Really quick and easy service and a very nice staff. Definitely somewhere to go to split a meal or get some good BBQ in the city. Shared Riblets and sweet potato fries with someone and it was delicious. That BBQ sauce is delicious and the portion sizes are definitely generous.The table was a little sticky and the space is small but the food makes up for it.Also, a pretty sweet selection of soda/pop with a few novelty bottles that add to the experience.Definitely get the BBQ!

18.description: Mehhhh. Unfortunately, not impressed. The cornbread was not very fresh...the mac and cheese was nothing to write home about....and the pulled pork sandwich was doused in BBQ sauce...probably because the pork itself had no flavor. Disappointing, as we can always use good new restaurants in the neighborhood.

41.description: After posting my review a few weeks ago, it came to my attention that I had reviewed the incorrect location. In the spirit of accuracy, I am attempting to recreate my previous review from memory. I visited the Printer's Row Porkchop location during the June 2014 Printer's Row Lit Fest. Not wanting to brave the usual suspects - Potbelly or Subway- I saw the sign for this outpost of Porkchop as I was crossing Dearborn.  I must have timed it right, as there was just one person ahead of me in line when I walked in. By the time I had finished my lunch, the crowd had picked up considerably. After studying the menu, I decided to keep it simple with a brisket sandwich. I noticed that chips were on offer, but none of the sides appealed, so I stuck with the sandwich. The brisket itself was delicious- tender and not fatty/gristly in the least. The sauce was solid, though I would have liked to be able to customize my sandwich with other types of sauce, possibly via squeeze bottles of the stuff set out on counters. I don't know if this is how things are run at the other locations, but I did not seem to see any free-range sauces here - even hot sauce. I had never had brisket served on a pretzel bun before - methinks it might be BBQ with a hipster twist - but I found the quality of the bread fairly tasty, if unexpected. The service was efficient, and pleasant, getting me in and out in good time for the afternoon's slate of Lit Fest events. I hope to branch out and try other BBQ places around the city, but am glad to know that this place exists next time I am in the area and in the mood for BBQ.

50.description: This was some of the worst food that I have ever eaten, although I say eaten very lightly, since I after the first bite or two, I basically just choked it down because I was hungry.I can't decide where to start with how bad this food was.  I ordered the pulled pork and Mac and Cheese.  The pork was awful.  There was no evidence of the pork being smoked.  No rings or no color.  There was no evidence of seasoning at all.  No bark, no flavor.  The sauce was awful and basically, non existent.  There were no options of sauces either.  Just some flavorless, poor attempt at a vinegar based sauce.  It was the driest pork sandwich that I had ever attempted to eat.  I don't know how long ago the meat was cooked, but it was obvious it was reheated and served.The Mac and cheese was equally bad.  It was a combination of noodles and some awful cheese, that's it.  No seasoning at all.  It had the appearance of a plate of nachos that you whip together late at night when you have nothing else in your fridge but cheese and chips.PLEASE DO NOT GO THERE!!  The south loop deserves much better.  I don't see how people can call this BBQ.

4.description: Wow the food was to die for delicious. I was impressed. I was referred to this place by a coworker  and the food knocked my boots off. My biggest complaint had to be the line and the wait for foods. By the time I ordered and got my food my lunch break was almost over so I definitely recommend ordering ahead of time. The girl who takes your order is very nice and personable, but more importantly the food is amazing. I had the Po boy sandwich and it was amazing. The shrimp were perfectly cooked and the fries and coleslaw made great sides. I kinda wish they would have taken the tails off of the shrimp. Other than that I do recommend giving them a try it is really worth the wait!

6.description: Oh boy, where do I even begin. I tried this place a few years ago at a Yelp Elite Event and it was soo good! I travel downtown for work sometimes and have been meaning to stop in to give them a try at their actual restaurant. When I first walked in at lunch time (Downtown) - the place was deserted with one other guy who looks like he had been waiting a while. That wasn't a good sign, but I was already in and didn't want to leave. When you first walk in - all I smelled was a strong smell of cleaning solution which I can't stand in restaurants. You should smell food, not cleaning solution! Also, the place looks like they made an effort in making it trendy, but it still gives off a very dingy vibe. It's dark and the lighting is awful. It would not be a place where I would want to eat for lunch. You want to get away from the fluorescent lighting in the office - not to go to another fluorescent room! Oh and there was only one lady at the counter who was moving super slow. While I was waiting for my food - another worker came in (looks like she was late). The late girl asked the other girl if she needed any help, she said no and the girl went to go sit down at one of the dining tables playing on her phone!!! WTH! The menu was not that big at all. All the pulled pork sandwiches came on a pretzel bun which I do not like, so I ended up getting the pulled chicken because it was the only one that came with a regular bun. I'm not the type to change the Chef's recipe unless I absolutely hate an ingredient. After waiting a while (I actually got my food before the guy who had looked like he'd been waiting a while!) - I took my food elsewhere. First, my sandwich came on a pretzel bun! The chicken was dry and it didn't even look marinated. The girl had just squirted some BBQ sauce on top of the chicken! Not the way I had it at the Yelp Elite Event. BBQ tasted good, but it was not mixed in well with the chicken. It gets worse -  the sandwich had a hint of the cleaning solution taste to it. I ended up throwing half the sandwich away it was that bad. Needless to say, I will not be back. Very disappointed!

22.description: I've generally had good experiences with Porkchop's sandwiches.  They are tasty, and the one time I had an issue with an order, they were very quick to rectify it.  The resolution to that issue is why this is a 3 star review, and not a 2 star.My main beef with this restaurant is price, at least relative to the business model.  At $9+ (after tax) for a medium-sized sandwich, Porkchop Express would generally not be in the average Chicagoan's wheelhouse for a lunch spot.   And clearly that is what they are going for at this "express" location.   And $20 for a slab of ribs at a non-sit-down restaurant?  Nuh-uh.  They are good, but not that good....So my piece of advice to the owners is this:  throw something in with the sandwich!  Take your cheapest-to-produce side dish and include it.  There are very few, if any, successful fast food lunch spots in the Loop where $9 wouldn't at least get you a drink and/or a bag of chips (usually both!) with your order. Again, love the food, but when I do the math, my wallet usually guides me to another spot for my mid-day grub.

15.description: Not very good experience. -Food doesn't taste that good. People here are very nice. They started to provide discount to students.

20.description: Seriously the worst BBQ I've ever had. Go to one of their other locations if you can.Food seems to get trucked in from another location - the brisket I had was simply reheated in the old Pockets calzone oven, rather than smoked on-site. Brisket was tough, and flavorless. Coke machine was also busted.I've gone to their location on Randolph, and had a great experience. The food tasted great, and actually appeared to be smoked on site.Of course, it'd be rather difficult to get a smoker into a small space, especially in the Printers Row neighborhood... but with that being the case, why even open a barbecue joint in the area?Great idea, just poorly executed.
