36.description: The brisket was literally the FIRST brisket I chose not to finish.  When I say this, I feel the need to qualify: if it is dry, I will finish; if it's been sitting in my fridge for a week, I will finish it; if someone approaches me after I've eating a large pizza and offers the leftovers they found on a seat on the 29 after closing time, I will STILL finish it.This brisket had no smoke ring and was basically steamed without seasoning. Quite simply terrible. Imagine really bad barbecoa.My bud pushed away his chicken because it was stringy and excessively dry.Buns were steamy and mushy.Sides utterly forgettable. When  we ordered, the service was only slightly friendly and looked sort of bewildered, like kind of surprised they were even working at a BBQ place at all, that look that responds to my order of a brisket sandwich that says "wait let me check if we can... yeah... wow... yeah .... we can totally throw one of those together for you. how 'bout that!" In short, under-trained, under-versed and not BBQ people.I am tempted to be more brutal because it takes a certain level of audacity to open a BBQ when the BBQ is not good enough to serve at a home party let alone a professional establishment.  I felt cheated, swindled even.

14.description: The place was dead quiet at 12:45 on a Friday afternoon... Should have taken that as ominous sign number 1. When I walked in, there was a gentleman cleaning up the trash can and getting the garbage out of the bin. Honestly thought he was the janitor. He went about his way and I sat there for a minute or two as he did so expecting someone to come from the back and help me. Nope. The mistaken janitor was the lone man working the joint. He did wash his hands before handling food or anything else. So props for that as I have seen people not be as diligent...I got the Brisket Sandwich, a side of baked beans and a bottle of soda all for takeaway. As has been said in a previous review, it appears that this is all brought in from somewhere and heated up on site. That's not a worry for me; as long as it's hot and tasty. The sandwich was; albeit loaded with fatty pieces. Normally in a sandwich or platter, the fat isn't as prevalent. I would call it 70% meat, 30% fat on my sandwich. But tasty, allow me to reiterate that. The beans on the other hand, a bit cold, albeit tasty.I think it's a bit pricy for what you get and it seems to be a poor interpretation of what they hoped it could be. It's almost like a skeleton of what the potential of this place is. All places deserve a second chance and this one will get that as well.

3.description: I'm here all the time because they're open late and I never have food at home.  Luckily for them they're the only fast place open in the area that late.  Props for convenience, but don't expect anything special.Also, I think I'm putting the owner's kids through college.

1.description: I would give it ZERO stars if I could. I will never ever go back to this location. We showed up at 10:55am and ordered a breakfast sandwich. The girl behind the counter was rude and very short. She stayed they didn't sell breakfast after 11. But it wasn't even 11 yet. AWFUL service, dirty restaurant, and disrespectful worker.

2.description: The woman behind the counter put her finger in my tuna to spread it across the bread instead of using utensils and then was moving so fast trying to anticipate what I wanted that she put wrong things on and wouldn't redo it.

5.description: This Subway sandwich recently opened and the service and sandwiches are great! Everything here is new and clean. The ingredients are fresh and the staff is friendly and helpful.  $5 foot long sandwiches for any sandwich listed on the menu!! Their double chocolate chip cookies are chewy and delicious too! My new favorite place! A better deal than Potbelly's for sure!

6.description: This location did not honor the any regular sub in October promotion. I ordered a subway club, and they told me that they were only honoring the promotion for three subs.

0.description: "Sub" way... I emphasize "Sub" since this is supposed to be what they're known for.  However, you can tell by the end of the day that the bread is not as fresh as other locations.Other than that, it's your standard Subway, specializing in Subs, salads, wraps, soups, cookies, etc.

4.description: I love Subway but unfortunately, my last two trips have been disappointing. The first trip resulted in hard, OLD bread and nasty roasted chicken (that was my husband's sandwich). On trip two, my bread was hard as a rock. I couldn't even bite into it, transferring the inner parts of the sammie to my own bread when I got home. :( Think I'll take my business up a bloock to Potbelly.

1.description: This is my local bookstore around the corner from me. I can't say I have always been fair to them and tried to buy local, so yesterday I was in need of some new reading materials and I decided to go to Sandmeyer. I walk in and an older man was at the desk. He did not greet me. I asked for help with a book. He got it for me but did not engage in any conversation with me. I paid for my books and I got a paltry "thanks".If you want locals to get up and come to your store when Amazon will deliver a book to my door in an hour maybe you should try a little harder to be nice and engaging.

9.description: Great local, old school bookstore with classic wood floors and good variety for such a small space.

10.description: This is such a great bookstore. Lovely, quaint, and tucked away in a little section of the South Loop. They have excellent taste in books, all of which fall under a huge range and are very well organized on the shelves. Never have I been in here and not had my questions adequately answered, ranging from "where is... [insert name of a book]?" to "do you have anything on... [insert subject]?" to "Please help. I need something and I don't know what to get." The one and only issue I have with this place is slight, which is that the books are a little more expensive than you would find elsewhere. The reasons for this are obvious: rent in the Loop must be rather high, and it is an independent bookstore after all. Still, if you can, try not to let that deter you. This place is really wonderful, and it's good to support a brick and mortar store where you can reach out and smell the books in front of you.

21.description: I can't believe no one else has reviewed this yet, and I don't even live in Chicago!This bookstore gets four stars only because my friend and I waltzed in 10 minutes before closing and barely had any time to browse before we left so they could shut up shop.But I liked what I saw. Located in Printer's Row, this independent bookstore has been in operation since 1982, and you can tell that the proprietors love books. The business section is fair to middling, but the poetry shelves were impressive. Most appreciated of all, however, were the books that greet you upon entering: A quality selection of design and pop culture-related books.I wish I'd had more time here. I know I'll return, and you should go in my stead! They even have a frequent buyer's program. For $10 a year, you can get 10% discounts on all purchases.

16.description: This bookstore is so great. It's beautiful inside and out, and I love the old smell, look and feel of it. The staff is extremely friendly and they have a great selection of books. It's very cozy and welcoming, unlike some OTHER bookstores in the neighborhood.

17.description: I can't believe no one else has reviewed this yet, and I don't even live in Chicago!This bookstore gets four stars only because my friend and I waltzed in 10 minutes before closing and barely had any time to browse before we left so they could shut up shop.But I liked what I saw. Located in Printer's Row, this independent bookstore has been in operation since 1982, and you can tell that the proprietors love books. The business section is fair to middling, but the poetry shelves were impressive. Most appreciated of all, however, were the books that greet you upon entering: A quality selection of design and pop culture-related books.I wish I'd had more time here. I know I'll return, and you should go in my stead! They even have a frequent buyer's program. For $10 a year, you can get 10% discounts on all purchases.

12.description: I work in the neighborhood and have been to Sandmeyer's more than a few times. Usually to pick up a gift or a unique card. I bought a book for a gift recently. They didn't have the exact book I wanted in stock but the salesperson was friendly and showed me some other items from the same author. We did find the exact book from another bookstore which was more appropriate for the receiver so I never gave them the book. I was not able to return the book within their 2 week return policy so the "not so friendly" gentleman put the book back in the bag and said I couldn't return it. No store credit, nothing. I left very disappointed. It gave me that "I'm not going to shop there ever again" feeling.

5.description: Really lovely bookstore, friendly owner and great array of books! Books are priced by the regular price on the back. Love that's it's on Printer's Row which is down the street from where I live! Love the vintage feel of it with the creeky hardwood floors. A great local business to support. Will come back!

11.description: There is so much to love about Sandmeyer's.This quiet, well-organized independent book store has all the things you like from the chain stores, and none of the things you don't.Excellent selection? Check. You can find novels, literary journals, nonfiction, children's titles, and the usual categories you'd look for at Border's or B&N. Unlike those places, however, Sandmeyer's has an excellent selection of local history books. Whether you want a pictorial guide to the suburbs or historical fiction set in Chicago, you'll find it here. A discount program? Check. Sandmeyer's has one, just like the big chain stores, but they won't send you a million emails every day if you sign up for it.Helpful staff? Check. The guy at the register was happy to chat with me about their selection of literary journals, what they normally stock, when they get new ones in, etc. They're also happy to order things for you in many cases.Here are some things Sandmeyer's has that your typical chain store does not: location in a beautiful building in Chicago's historic Printer's Row, proximity to numerous places to grab lunch and read your new book, and excellent displays of the new Penguin books with the beautiful covers, including the great ideas series. The publishing industry as well as bricks and mortar book stores are allegedly in crisis, but Sandmeyer's reminds me of all the reasons I walk into a real store and buy a book instead of downloading something onto an e-reader. The tactile experience of holding one of those new Penguin editions, a "curated" selection of books rather than a few suggestions generated by an algorithm, a staff member to recommend something if you can only buy one thing today but have your eye on three different titles, and yes, that wonderful paper and ink aroma. Plus, if you're like me and you sometimes drop your reading material while perusing it in the bathtub, you're only out $10, not $150+.Did I mention that Sandmeyer's is also convenient to public transit? It is! You can walk to this lovely building from the red, blue, brown, orange, and green lines, and if you don't mind a little walk, it's totally doable from the metra as well.In short, go to Sandmeyer's. Buy a book. Read the book. Repeat as necessary.

19.description: One of my favorite bookstores in the world and one of the best things about Printers Row.  This is the way a bookstore should be.  Creeky wood floors, intimate bookshelves, comfy and cozy atmosphere.  The owners are mavelous and very knowledgeable.  A true gem indeed.

0.description: Beautiful building with helpful staff. The wood floors creek when you walk, which is lovely. There is normally only one copy of a book out so there is a ton to look at!

20.description: Very nice store with a friendly staff.  The selection here was excellent and it's easy to find something in particular and great to browse through the racks.  Not a bad selection of crafty books either.  We bought some books on Chicago hikes, and I'm sure we'll be back again!

3.description: The staff is kind. The store is adorable. Their selection of children's books is incredible. The creaky wood floors make it feel like the coziest little place on the map. The only reason I couldn't give it 5 stars is that their philosophy section is a bit smaller than I'd like. However, they have tons of books elsewhere.

2.description: As previous reviews have stated, the guy working there (who may have been the owner) is not the friendliest, but he is certainly not rude and I found a great book in the sale section at half price which I will be taking home to New York with me as a lovely souvenir! (My Berlin Kitchen by Luisa Weiss).

18.description: I love Sandmeyer's! Not a massive selection being that they have limited space but I dig the aesthetic and can usually find a worthy book at Sandmeyer's. They have the Penguin 'Great Ideas' series which rocks my world. I recently became a VIP meaning I get 10% off all books here. Yayer!

13.description: Nice small independent bookstore. They have a good selection of local flavor books and authors, the remainder of the selection is interesting and diverse, if a little limited. Great Printer's Row loft/storefront atmosphere. The owner is not terribly talkative, so don't expect a lengthy conversation with him, he's pleasant enough, though.

4.description: Lucky to live close to here, the 10% off member card for $10 is a nice touch. Friendly staff. the discount card works for families/couples/etc, which is also nice.

6.description: I absolutely love this store. The service is great but most of all it's in my neighborhood. Having a bookstore in your neighborhood today is rare, and to have one as great as Sandmeyers feels like a luxury. They have a great selection of cards for any occasion and fantastic books. The key to this place is that the volume is low, quality is high.

15.description: This is how a bookstore should be.  Friendly, knowledgeable staff.  It's not a huge store, but big enough.  A great store to "have a look."  Very comfortable atmosphere, good vibe, quiet.

7.description: It's so sad that bookstores are becoming a thing of the past with the advent of the Internet and technology.  This is a really cool bookstore; it's on the first floor in a historic loft building and still has the original creaky hardwood floors and radiators.  I live in the neighborhood and whenever I pass by the store is usually empty.  It's too bad they don't allow dogs, otherwise I would visit more often.

8.description: I live right down the street and come here often, especially to buy birthday and holiday cards at the last minute. The store is pretty with lots of light and the book selection is fairly good, though they are limitted by small size. The shop could do with a couple of spots to sit and read and I wish that they sponsored more cultural events like public readings and signings. But overall, it's a good independent bookstore.

14.description: It's everything I want a book store to be.  So quiet and peaceful.  The historical building is probably why I fell in love initially - the friendly owners make it perfect.  They won't have every single book you're looking for but they'll happily order it for you.  Join their club and you can get 10% off everything for a year.  I love it here.

3.description: Seems pretty consistent for a 7-Eleven.  It's had some of the same staff for a very long time and this has been my go-to convenience store for almost 10 years now.  Not bad at all.

1.description: I don't usually try to complain about other service workers doing their job, and especially not when they're handling alcohol sales - there's a lot on the line for both the clerks and the businesses! I'm in the food and beverage industry and understand this completely. This is a rare exception, just for being such an over-the-top misrepresentation of the work we do as retail beverage workers. I went into this 7-Eleven at 12:45am last night, 7-18-2015. I held the door open for a lady as I entered. I was only in the store to buy a 6pack of beer for friends visiting and waiting for me back at Hotel Blake across the street, so I headed straight for the cooler, picked my beer, and went to the counter. I had zero - ZERO - contact with the lady I opened the door for after doing so. Security cameras can back this up if need be. We arrived separately, were on opposite ends of the store - she was a total stranger, and very observable so if ANY kind of attention or observation was being made.I had my ID upfront upon catching the clerk's attention to purchase my item, and he asked to see the IDs of the "rest of my group". I came in alone. I held a door for a woman, and made zero contact once in the store. I explained this, rather incredulously, to the clerk, but he denied the sale regardless. Once again - I was on the other side of the store. I had no idea what "group" he was even REFERRING to until he said, "The people you came in with." I held. A DOOR OPEN.7-Eleven, I fully respect your right to uphold the city's liquor laws regarding suspicious alcohol sales. I see on your website that you train your employees "how to observe guests and their behavior to determine whether age-restricted products can be sold", but I'm wondering how having basic manners counts to make me suspicious and worthy of being denied service. Obviously, this isn't about being denied one silly 6 pack of beer: It's the fact that the only explanation I can see for this kind of reasoning from your clerk is blatant abuse of power in denying customers at random (sexism? homophobia? sorry I don't look like the most feminine woman out there??? grasping at straws because there was no other *reason*), or a total failure in how you "train" your employees to observe the sales they make and customers they come across.I'd very much like to know how this clerk in particular (12:45am, 7-18, Saturday night - bigger guy with longer, brown hair) reached his conclusion, and how 7-Eleven backs up random denial of sales based on unsubstantial reason. Suspicion needs to be REASONABLE - perhaps this gentleman needs retraining on what that means, or else this indiscriminate discrimination IS something 7-Eleven stands by, in which case I'd like to know in order to inform my future shopping choices. Thank you for your understanding and time in reading this.

2.description: Ok, so once every two months I scrounge a complete dinner out of junk food.  Cheetos, Rolos, Gummybears, pickles, a burrito, Mellow-yellow, pretzels, sour-patch kids and sour worms etc. all get place on a platter and served on a special place on my coffee table/heart.  7-eleven often holds the object(s) of my desire.  Though this particular is no more or less amazing than many other 7-elevens, this one is mine.

5.description: If you buy anything at a 7/11 you're a sucker because you are over-paying, and it's mostly crap anyway. That being said, the staff at this one are usually really nice and helpful. This despite having to put up with drunk Columbia College kids clamoring to get into the beer cooler and all the lottery ticket junkies. As you can tell, I'm there all the time. It's in MY BUILDING for crying out loud!!! And the homeless guy who has staked this place out is a good sort, not at all agressive, just trying to put together enough money to get out of the weather and into the SRO down the street for the night. I usualy give him some change or a buck. So if you must go to a 7/11, go to this one. But in general, do your best not to.

6.description: Its a 7-11 with crappy service and always always always a bum outside asking for something. ALWAYS - i have been coming here for maybe 8-10 years and its usually the same guy outside but sheesh!

7.description: I am not a fan of 7-eleven, but when you need Advil at 11 pm or a cheap coffee or milk and you live far away from all big stores - why not to go there? It's pretty clean compared to other 7-elevens in Chicago. Usually there are a lot of students from Columbia college, so it's safe to go there even at night.

8.description: Stopped here to play my lottery. Hope I win the millionaire raffle

9.description: oh 7-eleven, you have oh so many pints of ben & jerry's chocolate chip cookie dough!  pinch me, please.  obvious leg up on brooklyn bodegas.

0.description: I'm usually willing to write a review about a restaurant I like or a good hotel, but a convenience store?  Really?  They are called convenience stores because that is why we go to them.  Not for great food or good selection or even OK prices we go there because they are conveniently located and or open at ridiculous hours.So, I guess if there is a convenience store I'm going to walk out of my way for I should write a review and this is one of those places.   If you know the South Loop area, you know the only thing they have more of than Dunkin Doughnuts, it is 7-Elevens.  So what makes this one worth an extra block walk from my residence to the Harold Washington Public Library?One, COFFEE is always brewed and fresh!  The two 7-Elevens on State Street this is not always the case, and there is nothing convenient about wanting coffee and not having any brewed.Two, Price, a large refill on State Street is $1.49 a large refill on Dearborn is $0.79.  I have to say, it is safe to say I am a fan.

4.description: I walk to CVS on State & Congress to avoid the homeless standing outside, hustling.

28.description: Yehia is my eyebrow waxing go-to in a pinch. There are better salons out there, but when I can't get into anywhere else or happen to be in the area, it's where I go. Not the best, but it'll do.Shaping is $15, cleanup is $12. Just make sure when you go, they know which you need and they don't try to convince you otherwise.

1.description: I have recently moved back to Chicago from the DC area after many years and was really worried about finding a great stylist. Well, I have never been happier since I've found Mish at Yehia's! Not only is he easy on the eyes but he knows hair and is a great colorist! I can describe a color to him and my hair will turn out exactly as I'd imagined it. He has kept my hair healthy with trims and keratin treatments and I trust him immensly! Mish is amazing!

39.description: I've had the best and the worst here. The best: have Jessica do your eyebrows and any waxing needs! My natural brows look like I am the love child of Bert and Ernie and Jessica makes them look fantastic--and only for $12! So, definitely get her! As far as other stuff goes, I got my hair done here for my headshots and they curled it into Shirley Temple curls! Depending on the hairstylist, there can be language barriers (I told my guy I wanted it straight and nice big, soft curls at the bottom. He said he totally understood but made me look like a Texas beauty queen). I also got an overpriced manicure there and it was mediocre. Anyway, moral of the story: Jessica is the best person EVER for waxing (she also does a bunch of skin care stuff--fantastic)! Go to Yehia for her, but steer clear for other stuff.

9.description: Just got my hair done here last Saturday. I made an appointment to get my hair dyed and styled, before I went back home for spring break. Unfortunately, I am completely disappointed with my results! When I called to make my appointment I made  sure the receptionist new that I was coming in to get my hair ombré to a grayish blue color! She set me up with a guy named Mish , and when I arrived and showed him the picture, he told me he would have to reschedule me! I couldn't be rescheduled b/c I needed my hair done that day! I had a flight the next mourning!  Long story short, he took me in , and I got a completely different hair color than I expected. I was near tears when I left the salon. I hated the color or colors!!!! My hair is pink orange purple and just Ughhhh!! I now have Multi  colored hair b/c he failed to evenly distribute the dye throughout my hair! I honestly can't express how upset I am, and I paid 130$ for the worst dye job of my life! DO NOT GO HERE TO GET YOUR HAIR DYED!!!!!

29.description: Took me long enough but I finally came to terms with the facts:(1)My head is fatter than anything on God's green earth. (2)Fabio's stylist armed with the Mjolnir of shears couldn't do anything to make my hair look cool/sexy/awesome/hip/not-lame.Thus, blind to price, I chose Yehia since it's right across the street from my swinging pad. Here's the scoop: Showed up at 10:45 for my appointment, and I was greeted by a cavalcade of oddities. Reading material? Spin, N'digo, and the Lake Forest Academy Viewbook 2009. Given those choices, I obviously went with the Viewbook which is why I now know more about the competence of the girls' field hockey team at LFA than anyone (parents included) would ever care to know. Hat's off to you, ladies.My stylist? Quite mum this one was. Gave him my usual, stunning opening line about not knowing what to say when a stylist asks me how I want my hair done. Imagine...Stylist: How do you want it done?Me (bumbling): Well my first instinct is always to say, "shorter," but--ha!--you can't really cut it longer, can you?crickets...crickets...cricketsSo I guess it's time to retire that tired bit, but I'm not happy about this development. After bumbling through what to do with my absurd mop, we embarked on a twenty minute experiment in silence, awkward moments where our eyes met in the mirror and I quickly pretended to investigate the ceiling, and hair cutting. You know what struck me as terribly odd? My stylist kept borrowing tools from a comrade. Shouldn't he have his own tools? Has he not earned his stripes yet? What gives, man? Besides these oddities, Yehia did hit the mark at times: My hair doesn't look atrocious, the price was reasonable (20 bucks), and the place is right at my doorstep. I'll probably go back but it won't be with gushing enthusiasm.

42.description: This is the "new" Yehia - i.e. a sexist excuse to make men stop going to the old Yehia, which still maintains a predominantly female clientele.  The barbers are nice... but freakishly religious.  Two Orthodox "Passion of the Christ" loving Christians work here.  I guess that's tolerable for a nice $15 haircut and shave in the loop.

23.description: I always go to Albert!!! He is my stylist and he is fabulous, enough said!!!!! He does all types of hair and has great conversation. He will not let you leave the shop until your hair is up to the level of perfection he holds himself too! I also go here to get my Brazilians done by Valerie and she is amazing, her expertise and technique is amazing! I have been going here for the past 3 years...never disappointed!!!

5.description: By the look of the place, it's nothing special.  Not a high quality spa. It's not classy or polished. My rating is purely based on their work.  They do a great job with hair.  I have had a mani, pedi, hair and eyebrows done here.  They are very nice and I've been going here for probably 10 years now.  I drive an hour just to get my hair done.  Love it and have recommended a million people!!!!

31.description: My experience here was awful.  I wanted to get my hair colored black and just a wash and blow cut after that.  I walked in and once I checked in and put on a robe, I was lost.  No one came up to me so I just went over to my sister who was getting her hair pressed while I waited for someone to come up to me.  Finally someone approached me and asked what I wanted done.  I told him I wanted my hair colored black and he was like, "Really?  Don't you think that's too dark?"  I'm black woman with medium dark complexion.  How would it be too dark??  Well, he ended up talking me out of it and just dying it a dark brown color.  So another guy came up to me and colored my hair and toward the end got color on my blouse!!  A big glob fell on the collar of my blouse and yes, they were concerned and he tried to get it out but it was to no avail.  I could tell he wasn't that comfortable dying hair.  The only competent person was the person who washed my hair.  Once I got out of the chair the first guy came back and and finished styling my hair.  He was saying how dark it was and how good it looked.  Of course it looks dark!  It's still wet!!  So he's drying my hair and putting the dryer so close to my scalp he was practically burning me.  When he was going over my hair with the flat iron, he was curling his hand under and spritzing hair spray.  I asked him not to curl it under because I didn't want to look like a 12 year old girl.  And I asked for no hair spray because I wasn't going to be washing my hair the next day.  I have African-American hair and I only wash it about once a week.  So he did it several more times after I asked him not to, so pretty much the damage was done.  I looked like I had a bowl cut.  And he takes me to the mirror to show me how dark it is, but it still looks brown to me, the same color it was when I walked in.  So pretty much I paid for color where there was no difference and to look like a little girl.  And my sister has natural hair and all they did to straighten it was to blow it dry with a hair dryer.  You need more than that...at least a pressing comb.  And come to find out, Yehia was the one styling my hair.  He never made any introduction and there was no communication while he was doing my hair.  If you're the owner or the manager of a place, at at least be personable and make your clients feel welcome.  I'll definitely never go back and I advise everyone out there not to go either.

25.description: If I could, I would give this place 0 stars. The walls were dirty and there were old plastic carts (the ones used when hair is colored) haphazardly left with old dried out dye against the wall at the back of the shop.  The colorist barely spoke to me, started the highlights an inch away from my roots and because he didn't check whether or not my hair had previously been colored, managed to turn it orange.The stylist interpreted a "trim" as "please chop 4 inches off half my hair and leave the underneath hair long". This made my hair look like 2 different styles on one head, an ear length bob and then a longer style underneath.  By the time I realized what was going on it was too late as the damage had already been done. When the hair was being dried I felt like crying, the highlights were awful and so thick that I looked like a zebra, and the cut was akin to a mullet. While I was there another woman getting her hair dyed started yelling that her head was burning.Needless to say I ran away from this place and will never go there again.

12.description: Mish did an awesome job although I have to say I found the price a bit high in comparison to other salons who have provided the same service. I'm natural and very very curly so my hair won't stay straight very long so paying nearly $100 seemed ridiculous to me. However, the service was quick, the salon was clean, and the music was jamming. I may go back one day but not too soon.

37.description: If there was a zero star rating, i would give it to this salon.l rang in to make an appointment to have a shampoo wash. l made sure the receptionist understood that l wanted a stylist who knew how to take care of black hair and she recommended a stylist named Mohammed. And so, appointment made, i got in my car,paid $10 to park in a lot closeby, got in the salon,the receptionist asked me to sit and wait,  l waited for about 5 to 10mins and decided to ask a random stylist who and where Mohammeds station was, he heard me ask and turned around, he then signed to me to come to him(l thought that was rude,although he was working on a client, l still thought he could have been courteous),he asked me what l wanted to do and l told him a shampoo wash, and he just carried on with his client and said he does not style black hair, speaking under his breath and not even looking at me like l wasn't there, and he then just pointed to another stylists and said ask her if she'll take you on. What an ........... At this point l was boiling.l walked over to the other stylist knowing there will be a very small chance that she could fit me in, asked her and she said no she could not .And so i stormed out of there.That was my first time and definitely my last time.Could not believe l had wasted my precious time driving all the way there, paid for parking and then to be spoken to so unprofessionally by this uncouth stylist, was to say the least, deplorable.What you need is professional etiquette.Spend a day in Van cleef on Huron and clean your act.

21.description: My experience with the stylist Marketia has been professional, courtesy, and a great stylist My hair has never looked so good.  My biggest concern, or should I say gripe is the shampoo assistant Brandy. I had an appointment last week that included getting my hair colored. I informed Brandy twice that I wanted a dark brown color and she said okay.  I sat and waited about ten minutes until she got everything together.  Brandy then proceeded to put a white product on my hair that I was not familiar with, so I asked her what is was, she stated that she didn't know. I then informed her that the product smells like a chemical and asked what chemical was she putting in my hair? She stated that she was not putting a chemical in my hair, I told her I could smell the sulfur and peroxide and she was indeed putting a chemical in my hair.  Brandy responded by saying she didn't know anything and was just doing what she was told. Really!?  I was shocked and very concerned that one of two things was going on (1) Brandy knew what the product was and just refused to answer my questions or (2) she didn't know what the product was and was doing as she was instructed.  Either way that's bad customer service, if you ask me.  This establishment or any other consumer establishment is based on relationships, honesty and integrity. If those characteristics are lacking then your business will suffer. So, after the chemical was put in (developer) she put in the color. I asked her was the color dark brown and she said yes. I informed her that it appeared to be black and she stated it was a very dark brown.  To make a long story short, I asked her three times about the color of my hair and when she was blow-drying it, told her she colored my hair black and she repeatedly denied that she colored it black. Brandy colored my hair black even though I did not want my hair black, then she insulted my intelligence by lying about the chemical and color.  I do not want to be bothered with someone like that.  I remained calm, professional and courteous, and even tipped her $5.00, but I don't plan on having her in my head ever again.   Hopefully, the shop as more than one assistant! Just because I don't possess a cosmetologist license doesn't make me a fool.  In fact, I have too much education, too many degrees to let someone make me loose my temper because they are incapable of telling the truth!

16.description: I absolutely love how Elliott styles my hair! He is also a phenomenal colorist.

17.description: I've got curly hair that is typically difficult to manage and style.  When I want to change it up a bit- I like to have it straightened but with lots of volume.  Although I wasn't formally welcomed to the salon, I was walked over to the shampoo spot where a young lady shampooed, conditioned and massaged my hair.  I must say, it was the best shampoo I've ever had:-). Later they applied a softener and gloss that stayed in for a good 15-20 minutes. Finally, Emad worked on my hair got it just right!  My hair stayed frizz free and with lots of volume for a couple of days.Definitely going back!!!

10.description: I walked in to ask about their services and everyone seamed like they were high, the boy at the desk didn't even want to take off his ear phones when i approached him.I asked how much a QUICK trim and style would be, that's all. and he sat there and kind of laughed and said "i don't know" how do you not know how much your services are?!i then asked if they had a student discount and he laughed, finally someone else came up and i asked him "how much for a quick cut and style" no wash (i was in a rush between work & school)he said $40 which i am not able to afford as a college studenthonestly i think this place is a front, they were all sitting around acting really weird

11.description: Mish has done my hair many times.  I  have very short natural hair that I wear blow-dried.  He takes good care of my hair and is excellent with cutting and styling.  I would recommend him for long or short hair and for either natural or chemically treated hair.

26.description: I have been going to Yehia's for about 2 years. I have used a few of their services. I have had my hair relaxed by Mohammed who just rocks!! My hands and feet done by Burt (she is awesome!!) and my hair washed by Marcus, Mish and others. I love this place and will go back for more!!

27.description: This is what I get for being spontaneous and stubborn, and insisting on getting a haircut even when my usual, beloved Daniella's wasn't open.  I'd walked by this place a few times, and because I never looked closely and only saw a bunch of Aveda ads, thought it was an Aveda salon.My hair was getting way too long, so I just wanted it shortened to shoulder-length, with some layers. A reasonable request, I thought, and not too complicated. Who could mess this up?Yehia can. Apparently, "shoulder length with layers" to my stylist meant "a short bob with shoulder length pieces."  WHAT?  He chopped away so fast that I didn't even realize how short he was cutting, and by then it was too late to salvage my hair.  My head has split personality disorder now - half of it wants to be a bob/pixie cut, and half of it is a terrible shoulder-length trim. It kind of looks like a longer, punk-rock mullet. I didn't even know what to say at the end. "You fucked up my hair"? "This looks terrible, I'm not paying"?  Instead, I just got out of there as fast as I could.  When I came home, my husband called me "Poof Head."Thank god it's hat season.

35.description: The reception has always been horrible.  I went all the way down there the other day and they told me my reservation was cancelled, and i was notified by voicemail the day before, the number they called was way off my actual number...I got no voicemail.  That was the first time they have ever even acknowledged I had an appointment though.  Usually I show up having called a week or two prior and they have no idea who I am.  I've gotten my hair done there a few times, gotten my head burned by them more than a few times.  Needless to say I'm not going back.My advice, don't waste your time at this place you can find one with better service and who does a better job for the same price.

8.description: When I first walked into Yehia my hair had become damaged as a result of me wearing weave.  I only had a limited time to get everything taken care of, because I had work later.  Not only did they take down my extensions, but they were able to style me as well, all before I needed to leave for work.  Their deep conditioner and other products make it a fantastic experience.  Now I'm a regular customer and I go to Emad because in my opinion he's the best. Emad is very attentive of his clients and is meticulous in his work.  If you're thinking to go make sure you request him, you won't be disappointed!

0.description: I am a Yehia's fan. I've been going to the one in the suburbs since I was in high school. I was very skeptical about Emad doing my hair since he was using the ceramics, but it turned out Emad did a great job doing my hair. My hair stayed flat and straighten. I have thick hair as you can see in my profile picture and a lot of hair. Hair tip: Remember ladies, It's all about the blow drying technique. If your hair isn't blow dried properly expect a hair fail. Your hair will puff up in 5 minutes.

38.description: I will never patronize this place again. They use ENTIRELY too much heat and actually severely damaged my natural hair. They are not well-versed in dealing with all the different types of textures of African-American hair. My hair is fine and doesn't need that much heat and I told the stylist this repeatedly. Still, my hair was literally fried. It smelled like smoke and was so damaged that I got double my refund back. Yehia himself had to take care of it. I really do not recommend this place for any African-American woman.

20.description: Came here for waxing and want to come here again for facials. Mira is the best esthetician in South Loop. I used to go to her for facials and waxing, when she worked in European Touch. So when I met her once and she said that she is now in Yehia, I decided to start going there. All the staff members, I met, where nice and polite. Very much recommend this place to everyone!

19.description: It's the best place in town for a blowdry. I have very difficult curly hair and Emad works his magic every time I go there! If you want an amazing blow dry that last for few days ask for Emad.

33.description: If you want bone straight hair this is your place.  They charge $45-55 for blow dry, press and curl.  They get you in and out really fast.  I will warn you though they use A LOT of heat on your hair to achieve the silky bone straight hair you desire.  If you go too often your hair will become very dry and brittle over time and you may need to chop it all off and start growing it all over again.  Oh and if you get your hair colored here and you have very dark hair... and you want lighter hair. They will use a bleach to get the results you want but I don't think it's too healthy. Overall, my recommendation is if you have an event or you can't get an appointment with your regular stylist then go here.  But I wouldn't make this a regular place...your hair will not stay healthy here.

2.description: The only plus to this place is that they're fast. You won't wait all day just to get in the chair or leave out. I went to Mohammed for a couple of years. He's nice and does a great job with styling layers but cuts too much hair off length wise. My hair grows fast but never progressed past nape length the entire couple of years I went to him. Had to stop going to him. If you want your hair to stay short-medium length, then he may work for you. Otherwise, I'd choose another stylist.

34.description: I had a bad initial experience with the service there. Its not that they are not friendly, its that I had a photoshoot and made a special appointment and the hairdresser went on a trip and he didn't call to cancel with me until I called him. So luckily enough, I found another hairdresser the same day.Next, I returned because I know they can blow my hair dry afterwards. I asked the hairdresser to return my hair to its dark color and brought photos. He just brought out a mix and got to work. It didn't return to my color so he had to explain AFTER THE WORK was done that he was apparently acting in my best interest. What made it worse, I don't think he had a good eye for what brown would best suit my skin color- it looked like a wig. A girl even asked me, "Is that yours???"  Anyway, I returned upset and at no charge I was handed around the room for color, dry and then, the owner himself took the liberty of layering my hair! Do you know how long my hair takes to grow??? My holiday, my friends said my hair was wrecked. Weak from color, a cut that didn't suit my curly hair and i just had to wear it back everywhere. I'm still trying to moisturize what's left. But come on!!! The cut was aweful but one feels so bad because they are so darn nice while they are wrecking your life. You just go home and cry but while saying goodbye, you think they deserve a tip. Here is a tip: Go for friends and not for your hair!If anyone knows a hairdressing place that with a customer service strategy that listens, educates and asks permission about what they plan to do- and who actually knows black, mixed, latin hair- I would be happy to hear from them. Yehia's is a friendly place but they will smile and promise you donuts while coloring your hair an unmatching color and cutting the rest off giving you no notice at all.  Their new motto should be: Go for friends, not for hair.

32.description: 0 stars!My experience was awful.  It wasn't just that my hair looked awful; but the fact that everyone kept saying how straight, beautiful and lively it would look....WTF?I went to the Oak Park location.  The staff was very friendly; however, I could immediately tell that they knew NOTHING about AA hair.  Yes, the blowdryer was hot but my hair is natural and that is definitely not enough to straighten my hair.  My hair was still moist at the scalp and neckline when some really old man attempted to curl it with the old school stove curlers.  He parted a couple of big pieces and turned my hair under really tight after I told him I wanted it straight (he probably didn't understand me considering he didn't speak english).  The edges and roots were soooooo nappy and the style looked like a JCPenny doo.  This was a complete joke and wasn't worth the $45 (no tip for flat ironing my hair wet)!  Whoever said bone-straight, silky etc.  has never been to Detroit and had a real satin press and ceramic curl!Maybe it was just the location IDK, but I left pissed, $45 lighter, damp scalp, and had to go home and do my hair.Oh BTW, parking sucks!

18.description: If you have natural hair please avoid..Or you will regret it!!  Worst experience ever!

41.description: i've gotten my hair done here before and they did a great job for under forty bucks. i havent been back due to my schedule but i plan to pretty soon

13.description: It is hard to find a good stylist that does a good job on your hair AND knows what they are talking about. I have natural hair and when I go to the hood to get my hair done it looks great but they can't tell me how to take care of it. When I get someone downtown that can give me great ways of keeping my hair healthy, they unfortunately can't get my hair the way I want it (my roots straight as well). Emad was able to do both, provide advice on how to manage and treat my hair AND does a great job. This is the recipe to make an excellent stylist!

4.description: I am due for a hair cut and unfortunately it's too expensive for me to fly from Toronto just to get a hair cut :-).  I decided to give this salon a chance based on reviews and I was happy with the results.  They applied a deep conditioner that made my hair smooth and soft.  Mish was the stylist who cut my hair and he did a great job! He could have done a quick trim but took the time to let me know that more of my ends needed to be trimmed so my curls look better.  The overall experience was nice and would recommend this salon to anyone.  From what I observed they are capable of working with all types of hair which means they are talented.  I'm in Chicago often and I will be back soon! This place is worth a try if you're looking for a quality salon with friendly staff and affordable prices!

24.description: If you have CURLY hair, go to Emad.  Emad understands curly hair and knows how to cut it.He is the only stylist cutting my hair from now on.  My hair feels light and sexy after I leave Yehia.

6.description: I have been going to this location for 14 years! I may take breaks and try other things but I always come back. My stylist is Misch who is amazing and always makes you feel beautiful, if he is not available then ask for Ahmed he is so nice and very talented as well. Misch recently did color after Ahmed talked me into and and I haven't stopped getting compliments! I have never had a problem. I even get all my waxing done here. My waxing person is Val she is AMAZING! I get Brazilians, brows and lips and you cannot beat the price and precision. If you are looking for an all in one stop shop this is your place. I love everything about it!

22.description: I've got curly hair that is typically difficult to manage and style.  When I want to change it up a bit- I like to have it straightened but with lots of volume.  Although I wasn't formally welcomed to the salon, I was walked over to the shampoo spot where a young lady shampooed, conditioned and massaged my hair.  I must say, it was the best shampoo I've ever had:-). Later they applied a softener and gloss that stayed in for a good 15-20 minutes. Finally, Emad worked on my hair got it just right!  My hair stayed frizz free and with lots of volume for a couple of days.Definitely going back!!!

15.description: I visited Yehia almost a week ago. My hair still looks GREAT! Mish did an excellent job. His assistant's were kind, friendly, understanding, and they listen to your concerns and questions regarding your hair. 5 stars goes to his team of assistants as well. Great customer service. He clipped my ends perfectly. Not too much & not too little - still have the length I desired plus my hair looks healthy. It's JUST RIGHT! I love Mish. My next hair appointment will be with him that's for certain. I must add I watch other clients leave from their stylists' chair very pleased & happy. I believe besides just Mish there is salon full of qualified individuals that know how to make their clients leave feeling replenished and recharged.

40.description: Don't like the place. It's too creepy.

7.description: I live a few blocks away. Emad cut my hair like an artist. I was extremely happy. Have received nothing but compliments. My only criticism is the shop is dirty. It needs a good cleaning. The staff is very friendly. I am going to try a mani pedi next time.

36.description: yehia is a business that i've been able to count on for the past 16yrs. i've been to a number of locations over the years. this is my fave. being black and having natural hair isn't a crime here...if you want to wear it straight they won't try to pressure you into chemically altering it. i dont wear my hair straight ALL the time, but i know that when i do i can count on it to be gorgeous if i go here. i like the stylist ayemen...i highly recommend him and the shop in general. i've never had to wait when i go in and have never been displeased. check em out it won't break your pocket book either. my only criticism is they are SERIOUS about the blow dry...a little too serious...they can some times make it so straight that if you like to go back and forth from curly to straight...that may be hard b/c the "straightness" often stays after you wash...

30.description: The second time I visited, my hair was box-dyed brown.  I asked to go blond.  I chose a relatively ashy medium shade.  They foiled me, covered the rest of the hair, and then I sat.  In total, i sat FOR FOUR HOURS.  They plied me with Starbucks, funny stories, and reassuring looks, but at no point did my stylist or anyone else suggest I was in for such a long adventure.When I left the salon, my hair was a very very pretty, very very light blond.  I received wild compliments over the next couple of days.  I was very happy, and forgave the marathon.  UNTIL THE ENDS OF MY HAIR STARTED TO FALL OFF LIKE ASHES AT A BONFIRE!It's supposed to be an Aveda salon--healthier for your hair?  I had to cut some of the ends myself so I could go to my business meeting without little bits of hair all over my shoulders.  As a result, I now have stupid-looking pseudo-bangs and the back layer is still fried.My roots have grown out to the point that I need a touch-up and am at a loss as to where to go.  I'm thinking I'll have to get a bob to get rid of all the brittle/dead ends, which bums me out b/c I'd like to keep the pony-tail option through summer's end.I'm pretty bummed b/c the location, people, atmosphere, and price are right.  I just can't have my hair falling out :(

3.description: I went to Yehia last week and Ahmed did an amazing job with my hair. I needed a lot since my sew in had to be taken out. He took it out and made suggestions and washed and trimmed my hair. I appreciated that he showed me how much he was cutting. Great service at a fair price.  This was my first time there but I'll definitely be back!

14.description: From beginning to end, this was a wonderful experience. I was greeted when I walked in the door and the guy asked who was my normal stylist. I told him it was my first time there. Right away, he told me to sit in the seat to get my hair washed. The woman was very respectfully the whole time asking me was the water too hot or cold. She even apologized to the fullest when a "splash" of water hit my eyes. Next, I was put under the steamer. I chatted with hair washer and asked what she would recommend I get since our hair was the same length. She suggested a few styles and I chose one. She offered me some water and I politely declined. I was handed off to a guy who blow dryed my hair. Didn't take long but it hurt a little if the heat was on too long. He offered me water as well. I still declined. Finally, my stylist comes over and introduces himself as Mish. He wanted to know where I usually get my hair done. I told him I wanted to try some new and convenient to get to. He finished blow drying my hair. He asked whether I wanted a lot of volume or not. When I say I felt like a princess afterwards that's an understatement. My hair was so bouncy and shiny. I thanked him for his service and gave him a tip. I will definitely go to Yehias again. I love the fast and efficient service provided. Thank you.

58.description: Right out the gate I have to say, FANTASTIC! I tried the Pan-Roasted Walleye and it was great! I didn't want the meal to end! It's a comfortable and welcoming environment, thanks to the staff and the atmosphere. Great craft beer selection... I'll be back for sure!

56.description: This place is a gem a true Gastro Pub. No joke beer selection obviously chosen by people in the know and not some slick beverage manager jocking the local Trend. the menu is a simple list of quality product in season not a glutton of comodity beef and low quality cheddar cheese. this place is awesome and will only mature and get better with time 5 stars all the way!!

29.description: We lived in the building and we were excited for the place to open! They had brown paper up in the windows for a long time and we thought it would never open.The space is aesthetically pleasing to the eye. We stopped in on opening night and my wife had a couple of beers and we both had the burger. Great beer selection. We chose the burger as the food menu is VERY limited and the price to portion ratio seemed a little off from the other plates we saw leave the kitchen. The burger was nothing special and the ambiance matched the fare.We never went back for a second chance as there are so many solid places for a good bite in the south loop. It's a shame as the place and location have great potential...

42.description: If you like beer come here and ask Cecil the bartender what you should have.  He is the pro at matching Villain's vast selection of beers to your particular tastes. He can also recommend some great appetizers -- the pork belly was AMAZING!  Good thing I live on LA or I'd be here too often.  Cecil and the team were great; the chef even brought our our food and explained all those foodies things.

23.description: I love this place because sometimes you don't want regular bar food, so if that's you.....you should check this place out. The selection of beer is amazing and the food is absolutely delicious. I admit if you just want wings, sliders or skins this is probably not your spot. If you want to up your taste buds then this is a great place with great service!!

47.description: I like many others, have been waiting for Villains to open for a couple years now!  I think this is why our expectations were high.   Pros:Really great beer list.  I enjoy that Villains has new beers to offer from Denmark, etc.  There are plenty of restaurants in the area with local beers, so this is a nice change in my opinion. Service was fantastic.  The server had extensive knowledge of every beer and every dish.  Cons: The food did not meet our expectations, especially for the price.  The pork belly was our favorite with a lot of flavor.  The walleye was okay but too salty and the sirloin was nothing special.  I think Villains could be a great place and I will absolutely try it again as I think it has the potential to be a solid addition to the neighborhood! Good place just not my favorite YET!

8.description: I'm always excited to see a new bar/restaurant open in the south loop, and Villains was no exception. It's conveniently located near the Harrison redline station, so getting there is easy. Once you're there, the ambiance is warm and sultry, and the service is friendly and prompt. They've got a great a drink  menu including  my fall favorite Pumking. The food menu is full of locally grown/raised food, and features a list of their partner farms, which I love. The main problem were the prices and the variety. I think they could use a few more reasonably priced items: throw some Pom frites on there - everybody eats them and all the farms have potatoes. I get it, there's a fancy demographic moving to the area, but until the area develops more, I think the menu could be a bit more accessible. It's not outrageous, just slightly overpriced I. My personal opinion. And I couldn't bring myself to order a $16 burger with Blackies across the street. I'll be back again for a cocktail with friends for sure.

31.description: If you want to have a dining experience and not just another meal to fill your gullet, then you should try Villains. From the outside, the restaurant is appealing already and has quite the appeal. The inside is industrial, sophisticated, evoking simple modern elegance. There is a steampunk light at each table one can control which just adds to the wood table and general ambience. We bought a Groupon for the wine/beer pairing with chef tasting menu. It was one of the best culinary decisions we have ever made to try out a new place! The tasting was more than enough for two average sized people. The waiters were so courteous, informative and just truly added to the wonder of the epicurean adventure. Beers were really awesome and staff was knowledgeable about all aspects of dining. Our first course was a charcuterie board with the most amazing chicken pate ever! Really delicious hams and pickled goodies too. Second course was a corn cake and veggies which wasn't my fave. Too bland. Third course was a seafood hotpot with langoustines and fish and like a fish stew of sorts. Delicious! Third course we picked was the beef tenderloin cooked to perfection. Then a raspberry topped cheesecake for dessert. All courses paired with beers to compliment the dish. Presentation and cleanliness were top notch. Service professionalism absolutely wonderful. Decor minimal: the space was inviting and cozy. Prices reasonable and good portions. Bar scene was very laid back. A great family place or date or just out with friends kinda night.... Villains can and will accommodate. Drink selection very well crafted serving all palates! I even saw a 17% ABV beer! Go and try this place out. You will most definitely come back.

34.description: The burger here is amazing, let's just get that out of the way first. To be perfectly honest, I throw it in the DMK-Au Cheval-Kuma's-Bad Apple mix of top burgers in Chicago. Also appealing is the extensive list of relatively hard to find beers on draft (Ballast Point tap takeover currently, Mikkeler, etc.). What lacks, as other reviewers have pointed out, right now are service and price point. The service was really poor, taking 10-20+ minutes between check-ins (I'll conservatively say the joint was 2/3s full when we ate), which resulted in empty glasses and quite some time to actually place our food orders. That will improve with time. The price point, is kind of a head-scratcher though, which are all probably $3-4 too high (burger, maybe more like $2) from what I was looking at on the menu and comparing against plates at other tables - but I can't speak to the quality of those dishes. Decor was cool, ambiance was good, and will say it was a bit noisy, but otherwise really liked this joint. Pretty close to the EL as well, so that's pleasantly convenient. Will be back for that burger, most definitely!

16.description: Came here with the gf for a date night and we had a great dining experience. We got:- Farmers cheese gnudi - pronounced "nudie" - light, flavorful and not too filling.  - The 2013 & 2014 "draft beer". They had a massive list of beers from two beer companies from Denmark- "mikkeler" and "mad beer".- Pan-roasted bone-in skate wing - 1/2 of us would try this again - Grilled slagel farms beef burger - 8.5/10We will be back again for the rest of the menu

13.description: The burger here is amazing, let's just get that out of the way first. To be perfectly honest, I throw it in the DMK-Au Cheval-Kuma's-Bad Apple mix of top burgers in Chicago. Also appealing is the extensive list of relatively hard to find beers on draft (Ballast Point tap takeover currently, Mikkeler, etc.). What lacks, as other reviewers have pointed out, right now are service and price point. The service was really poor, taking 10-20+ minutes between check-ins (I'll conservatively say the joint was 2/3s full when we ate), which resulted in empty glasses and quite some time to actually place our food orders. That will improve with time. The price point, is kind of a head-scratcher though, which are all probably $3-4 too high (burger, maybe more like $2) from what I was looking at on the menu and comparing against plates at other tables - but I can't speak to the quality of those dishes. Decor was cool, ambiance was good, and will say it was a bit noisy, but otherwise really liked this joint. Pretty close to the EL as well, so that's pleasantly convenient. Will be back for that burger, most definitely!

11.description: What a disappointment!  I had been looking forward to coming here since it opened, but when I came for drinks on a Friday night, the service was abysmal.  We sat in the dining room, and perhaps our waiter was disappointed that we weren't ordering food?  (There were plenty of open tables though).  In any event, it took 15-20 minutes to get our beers after we ordered them.  The waiter apologized, but this seemed to be insincere, as we later waited another 15 minutes for him to come and take our card.  When he did not do so, we decided to leave cash and head out.  This place has great ambiance, a solid beer list, and some serious potential, but I hope they can remedy these service challenges!

39.description: The food is incredible! The burger is one of my favorites in Chicago.The table service, and drink service was very, very slow, during a not-busy Saturday night. Will be a personal 5-star place if the service gets better.

37.description: Walking in I had high expectations for this reborn south loop restaurant.  I was a little more than worried that my fantastic Monday night memories of delicious burgers and beer would be ruined.  I was definitely wrong.Here's the pro... the burger was freaking awesome.  One of the best tasting burgers in the city.  The bacon & onion gave the burger an incredible unique smokey flavor that I haven't had before.  To top that, the aged cheddar was a great compliment to the rest of the burger.  I would definitely order it again.That being said... the burger and fries was $16. I walked away spending $42 on burger and fries for my wife and I.  Seems like a little much for 2 burgers.  The fries were nothing special and my wife's burger was a little under-cooked for her medium-well order.

0.description: The new Villains is a 180° from their old space, under new management and reinventing a new chapter. At the bar, it was very comfortable and laid back, with some understated modern decor. It had a similar modern/rustic vibe to the Publican, somewhat upscale, but relaxed. Friendly people at the bar, had some nice conversations.Service at the bar was great, very prompt and friendly, the bartender made a mean cocktail too. Beer selection was very impressive, there were a number of the Mikkeller Spontan series on draft, a number of Prairie drafts, Logsdon, and more. Lots of depth and variety. There was a reserve bottle list with some spendier stuff that I haven't seen elsewhere. The menu was well organized, with prices and sizes listed, and they offered half pours if you just want to test drive a few beers. Just an amazing selection.Overall a great experience, I'd return again soon to try some food, the photos here look good. Best downtown beer bar in my opinion.

38.description: My friend had trouble finding the restaurant and called for directions, the person answering the phone couldn't give him directions and told him to walk in the wrong direction. It was comical to me at least. We ordered a fried cheese ball thing for starters which was good but fried everything is good. We ordered the socca cake which was just ok. My friend ordered the porkchop which was mostly grizzle. Everything we ordered had peas on it. I assumed a Green Giant truck must have overturned near the restaurant and they really cashed it. The waiter also mentioned that the greens were suffocated and it made my eyes roll. I hope those greens didn't suffer much. I remember leaving hungry and thinking we spent too much money. For the small menu, they should do those dishes really well but it's not worth it at that price. So many places in Chicago have a great beer menu and great food. Go to one of those places.

51.description: I'm not sure where to really go with this review and it's taken me a few weeks to think about how I wanted to write it. I purposely waited a bit after my experience cause I was so disappointed. As a long time Printers Row/South Loop resident, I admittedly had high expectations for Villains. Not in the sense that I wanted a new place to go, but in the sense that this section of Clark is going through a rebirth. Places like First Draft, the new condos, and now Villains will hopefully bring this section of Printers Row up to the standard that exists two streets over on Dearborn. I'd comment on Blackies as a contributor, but that's just hopeless. I was a bit disappointed in my first visit. First, the menu is highly complicated for the customers in this neighborhood. I get that they are trying to be "organic," "local," "authentic midwestern," etc, but come on, when the cheese plate and the burger are the only things recognizable on the menu, there is a problem.  My wife order the cheese plate since she wasn't feeling the burger but nobody seemed to really know what the cheeses were. Their response was "this is an international one." The Fromage Gods are shuttering! While my burger was good, it wasn't great considering the price point. Yeah yeah, I get that it that the burgers are hand made, but I'm not paying that much for bacon cheese burger. I will say the beer menu was extensive, although somewhat unrecognizable. Across the street at First Draft you find 60+ taps of names you know and love. The same thing is true for Bar Louie, Kaseys, Hackneys, and even Flacos. At Villains, it's a crap shoot. You order one and hopefully it meets your expectations. However, again, like the burger, the prices were high. Well, according to the management, not high enough since they crossed out the old prices and hand wrote in higher ones in pen (note my photo of the beer menu with the magically changed prices).   The service was spotty at best, which is shocking since they don't really seem busy. I get that they just opened, but when the staff gloats that they "worked at the old Villains" and have a "fantastic chef" there is a certain expectation of competency that they failed to exhibit. Don't hype yourself up until you're ready! This is a tough f&b town and many of us despise arrogance in our dining and drinking experience. Take the humble road and you'll be successful. Finally, I wish Villains good luck. With some minor changes, they could be a wonderful addition to Clark St and Printers Row as a whole.

27.description: We went to Villains for the brunch on Sunday,the atmoshphere is really nice,but the brunch menu was not that tasty,I ordered a french toast,it was very dry and felt like eating an old piece of bread,my husband had a skillet and it was just ok,the taste was very plain.Bloody Marys on another side were good.We will try to come back to check out the food for dinner,because I do believe in second chances,will see

32.description: I was looking forward to this place opening up for well over a year.  I have now gone to it a few times, and it's a complete and utter disappointment. The service is bad and the atmosphere is Blah at best.  I walk by it every single day and it is almost always completely dead (with the exception of the same 5-10 dudes that are always in there sitting at the front bar).  The actual booths for where the diners are supposed to sit is always vacant.  Did I mention this spot is also completely uninviting and dark?  Villains only has 1 TV in the bar which is rarely ever on - which seems odd for a bar. With the new Sociale Bar opening up (which seems to already be a hit as it was packed on a Thursday and it's not even officially open until the following Monday, Sept. 28th).  That place has the doors/windows open and seems to have a lively atmosphere from what I can tell.  First Draft down the street is also a complete hit and has an excellent wait staff, great selection of beers and amazing chicken wings.My guess is that this place will be around for the next 6-12 months at best.  I had very high expectations for the re-open of this one...but it's a complete failure.  I am now looking forward to the next bar that will be there...

54.description: I had a sub par burger with overcooked bacon that I didn't ask for and a lukewarm beer and the check came to over $25.  This restaurant has serious delusions of grandeur, it's not Everest, it is a bar on the first floor of a parking garage between a convenience store and a gym.  I was turned away on opening night even though there were several tables available.  Do yourself a favor and go to First Draft right across the street.  They have a huge menu, the servers are actually friendly and I just had a delicious goat cheese burger and beer there for $12.

48.description: Best meal of 2015, with Selden Standard in Detroit a close 2nd.I am officially a member of the Villains Clean Plate Club.  I do not want to go into too much detail about how good our meal was because if someone else eats all of the cheesecake I.will.lose.my.shit.Our meal was so good, I finally admit to being ignorant to what Medium-Rare means.  My sirloin was cooked medium on the outer 4 cm of the sirloin, and rare on the inside 4cm.  Medium rare is not "pink on the inside".  Our tab was $107.  We ordered 3 glasses red wine, 2 appetizers, 2 main courses, 1 dessert.  I feel that is an extremely fair price for the food we were served.  I cannot wait to come back and drink beer and try more of the menu.One request of the owners, please stock some bottles of Einstock beer from Iceland. xoxoxoxZach

44.description: "there's only one burger on the menu"i'm going to give it to you straight. the villains burger is the best burger i've ever had, and it's not even close.i've had burgers from many places in LA, NYC, Vegas, and the list goes on. This burger has something that can't be described, or matched, by any other burger in the country. it's not just the beef fat mayo (for real? beef fat mayo?!), it's the charred inside of the bun, the smoked red onions, the 4-year cheddar, the B&B pickles...the new villains burger is an experience that you need in your life.

24.description: Our expectations were high.  Villians didn't come close to meeting them.  In the new location they've ventured away from standard pub fare, which was a mistake.  They're having trouble measuring up on everything else.The new space is dark, cold, barely decorated, noise, no ambiance.

7.description: Been here easily 10 times or more, they've always had a vegan option. Until today. Wtf.

49.description: As a SLooper, I've been waiting for years (literally) for Villains to re-open.  Since they opened about a month ago, I've been there 3 times and my experience has gotten better each time.  The beer menu that is second to none - my only critique would be that the menu is very meat-heavy and can be difficult to satisfy a diner who doesn't want a heavy dinner (or a salad).

40.description: Definitely potential to improve, but off to a good start.Food is decent, not spectacular. Good, fresh, organic ingredients, a distinct southern tinge, and well cooked. Just a tad bland, perhaps, and missing a little bit of the wow factor to make it supremely tasty. With a bit of time, I really do think this will improve.Beer selection is amazing, but it's a bit of a crapshoot. I kinda like that as you're never quite sure what you'll end up with despite the descriptions.Service: this was where I feel Villains needs work. Despite the restaurant being half-full on a midweek evening there seemed like there was just one server. The pace was a little languid and the server didn't really engage us about our food/drink choices which I think needs to happen at a place like this.Still think Villains has room to improve and grow and hoping that it will. It's so different from the old space across the street with its skull lights and dive-bar vibe (which I miss) but good luck to them with their new concept.

53.description: We went to Villains on a whim.  We went to another local restaurant and, after sitting on their patio for over 10 minutes without the waitress acknowledging us, we decided to try another place.  Villains is on each of our ways to/from work and we'd been wanting to try it, so we popped in around 8:15 on Wednesday.Aesthetically, the place is great.  A very cool mix of industrial and rustic.  A good mix of trendy, upscale, and a bit divey.  Between the exposed-filament bulbs, the giant wall of beers, and the knives that look like switchblades, it's clear that the owners put some effort into every detail.  We were greeted quickly with some waters and started looking at the menu.  Neither my girlfriend nor I think of ourselves as foodies or craft beer people.  Looking at the menu, we were both a little unsure if we still wanted to eat there.  Our waiter, Pascal, greeted us very shortly after that and we decided to give us a shot.  We weren't feeling too adventurous, so we both ordered a burger.  In my mind, burgers are deceptively simple and it's surprisingly difficult to make a truly good burger.  I also got a dry cider to go with it.We were both glad to see that the attention to detail extended to the food.  The burger was a true medium rare, and clearly made of high quality beef.  The bun was perfectly toasted.  I won't keep going on with each ingredient, but it was a damn good burger.  We were both impressed and will be back.  The prices aren't cheap by any measure, but it became clear that Villains is serving high quality food.My one major complaint: the angles of the chairs are absurdly upright...like something you'd expect from an etiquette school where they want you to sit at 90* and balance a book on your head.  Looking around, not a single person was sitting back in their chair - everyone was leaning forward to keep their back off the chair.Overall, the chairs suck but the food, drinks, and service are awesome.I'd love to see a broader menu though, for us non-foodies.

30.description: I just left Villians and all I can say is WOW. The service was attentive but not overbearing.  The space and music were top notch. The food was quality, well prepared and delicious.  Don't miss the chicken, burger, cheese plate and cheesecake.  Amazing.  What a great addition to the South Loop. We had the great fortune to meet  the owner Marco.  He is committed to the neighborhood and providing a quality social and dining experience to its residents and visitors. Can't wait to go to enjoy Fried Chicken Monday's.  While their beer menu is amazing you won't be disappointed if you want a glass of wine or a cocktail.   There is something for everyone.  Take my word, you must go to Villians.

46.description: The food and the wine were so-so and definitely overpriced. We requested mayo on the side, and they brought a (not requested) beef fat mayo, which we didn't like and had to pay extra for. I would not recommend this place.

1.description: Beer and food menu have changed since I was here last and I got food this time:Under "Bites:"Roasted almonds - could have been store bought. Nothing special.Pig ears - very thinly sliced, nicely seasoned, went well with the lemon aioliCharcuterie: serrano ham and salumi were good but chicken liver parfait and country pate had an unpleasant funk to them that I have not encountered in other force-meat preparations.Kennebec fries were less fluffy on the inside than last time. Coworkers still seemed very happy with the burger.Had high hopes for the buttermilk pie, but it was served cold with warm but undercooked apple slices. Although the pie itself was pretty good, the filling was overly sweet instead of tangy and gooey and the slice should have been served heated for maximum luxurious effect. The apple slices felt like an after-thought; a tart apple compote or chutney would have been prettier and a better counterbalance to the sweetness of the pie.But I think the make-your-own beer flight option is new and awesome. Right now Villains has a whole bunch of fruity and sour options to be on trend. I got the Baird Shuzenji Heritage Helles (excellent, complex, but easy drinking), Rosee d'Hibiscus (watery body but tangy bright flavor and beautiful color), EOS Hefeweizen (like a paler Hoegaarden), and the Mills & Hills Russian Imperial Stout (roasty, malty, medium-bodied, great) to go with dessert. Some colleagues got mixed drinks and were not impressed with the Villains Punch, the Old Fashioned, or the Fortunate Son - common complaint was too sweet or one-note.It was also hard to get service after food was served despite the place only being half full. Still a decent choice for after-work beers, but spend your money on the great beer list and save the rest for food elsewhere.

55.description: Villains! What took you so long to rejoin Printer's Row. I loved it before and it's possibly even better now. Bartenders super friendly, amazing beer list, and great atmosphere! Burger was good. Dry aged beef and wonderful smokey flavor to the onions. Not to mention you can't go wrong with aged cheddar..Will definitely be back, especially to see what's new on draft.

9.description: Damn...where do I start?The selection of beers is outstanding!!!
