They have a HUGE assortment of craft beers with good description of each.  Even better the bartender Nic was excellent, had an understanding for the flavors of beer and selected some based on my liking.  Very attentive and just seemed like a nice guy.Now the menu....Extensive list of apps and main entrees, even lots of vegetarian options.  I tried the burger for $18, and it was worth every penny.  The components are divine, and the combination of the bread, mayo, and the meat itself......oh my good.  This burger had a unique crisp along the outside and was perfectly cooked medium on the inside.  It was like nothing I had ever had before....truly remarkable...the crispy outside of the meat, drenched in 4yr aged cheddar cheese, topped with a melt in your mouth bun...(potato maybe) Damn my mouth is watering talking about it.....The fries that came with it were good too, large steak fries with mild seasoning.  Sorry the burger was so good, the fries were just a side, literally.  Overall, this place is on one of my top burger joints ever.  The excellently prepared burger in combination with craft beers and knowledge friendly service....this is a must eat if you are in the downtown Chicago area.

26.description: Damn...where do I start?The selection of beers is outstanding!!! They have a HUGE assortment of craft beers with good description of each.  Even better the bartender Nic was excellent, had an understanding for the flavors of beer and selected some based on my liking.  Very attentive and just seemed like a nice guy.Now the menu....Extensive list of apps and main entrees, even lots of vegetarian options.  I tried the burger for $18, and it was worth every penny.  The components are divine, and the combination of the bread, mayo, and the meat itself......oh my good.  This burger had a unique crisp along the outside and was perfectly cooked medium on the inside.  It was like nothing I had ever had before....truly remarkable...the crispy outside of the meat, drenched in 4yr aged cheddar cheese, topped with a melt in your mouth bun...(potato maybe) Damn my mouth is watering talking about it.....The fries that came with it were good too, large steak fries with mild seasoning.  Sorry the burger was so good, the fries were just a side, literally.  Overall, this place is on one of my top burger joints ever.  The excellently prepared burger in combination with craft beers and knowledge friendly service....this is a must eat if you are in the downtown Chicago area.

25.description: We had brunch at Villain's and it was delicious. We tried the biscuits and gravy, the trout, the scrapple and the hash and all were extremely tasty dishes. Obviously beer is they're specialty, but the bloody mary's are good as well. Overall, the experience was great....really cool restaurant. We will definitely be back.

12.description: Pros: Really enjoyed our evening at Villains! Sat at the bar with my husband on a Saturday around 9pm. We each ordered several beers and a sampler. Great selection of diverse brews we've never had before. We also had the scallop appetizer and 30-day dry aged sirloin; both were delicious. Cons: Food was a little pricey but we attributed that to the fact that it's Chicago. Chairs at the bar are incredibly uncomfortable.Overall - We'd visit again!

59.description: Living close by, my husband and I have been awaiting the opening of Villains for quite some time. That being said, they exceeded our expectations! You won't find these beers anywhere else, and the burger was out of this world! Definitely a must try, and a great Printer's Row addition!

21.description: Had visited this place about 3-4 months ago. The food was mediocre. The fries were all over salted to the point where we could eat. I had ordered a fish dish which I didn't enjoy. It was over salted. My husband ordered a burger which he said was ok as well.

17.description: Our expectations were high.  Villians didn't come close to meeting them.  In the new location they've ventured away from standard pub fare, which was a mistake.  They're having trouble measuring up on everything else.The new space is dark, cold, barely decorated, noise, no ambiance.

10.description: Best burger ever!!! Love their beer selection... Need 2 stomachs... Definitely be back!!!

5.description: I'm not sure where to really go with this review and it's taken me a few weeks to think about how I wanted to write it. I purposely waited a bit after my experience cause I was so disappointed. As a long time Printers Row/South Loop resident, I admittedly had high expectations for Villains. Not in the sense that I wanted a new place to go, but in the sense that this section of Clark is going through a rebirth. Places like First Draft, the new condos, and now Villains will hopefully bring this section of Printers Row up to the standard that exists two streets over on Dearborn. I'd comment on Blackies as a contributor, but that's just hopeless. I was a bit disappointed in my first visit. First, the menu is highly complicated for the customers in this neighborhood. I get that they are trying to be "organic," "local," "authentic midwestern," etc, but come on, when the cheese plate and the burger are the only things recognizable on the menu, there is a problem.  My wife order the cheese plate since she wasn't feeling the burger but nobody seemed to really know what the cheeses were. Their response was "this is an international one." The Fromage Gods are shuttering! While my burger was good, it wasn't great considering the price point. Yeah yeah, I get that it that the burgers are hand made, but I'm not paying that much for bacon cheese burger. I will say the beer menu was extensive, although somewhat unrecognizable. Across the street at First Draft you find 60+ taps of names you know and love. The same thing is true for Bar Louie, Kaseys, Hackneys, and even Flacos. At Villains, it's a crap shoot. You order one and hopefully it meets your expectations. However, again, like the burger, the prices were high. Well, according to the management, not high enough since they crossed out the old prices and hand wrote in higher ones in pen (note my photo of the beer menu with the magically changed prices).   The service was spotty at best, which is shocking since they don't really seem busy. I get that they just opened, but when the staff gloats that they "worked at the old Villains" and have a "fantastic chef" there is a certain expectation of competency that they failed to exhibit. Don't hype yourself up until you're ready! This is a tough f&b town and many of us despise arrogance in our dining and drinking experience. Take the humble road and you'll be successful. Finally, I wish Villains good luck. With some minor changes, they could be a wonderful addition to Clark St and Printers Row as a whole.

3.description: Went to Villains for the first time 1/23/16.  We stopped in before a show at Chicago Theater for dinner and beer or two.  I read the reviews and saw some mixed opinions, decided the beer list was worth it so we went.  So here's my take on Villains using lists of things I liked versus disliked. What I liked:1.  Great selection of Imperial Stouts2.  Service was awesome3.  Atmosphere and decor4.  Food was good overallWhat I didn't like:1.  While the Imperial Stout selection in numbers was impressive, I felt like there was a big drop off in quality from the good ones to the rest.  I did a flight of just Imperial Stout.  They do have a couple outstanding Stouts just the same.2.  Music was what you'd find in a trendy restaurant, not exactly my taste.3.  Food was just good not great.  Overall, I'd say my experience here was average.  The burger is good and not great, and the fries on the side are the same.  Beer list is good overall but I felt the quality was lacking in the middle tier of quality.  Would I go back?  Yes I'd probably return, but I would not seek it out again for dinner.

35.description: I have been to Villains five or six times, and have always enjoyed the food and drink.  I stopped in Sunday to try the brunch, and they still had a lot of beers from the Ballast Point event.  The oyster sandwich was excellent - the oysters were fried but still tasted like seafood and were topped soft eggs, spicy salsa and radish garnish.  I have had the vegetarian dish, fish dish, burger, charcuterie... the menu changes regularly. Everything tastes really good and the portions are the right size.  The beer selection is atypical, and they have had a lot of Scandinavian breweries.

19.description: Walking in I had high expectations for this reborn south loop restaurant.  I was a little more than worried that my fantastic Monday night memories of delicious burgers and beer would be ruined.  I was definitely wrong.Here's the pro... the burger was freaking awesome.  One of the best tasting burgers in the city.  The bacon & onion gave the burger an incredible unique smokey flavor that I haven't had before.  To top that, the aged cheddar was a great compliment to the rest of the burger.  I would definitely order it again.That being said... the burger and fries was $16. I walked away spending $42 on burger and fries for my wife and I.  Seems like a little much for 2 burgers.  The fries were nothing special and my wife's burger was a little under-cooked for her medium-well order.

28.description: Meh. Limited menu options. Inattentive service. Overpriced. Many interesting beers on draft, if that's your thing.

45.description: If you're looking for shitty bar food, or poorly executed gastropub eats, you won't find it here.Many of the complaints below are that the food is too obscure. Spring peas, turnips, argula, roasted chickens, steaks, and pork belly isn't 'obscure' last I heard. Actually, the cats here are making local, organic, seasonal food as approachable as possible. With a cool environment with a hint of edge and a beer in hand, why not go for the walleye? If that's not up your alley, maybe some fries and the cheese plate. I'm sure you've heard of those.

33.description: I walk by here every day between 7 and 8 at night, and oh how sad and desolate it looks from the outside, now that people have gone here and spread the word about this place.I went here twice just to be sure.  The service was lacking both times, a combination of inexperienced wait staff and being ignored too much.  The first time I went they were out of hamburger meat (yeesh), so I settled for their off-menu pork chops that the server suggested to me last after everyone else I was with had already ordered.  So it's not like they were pushing the special or anything. It was ok. Not good, but ok.Second time I went here I got my burger, but only after one of the chefs/cooks came out and advised me that this place is "not just a burger joint" and that I should consider something else on the menu as well.  Hmm... sounds like the people have spoken and you don't like what you're hearing, buddy.  Burger was actually good.  Burger + 1 beer + tip = $30 is absolutely ridiculous.Menu selection is too eccentric for it's own vibe, and the neighborhood.  I'm not a beer drinker so I don't care they only serve beer from one brewer, but my friends who do drink beer seem to take exception to this.  Seriously consider changing/expanding your menu, or you know, keep your nose held high while everyone eats somewhere else. What you're going for now is ok.  Not good, just ok. +1 for interior design.

43.description: So... Huge fan of "old Villains" and now I am huge fan of "new Villains."  Initially, I was under the impression that they would only serve Mikkeller Beer.  Yes it is great but it comes from afar and there are so many great local options.  My concerns where eliminated upon my second visit when I found all my favorites on tap. My wife and I tried the scallops which was a great choice.  Perfectly cooked and the perfect temp (scallops can be tricky).  Looking forward to going back for the burger that everyone is raving about.  One suggestion... They should have a "old villains" week.  Bring back the tots and the Motherload Burger if only for a limited time only.

2.description: This is a solid place.  Not the best in the area, but for sure not the worst.  Went here and was almost overwhelmed by the beer selection.  It isn't huge by any stretch, it is just for such a small place in the Loop, it was unexpected.  This place has a huge stout collection, so if you are a fan or darker, richer, and more flavorful beers, you'll be in heaven here.  Atmosphere isn't bad.  Very, VERY dimly lit, more light comes from outside than there is light inside.  Staff are friendly but not overall attentive and overbearing.  If you ask for advice or questions they will answer, but they aren't overly friendly and helpful.  That kind of if you know great, if you don't know what you want, we will give it a shot, but not go out of our way.

18.description: Every once in a while you stroll by a restaurant that catches your eye and peaks your interest...  This restaurant has perfected one of the most amazing, flavorful, and juicy burgers that Chicago has to offer.  They only have it Monday evenings.   The head chef put his heart and soul into this creation.  I've eaten at hundreds of burger joints and I have to say they've raised the bar quite high with their quality and presentation.  The beer selection is impressive to pair with your dinner.  Overall this place is great to bring a date or have a bunch of friends.  I highly recommend it!

41.description: To the people complaining about high prices or a menu they cannot read, go back to Hooters or some other run down bar. While their menu is not extensive, their food is delicious. Prices are higher than average, but was not dissapointes. Service was great, the beer was delicious of course, and the burger and sirloin we had for dinner did nor dissapoint. Will be coming back to try out the apps (and more beer).

52.description: Would not recommend and will not be going back anytime soon. Way overpriced for what you get. I ordered a glass of wine and there was hardly any wine in the glass...while the wine tasted good I would have enjoyed a full glass of it. Had to send my steak back after undercooking...just overall a bad experience.

50.description: Wonderful.  Try it!  You won't regret it!

4.description: Great find in the South Loop:  Villain's is a really swank beer bar with new American/neo-French cuisine and a lovely design aesthetic.  Service is terrific and helpful, steering you through an impressive selection of beers.  The food isn't bad, but it's got some problems; the portions are small, and the potato leek soup was lukewarm and haphazardly executed.  The cheese and charcuterie were well-done, though, and the main draws -- the outstanding beer list (all available in flights, as well) and the atmosphere -- are almost flawless.  I'll definitely be back.

6.description: The selection of beers here is exceptional.  Last night, I tried several options with a flight.  All were delicious.  I started with the Bomb and moved on to try other drinks including the Pumpkin Lager and Shipwreck Porter.  Of note, the Big Worster is a fun choice, as it has 17.3% alcohol content.  It's one of my husband's favorites.  The food here is delicious but the serving sizes are generally small in my past experiences here, especially for the appetizers.  The ambience and service are great.  We will likely be coming back, and we recommend it.

22.description: The selection of beers here is exceptional.  Last night, I tried several options with a flight.  All were delicious.  I started with the Bomb and moved on to try other drinks including the Pumpkin Lager and Shipwreck Porter.  Of note, the Big Worster is a fun choice, as it has 17.3% alcohol content.  It's one of my husband's favorites.  The food here is delicious but the serving sizes are generally small in my past experiences here, especially for the appetizers.  The ambience and service are great.  We will likely be coming back, and we recommend it.

15.description: Pro: great selection of beer. As a stout fan, this place is definitely a must visit place for me. The servers were very attentive and seemed to be knowledgeable about their selection. Con: Food is disappointing for the price. We ordered the burger as entrees. The meat patty is a little bland, which might be better if there's more thought put into the marinating process. Overall,  the burger didn't meet the price tag of $16.

57.description: They just opened so hopefully they will pull it together.  My reference point for the visit was the old Villains and Three Aces a wonderful craft food and beer mecca that strikes the right balance nearby in Little Italy.The space is beautiful and worth a visit for the aesthetics alone.  The handwritten beer list is an awesome sight even if illegible. Unfortunately most of the rest of the experience feels like a novelty act - a peculiar beer menu dominated by selections from a couple of Danish Brewery's that make American style craft beers that you can get from dozens of great local breweries - Revolution, Ale Syndicate, Metropolitan, Bell's, etc. Another former Villains regular theorizes that they are in a hassle with the local distributor.  Pretty standard stuff for Chicago. I didn't dip into the food on this visit but it is limited and expensive - a solo burger sits in the accessible slot for those wanting to give Villains a try.  All in all it feels like after the long wait that the new Villains is trying way to hard to stand out in Chicago's increasingly crowded craft beer and food scene.  I will be back for the burger and another crack at the beer list but my regular stops in the area will continue to be at Three Aces, First Draft and the recently opened Burger Bar.

20.description: I'm always excited to see a new bar/restaurant open in the south loop, and Villains was no exception. It's conveniently located near the Harrison redline station, so getting there is easy. Once you're there, the ambiance is warm and sultry, and the service is friendly and prompt. They've got a great a drink  menu including  my fall favorite Pumking. The food menu is full of locally grown/raised food, and features a list of their partner farms, which I love. The main problem were the prices and the variety. I think they could use a few more reasonably priced items: throw some Pom frites on there - everybody eats them and all the farms have potatoes. I get it, there's a fancy demographic moving to the area, but until the area develops more, I think the menu could be a bit more accessible. It's not outrageous, just slightly overpriced I. My personal opinion. And I couldn't bring myself to order a $16 burger with Blackies across the street. I'll be back again for a cocktail with friends for sure.

36.description: This is our go-to spot for any occasion or lack thereof - we can be found at Villain's whenever friends come to town, or simply on a Friday night to go sit up at the bar and split a burger and opine over the extensive beer list.  We were regulars of the old Villain's as well and are so happy that we have the same long beer menu to pore over as with the old.  I love seeing what their rotating seasonal menu brings and trying the new offerings when they become available.

14.description: I haven't had a better burger in Chicago than the one I had here. Amazing! However, it might be the only dinner item that doesn't seem a tad overpriced. I love the ability to do flights of beer since they have so many beer options. The winter list has been pretty stout and saison heavy, so it has been tough for some of my friends to find a pale ale/lighter option although they do offer wine and cocktails as well. I love the wood decor. Since they've opened we haven't had trouble getting a  table here ever. The bar is pretty small so that can be hit or miss if you just want drinks.

58.description: Delicious food. TERRIBLE service. Their juices and smoothies are terrific and their crepes and french toast were great! But the waitress was horrible! She left before taking our whole parties drink orders and rolled her eyes and corrected me when I misspoke and said "berry crepe" instead of "mixed berry crepe." She was rude in all interactions and overall made the dining experience unpleasant.Would recommend the food if you didn't have to deal with the people.

56.description: Tried this place for the first time yesterday as I just moved to the South Loop/Printer's Row area. Huge menu with lots of options for everyone, including vegetarians (went with my sister and she does not eat meat). I have the chorizo jalapeno breakfast bowl which was delicious. A little pricey at $15 but turned out to be a huge serving. Mimosa was good but expensive as well at $10. Food was brought out quickly but ended up waiting for the waitress for 10-15 min to get a check and then another 10 minutes for them to pick it up which is the reason I knocked it down a star. It wasn't busy at all (noon on a weekday) so no excuse for slow service.

29.description: Another divine brunch this morning with a friend here.  I ordered the salsa stacker today, which was delicious.  It had an English muffin topped with tofu, zucchini, red peppers, salsa, and avocados.  The serving was plentiful and filling, and it was decently priced.  I highly recommend this restaurant, especially for brunch.

42.description: Excellent service, great customer service, the food was delicious. I loved the staff, I got to meet all of them and they where from different countries and so nice to talk to! The general manager was had so much expertise and so friendly. I found out the jam was made by the chef, that was delicious! And the house coffee was good!

23.description: Came here when a bunch of my college friends were in town and while the food was good the poor service knocks this place down to 2 stars.It took about 15 minutes after we were seated for our waitress to come over to take our drink orders. It took another 15-20 minutes for us to get our drinks and when the Bloody Mary's came to the table the busser had no idea which Bloody Mary was which, so my friends and I had to spend time investigating the contents of each drink to determine which belong to whom. The same thing happened when our food was delivered to our table. We had three orders of French Toast and two looked damn near identical. When we asked which was which the busser gave us the "how the hell should I know look" and said she didn't know. You would think that someone delivering food to a table of 9  would know what dish was what so that the correct person could get the food they had ordered.In terms of the food, 90% of us enjoyed what we had ordered. I probably won't come here again because of the service. I didn't like having to spend 11,000 seconds trying to figure out which dish was which because the people working here couldn't help us figure it out.Food we had*Chicken and Waffles - the chicken was juicy and crispy. *Breakfast Tacos - must try. So good and filling.*Elvis French Toast - hated it. I am not a fan of peanut butter unless there's jelly so I don't know why I got this. My own fault.*Cookie French Toast - this was a special menu item and it was delicious. *Cornbread French Toast - this was a special menu item and my friend said it was good, but there was a little too much corn for her liking.

47.description: The food here was fairly good, but the service was so unacceptable the food was ruined: Asked for warmed skim milk with coffee, which came cold five minutes after the coffee which was barely warm to start with. Served scrambled eggs were cold. Informing the waitress, she offered to microwave the dish. My sister sat with barely touched cold coffee and cold eggs, which was of no interest to the staff. I guess there's always more tourists. Maybe the second time in my longish life that I tipped 10%

8.description: Had a great time with my 9yr old daughter. Only giving it 4 stars because we were seated near the entrance and every time the door was open a very cold breeze would rudely enter. Chicago weather on this particular Saturday was 5°F not including wind chill.

31.description: Love the place, love the food, ambiance, love the vegan and vegetarian options! The only thing that you should really focus on improving is SERVICE!!! We've been there 4 times now, and we always get waitresses with no service attitude, that you literally need to interrupt their chatting to call their attention.

34.description: I believe this is the third Meli location that I have been to, and it's been very consistent. This location is a bit trendier and more contemporary since it is downtown. The food is delish. I got the Meli salad and it was better than I thought it would be. It was slightly deceptive because the presentation gave me the impression that I might not be full, but that was not the case at all. Service was a little slow, but eventually we got the check.

16.description: My favorite breakfast spot. There's usually no wait, the bloody marys and mimosas are good and the food is excellent. I love the spicy omelets- the Spicy Flamenco omelet, chicken omelet and ghost pepper omelet are my favorites. They also have quite a few vegan options and they're daily specials are always interesting and tasty! The Greek town location is also good, but no alcoholic beverages there.

13.description: Another divine brunch this morning with a friend here.  I ordered the salsa stacker today, which was delicious.  It had an English muffin topped with tofu, zucchini, red peppers, salsa, and avocados.  The serving was plentiful and filling, and it was decently priced.  I highly recommend this restaurant, especially for brunch.

11.description: I am having a salmon salad and there are gnats flying all over the bread they brought to the table. The waitresses are very rude when I brought this to their attention.

39.description: This is a great casual spot for brunch, lunch, or even dinner. The menu is extensive, the ambiance is cute (think "upscale trendy diner", LOL), and the food is fabulous. I am a sucker for breakfast food and am a huge fan of the cinnamon apple crepes. The lunch items look great, too, especially the fries. Service is efficient and friendly, though maybe a tad disorganized (multiple servers were assigned to our table, causing some confusion for everyone). Prices are higher than the average diner but you get what you pay for in terms of quality and generous portion size. I highly recommend.

37.description: This is a cute little place that was next to my hotel.  I didn't know they were connected until after I walked out and down the block and saw I could have easily gone through the lobby.  For a brunch time Saturday, they were relatively busy but I easily found seating at the bar.  The staff were attentive while busy preparing others drink orders - which looked quite tasty!!  They checked in without constantly asking me if I needed anything.  I was entertained as they made different kinds of cocktails and smoothies - the things people request!!I ordered the breakfast quesadilla and it was AMAZING!!!  The plate was as big as my head and there was no way I could have finished it - a full quesadilla with a side of chopped red potatoes.  However, I did make many attempts.  Everything was seasonly perfectly which made it hard to stop eating - it was just that good.  I would highly recommend this spot to folks looking for a lively, open, airy spot for themselves or for a few of your friends.

0.description: Great brunch menu! I ordered Cafe Eggs Benedict and it was delicious. It does have pork belly in it so you have to OK with pork. Pork had good flavor and hollandaise sauce was the perfect consistency and flavor. It came with red potatoes, which were well seasoned and tasteful. They MAKE THEIR OWN KETCHUP! Which I thought was pretty cool and delicious. My friends ordered the Brioche French Toast and Farmers Bowl, which both looked and tasted amazing as well. Overall, great place to eat if you're looking for a nicer brunch. It was a little pricey ($13-15/meal) and the alcoholic beverages seemed extravagant when it came to the pricing as well for a small glass; nonetheless, you wouldn't just go here for the alcohol, but their food!

38.description: A tip to ALL hostesses, please before you seat someone make sure there's someone servicing the table.  There were at least 5+ waitresses walking around. I was alone waited 10min even after 2 parties came in after me was seated, waited on & given coffee. I watched now I'm irritated. But at least I got a glass if water from the busser. I flagged him down to get the manager. I got the attention of the manager. Finally the waitress NOT MINE waits on me. I ordered they got that wrong. In my head "since I don't have a waitress I guess no one will bring me a bill". Or " maybe i should flag down the bussers they're always attentive & around" LOL I'm trying to make light of the situation & not destroy my bksft experience. At the end still never knew who my waitress was. YES my meal was comp but the SERVICE IS JUST AS IMPORTANT AS THE MEAL....

51.description: The service was....weird. I can't tell if my waitress was angry or confused. I paid 12 bucks for a french toast that tasted like cardboard and then 5 dollars for a side of two eggs. I went with a party of 6 and the payment process was super weird. They gave us each a check for our plate but then said they could only take 4 cards. It was all just very weird and uncomfortable. I could have paid 8 bucks for a better tasting breakfast anywhere else!

27.description: Food - Food was awesome, I got the jalapeño bowl which was chorizo with eggs, jalapenos, onions, pepper jack cheese. The food was full of flavor and spicy. Toast had a sweet taste which made the food more enjoyable.Service - Our waitress was unhappy from the moment we saw her. She was short and cocked a bit of an attitude. It seems the general feel from anyone working here is unhappy, and it really kills the vibe and atmosphere.Timeliness - Whether our waitress forgot to place the order for waffles, or they were just that slow, one of my friends received her waffles as I finished my Jalapeño bowl. It took about 30 minutes for them to get the waffles out and there was no genuine apology or any kind of compensation.Atmosphere - Really the typical modern feel, not anything spectacularOverall - I really liked the food but I will not be coming back here again and will discourage people in the future. The service was bad enough for me to not even want to bother. There are so many brunch places in the South Loop area and they have all been very friendly and nice even if the food was sub-par. I would stick to those.Service - 0/2Food - 2/2Atmosphere - 0/1

32.description: Eh, this place was ok. We came for breakfast on a Sunday morning around 9 and had no problem getting a table. We sat at the bar. The food was pretty good--- i got the avocado toast and the husband got the breakfast tacos. Portions were HUGE. Almost laughable really.... But it wasn't cheap so I guess it's nice that you get a lot of food. Tab for us was about 40 between two coffees and food. My main issue with this place was the service. Zero smiles, zero small talk, very little interaction with the woman behind the bar besides "are you ready to order" and "can we get the check".  I would give her a pass if she was slammed but the place wasn't very crowded. The other servers seemed to have the same attitude, a little robotic. The place felt a little sterile to be honest. So if you're in the neighborhood--- decent food but don't expect much in the way of service. Id probably wait at wildberry.

54.description: Went with a group of friends for brunch and really enjoyed the place and food was very good. Came highly recommended and met the expectations. Had the avocado toast. Was good but maybe a little less chili flakes next time. Will be coming back for brunch again to try some of the other items.

48.description: Food is good and the venue has a modern and open ambience.  The hostess does not smile, mind you.  But our table attendant was efficient and soft spoken.

44.description: Just saw this place around the corner and looked good so decided to try. Everything was ok, the eggs, potato's. The sausage was really good. But the pancakes are a no go. So if you go, just don't order pancakes!

24.description: The the food and the service were good. I don't understand while the restaurants overall rating isn't higher.

7.description: One of the best brunch place in South loop. Menu was like a novel (good way). Lot's of choices. They don't have a wheelchair ramps. If you have a stroller someone has to help for lifting the stoller with you. Inside was nice and spacious. No comments about the food ;)

49.description: It's nothing great but you get tons of food for the price. The wraps and smoothie was good. Our waiter wasn't to friendly and barely saw her. I would pass on this restaurant and go somewhere cheaper. But if you want smoothies this is place to go.

40.description: Amazing food, coffee, jam, juice. Terrible service. It was was almost entertaining. Waitress asked us for a pen, forgot numerous items, etc.

53.description: The food was fantastic, however I have only been there for breakfast and brunch. I highly recommend any of the Benedict options. My favorite is Hash Benedict followed by the Cafe Benedict. The reason I am giving the place 3 stars is because the service is a hit or miss. Slow refills is the common problem I encounter.

30.description: Cute spot in Printers Row. Popped in on a Saturday around the lunch hour, and it was surprisingly crowded. My Dad and I sat at the bar and enjoyed a cup of coffee. Ambience was nice and even though it was crowded, we were able to chat without yelling. The hostess and Bartender were very nice!

46.description: Delicious food! Good service. Will return, fo' sho'Falafel and beer. Who could ask for more?

1.description: How does a place go down hill so quickly?First, when Meli Cafe opened on the corner of Dearborn they did everything right. They opened the windows, had a pretty diverse menu, and made their establishment look modern, elegant, and comfortable to attract the yuppie population of the Printers Row / South Loop area and beyond. Well, the problem is that the busier they became the worse their food and service became as well. On any given Sunday you will see a crowd of people standing in their lobby and outside of their doors waiting upwards of 60 minutes to be called in for a table - for what "breakfast food"? The last three times I've eaten here the food has been progressively worse. Yesterday, my friend and I attempted to dine here. Notice the word "attempted" in this sentence, because I ordered an omelette and my friend ordered a flat-bread dish. After 40 minutes our food was not served, so my friend insisted that the waitress bring out my food even if hers wasn't ready. I said,"Why would my food be ready, if I ordered an omelet there's no way they cooked mine first if we are at the same table, right?"  Moments later the waitress delivered a cold omelet to my table and dried out potatoes that looked like they were the left overs from someone else's plate. I mentioned that the food was cold and the waitress just stood there like her IQ was below average with a blank stare on her face. Not wanting to rock the boat, I ate the omelet and made the decision - okay, I'm not coming back here again. 30 minutes later - YES, we are talking one hour and ten minutes later my friend finally said,"I'd like to cancel the flat-bread it's been over an hour and it's still not out." The waitresses in an very unconcerned tone said,"Okay." No apology, no offer to resolve it, nor did they offer to get the manager to see if there was something they could do to save the experience. I paid my bill for the cold omelet, and tipped and walked out - never to return again. My friend left hungry and decided to eat elsewhere. Here's the clincher they weren't even busy! They had more staff walking around than they had customers. This incident occurred at 3:30 pm when they had no more than six customers in the entire place, so what else were they doing if they weren't preparing food? The real problem here is when a business starts making large amounts of money, generating a lot of buzz, selling out tables week after week they get a little foolish and start thinking their place will always be as busy as it once was - false! Several people that I know experienced the same thing and I'm under the impression that they won't be doing so well in the coming months. Customers have options the decor, table cloths and nicely painted walls won't convince them to spend $20 for a cold omelet and bad service - get smart Meli Cafe or you will be closed soon!

55.description: I'm giving them a 3 for extremely slow service and no smiles.  Food is great.  I had one of their egg breakfasts with bacon, toast and potstoes.  So delish and well seasoned.  I highly recommend this restaurant despite poor service.  They would get 5 stars from me if their service improved greatly.

9.description: yummy yummy yummy chicken and waffles! This is the first place I've been that actually seasons and puts BACON into the waffles. YES, I SAID BACON! WHOA! The chicken is always fried to perfection. Living in miami, there are really no good chicken and waffles places. I remember looking forward to my trips to chicago for this little piece of food heaven.

26.description: The food was delicious! Try the cornbread French toast for sure! The only disappointing factor were the mimosas. We tried four different types and it took way too much time. The mimosas barely beat the food out. One had a fly in it and two tasted terrible. The waitress comped the two mimosas because we didn't drink them. Best advice go for the food, but they really need to work on bartending speed and quality of the drinks.

25.description: We went there on a Sunday morning! We didn't have to wait much, for 5 mins which was great.The restaurant is so classy, fancy. Loved the decoration, the atmosphere. People were high-class. The food was great especially the omelette. The crepe was not as expected, we ordered the chocolate infused crepe with strawberry, it wasn't that good I would give it 5/10. I had a way better ones in a cheaper places.Pricing wise, I can tell you that it's a bit over priced. It's on the high end of pricing. You should expect to pay 20 - 25 $ per person for breakfast . The coffee was normal, not superb. The mimosa was great thought to be fair. Overall, it was a good pleasant experience, I would definitely come back.

12.description: Meli has great food. But, this is my favorite out of their three locations because unlike the other two, this one actually serves dinner as well. The other two locations only have breakfast and lunch and they close at 3:00 PM. This location closes at 10:00 PM. I wish that the other two Meli locations were open for dinner as well because their dinner is just as good as their breakfast and lunch.

59.description: Meli was an amazing brunch experience. I came on a weekday and we were seated almost immediately. The flavors are very unique and I would definitely come back.I ordered the Banana Bread French Toast. It was fantastic, heavy as you would expect, but I did wish that there was a little more nuttiness as well as crisp on the edges. But I would highly recommend this dish as one to share, very unique.The Pork Belly Benedict was also great. Flavors were better than the banana bread in my opinion. Egg was cooked perfectly.Our service was good and the food what we expected.

21.description: This might be my favorite brunch place in the city. You just have to expect un-interested wait staff.Breakfast:The chicken and waffles is my favorite in the city because the herbed waffle is outstanding. And the bread pudding pancakes are insanely good. The Elvis is okay but is really better in small portions, and eaten a day later in the fridge.My wife loves the cured salmon crepe, but I would never order it again, I found it unappetizing.I've also had a black bean southwestern type breakfast special that was disappointing.Lunch:The goat cheese wrap is excellent and all I've tried (although don't get the pasta salad as your side, it's like grade-school cafeteria quality).

17.description: I've been here several times and have really enjoyed this place.  Huge portions at fair prices with a ton of variety!  What more could you want?  (I suppose the service could be a bit better, but I haven't had any huge issues other than inattentive servers).  In any event, try the caprese wrap!

10.description: The Eggs Benedict were fantastic.Ample seating, nice atmosphere. It's close to where I live definitely coming back!

5.description: I really enjoyed breakfast here.  I ordered the breakfast tacos - Warm corn tortillas, eggs, chicken chorizo, cilantro, pepper jack, pico de gallo, chipotle aioli. Served with baby reds.  Loved everything about this meal.  The flavors worked really well together, portions were good and would order this again and again.  My mimosa was really good too.  My son got chocolate chip pancakes and he liked them.  He really didn't like his fresh squeezed apple juice though.  His still-developing palate is used to Mott's.  This was very thick and unfiltered juice.  I drank it on his behalf.  It was ok.  Can't wait to come back!

3.description: Came here when a bunch of my college friends were in town and while the food was good the poor service knocks this place down to 2 stars.It took about 15 minutes after we were seated for our waitress to come over to take our drink orders. It took another 15-20 minutes for us to get our drinks and when the Bloody Mary's came to the table the busser had no idea which Bloody Mary was which, so my friends and I had to spend time investigating the contents of each drink to determine which belong to whom. The same thing happened when our food was delivered to our table. We had three orders of French Toast and two looked damn near identical. When we asked which was which the busser gave us the "how the hell should I know look" and said she didn't know. You would think that someone delivering food to a table of 9  would know what dish was what so that the correct person could get the food they had ordered.In terms of the food, 90% of us enjoyed what we had ordered. I probably won't come here again because of the service. I didn't like having to spend 11,000 seconds trying to figure out which dish was which because the people working here couldn't help us figure it out.Food we had*Chicken and Waffles - the chicken was juicy and crispy. *Breakfast Tacos - must try. So good and filling.*Elvis French Toast - hated it. I am not a fan of peanut butter unless there's jelly so I don't know why I got this. My own fault.*Cookie French Toast - this was a special menu item and it was delicious. *Cornbread French Toast - this was a special menu item and my friend said it was good, but there was a little too much corn for her liking.

35.description: Love this place sooo much. Bfast anytime with lots of veggies and fantastic fruit-veggie juices/smoothies or alcohol, depending on the day. With convenient hours starting at 5am!!

19.description: We went there on a Sunday morning! We didn't have to wait much, for 5 mins which was great.The restaurant is so classy, fancy. Loved the decoration, the atmosphere. People were high-class. The food was great especially the omelette. The crepe was not as expected, we ordered the chocolate infused crepe with strawberry, it wasn't that good I would give it 5/10. I had a way better ones in a cheaper places.Pricing wise, I can tell you that it's a bit over priced. It's on the high end of pricing. You should expect to pay 20 - 25 $ per person for breakfast . The coffee was normal, not superb. The mimosa was great thought to be fair. Overall, it was a good pleasant experience, I would definitely come back.

28.description: Meli cafe is trash. I live around the corner so I've given it a few chances. The first time was disappointing, second time disappointing, third time -disaster. Their food is mediocre at best but way over priced. The last time I even bothered to give this tourist trap establishment my money, it was because my parents were in town and all other breakfast restaurants had hour and a half long waits while Meli only had a 30 minute wait. So we go and we get on the list and we see other families of three get on the list behind it. Of course 3 other families get seated before us of the same number. At this point I'm getting heated so I go in and ask about our position on the list and the hostess looks flustered and says "you should be next" as if she noticed the mistake. So we get seated in the next few minutes and we're put next the loudest table of couples you could imagine. Ordered coffee, never got coffee. Ordered eggs Benedict, the dish was poorly seasoned. It took forever to get our check but when we did, we were out of there.The only thing that Meli does right is when you order you a specific way, your food will come that way. Like my dad is on a strict diet so when he asked for an omelet cooked with no oil and no roasted red peppers. He got that. Cool, if you actually read this whole review, I suggest you not go here and go anywhere else like Le Pain Quotidien (upscale good food) or even Toast (lower scale better price for the quality) is better than this trash.

45.description: This place is amazing! Ari, is amazing and we ate here 6 times, lunch, breakfast, and late dinner, all with excellent service, consistently spot on food, and bar drinks including said pressed juices at a discounted price compared to hipster shitholes. Relatively stuck up clown free, and the eastern european waitresses make the place a fresh of unpretentious deliciousness, boo to the hipster American clowns who gave this place bad reviews for service, go eat at Ihop you suburb creatures!

33.description: A little gem in Printer's Row, where brunch options are still sparse.  Although the space is small, there are rarely the sort of lines that you'll encounter on a weekend morning at the original Greektown location.  Unfortunately, unlike the Greektown location, the "homemade" jams don't appear homemade and seem to be limited to strawberry and strawberry.  The chicken and waffles is generally a treat worth the calorie splurge...  perfectly seasoned and sometimes-crispy fried chicken pieces (boneless tenders, not actual legs or wings) with bacon maple syrup and herbed waffles.  Solid strawberry french toast for those who prefer dessert for breakfast.  Eggs are well-done whether the request is for sunny side up, over easy or over medium.The service isn't overly friendly, but it's not unfriendly and it's very accommodating.  You'd prefer your french toast stuffed?  No problem.  You'd prefer feta to mozzarella?  Done.  You want your cappuccino with 2%?  We'll mix whole and skim for you.

43.description: The first impression I had when visiting was: Wow, this place is gorgeous.  The interior design was very modern and welcoming for a morning brunch.  The first time I visited I ordered the café benedict which both looked and tasted good.  The second time I ordered a do-sant sandwich and a kiwi juice, both of which were delicious.  Both times the service was fine, no complaints there.  Meli Café is a little pricey compared to most other brunch places but overall I still recommend it to those willing to pay a little extra for a quality brunch.

2.description: Came here on Valentine's Day so a bit of a wait was given but we were seated after around like 30 minutes, which we didn't mind at all. The seating is quite tight and the tables are a bit small, so don't expect a great deal of privacy. My boyfriend and I ordered the Artichoke Benedict off the Daily Specials menu and the Yuppie Breakfast bowl. Both of the dishes were just okay, nothing surprisingly delicious and would make me want to come back. The Artichoke was tender and the potatoes were tasty but you can't really go wrong with roasted potatoes. The Yuppie Breakfast Bowl had kale, mushrooms, and chicken sausage slices, but still lacked seasoning. Our server was very inattentive and not very friendly. Not once did we see a smile. You would think that on such a busy holiday, they would want to get customers in and out as quickly as possible, but we had to flag her down for everything in order to get what we wanted.

18.description: Not only is this place gorgeous, the food is amazing too!  I had the banana bread french toast and my wife had the jalapeno bowl.  I could barely put my drink down before she had finished half of her dish.  Banana bread french toast was amazing, and the drinks were too. Definitely coming back!

41.description: Environment, layout, interior design was pretty nice. Waitress wasn't very nice. The french toast didn't have any taste of egg on it. If you like that, then I guess that woudn't be a deterrent for you. Prices for food ranged mostly from $10-$14.. which is alright given the area. It wasn't a terrible experience, but I wouldn't go back. If you're in the loop, Wildberry is better.

52.description: I go here in a pinch or if it's on my way. The servers always seem a bit inconvenienced, or ready to finish shift, or anxious to close up. And one or two don't know the menu and get orders wrong. They seem to work hard to shoo customers out around 9-10. So kinda mixed bag. The food's good, but ultimately this place could be so much better but seems to be mismanaged and staffed in a really strange way.

50.description: This place has the best breakfast menu- my husband described their scrambled eggs as "little buttery clouds of heaven". Everything I tried was delicious. We were in town for four days and this was the meal of the day- one day we strayed..wish we went back to Meli cafe!

4.description: Wahhhhh, how have I not reviewed this place yet? I guess it's easy to forget since I have reviewed their original location over in Greektown, but this location is my go-to spot now since it's much closer to home. For visitors to Printer's Row, it might be hard to find parking, but at least it's close to the 22 and Harrison Red Line.Much like the other location, it's all about the brunch specials here (never been here for lunch or dinner, though I should try it). Now I know it's kind of common knowledge that you should avoid specials on menus since that's how some places get rid of surplus ingredients. Here though, the specials change daily and really tend to stand out. And even if none of the specials stand out to you, you can't go wrong with one of their cheesy breakfast bowls.While the tables are a bit on the small side, you can't beat the decor or the large windows. It's weird that they've converted a former fancy hotel restaurant into a brunch spot, but it really works well. It seems like a super fancy place, but it's really just a great casual location of my still reigning champ of breakfast foods.

6.description: Stopped in here on a day added to a work trip. They make all of their juices and even ketchup in house. As you can imagine, this made for an awesome Bloody Mary experience and my husband enjoyed his screw driver with fresh squeezed OJ. I got the Benedict florentine and he had the breakfast tacos. Both delish. The tacos are spicy, really spicy. Only order of you can handle the heat! Service was good and decor was modern and fresh. I'd come back!

22.description: The wait service is atrocious. I've been here twice now, hoping the second time would be better. Never again. The food is nothing special and certainly something you can get anywhere else.

15.description: Love this place... for the most part. They serve breakfast almost at anytime. Their fresh juices are also great!! This place is the ultimate Hangover cure. Be sure to try their Bloody Mary bar. 8 different bloody Mary's. My favorite is the cucumber one.Only negative thing is the music is so weird. Like a mix mash of odd sounds & very hard house music at time. Not at all what I want to hear when eating breakfast. Come for the food & drinks but bring ear muffs if u can.

57.description: My fiancee and I went to Meli Cafe a few weeks ago, looking to watch the NBA finals and have a burger and drink at the bar. The staff were friendly and invited us to come in, but despite having almost no customers it took a long time to find someone to change the channel, and take our order. We each ordered a burger, me the turkey burger with jalapeno coleslaw and my fiancee a beef burger with fries. The burgers were fine but a bit messy, the only problem being that the tomatoes in mine were decidedly mealy which I think should have been evident to an experienced cook. My slaw had no discernible jalapeno, and my fiancee's fries were soggy and oily and we couldn't bring ourselves to do more than try a few before abandoning them. Also challenging was that the plates were narrow ovals each covered with a much larger swath of wax paper. Because they weren't sized or fit together, food or ketchup on the paper would start to drift off the plate and start dribbling on the counter.On the way in, the dessert case had several options that looked good, and we ordered carrot cake and coffee. The carrot cake really was delicious, but they only brought one fork even though we ordered just one dessert between the two of us and specifically mentioned that we were looking to share it. It took a while for the dessert to arrive although it wasn't clear why, given the lack of crowd and the fact that it was coming from the case at the end of the bar. We waited to start eating the dessert until the coffee arrived, but when the bar attendant returned several minutes after bringing the carrot cake, she didn't have any coffee. When we asked her about it, she apologized and mentioned that she simply forgotten the order. She then poured it from the station that was right next to where she was standing when we ordered it the first time.Other things we noticed when we compared notes afterward were that the dessert menu didn't mention many of the items in the dessert case in front, and the chalkboard specials menu had a few misspellings. To be clear, the hostess and staff at the bar were extremely friendly and polite, but the experience accumulated a lot of disappointments that could have been helped by better management and better attention to detail. Given our experience, we were honestly surprised at the many positive reviews it has on Yelp (but at not the spotty service) but perhaps Meli is stronger with brunch, or sometimes its kitchen isn't on its A game.

20.description: I've been here several times and have really enjoyed this place.  Huge portions at fair prices with a ton of variety!  What more could you want?  (I suppose the service could be a bit better, but I haven't had any huge issues other than inattentive servers).  In any event, try the caprese wrap!

36.description: Meli isn't amazing but it's reliable and nice. Pleasant lunch or breakfast place. I've had some hilarious staff interactions, and some weird service experiences, but overall Meli gets the job done.

14.description: Eh, this place was ok. We came for breakfast on a Sunday morning around 9 and had no problem getting a table. We sat at the bar. The food was pretty good--- i got the avocado toast and the husband got the breakfast tacos. Portions were HUGE. Almost laughable really.... But it wasn't cheap so I guess it's nice that you get a lot of food. Tab for us was about 40 between two coffees and food. My main issue with this place was the service. Zero smiles, zero small talk, very little interaction with the woman behind the bar besides "are you ready to order" and "can we get the check".  I would give her a pass if she was slammed but the place wasn't very crowded. The other servers seemed to have the same attitude, a little robotic. The place felt a little sterile to be honest. So if you're in the neighborhood--- decent food but don't expect much in the way of service. Id probably wait at wildberry.

12.description: Top notch bike store!!!! Dennis and Andre were amazingly patient and helpful. Dennis worked within my budget and we walked out of the store with 2 amazing bikes and a wealth full of knowledge. I don't know much about bikes and Dennis and Andre were ever so patient with my questions. I can't say enough good things about this store and Dennis's staff. I will go to them for every bike need I have. Great great great great experience. Thank you!!!!!!

3.description: I've been to On The Route several times from the time they were on south Michigan to now and the service is always excellent. I've had flat tires fixed in 20 minutes and tune ups that pro longed the life of my  trek 7.5.Jeff is the absolute best! He's always kind and efficient and is a pro on everything bike!I've recently purchased by first high end bike a Raleigh Willard 2 cyclocross and it's been nothing short of amazing.

1.description: I commute year round, I can do all basic repairs myself. I can walk the walk and talk the talk. As such, I usually make friends w bike shop employees fairly quickly.Not this place. I have an issue w a crankset, I happened to roll by and went in to ask the guy if he could check the tightness of the crankarm and BB. In my experience, this is something that's done for free, although I'd be willing to pay if necessary.Dude working was almost standoffish when I asked him if he thought it could be an issue of the BB getting wonky or cranks coming undone, with wonderful phrases like "Well, I can't say b/c I don't know the bike's entire history," or "I mean, I'm *just* speculating here, so I'm really not sure." I asked questions of him b/c he's the expert, and every.single.answer I got was chilly, at best. It's just odd to me, b/c I have NEVER experienced this from any of the other 6-8 bike shops I've regularly gone to in my 8 years of living in Chicago. The guy's final suggestion was, if I wanted him to, he could remove the entire BB and crankset, check its tightness and threading, and completely reinstall it.I came in asking him to check the tighness of the crank arm, and he responded by suggesting we totally rip out and reinstall the BB and crankset. That's like going in to check the pressure of the tires in your car, and having the mechanic suggest you buy new tires b/c the pressure is low.That and, $9 inner tubes. I get it, guys, rent is more expensive in Lakeview, but wow. WTF.Normally I'm not one to complain about the attitude of an employee at a bike shop, at all, but this guy supremely rubbed me the wrong way. Never again.

2.description: Friendly and knowledgable service. I was helped as soon as I walked in the door. I believe the owner helped me and he not only gave me a discount for being a first time shopper but gave me great advice.

9.description: I went in twice in the last several weeks to inquire about a new bike and made a purchase on the second time. Dennis, the owner, was extremely courteous and helpful. I already knew which bike I wanted coming in, but the professionalism and respect that Dennis and Jeff displayed was what eventually convinced me to make a purchase at the shop. During my visits, I saw the two of them treat every single customer from different backgrounds of riding with the same respect that they deserve, from the guy with the expensive cyclocross to the old lady with her cruiser bike who was just beginning to ride. Prices are very affordable for brand-new bikes and labor isn't very expensive either. They have a great selection of accessories as well.

10.description: Went in for some tubes, picked up a hat I hadn't seen elsewhere. They guys were friendly and quick. I work nearby and was glad to find this resource, as I commute daily on my bike. I'll be back when I need my bike serviced.

13.description: Came in for a tube change last night while it was extremely busy and ended up being helped really quickly. The guy (Andre was his name I think) helped me and 2 other customers simultaneously and also made us all feel like we had his attention as he worked quickly on our repairs. He was awesome, 5 stars, definitely coming back soon.

16.description: Knowledgeable, quick, and genuinely nice dudes. Had a good selection of moderately-priced parts, and totally reasonable labor costs. Jeff even adjusted a couple minor things free of charge while he had my bike on the stand, and took his time in explaining the different repair options that I had.

6.description: Love these guys. They're always friendly, helpful and will fix your bike as quickly as possible. They're definitely my go-to bike shop.

15.description: The fourth star is for a super convenient location close to the loop.  The fifth star is for a job well done.  Popped a spoke on the way to the office last week and rather than ride a wobbling wheel all the way to my usual shop in Evanston after work, I rode the few blocks down Dearborn during lunch.  Despite the extra work to drill out a stripped rotor screw to get to the hub (at no charge), the wheel was trued, tires filled and brakes recalibrated in no time and I was back at the grind before anyone knew I was away.  Top quality work and despite no desire to experience more mishaps on the way to work, I'm sure I'll be back.

0.description: In and out, not even 10 minutes, and my brakes are fixed and tightened up. Go here.The owner is very straightforward and expresses both care and honesty. I feel like I can trust him with my ride. They made an adjustment on my brakes to where they feel tighter, faster and safer now.Remember to get a student discount fellow college goers!

5.description: Just picked up a 2015 Raleigh Roper here. Graduating from a very old mountain bike to my first road/cyclocross/commuter, the two gentlemen were very helpful in providing valuable input to my decision. I also came here when they were having a sale on all of their 2015 models. Got my bike for 50% off. To top it off, they also do Military discounts here. Can't complain about a great establishment!

11.description: Amazing Bike Shop!!!!  I needed to ship my bike to Minneapolis and Jeff was super accommodating!  I've never experienced such friendly and accommodating customer service!

8.description: Great experience! I had a tune up done on my bike. It rides like new again!! They were very friendly and quick! The biggest thing that I appreciated is that they didn't try to up sell me with accessories or unnecessary repairs. Definitely will be back! Easy 5 stars.

4.description: I have been in the bicycle business for over 18 years as as a former shop owner, former bike shop employee, and currently a mobile mechanic. These guys are an exception to the Chicago bike shop rules. Jeff took amazing care of me when I stopped in to the Printers Row shop in need of a few small parts. Not only did Jeff display amazing technical instincts, he does so with a smile with no infamous bike shop attitude. James also sets a new standard for bike shop friendliness and knowledge of the industry. This place is a gem. I never met this owner, but if I did, I would tell him how lucky he is to have both of these fine mechanics.

14.description: I had a minor issue that needed immediate attention appear on my bike as I passed by the shop, so I stopped in.  They fixed it quickly and inexpensively.  I was pleasantly surprised, considering the other bike shop in the area is expensive and always has a huge wait time.  I'll definitely stop by On The Route next time I need gear in the area.

7.description: Jeff at On The Route is incredibly knowledgeable about all aspects of any bike. I am lucky to live in the building above On The Route and even in the short time they have been here they have helped my girlfriend and me many times. Just yesterday I took my vintage moped - not even a bicycle- because my mirror wouldn't stay on and Jeff went above and beyond to grind down a part to retrofit my mirror. Quite simply he solved my problem and was eager to help out. Definitely a first class job.

58.description: This is place is awesome. I've been coming to Emad for 5 years now. I searched high and low before finding these guys. I have curly thick hair and always leave feeling and looking great. It's a full service salon. Ahmed is the best threader. Great service, quality and atmosphere. Mish is always so helpful and friendly. All amazing guys!!!

56.description: I highly recommend Nina for fabulous nail services and Mira for soothing, professional facials.  I have known both lovely women for years and am delighted that they are now with Trio3!

29.description: International Chic!  I went in for a blow dry as a walk in and was given to Mish, a co-owner!  He was remarkably focused and deliberate, drying small sections at a time and gently rolling each section in Velcro rollers.  I am a serial blow dry addict and I knew I immediately that I was dealing with a true professional.  I was so impressed that I went back for a hair cut which was fabulous and then again for color and highlights.  My hair has never looked so healthy and stylish.  Each timed I left the salon feeling as though I could take on  London, New York or Hong Kong.  I love the boutique atmosphere and, Jane, who gives a 15 minutes scalp massage, as she washes your hair.  This will be my weekly hang out for blow dries and monthly for other services.  I found the prices to be more competitive than any blow dry bar or salon even in the suburbs of Chicago.

42.description: Mira is an amazing esthetician. She is completely professional and is very skilled. She is a complete sweet heart and will make sure you enjoy your time at Trio. The salon is beautiful and the entire staff is amazing. Highly recommend this place for everyone!

23.description: I was having a hard time finding a replacement after my Stylist of 20 years moved away. I decided to try Salon Trio since it's by my house, and I'm so happy I did! Mish did a great job with my curly hair, and after the third visit I know I finally found a permanent Hair Stylist!

47.description: This salon is perfection! Beaitiful, clean, and relaxing. I got the royal treatment! Thank you Emad! You always make me feel beautiful!

8.description: I absolutely love Trio 3 Hair Salon & SPA. Whether your hair is straight, curly or coarse kinky, they are experts in delvering the color, cut, style and expert care you are seeking. They are the only Egyptians that I have ever experienced do not burn out your hair. Mish, Emad, and Ahmed are professionals,  men of intrgrity and honor. I have been going to them  for the last 5 years and always love my hair.Their place is elegant, classy and georgeous. Stop by for a visit.

31.description: I read about Trio 3 Hair Salon on yelp and decided to check it out.  I had tried to color my platinum blonde hair a light brown (through e salon) by myself..NOTE TO SELF....DON'T TRY TO COLOR YOUR OWN HAIR!!!! The great news is that my horrible mistake led me to this GREAT place.  It's warm, inviting, and Misch did an amazing job correcting the damage that I did (did I mention my hair was blue/green?)  I walked out with a beautiful brunette head of hair and best cut that I have ever had...I would really recommend this place to anyone that isn't happy with their hair.  They take the time to listen and ask you what you would like and then give honest professional guidance.  Their prices are beyond reasonable and I will never go anywhere else.  They made me feel very welcome, and I'm so grateful to have found the salon through YELP.  Trio 3 Hair Salon thanks so very much for your wonderful work...I'll be forever grateful and refer everyone I can to your salon!!  Thanks Misch...you are loved and appreciated!!

34.description: This place is great. I followed Ahmed from Yehia here. Ahmed always gives a great haircut with more than attentive service for a very reasonable value. This place is stylish with spa-like features.

16.description: I must give special shout out to Nina! One of the best pedicures and manicures I had in a long long time.  The pedicure Is outstanding!  She gives a full hour pedicure.  She gives attention to every toenail.  The foot massage is so relaxing.  If you need a professional and relaxing mani and pedi see Nina! And she has the sweetest personality.

13.description: I had my hair  colored by Emad and cut by Ahmed and everything turned out perfect. I had went to a different salon a month ago and spent over 200$ but ending up with a color no different from what I originally had but Emad totally fixed my hair. He was very charismatic and easy to talk to. He kept it real with me and told me he would try to do the best he could without damaging my hair and that's exactly what he did! He was very attentive and cared about how my hair turned out. This is definitely the place to go to get the hair color of your wish! Everyone at the salon was super friendly and I will definitely be back for recoloring!

11.description: I have been getting my hair cut and styled by Emad for many years now and was so excited to come to the grand opening of Trio 3! Salon is perfect!  Great location and easy to get to. My thick and coarse/wavy hair is usually a handful but Emad always take extra special care in it and I walk out with silky, bouncy, great looking hair. Even got compliments by my neighbors when I came home:-)The three most important men in "this girl's life"...my dad, my hubby, and Emad! Lol.

39.description: I LOVEEEEEE THIS PLACE!!!!!! THE BEST EXPERIENCE I EVER HAD!!! I had 30 inches long hair and I got Mish to cut my hair up to my shoulders and to give me layers. Then I asked for a turquoise ombre and OMG..THE BEST DECISION OF MY LIFE!! I wish I found them sooner! I had 3 people working on my hair making sure everything went smoothly. THIS SALON ROCKS and trust the reviews on here! Mish and Emad and Jay helped create my pinterest worthy hair ...Thank YOU SO MUCH!

37.description: I must give special shout out to Nina! One of the best pedicures and manicures I had in a long long time.  The pedicure Is outstanding!  She gives a full hour pedicure.  She gives attention to every toenail.  The foot massage is so relaxing.  If you need a professional and relaxing mani and pedi see Nina! And she has the sweetest personality.

0.description: This review has been a long time coming, but I am finally getting to it. I am a licensed cosmetologist (not practicing), recently moved not only back to the Chicago area from San Francisco, but to the freaking South Side. So I was totally shooting blind when I booked at Trio. On top of that, as anyone can tell from my profile, I am an unapologetic and incorrigible iconoclast. So I gathered all my pictures of Anita Pallenberg and Stevie Nicks and Siobhan fucking Fahey and went in, armed with at least my knowledge of the cosmo vocabulary to try and explain how to achieve the complete Frankenstein's monster that is my desired "style," which *looks* like it'd be easy, but as anyone in the know knows, in less-skilled hands would likely be a huge disaster (I once had to get one of my old cosmo school teachers to fix a disaster and he was like "Are these drunk highlights? These look like drunk highlights!" LOL!). The color was absolutely perfect (really got a *beautiful* tone) as is the cut, which is growing out fabulously. Mish completely nailed it and now has a loyal client in me. Also, I don't remember the other guy who was there's name who washed me out, but MAN did he give me a scalp massage I won't soon forget. They were delightful and I love them. I don't live in the South Loop but when I walked out of that salon, I felt like I should walk straight into one of those bars around there to see how much action I'd get with my rockin', revived hairstyle.When you do hair, you know you've nailed it when your client can't stop touching their hair and like, shaking their head in this certain particular way, it's a great feeling and why stylists love what they do. The guys at Trio totally had me doing that. Thanks guys and see you as soon as the grey cannot hide in the highlights any longer! ;-p

38.description: Awesome salon!  I came in needing a haircut badly. When Ahmed sat me down and saw what my over processed hair looked like (I've been dying it various shades of blonde for 2 years and curl/straighten it weekly) he broke the news that there would be no trim.  There was about 5-6 inches of dead ends.  Yikes.  I was scared to death since my hair hasn't been above my shoulders in years but I could tell it needed to be done.  Thank god Ahmed is such a talented stylist.  I came in expecting to leave a few inches shorter but came out love love loving my new short hair!!!  Price was $65 for a cut and blow dry.  Highly recommended.

51.description: This salon is really a hidden gem of the south loop! I've been going to Mish for about 8 yrs and he has always done such a beautiful job, my hair is always gorgeous and stylish! Emad and Ahmed also do a phenomenal job, Emad did our hair for my sisters wedding and the bride and bridal party were on point!!!! Pay this salon a visit, this is truly such a chic spot with a wonderful and stylish staff!! Love seeing Mish, Emad, and Ahmed when I go!!!

27.description: TL;DR - Hair cut and color took 4 hours, stylist treated me terribly when I got upset with how long it was taking and was confused about the process. Explanation: I chose this place based on the excellent reviews, but I got my hair cut here today and my experience was sub-par. There were two issues with my cut and color, A) a miscommunication about what I wanted and B) how it was handled.I came in and asked for an ombre that could be added to my existing dark roots and reddish colored hair (my hair is dark brown). Ahmed told me that what I wanted couldn't be done. He spent 10 minutes talking about a different way to do the ombre that I didn't really understand, and I asked for clarification. He said that he would add color to the bottom of my hair, I said fine.An hour and a half later, he was finally done applying the color. He washed it out and when I looked in the mirror I saw that my hair was BLONDE. My hair is very dark and this was NOT what we had agreed to. I was upset because it looked terrible. I said "This is a lot blonder than I was expecting." Ahmed immediately became very defensive and said "You think this is the end of what it looks like? This is only part one of the process, I told you that." No, no he had NOT explained that it was a two step dye process and that it would take upwards of THREE hours to dye. I explained that I had not understood that, as I had never had an ombre take longer than 2 hours before, or take more than one dye, or use BLEACH on my hair. I have had ombre done every 6 months for the last 5 years at many, many places. He said that every other stylist I've ever gone to had done it wrong, and you have to bleach hair first to "lift" the color, and then tone it to the correct color. He lectured me about "lifting" and "bleaching," how he had told me that this was going to be the process, and that everyone else had done it wrong for at least 10 more minutes. I explained that I had not understood this, and did not know it was going to take 3 hours to complete, so I had to reschedule an appointment I had that was coming up in 30 min. Ahmed then let me pick out the color to tone my hair, and had another woman in the salon wash it out. While she was washing my hair she said "I heard you were freaking out about your hair being blonde" in a very judgmental tone. Ok, I misunderstood about the process of the dyeing - I accept some blame for that. But to tell the client to her FACE that in effect you had been gossiping about her behind her back and laughing about her freaking out for something she didn't understand? It was incredibly rude and it made me even more upset.THEN I sat down in the chair for Ahmed to cut my hair and he asked what I did for a living. I told him and he said "So what would you do if I came to you in your industry and told you that everything you were doing was wrong?" Now this made me SO mad because he was insinuating that I said "This is wrong, you are doing this incorrectly." ALL I said was "this is more blonde than I expected." So he was basically accusing me of accusing him which is NOT what happened. I felt very attacked. I explained that the issue was that I misunderstood, and that I never accused him of being wrong or doing it incorrectly. The problem was just that neither the process nor the time investment were explained to me.Ahmed did give me $30 off and try to give me free shampoo, but these things were way too little too late. Again, the issue wasn't with the hair because it turned out not blonde (although the technique was not great, because the dye is streaky and poorly blended in many places). The issue was with the way he handled it. If he had simply said "I'm sorry I didn't explain what what happening, this is what we're going to do" I would have been totally fine. Instead, he got very defensive and attacked me and was very rude. I'm glad that so many other people have had good experiences here, but I was treated terribly and would not sink FOUR TOTAL HOURS into a haircut again, even if it were great (which it wasn't).

32.description: Emad has been styling my hair for 4 years. Their new salon is so relaxing. Trio 3 and Emad also provide the absolute best Keratin service I've had done in Chicago. It's so nice going to Trio 3 that I find myself going more often for cut, color and Keratin.  Their prices are also very reasonable.

54.description: I checked the Internet and Yelp and came upon this place. I wanted a last minute booking and they fit me in. Emad was patient and gave me his honest feedback. He listened and his suggestions were right on the $! I adore my new cut and color. He corrected my hair and made it feel and look like it use to. They've scored a customer for life!

48.description: The south loop finally has a beautiful and elegant hair salon for men and women. A full service salon that offers hair, nails and skincare!MISH and EMAD have been doing my hair for about 8 years now. Finding them was a blessing. They have dealt with my constant "it hair style" I've had short hair, long hair, purple, pink, red, highlights, you name it these guys have done it. And my current obsession platinum blonde. There is nothing these guys cannot do! One thing I love about them, no matter what style you choose to go with they will tell you why it will or won't work for you. And 9 times out of 10 their suggestion is better than what you wanted. They are good at what they do! They understand that not every "trend" will "work" for you but, they always have an idea that will blow you mind and you will leave the shop 100% satisfied. Now if you need someone to do your significant other's hair. AHMED is the guy you want! He too has dealt with my "I want my boyfriend to have this hair style" all i have to do is show him a picture or try to explain what "we" want and he will work his magic (Let's be honest when I say "we" I mean me, my boyfriend could care less on what hairstyle I choose for him) he says; "as long as you like it, I like it"... That's a lie, he secretly loves it when someone compliments his hair style. (He willNever admit it, and I'm ok with that) Oh! Don't be fooled, Ahmed is a hair stylist! He also does women's hair.
