Just like Mish and Emad. Let's not forget they offer nails and skin care! Your go to girls are MIRA and NINA. These ladies couldn't be nicer, and they are good at what they do! For someone who is as picky as me I highly suggest you give them a try. They will not disappoint! Trio3's assistant JAY is an asset to the shop, she is friendly, attentive and makes you feel welcomed. As someone who has worked in customer service for years I'm very picky. Going to Trio3's hair salon is my go to shop! And yes, I highly recommend it. You won't be disappointed.

44.description: I love this place...1) While getting the best manicure ever I watched the stylist cut hair to perfection! I saw men walking out of there with perfect haircuts. I liked looking at themselves in the mirror with a surprised look on their faces! Amazing technique and excellent styles! 2) They worked on diverse hair textures with the same enthusiasm. I saw an African American woman with thick course waist length hair get a blow out and a trim (looked amazing). The same stylist cut a White mans hair and the guy was beaming in the mirror at his reflection. A moment later a woman with curly red hair came in and he cut and styled her into a bushy bob that once again caused a glowing beaming smile and multiple thank you's.3) I was there for spa services. The spa pedicure is long, because they take their time and make everything perfect. The manicures were also lengthy, because she soaked my hands with a towel, gave me a massage and did the maintenance work that they do on the cuticles. Not only does this place look great... All of the stylists were excellent. The spa is the best I've ever had.

24.description: Five stars for the warm and hospitable staff, and first-class service. Emad is truly a masterful stylist! I walked into Trio after a botched haircut from my regular stylist of 11 years and Emad not only listened to my concerns but did so with a sense of patience, warmth, and confident professionalism that made me feel safe to trust him with the task of rehabilitating my hair. I felt completely comfortable and at ease as Emad skillfully cut away at my hair, and the end result exceeded my hopes. After, he taught me how to style and care for my hair; I could tell as he shared with me his instructions how passionate he is about his craft and how much he cares about his clients' satisfaction. My great experience with Emad has convinced me to turn to only Trio for my hair care needs from now on.

7.description: I came to this salon for a haircut right after they opened and was so impressed with my cut from Emad. I have long blond hair and usually my requests are simple, but no other haircut seemed to add as much dimension to my hair as this cut! When I returned again for round 2 with Emad, I learned he has been doing hair for over 20 years, started in Jordan and then spent time learning and cutting hair in Italy. He feels so passionate about his craft, it is no wonder I loved my hair so much! He really knows what he is doing. For their price and level of quality, I definitely recommend this studio!

49.description: Mish has taken care of my hair for years, and it always looks amazing. Everyone here is friendly, and the stylists are all talented...they work miracles!

40.description: I had my hair done by Mish when I was in town from Boston, and I had a great experience. I always found Chitown stylists to be inimitably good, so took time to get my hair done and find a person who could turn my choppy flippy layers into a nice rounded bob. Tried Trio based on Yelp reviews. Mish managed to give me what I wanted despite my near-inscrutable description, and he did not take off too much even by my trim-anxiety standards. My hair is healthier and I got compliments all day. I will come back to Chicago to see him!

53.description: Ahmed was fantastic.. I can be a pain in the butt when it comes to cutting my hair.. He did exactly what I wanted/ needed! On top of that my blow out was beyond perfection. I left feeling beautiful in my sweats and makeup free face! Thanks Ahmed:)

30.description: I was hesitant to try this place without knowing anyone that had been here. I was quite attached to my stylist in LA and since I moved here I had kept putting off getting a cut. I tried one other place a year ago and was left feeling "ok", but I LOVED my cut after leaving Trio. I wouldn't hesitate to come back here. As long as I don't move out of the city, my loyalties will be to this salon for any hair styling needs. Truthfully, no one would have ever compared to my LA guy, but this salon comes amazingly close and for a fraction of the price. THANK YOU!!!

46.description: Trio 3 Salon is a treasure in the South Loop, created by Mish and his talented team.  Attention to detail is reflected in their work, the design of this new Salon, and the service you receive. Don't wait to pay a visit, you will be delighted.

1.description: I called Trio just the day before my appointment and was able to get a spot with Emad around the time I was looking for. My hair needed work, BADLY, and I could not get an appointment with my regular stylist. Never having been to Trio before I was quite nervous to get my ombré redone by a stylist I only had read about on Yelp.Emad was simply amazing. Not only did my ombré turn out flawless but he gave me great hair-care tips and also a great scalp massage. I would highly recommend Trio for color/cuts. I have not tried their other services yet but will be keeping them in mind for my future no chips and pedis.

55.description: The best hair and nail salon in Chicago. The best no chip manicures from Nina and facials by Mira!  I have been following these technicians since they were at European Touch!  Highly recommend the nicest salon/spa in the South Loop!

9.description: Went in for just a trim and got just a trim! My hair went from a crappy wall with crappy ends to long hair that had a shape and moves and feels nice! During my last haircut, at another place, I asked for a trim and was robbed of 3.5 inches of hair. But here I asked for a trim and got just that! Thank you! I'll be back.

26.description: This place is amazing! It was my first time going in this past Friday. Ahmed colored, cut and styled my hair and I could not believe how great it turned out...(The last place I went to did not do such a great job so he had to fix all that). I was actually surprised by the fact that my hair looked more healthier AFTER the color than before. I am always paranoid above damaging my hair but Ahmed's technique and products that he used really set this place apart from other salons. They will not let you leave until you are completely satisfied. For me it didn't take much because everything he did was phenomenal. The way he cut my hair and layered it completely changed the shape of my face. Crazy how just a haircut and color touch-up can change up your whole look. Even if you aren't sure what you want done, Ahmed will give you his honest advice on what he thinks will work best for your hair and face shape. Also I have never had a blow out last so long and look so awesome...It was celebrity level work. Was super impressed. Will definitely come back.

25.description: I had a wonderful experience at Trio 3 and cannot recommend it enough.  I went in for the first time ready to donate my hair.  To do this, I had to cut almost all of it off.  As is often the case with drastic cuts, I was nervous. However, Emad did a fantastic job.  He also provided me with a discount given that I was donating my hair.  I made a new appointment before I left, because I was so satisfied.  A month later, and all I get is compliments on my hair. I definitely recommend it in terms of professionalism, technique, and price.

12.description: As everyone else has said, this place is amazing!  I just saw Ahmed and got probably the best haircut of my life.  I didn't provide a ton of guidance, as I was hoping that he would use his creative expertise to figure out what works best for me, and he definitely delivered.  I would recommend this place hands down!

59.description: I went to Emad for a trim; and Im so glad I did! I recently moved from the suburbs to Chicago and needed a new stylist and went to Trio based on their great reviews and great pricing. Emad was great, and it was honestly the best haircut I've ever had. I walked out of the salon feeling like a million bucks and plan on returning back soon for a blowout because his blowout after my haircut was incredible! I definitely recommend!

21.description: Great cut for a great price. Ahmed is skilled. I have "asian" guys hair, and he did a great job. This will be my new go to!

17.description: I have been getting my hair cut by the same person for 27 years.  Now that I moved to the city and sold my car I needed to find someone new.  I was very hesitant about finding someone new and did a ton of research which brought me to this salon and Mish.I went in and the front desk staff was very nice.  The girl who shampooed my hair was very friendly and gave a nice little head massage .Mish did an AMAZING job with my hair.  I showed him a few pictures, said i trusted him, and I have never been more pleased with a haircut.  He took his time and then did a blow dry and style.  I received so many compliments.  I will definitely be coming back and I can happily say I found my new hair dresser. My only small piece of room for improvement is how the receptionist answers the phone.  When i called they just said hello - not something like 'Hello this is Trio Salon' which made me feel like i dialed a wrong number.  I was caught off guard and has to ask if this was the salon to which she just said yes.  It might help to have a bit more of a profesional greeting so customers know they have the right place.

10.description: Generally I do not write reviews, but Mish is exceptionally good at what he does. He has been my stylist for the past 6 years and wherever he goes, I go. I've been to many different stylists and I have to say that there is absolutely no comparison!!! Not only does he do an amazing job with hair cuts, he is fantastic with color and up-do's. One of my personal favorites would have to be the Keratin treatment. My hair was completely damaged and now it is long, healthy and manageable. Certainly, he is capable of doing anything! Every time I request a certain style he makes it better than I imagined. Never have I been dissatisfied with any service! That in my opinion means a lot!

5.description: Ok...After getting a wonderful cut almost a week later...I did the craziest thing ever!! I "thought" a piece of hair was a little bit long. So, what did I do? I cut it at home. :/ for full disclosure, NO I don't know what in the hell was I thinking. I was feeling impulsive that morning. I show up for a blow dry and Ahmed immediately noticed the difference. We both laughed at what I did to myself and his work. I jokingly told Ahmed he did this to me and how can he let me walk around looking like this. I don't know why my "Jedi" mind tricking wasn't working that day. The force must not be with me. Thankfully, Ahmed patiently fixed the problem I created. We both agreed to leave my hair in his hands because I don't know WTF I'm doing. What initially was supposed to be a a simple wash and blow dry turned into fixing the hot mess. I left the salon with an edgy bob and looking 100% better. I'm confident when Ahmed sees my name on the appointment schedule, he'll wonder what does this client have in store for me this time. Maybe I'll try coloring my hair at home and give Ahmed another challenge ;0).On second thought....nah!!!

3.description: This place is amazing! It was my first time going in this past Friday. Ahmed colored, cut and styled my hair and I could not believe how great it turned out...(The last place I went to did not do such a great job so he had to fix all that). I was actually surprised by the fact that my hair looked more healthier AFTER the color than before. I am always paranoid above damaging my hair but Ahmed's technique and products that he used really set this place apart from other salons. They will not let you leave until you are completely satisfied. For me it didn't take much because everything he did was phenomenal. The way he cut my hair and layered it completely changed the shape of my face. Crazy how just a haircut and color touch-up can change up your whole look. Even if you aren't sure what you want done, Ahmed will give you his honest advice on what he thinks will work best for your hair and face shape. Also I have never had a blow out last so long and look so awesome...It was celebrity level work. Was super impressed. Will definitely come back.

35.description: I decided to give this place a try. I got my hair trimmed today by Mish. He was really nice and asked me what I wanted. My hair is fine and straight. I told him I just wanted a trim with my layers cleaned up. He took his time with my cut and checked with me with the length before he actually cut just to make sure I was comfortable with the amount being taken off. Totally appreciated that. After the cut he dryers my hair and used a round brush and Velcro rollers and my hair actually had volume! Why can't I do this myself? I love my cut and style and even though I just wanted long layers he made it look nice. My husband approved! I will be back!The salon is really nice and inviting, a nice addition to the neighborhood for sure! Glad I decided to check them out! My hair cut was 70 which is about 10 dollars more than what I usually pay but it's worth it. I'm very happy with my cut!

19.description: I finally found a salon I'll return to. Emad took the time to listen to me and suggest new ideas, giving me the benefit of his expertise and experience, while still carefully checking with me before he made any big cuts or changes. I have very thin, fine hair and have never found a cut that really worked to give it body, but Emad found the solution. Of course I looked great coming out of the salon, after Emad spent time styling me, but the new cut passed the real test when I washed it at night, didn't blow dry, and the next day it looked great with only a simple brush through (no products or curling). It still had shape and looked more voluminous than I ever managed with a hair dryer and lots of curling. I've never had a better cut. To top it off, the salon gives a very relaxing shampoo and massage and a leave-in conditioner,  steam treatment before the cut. Everyone at the salon is skilled, professional, and kind. I had a great experience.

28.description: In town staying at a hotel nearby and needed a haircut.  Picked Trio 3 based on the reviews and was not disappointed!  Ahmed did a great job and everyone was very nice, you can not go wrong here!

45.description: This is the first time I have gotten my hair professionally colored, and I could not be happier with the results. The atmosphere here is great; everything is so clean and everyone is really friendly. I had my hair highlighted by Mish. I wasn't sure how to describe the color I wanted, but Mish easily helped me figure out what I wanted and a couple of hours later, my hair looked awesome. I also got my hair cut, and again, Mish knew what I wanted even though my description was lacking. This is the best my hair has ever looked. Awesome service, great people and atmosphere, and all at a great price. I am one happy lady.

33.description: I received a haircut and style by Mish.  He did an exceptional job at cutting my long/ fine straight hair.  He added perfect layers & used rollers to style it.  Mish took his time. I am definitely coming back to Trio 3 for my next haircut/style! This salon is top notch.

43.description: Mish is the best hairdresser I have ever had.  He is excellent with cut and color.  The last time I left there, I hadn't walked even 30 feet, and I was stopped on the street by some women having a drink, and they raved about my hair. Mish is a miracle worker!

2.description: This is the best hair salon experience I've had in Chicago, including some very pricey Lincoln Park salons. I got an appointment easily, and they were ready for me when I arrived a few minutes early. Mike's shampoo was sublime and Emad's haircut a masterpiece. Emad took the time to listen to my thoughts and explain exactly what he wanted to do and WHY. I had his undivided attention for the whole appointment and ultimately got the best haircut and blowout I've ever had. It's even better than what I wanted. He's a true artist. Try this place out. It's well worth the money. You won't regret it. Oh, and being cash to tip, always.

18.description: Awesome salon!  I came in needing a haircut badly. When Ahmed sat me down and saw what my over processed hair looked like (I've been dying it various shades of blonde for 2 years and curl/straighten it weekly) he broke the news that there would be no trim.  There was about 5-6 inches of dead ends.  Yikes.  I was scared to death since my hair hasn't been above my shoulders in years but I could tell it needed to be done.  Thank god Ahmed is such a talented stylist.  I came in expecting to leave a few inches shorter but came out love love loving my new short hair!!!  Price was $65 for a cut and blow dry.  Highly recommended.

41.description: So excited about the new salon! I have been going to Mish for years. Extremely courteous stylists and staff, chic atmosphere, and they keep your hair not only gorgeous but healthy as well.

52.description: This Salon is Amazing and Mish is one of the best stylist in Chicago! Trio 3 hair salon & spa is Amazing!

50.description: Mish is the best!!! I had recently had my sew in taken down and my hair was all over the place. My hair is natural so most people would have looked at the nest on my head and turned me away but they took me with open arms. Whatever products he used on my hair gave me life! I got trimmed up and deep conditioned I love my hair! I will be back in 2 weeks!

4.description: I decided to give this place a try. I got my hair trimmed today by Mish. He was really nice and asked me what I wanted. My hair is fine and straight. I told him I just wanted a trim with my layers cleaned up. He took his time with my cut and checked with me with the length before he actually cut just to make sure I was comfortable with the amount being taken off. Totally appreciated that. After the cut he dryers my hair and used a round brush and Velcro rollers and my hair actually had volume! Why can't I do this myself? I love my cut and style and even though I just wanted long layers he made it look nice. My husband approved! I will be back!The salon is really nice and inviting, a nice addition to the neighborhood for sure! Glad I decided to check them out! My hair cut was 70 which is about 10 dollars more than what I usually pay but it's worth it. I'm very happy with my cut!

6.description: I love this place...1) While getting the best manicure ever I watched the stylist cut hair to perfection! I saw men walking out of there with perfect haircuts. I liked looking at themselves in the mirror with a surprised look on their faces! Amazing technique and excellent styles! 2) They worked on diverse hair textures with the same enthusiasm. I saw an African American woman with thick course waist length hair get a blow out and a trim (looked amazing). The same stylist cut a White mans hair and the guy was beaming in the mirror at his reflection. A moment later a woman with curly red hair came in and he cut and styled her into a bushy bob that once again caused a glowing beaming smile and multiple thank you's.3) I was there for spa services. The spa pedicure is long, because they take their time and make everything perfect. The manicures were also lengthy, because she soaked my hands with a towel, gave me a massage and did the maintenance work that they do on the cuticles. Not only does this place look great... All of the stylists were excellent. The spa is the best I've ever had.

22.description: Great for men too. After my wife went in for a cut at Trio 3 Hair Salon & Spa and came out with a great new look, she told me to go there as well. It was all perfect timing - she just had a great experience here and I happened to come home with another bad haircut from one of those chain barbers. Regardless, I just got my hair cut and couldn't be happier. Lol, I'm sure the wife will pleased as well. Happy wife, happy life :)

15.description: I LOVEEEEEE THIS PLACE!!!!!! THE BEST EXPERIENCE I EVER HAD!!! I had 30 inches long hair and I got Mish to cut my hair up to my shoulders and to give me layers. Then I asked for a turquoise ombre and OMG..THE BEST DECISION OF MY LIFE!! I wish I found them sooner! I had 3 people working on my hair making sure everything went smoothly. THIS SALON ROCKS and trust the reviews on here! Mish and Emad and Jay helped create my pinterest worthy hair ...Thank YOU SO MUCH!

57.description: Emad always does an amazing job. Have been going to him for years for color, cut, and style. Love the new salon!

20.description: I had been going to the same stylist for 8 years back home, so I was nervous to try someone new. Decided on Trio 3 based on the great Yelp reviews, and I wasn't disappointed. Mish made me feel comfortable and my hair came out exactly how I wanted (and I'm very particular about how I like my hair). He even gave me a discount from his original quoted price because he didn't end up cutting as much as he thought he would. I'll definitely be back!

36.description: Delightful experience. I came in for a last minute haircut because after 5 months of letting it go, I needed a cut, like, RIGHT NOW. The receptionist was very sweet and fit me in for an appointment after work. Emad was wonderful! He heard my vague concerns about having fine, flat hair and offered to add more volume with shorter layers. We all know that bad layers will ruin any look you have going, but I decided to trust him and I'm so glad I did! I love my hair and style, but more importantly, I am so impressed at how he was willing and able to customize my cut to match my hair texture and styling goals. What a professional! Their prices are comparable to other salons in the city, but the haircut I just got is way above.

14.description: A few months ago when I was new to this area I was looking for a hair salon. I decided to try this place because of all the excellent reviews. Yelpers did not lie!I have seen Mish 3 times. All three times he colored my blonde hair. Once he cut it. Everyone is so friendly and it is very relaxing. The hair washers are the best! I have found my go to salon!

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: African-American Hair, Asian Hair, Curly Hair, Perms, Extensions, Straight Perms, Coloring, Kids' Hair

58.description: Pros: Great beers on draftNice winesLively place but not too crowded on weekendsFun waitstaffCons: Right on the edge of being too far for pregaming events at Soldier Field

56.description: My boyfriend and I were in town for a long weekend from Denver, our first time visiting Chicago. Our first night in, we decided to look on Yelp for a nearby bar to get a few beers at. We ended up at Kasey's Tavern, just a few blocks from our hotel. Our bartender for the night was Shelby, who provided us with amazing service, to say the very least. Because of Shelby, we were in every night while we were in town. Don't get me wrong, we visited other bars and did the touristy thing as well, but each night when we were done seeing the sights and such, we made sure we stopped by Kasey's Tavern. I would recommend this bar to anyone. And recommend that Shelby needs a raise! Thanks for giving us a great experience.

29.description: Probably the best after work pub in the area. Great service even w/ bigger crowds.

42.description: My boyfriend and I came here recently to watch the Sunday football game. It's a super cute local bar with a homey atmosphere. Great 4-page beer list with tons on draft, and they even had hot dogs and tamales on hand for those who were watching the game. Definitely will be coming back here and would recommend to anyone for a low-key, neighborly place to have a drink. As previous reviewers mentioned, they don't really have a kitchen here (they do offer pizza), but you can bring in food - which is even better with all the great food places nearby! They also don't accept credit or debit cards unless the order is above $15 - so grab cash if you're only planning on a beer or two.

23.description: Kasey's is definitely a cool little neighborhood local tavern with a friendly vibe, chill, but not too dead. Old-school place that's been there in Printers Row forever. Also love most of the staff. Great moscow mules. Great place to meet friends, just chill out and pull up tunes on the juke box. Also, dogs are welcome, which makes it fun!

47.description: This was a pit stop before we met up with our other group for a bachelor party dinner. We was only going to stop for one drink and watch a little bit of the USA vs Ghana World Cup Game but we ended up staying for over an hour taking shots and ordering beers. It was a great time and the crowd was so hyped considering about 70 percent of the crowd had no clue what goes on during a soccer game but hey it gave us all a reason to chant U-S-A, U-S-A, U-S-A! Space and seating is very limited but the patrons were nice and it can get crowded. If you don't crowds this definitely isn't the place but if you love beer then this is the place. The beer selection is pretty awesome and if you need water just order a $3 Miller Lite during happy hour. The bartenders are pretty cool there too. I have a motto: treat your servers well and they'll treat you well. They charged my phone when my battery died and when we ordered shots of Jameson the pours were definitely not stingy. This place makes me miss Chicago and would definitely recommend this bar to anyone.

8.description: The bartender Shelby is awesome!!!! She managed to handle the whole bar by herself and was on top of it with service! We enjoyed our visit to Chicago and are so glad we stopped in here, twice!!!!! Thanks!

31.description: Great chilling neighborhood bar just like Yelpers said. Got a beer on draft per bartender recommendation. Was more bitter than I like. She wanted to replace it but by then, I didn't want more beer; just wanted water. I wasn't feeling too good (not anyone's fault). She was very nice though and didn't charge me and wanted to get me something I would like. So I give it a very good rating which for me is a 4 star. Would go again definitely. ps. They have lots of big TV screens, but they are hung up so high, I found my neck to be strained. A minor discomfort.

34.description: Good beer selection, nice variety of Chicago local favorite drinks and a nice neighborhood vibe.

16.description: Great chilling neighborhood bar just like Yelpers said. Got a beer on draft per bartender recommendation. Was more bitter than I like. She wanted to replace it but by then, I didn't want more beer; just wanted water. I wasn't feeling too good (not anyone's fault). She was very nice though and didn't charge me and wanted to get me something I would like. So I give it a very good rating which for me is a 4 star. Would go again definitely. ps. They have lots of big TV screens, but they are hung up so high, I found my neck to be strained. A minor discomfort.

13.description: Solid neighborhood bar kinda joint. I don't believe they have any food, but you can order from the surrounding businesses and have them deliver (or bring something in with you). Very laid back with a good beer selection - they open the front windows/doors when the weather is nice to let in some fresh air. And dog friendly!

11.description: It's like drinking at your friends house. With many many more varieties of beer on tap. Such a comfortable atmosphere, with laid back clients. Full bar, but beers are their forte. Prices are incredibly reasonable and bartenders are efficient and no nonsense.No food, but they'll let you bring it in.

39.description: Absolutely love Kasey's! Very comfortable and casual place for drinks in the city. Always a good mix of people and the bartenders are extremely friendly and attentive! All around a great place to hang out.

37.description: Nice place.  Good atmosphere.  However the bartender was not pleasant.  Very short. Didn't care if we were there or not.  I would go again.  Maybe she was just having a bad night.

0.description: Last night two of my co-workers and I decided that Friday the 13th was a swell day to get a drink after work LOL we work across millennium park but the bars around us didn't appeal, or should I say the prices hahaha. We spent all day reading yelp reviews and we came across Kaseys Tavern and Halligans The reason we chose Kaseys; the blueberry beer was very appealing and so were the reviews!We came in at around 7:00 pm  there was only one table available in the back by the bathrooms but didn't bum us out as much. The blueberry beer was GREAT! Even though they don't have a full kitchen menu, we swear that was the best frozen pizza we had ever ate!Definitely want to make out that our Server STEPHANIE was awesome!!! it was crowded and busy yet she was so attentive! A table open up in the front and she set our next round of beers over there and told us "hey ladies save u a seat up front, some folks just left" how awesome is she! Definitely recommend and are coming back again!

38.description: Kasey's is a great place to watch a Blackhawks game. Doesn't have to be a grandpa bar if you bring 20 year old friends!

51.description: We were looking for a place to grab a few drinks & kill time before dinner after arriving in Chicago that morning. We stumbled upon Kasey's tavern while wandering the streets and still trying get our bearings. It looked cool, so we gave it a try. It's a great little place with lots of beers on tap and a great selection of bottled beer as well. My boyfriend tried a few different beers on tap and liked them all. After asking for a suggestion for a "girly beer" the bartender presented me with heaven in glass. When she opened a bottle of "Wild Blue" beer and proceeded to pour it over ice, I was a bit skeptical, but she told me to trust her. The purple drink hardly tasted like beer and more like a blueberry cocktail, but nonetheless delicious and went down way too easy for a drink with 8% alcohol. I loved it so much I immediately looked to make sure I could buy it at home. If we find ourselves in Chicago again, we'll definitely be back. In the meantime, I'll settle for Wild Blue at home!

27.description: Bar staff is very friendly and they have a great selection of beers on draft. I will defiantly return to this bar.

32.description: Nice staff. Mixed customers. Given free Guinness glasses. Lots of draft selections from a variety of breweries. Old bar, mellow feel.

54.description: A small neighborhood bar that has a premier extensive craft beer list. This place must have more storage than actual seating place. A nice small neighborhood bar in a sea of extensive gentrification. That is good to see.

48.description: Man I miss this place. This is one of the most laid-back yet fun bars - and with a great selection of GOOD beer no less. Count on obnoxious Bears/White Sox fans at times, but overall, a pretty cool vibe and some fun bartenders. There's really no better place for football Sunday than here!

44.description: I wish I could give 0 stars for this place. In from out of town walked a few miles from where we were to go based on reviews HORRIBLE customer service, dead bar, I would definitely skip and head to first draft where we ended up and it much better!

24.description: Solid neighborhood bar kinda joint. I don't believe they have any food, but you can order from the surrounding businesses and have them deliver (or bring something in with you). Very laid back with a good beer selection - they open the front windows/doors when the weather is nice to let in some fresh air. And dog friendly!

7.description: Been a few years and I still come here. The place is a bit small, so come early to snag a table. It seems the beer list has grown, and is in my opinion second best to Hopleaf. I haven't been everywhere, so take that with a grain of salt, but it's a really solid list. I'd actually come here over Hopleaf. While the Hop is bigger, maybe three times as big, it's cramped. They set it up to accommodate as many people as the fire code will allow, and it just doesn't work. Anyways, Kasey's makes good use of their space, with a small outdoor patio. The service has always been good, and the prices are reasonable given the area (printers row). This is my pregame bar of choice.

49.description: The beer menu is four pages, there are 9 TVs playing the World Cup game, need I say more? Great place but eat before you come because there is no food. None!The tables are tough to out together and the waitress shooed us away from our table saying it was reserved.

40.description: Chose Kasey's due to the beer selection listed on-line and it did not disappoint.  Great variety of beers on draft although no pumpkin beers this time of year was a little disappointing, but found 1 in a can to start off with and it was good to go.  Shared a couple beer flights (5 for $10) and sampled some winners and losers.  Finished the night with an Allagash White.Service was incredibly friendly and efficient.  Only 1 server working the tables and bar on a Monday night and she did a great job.Add bonus was the food.  They serve the restaurant down the blocks menu.  They add a $2.50 fee, but well worth it.  Had the guc a chips, fish taco and buddy got a burger.  Fish tacos were huge and the chips were some of the best ever.  Burger got a thumbs up too.  Next time I'm Chicago, I'm going back.

53.description: Lots of TV sets, boring ass sports shows ....lots of different kinds of beer. Some people like that. I'm getting old or something because it just confuses me anymore. Usually wind up asking for beers by type ... like "yo, IPA please my friend" and just go with whatever they bring. Let's see what else....art students, friendly and OK to talk to. Free popcorn. Oh yeah, I went out front to smoke (large 6'5" (almost 2 meter) dude in black t-shirt) and some people tried to show me their ID. So... yeah that happens once in a while :)

30.description: What a fun place.  The staff are extremely friendly and pour a nice drink.  This is a sports bar but more low key than others.  One of the best things about this place is that they allow deliveries from all of the local restaurants - eg you go to dinner at Lou Malnati's Pizza Restaurant and there is a 50 minute wait (as was the case with us).  So we opted to go somewhere else.  It was much to our surprise when the bar tender told us we could order delivery!!! Perfect!!

46.description: I am a regular...  I avoid this place on days with sporting events because I don't really like sports or sports fans or crowds, but go several times a week because the beer selection is excellent and variable, and the staff is really nice.  I can read at the bar or play a card game, and it is not considered strange...

1.description: I live in South Loop and I love this place. It's sort of our neighborhood bar. It is local and I recommend this place if you are meeting up with people and want a chill laid back environment. It's very comfortable inside and it's never packed, just the right amount of crowd. I ordered an old fashioned and they had a decent bourbon selection. They really excel at their beer selection. It's not top notch- but it's just the right amount of chill that makes this place a gem of a hangout.

55.description: I was looking for a place to watch March Madness in the South Loop since the person I was meeting was coming from the north side and I was coming from the south side. We decided to meet at Kaseys. Parking was super easy to find on a Saturday afternoon. It is street parking so you get to shell out money to the parking meter company. Kaseys is also not that far from the red line.Kaseys has a great beer selection and a decent setup for watching sports. There is not a ton of seating but I was able to find a table. They don't have food at the actual bar but you can order in takeout.

9.description: I typically do not give one stars out to establishments but I have no choice but to do so for Kasey's, and not because of the drinks but because of the service. My friends and I decided to check out this bar about a month ago based off the great reviews on yelp. When we first arrived we were slightly confused because there is the bar and then there are tables. Since there was a group of four of us we chose the tables. What made this process confusing was that we waited for several minutes but no one came to serve us, so we were not sure if we had to go up to the bar or wait an eternity to come serve us. That was more so awkward than a huge deal, we just went up to the bar and ordered. We loved the beer and the environment and were overall having a great time. Towards the end of our time there, we noticed that the table behind us was getting service but not us, but at this point we did not care. I asked the man (his name is Craig with a "C" as he later bluntly told me) for our check. When he arrived with the check, he had added my boyfriend and my bill with our friends' bill. When we asked about this, as we had all ordered separately he stated that it was easier for the bar to do so. This was perplexing to me especially because there were no signs around stating this was the policy. I asked Craig for a pen so I could circle who had what. Craig hastily stated that he could just be informed of how we wanted to split the bill. However, when I began to tell him he rolled his eyes and then requested we split the items. After a few minutes of attempting to remember and almost calculating whose was whose, Craig returned and ripped the check out of my friend's hand and stated that this was not "rocket science" and stormed off. When Craig returned, I asked to speak to the manager due to the unbelievable amount of disrespect he had now shown us and I was told that he was the manager that night! I asked him why he had been rude to us this entire time and he stated that he had not because he had only started serving us (giving away his awful service once again). Needless to say he continued to argue with me until I finally requested to speak with his boss. In the end he continued to make errors on the separation of the check and did not even give my friend his card back originally. Also Craig was taking shots behind the bar, which is absolutely unprofessional especially if you are the manager. Although I have not called his boss, I am writing about my experience here. It is truly a shame because the place was great but who wants to be treated like that?!

26.description: Great place to stop in for a beer. We got a flight for $10, great selection, great service.

25.description: Came in from out of town. Awesome atmosphere great staff! Really fun place to watch some hockey. Will be back for sure!

12.description: Our concierge recommended this neighborhood gem. Fun place for drinks. Knowledgeable bartenders.

59.description: If you are in the South Chicago Downtown area and it just happens to be a day when the Bears or the Bulls are playing, and you enjoy a great pub/local bar to watch some sports, then you need to head to Casey's.  It is old time with a great history.  It is Chicago in so many ways.  And great service too.

21.description: Great beer selection. Great atmosphere.  It's great bar that I would not mind going to on a week day or a chill night out.  I

17.description: Great neighborhood bar. Atmosphere is pleasant. Diverse beer menu. Something for everyone. Bartenders are pretty attentive, even when you sit at the back tables. They have chili and hot dogs during home Bears games, which, how can you say no to that?! They also have an outside area which is perfect during a sunny summer day with an ice cold beer.

10.description: The married people bar.On the weekends it's full of couples and geez are some of the female patrons more than a little territorial. "Is this seat taken" means can I sit at this bar since the only chair available is right here it doesn't mean a single woman wants to join your conversation. *shakes head*The staff at this bar are top notch. You can order from nearby restaurants and eat it in there, which is great.

5.description: I wish Yelp had a 3.5. Kasey's is a nice neighborhood joint with great beer selection, featuring many seasonal varieties. However, there is no waitstaff whatsoever. You must go to the bar for all drink orders. They have 1x bartender in the whole place on a Saturday night. When we went to order a drink we were told by another guy behind the bar that the bar ltender would be back soon and we would had to wait a few minutes. Why couldn't the guy behind the bar get us a drink or ring us up? Decent place, just awkward on the whole process of getting a drink lol

3.description: Great sports/ dive bar. Lots of beer on tap and and bottles. Kitchen was open late and frozen pizza is on the menu. Check out my picture for a better look at the joint.

35.description: A stand out among the bleakness of bars in the Printer's Row area. As a little girl, I've always dreamed about having a neighborhood bar that wasn't Applebee's (HAHAHA ok I'm done).

19.description: This place is great!  Good beer selection, low key hang, dog friendly.

28.description: My erstwhile favorite neighborhood bar (I live practically across the street) until I saw they charged me $3 per drink for "rocks"...otherwise known as ice...otherwise known as frozen water. That's just some NY $hit right there. I'll be going to First Draft around the corner on Clark St for my drinking in the neighborhood needs.

45.description: Great neighborhood bar with an extraordinary local beer selection.  Went here with a friend to order some flights and was given great recommendations from the bartender.  Super laid back neighborhood spot that I would definitely recommend trying if you are in the south loop area during the day looking for a quick beer or two.

33.description: They have flights and great descriptions for the beer. It's my favorite place to try something new.

43.description: Great bar in the south loop! The bartenders were super friendly and the drinks were good and didn't cost an arm and a leg, what more do you need?

2.description: This place is very cool! They are a neighborhood Chicago bar that offers a large beer selection. They have a small outdoor seating area, about 12 people can comfortably sit outside. They offer monthly beer specials, I noticed their website wasn't updated with the current beer special, so I did call the day I was visiting. The location is perfect! It's not on a busy street or near a train so you can really enjoy the outdoor sitting area.The only con is that they don't offer food. You can bring your own food, which is cool because there area ton of restaurants in the wreath at you can walk to or have delivered.If you are looking for an authentic Chicago bar where actual locals hang, I would definitely stop here!Im giving 4 stars and not 5 stars because they don't offer food, the outdoor section is very small & the website wasn't updated.

18.description: This is Chicago's version of Cheers! Great bartenders (Shelly!), good beer selection and a nice neighborhood vibe. OH and they allow dogs. Inside. It's amazing.

41.description: The married people bar.On the weekends it's full of couples and geez are some of the female patrons more than a little territorial. "Is this seat taken" means can I sit at this bar since the only chair available is right here it doesn't mean a single woman wants to join your conversation. *shakes head*The staff at this bar are top notch. You can order from nearby restaurants and eat it in there, which is great.

52.description: Beer, beer, beer. No food. But beer.

50.description: This little hole in the wall place is super impressive - so many unique and local beers on draft. I was pumped to see Deschutes Fresh Squeezed IPA, one of my new favorites! You can create your own flight and you can bet that's what I did. When I'm back in the area I will definitely return. They don't have food besides snacky stuff so if you want something to eat you can order from the place next door - their food is really good - burgers, sandwiches and salads. They deliver for a small fee but the food's hot and tasty. Also: extra points for allowing dogs. :) I love these cute places in Printer's Row.

4.description: I love this bar. It's divey, it's pretty big, and the drink prices are amazing. They have a jukebox with tons of good tunes and all sorts of different local and imported options. I went back twice during the same trip and was always treated fantastically. Will definitely be back.

6.description: One of my absolute favorite places to go for a drink close to home!! The perfect down to earth neighborhood bar vibe and down the street from a taco place (you can bring outside food and eat it here). Kasey's boasts a 4 page long beer list and Tank 7 on draft.. They'll always have my business

22.description: This bar has a wide variety of draft and bottle beers. The atmosphere is very chill, which made it a good place to unwind after a long day. The service was slow since the bar was busy and there was only one bartender working.

15.description: Fond memories. Love this place! Used to go way back when and the vibe is still great. Classic bar.

57.description: Kasey's was a decent enough place to stop in between the auto show and dinner a few weeks back.  When I planned a valentine's day of fun for me and the mister, I mis-calculated the amount of time we would want to spend at the auto show, and we were left with a few hours to kill before dinner.  Neither of us had been to the Printer's Row area before, but were happy to see a casual bar such as Kasey's to grab a few drinks before heading up the street to Sofi for dinner.I was impressed by the beer selection at Kasey's!  I was surprised by the fact that they did not serve their own food, but impressed with the fact that Hackney's will deliver to them, not bad!I had a few Crabbie's ginger beers, while my other half tried a few different somethings.  The bartender was nice and not pushy, and was also ready to go with suggestions when we were undecided on what to order.The atmosphere was a bit dark, but its a cool neighborhood place, you can tell there are a lot of regulars.

20.description: Visiting from Costa Rica, I went there avoiding touristy places. great decision. Nice beer selection plus good service. Felt like a regular at this place. Recommended.

36.description: It's like drinking at your friends house. With many many more varieties of beer on tap. Such a comfortable atmosphere, with laid back clients. Full bar, but beers are their forte. Prices are incredibly reasonable and bartenders are efficient and no nonsense.No food, but they'll let you bring it in.

14.description: This bar has a wide variety of draft and bottle beers. The atmosphere is very chill, which made it a good place to unwind after a long day. The service was slow since the bar was busy and there was only one bartender working.

3.description: Worst! How hard is it to cook a burger? Really? I mean it's not that hard. The guy at the grill is lost. I waited 20 minutes for a burger I didn't end up getting because he mixed my burger up with a guys turkey burger that was so raw that it was still clucking. It's not that hard. Meat, cheese, bacon and a stinking bun. I ain't even asking for special sauce. Also, check your receipts people. Walked out of the door paying $3 bucks for a 2 dollar fritter. I mean it's only a buck but 1 plus 1 is two. Not three. Get it chick at the register. Two days deep and your not making any fans. Finally checking out is a nightmare. You have to wander around the place like a chicken with your head cut off in order for someone to notice that you might be ready to pay for your over priced meal. Might have to wait a while before I roll back and partake in your establishment.

1.description: Open to tenants of the 440 S. LaSalle building and their guests.Stopped by for breakfast.  Fruit and yogurt bar, bagel bar, made to order omelet station, packed and ready to go meals, Ended up having a tradition breakfast.  Scrambled eggs (cracked right in front of me, pinch of course salt, cooked firm... perfection), and bacon, sausage links, sausage patty, and hash browns.  Nice that you can get it all A La Cart for less than $2 each.Today's breakfast special was banana bread French toast with Vermont maple syrup for only $3.99.  I only passed because I wasn't in the mood for sweet this morning.Lunch was the Hanger Steak sandwich. I went with the pretzel roll and provolone.  Steak was tender, and tasty. Sometimes I need to add something like A-1 but this was solid on its own.  With pretzel rolls you can sometimes get an overly tough or dry one that requires gallons of water to wash it down.  When you go this route you sometimes end up "tearing" off your bites. This sandwich was perfect.  Held together and didn't fall apart yet easy enough to eat and wasn't tough at all.  Bonus points for not cooking it well done.Additional items tried-Pizza 4 out of 5 stars- Sausasge was pretty good as it was a little spicey. My co-workers and I were suprised this cooks in only 4 minutes yet comes out plenty crispy.  Pretty much everyone plans on getting the pizza again.    ***** Thai Chicken Pizza special 5 out of 5.  If it wasn't for the sample I may not have thought      twice about this option.  The peanut sauce offered a rich flavor and the spice clinched in. The     large portion of fresh veggies (carrot, cucumber, green onion) was impressive for something that costs less than $6.  I would have taken pictures of it but was handing out samples before I got back to my desk :)Taco Pizza - 4.5 out of 5. Refried beans, choice of fresh tomato salsa or roasted green salsa.  I had both and the green had a nice light kick and lots of extra flavor.  Green is the way to go here.  Cheddar cheese and ground beef.  Then out of the oven finished with queso fresco and cilantro.    It would have been a 5 for me if it had black olives.  Worth a repeat visit for sure.-Buffalo Chicken Wrap 3 out of 5 stars - Maybe 4. This think was delicious and loaded with chicken.  It's just I wish it was freshly fried chicken then diced, sauced, and served.  I realized that would take more time but with how good this tasted with the breaded chicken being soft, I can imagine it would be a 5 out of 5 with freshly cooked chicken.-Meatball sandwich 4 out of 5 stars - 3 nice size meatballs with proper amounts of seasoning. I hate it when a meatball is JUST a ball of meat.  These had plenty of seasoning and the sauce that it was tossed in was full of flavor as well. Visable chunks of olive, garlic, and capers.-Roast Beef and Swiss sandwich 4 out of 5 stars - This had to be at least 1/4lb of roast beef. Nice size sandwich and a nice assortment of ripe veggies to choose from as toppings.  I went basic lettuce, tomato, onion with the horseradish sauce. $1 more added a nice large side of fresh fruit.-Gryos Pizza (daily special) 4 out of 5 stars. - I was brave here.  I love gyros, one of my favorite foods, but as a pizza?  Cheese pizza made with seasoned lamb topping and onions. After it comes out of the oven it was dressed with the Cucumbers and Tomatoes and Tzatziki sauce. Nice melody of flavors but the tomato sauce overpowered the fresh veggies a little bit.  Not bad but I might as for less sauce or olive oil brushed on instead next time. That and likely ask to pay for extra meat.  -Burger, 3 out of 5 -  I think the other reviews are being a bit harsh. The taste of the burger was good but yes, it shrinks too much. They are hand formed but after cooking they shrink together making a thick patty that doesn't even cover the bun fully.**Update. 4 out of 5 but ask to have the beef patty flattened so it's thinner and fills out the bun**-Sweet BBQ Chicken Quesadilla. 2 ouf of 5 stars - Sweet is correct, no real spice hear.  Was hoping for a more falvorful chicken, like blackened or marinated.  Appeard to just be diced grilled chicken.  Very messy once the sauce was added.  A fork and knife meal.  It won't hold together eating it with your hands.

2.description: Absolutely Horrible!!!! Complete rip off. I got a burger, it started out a nice size, by the time it was done cooking it was the size of a white castle hamburger. it's about 1/4 the size of the bun, burnt, all of the seasoning was plopped into one spot in the middle of the burger so i had a massive bite of salt!! The fries are god awful, no flavor, no salt. I'm severely disappointed. I've also had the flavorless terribly dry pizza and a sandwich from the deli. Save your money go some place else. You want good cafateria food go across the street to the board of trade basement and visit cellars. At lease if you pay 10.00 for something the food is well worth the cost.

5.description: The prices have gone up 25% since they have opened a month ago while my salary has gone up 1% in a year. PUT A FOURK IN ME. I'M DONE!

6.description: I like the pizza station. Something new every day. A lot of food for not a lot of money.

0.description: I have yet to be disappointed.  The food and service is excellent. They do a seafood "catch of the day" (which actually changes only weekly) one week it was an ocean trout, which was beautifully prepared and served either over greens or as a sandwich for 8.99, I have not found a place nearby that would serve a comparable salmon/trout dish for less than 14.00. Today's chef special was a coriander crusted lamb tenderloin, with glazed baby root vegetables and a potato pave, which I think is just a fancy way of saying escalloped potatoes.  It also was 8.99 and the presentation was something out of a magazine.  Seriously, have a waiter bring that plate to me, and I am happy to pay well over 20 bucks for some of that!They have made to order pizzas, which look beautiful and run only 6.79.  Some sandwiches can be ordered with a standard amount of meats, or you can choose to beef it up for a small up-charge. If they continue to offer this quality of food, at these prices, I will continue to come back almost every day.

4.description: I love this place and eat here almost every day.  Make your own omelette with a lot of fresh vegies for breakfast.  Banana bread and pancakes were great. For lunch I have gotten the made to order grilled salmon and turkey burger and chicken sandwhich.  I thought the burger was a little on the small side but not nearly as small as Tony D.  I think they fixed that problem.  The Pizza is DELICIOUS.  The sandwiches are very fresh and high quality meat.  I thought the carvery sandwiches were a little light, then I found out you can order it city style and it comes with double the meat for $1.5 more. Fresh salad bar. Coffee and smoothies are great.

58.description: We came here for a coworker's birthday lunch, and it was quite empty. It looks like mostly all high top table seating here. The tables have a storage area underneath that holds the menu which is really neat. We were probably the first table here, and there were a few other people that came after. I felt like service was a little slow still given that there was 1 server/bartender. She did refill our water once, but I could have used another glass. It also took a little bit to get our bill. We were only a group of 6 so I'm not sure how they would have handle this as sometimes our group gets to be around 12 people or so. The food here though is really good. I really liked the fried chicken sandwich and fried brussel sprouts that I had. The other food items looked pretty delicious too. I might not really dine in again, but definitely would come for a pick up order.

56.description: This became our go-to spot while staying in the south loop.  Great beer selection, free snacks late night, and the food we ordered one night was also delicious.  You won't find a better bar in this area.

29.description: One of my favorite places to eat in South Loop.  Don't be scared by the sports theme, the kitchen is better than anywhere in a 1 mile radius!  I cannot remember life before porksicles, you have changed me forever. Also, the fried chicken sandwich is nothing less than a work of art.  Not a beer drinker, but their selection is A+ and will satisfy the most selective of connoisseurs.Probably the best sports bar in the South Loop, and one of the best restaurants in the neighborhood, too.

42.description: Lively bar in the loop, decent selection of draught beers, and one of the few open bars on a Monday night past midnight.  Did not eat here but will give it a try next time I am in Chicago.

23.description: The best bar in the South Loop, and one of my favorite bars in all of Chicago. So many beer choices, constantly changing out every week or two. It's a new menu every time I come here (which is pretty often especially during winter). Food is good as well, but my five stars goes to the beer and the relaxing pub atmosphere this place has.

47.description: This is a great place all around.  We do not usually come to this part of Chicago when we visit, and I am glad we did.  First Draft has a great atmosphere and character if you want a good bar to just sit and socialize or watch sports.  We came to also try some of the food, which looked very interesting (thank you reviewers!).  We had the Poutine among other things.  The food was fantastic but the Poutine was to die for, so that is what I remember most (and I eat mostly veggies).  The manager and bartenders are very friendly, great draft beer with a good selection.  I highly recommend if you are in the area.

8.description: I popped in here after a game at soldier field just based on the yelp ratings it got. So, thanks yelpers! This is a really fun bar! There are TVs everywhere, and on a Saturday night I didn't know where to look there were so many games happening at once. A host took our name down for a table which is better than most bars where you have to stake out and fight for a table. While we waited we grabbed a few beers. Bar was a good amount of people, but not people on top of you so it was fun but comfortable. There was a huge beer list to choose from, like several pages, but was surprisingly affordable with lots of beers in the $5-$6 range.Once we were seated, the waitress was super nice. We ended up ordering a few more beers and got the wings and brussel sprouts. The wings were very good, they fry them and grill them I guess so they have a good semi crunchy feel. I'd recommend the Chicago flavor, kind of a sweet bbq. The brussel sprouts were pretty good, but I dunno I thought they were pretty average contrary to popular yelp opinion. The waitress suggested Wisconsin spiggetes (spelling?) which are a fried cheese type thing, so you might wanna try that.I'd definitely recommend this place, especially if you are a sports fan. Friendly staff, cheap, good beer, good food, TVs everywhere : )

31.description: I love this place as my neighborhood bar around the corner. They have TONS of beer on tap and always give good suggestions (sometimes they let me try a sip before I commit to a whole glass). They have pretty good food too - some of my favorites are the South Loop Pizza, the Spinach salad with salmon, and a seasonal watermelon caprese salad they had this summer. It's small inside, so it gets crowded sometimes if you don't get there early.

34.description: Thanks Yelp. Some friends and I headed to Soldier Field to get tickets to the Bears Raiders game.  After getting there and seeing the ticket selection 2 of my friends decided to go to the game and me and another friend decided not to spend the extra cash so we grabbed a cab, opened yelp and found this sports bar right around the corner.  When we walked in it was not crazy busy and we were able to get a table in the center of the bar where we could comfortably see 5 different games.  This place has not only an extensive beer list but a very good whiskey menu as well.  I would recommend it if those are your drinks of choice.  We stuck to the beer as we were drinking for the long haul. I really like that their menu is broken up by styles and what is popular in the bar at the time. Also the beers are served in specific glasses for the style of beer which will enhance the flavor and experience.The only food item we tried were the fried cheese curds and they were pretty good.  Large curds with a heavy batter but it was suitable for the size of the curds.  Decent ranch but not spectacular.  If I end up in Chicago again this would probably be my Sunday sports bar of choice.

16.description: 64 beers on tap, good food and fair prices! I stumbled across this place on the beer menus app when I was looking out for a particular beer. I'm a beer geek and always looking for new places to go, especially on Blackhawks game nights since I go to most of the games and like to have a few beers and eat dinner before getting to the UC. I was able to park right in front (metered parking) at around 4pm on a Thursday. They had good specials for Blackhawks or Bulls game days and a lot of great craft beer at good prices. My wife and I shared the buffalo chicken sandwich which was very good. We substituted the mac & cheese for fries which was tasty. I'm not sure how long this place has been around but it's a great-looking bar and restaurant. Service at the bar was friendly and helpful. First Draft is a great alternative to Madison Street bars before games at the UC. We will definitely be back.

13.description: Thanks Yelp. Some friends and I headed to Soldier Field to get tickets to the Bears Raiders game.  After getting there and seeing the ticket selection 2 of my friends decided to go to the game and me and another friend decided not to spend the extra cash so we grabbed a cab, opened yelp and found this sports bar right around the corner.  When we walked in it was not crazy busy and we were able to get a table in the center of the bar where we could comfortably see 5 different games.  This place has not only an extensive beer list but a very good whiskey menu as well.  I would recommend it if those are your drinks of choice.  We stuck to the beer as we were drinking for the long haul. I really like that their menu is broken up by styles and what is popular in the bar at the time. Also the beers are served in specific glasses for the style of beer which will enhance the flavor and experience.The only food item we tried were the fried cheese curds and they were pretty good.  Large curds with a heavy batter but it was suitable for the size of the curds.  Decent ranch but not spectacular.  If I end up in Chicago again this would probably be my Sunday sports bar of choice.

11.description: Numerous reviewers seem to indicate that this place has the best draft list in Chicago. If that's truly the case then it doesn't speak well for Chicago, as where I'm from in SE Michigan there are a number of bars with more extensive lists. With that being said, the list here WAS quite solid and the prices were reasonable considering the location. I would not hesitate to drink here again. In fact, I drank here no less than three times during my recent weekend long trip to the Windy City.The service was always cordial and one late night bartender was extremely friendly. The kind of guy you could easily shoot the shit with all night if things were slow. I dug the decor as well. Kind of like an unpretentious sports bar with lots of hard woods a la a converted prefab Irish pub.I ordered some lunch one day of the food menu. The "first DRAFT". By the menu description I thought it was going to be some sort of BLT-like creation with a fried egg and beer cheese and some other over-indulgent crap on it. As soon as I ordered it the bartender asked how I wanted it cooked. Then it dawned on me I had just ordered a freaking 1/2 lb burger loaded with everything but the kitchen sink. It was pretty darned tasty but truthfully would have been better suited to the end of the night, too soak up the tail end of a bender, than it would have been as a lunchtime gut bomb. Duly noted for next time.

39.description: I made this place the Last Draft of the night after touring some other beer locations and having earlier dinner with friends.  This place in the South Loop has it going on.  The draft beer list is quite good.  They had some great Bell's limited edition and some seasonal Oktoberfest beers that were unique.  The location is pretty large with lots of seating and tables.  The staff are super friendly and efficient.  I will be back.

37.description: I was staying on Mich Ave and I always like to see what the area has to offer. I was walking around printer's row and found First Draft. They have a great selection of tap beers across all types. The food was very good, a simple burger & fries with a side of fried pickles. Definitely worth a try if you are in the area.

0.description: Fantastic neighborhood sports bar with food and drinks that will surprise you, (in a good way!)First Draft has a great vibe and definitely fits the south loop feel. I was amazed by the extensive beer list, especially the amount of beers on tap. There are also great selections of spirits to choose from.But don't miss out on the food, which is above average. And if you're there during a Hawks or Bulls game, it's half price pizzas and $4 beer specials.Mix all of this with a friendly, helpful staff and you've got yourself a winner.

38.description: So my boyfriend and I sort of found this place by accident. We were looking for lunch at a bar near a conference we were at, and we sort of went mostly based off of location. But wow did we get lucky! The bar looks really clean, it has a great vibe and they played good music. The waitress/bartender was super friendly and attentive! They had an amazing beer list and the bartender was knowledgeable about them to boot. Now on to the food... Which was delicious. I had the first draft burger, and let me tell you, that beer cheese is amazing! My boyfriend had the 34 Hanger steak sandwich, which he practically inhaled it was so good. I think the best part about the food was how well the burger and steak were cooked. We like our meat on the medium-rare to rare side and it's hard to find places that actually cook it like that, and First Draft certainly did! I would definitely recommend this place! It was the first place we went to eat at in Chicago and it definitely started the trip off right!

51.description: Love this place! Always friendly, good food and an OUTSTANDING Bourbon list. I'm not a big beer drinker but they have a great selection of beers on tap as well. I always discover some kind of beer I never knew I would like.  First Draft is everything a neighborhood bar should be, and the prices are also fair. I enjoy supporting neighborhood establishments & this has become one of my favorites.

27.description: Great beer selection, three floyds on tap. Tvs everywhere. Nice ambiance. Some of the best chicken wings I've had. Highly recommended.

32.description: Good spot. Easy walk from my hotel. Tons of beers on tap. Burger was really good. TV's everywhere. Good spot.

54.description: First of all, the service is abysmal. We waited 20 minutes after we ordered our drinks to order our food---meanwhile, our waitress went to another table at least 5 times while we sat and waited  The food is also very sub par. The fried pickles are pickle spears which is the worst. The pretzel bun I received was completely ripped in half so I had to eat my burger with a fork and knife! Everyone raves about the draft selection---two beers that I ordered were no longer served!It was just one thing after another here. Do not recommend. (Bus boy was lovely)

48.description: Good god, the beer selection here is amazing.I've had very little in the way of food from First Draft (though, both times I have gotten food, it was fantastic. Especially the squeakers, oh my god.) What primarily brings me out is the beer selection, which is one of the best that I've seen in the city. Was it worth waiting for them to open for a year? Yeah, definitely. (Though I just wish they had opened before I moved out of the dorm across the street, but alas. I'm sure my wallet's thankful that they didn't.)They have a truly mind boggling amount of draft beer on their menu in a wide variety of styles and will even mix beers for you (which I definitely recommend in some cases. They don't have Lagunitas's cappucino stout right now, but when they did, mixing it with a vanilla porter was my go-to if I didn't want to try something new). And really, it's nice to look at a beer menu and feel compelled to get something new every time, especially when there's such a variety.

44.description: First Draft has become a go-to of mine in the South Loop (after the gym, after anything at Soldier Field). I've been here a bunch of the past couple of months and I can now confirm that the food is pretty good (specifically the Turkey Burger).  Also, the service is always good here. I dig it here.

24.description: I wish I didn't have to leave a low star rating, but I always rate by the food I receive, not the service and experience. Feeling a little adventurous, I thought I'd try First Draft pizza seeing as it got some other positive reviews here. I ordered pickup and my pizza was ready in 30 minutes, awesome! Brought it home and opened it up, not really what I was expecting, but what matters is how it tastes. The best way to describe this pizza is an identity crisis. I ordered it with boar sausage and sopressata (dry cured salami). These toppings are something that I'd expect from a Neapolitan brick oven style. They have some pretty bold flavors that are enjoyable, perhaps better off the pizza. I have no other way to describe the crust, but reminiscent of Little Caesars, although made in-house. The sauce is pretty bland; it's mostly dry tomato paste with some seasoning. The cheese was undercooked. When all of the above is combined, it just simply did not work. Pizza aside, First Draft is a really enjoyable down-to-earth spot with a great beer selection and friendly staff. It is definitely the type of neighborhood bar that you'd take your friends when you're not sure where to watch a game or grab some brews. Perhaps their other offerings would be a go-to at a future visit. Next time I feel adventurous and want to try a new pizza joint, I will do just that.

7.description: ZOMBIE DUST, & SEASONAL HOPSLAM. Need I say more? This bar has a huge selection of around 60 draft beers.. The poutine is great. Three Floyds are some of the best beers out there right now and this place has a lot of them. I would definetly check it out if you are a beer snob, or if you are in the south loop! It is a little pricier than a normal frequenting bar, but it makes up for it in atmosphere, and great drinks! Give it a go!

49.description: This is a great place to go if you like craft beer and burgers. It is a popular bar in the area and can get crowded at times but still has a great atmosphere. Lots of TVs to watch games.

40.description: The food is delicious and the beer selection is top notch. The Chicago style wings are delicious. Very flavorful and well cooked. If you're like me and like to read at the bar on occasion, this is a good spot. The music isn't obnoxiously loud.

53.description: Great place.  They had a special for a burger and beer for $12. The waitress was a little off and did not explain the special until I asked.  She was new, did not know Stone was a U.S. Brewery, (I live about 40 min from Stone Brewery).  But the burger was done just right and the selection of local beers was great!Nice atmosphere. Well cared for local pub type good food.

30.description: Another visit, early Thursday afternoon, when the bar was very lightly patronized.  This time my lunch choice was a new item on the menu, cactus chili.  Ground beef, corn, and navy beans; the "cactus" part appeared to be not nopalito pads but rolled-up greenery which might have been taken for green onions, really more a garnish than a flavor element.  Mildly seasoned, with the spicery dominated by cumin rather than hot peppers.  Pretty tasty; I'd order it again.Onward to the beer.  I sampled six new items, including a flight of four samplers:- Saugatuck Neapolitan Milk Stout.  5.9%.  Opaque dark brown, light head.  Minimal nose, mostly bitter chocolate.  The taste is bitter chocolate, vanilla, and a definite strawberry note--certainly something I've never before encountered in a stout.  Creamy nitro mouth feel.- Three Floyds Lord Rear Admiral ESB.  6.4%.  Dark amber, light head.  Hoppy aroma.  Bittering hop taste, with a sour apricot note; long bitter fade.- Cahoots Brewing Amen Barleywine.  10%.  Cloudy red-brown, medium head.  Light nose with a hint of something fruity.  Malt-forward, bitter-chocolate and peach notes.  - Thr Bruery Autumn Maple.  10%.  Cloudy amber-bronze, light head.  Sweet, spicy nose, with just a touch of...chlorine???  In the style of a pumpkin seasonal, but actually brewed with yams rather than pumpkin among the fermentables.  I don't think that in a blind tasting my first reaction would have been "Ah, yes, yams," but, knowing they're there, I did detect (or imagine) a subtle difference from the familiar pumpkin.  Sweet pie-spice taste; I couldn't detect maple.- Crazy Mountain Lawyers, Guns and Money Barleywine.  10%.  Clear amber, light head.  "Cat pee" hop nose.  Good balance of sweet malt and bittering hops, with a slight salty note.  Less ethanol presence than the ABV figure would suggest.- Founders Devil Dancer.  12%.  A rather pretty red-amber, with a heavy head fading to "Belgian lace."  Ester and ethanol nose, with a bit of "fruit cocktail."  A solid malt base is nevertheless almost overwhelmed by intense bittering hops.  Here too ethanol is not as much of a flavor element as might be expected based on the wine-level ABV..

46.description: I love First Draft!  Food options are great, they always have my favorite beer available, and the atmosphere is perfect for watching your favorite sporting contest!The staff and service are very welcoming and will treat you like family.  Bartenders Chevrolet and Daniel are now my best friends.Amanda makes a mean watermelon vodka, definitely ask her for one the next time you're there!

1.description: My dad and I had a mixed experience here last evening. We arrived around 5:00 and found a half-full, welcoming space with plenty of room. We were offered a window seat and quickly got full menus, which boasted day-of specials for Bulls and Hawks games. Several TVs showed a variety of sporting events, and our high-top table was surprisingly roomy and comfortable. The bar filled up later, so I recommend grabbing a table before 6 on Friday nights.Our server was friendly but confused not only about when the specials happened (she wasn't aware there was a Bulls game that night) but which beers were offered at $4. We asked her to list them and she mentioned a few then vaguely pointed to our menus. Most of her sentences ended with sound effects. She seemed to infer that any 16oz beer would be offered at $4, so some of the ones I ended up ordering were full price. Not only that, they were served in 12oz glasses, which was confusing and disappointing.The food was worth our time, though. The honey-sriracha porksicles were tender and lovely with just the right amount of heat. Our salads were packed with spinach instead of what most restaurants do - iceberg - so they were a really great pick. And the pizza came out fresh and hot - they even modified it slightly so we could get the spicy condiment on only half!Overall, this is worth a try. Just do some hard-core investigating on the specials so you're not surprised when the bill comes.

55.description: Really bad customer service.. Barely said 2 words to me and my guest while I was there.

9.description: Between hitting the Art Institute and heading to Northerly Island for a concert, my boyfriend and I had several hours to kill. Normally we'd wander and see where we ended up, but it was pouring outside with no sign of stopping. We ducked under a construction awning and pulled up Yelp, and First Draft sounded like an excellent place to kill time.When we arrived, there were only a couple people at the bar and a large table full at the back, so we didn't feel like we needed to rush at any time to clear the table. We started with a couple of drinks and poutine - fries, beer gravy, queso, and brisket. The fries were a bit undercooked but the rest of the dish was tasty. We had another drink and chit-chatted and watched the ten TVs in our vicinity - this would be a great place to watch a game. After another hour or so we decided to put in our dinner order. My boyfriend built his own burger, and I went with the Southern Fried Chicken sandwich, subbing cheddar for American. Delicious. The chicken was moist, the cheddar melty, and the pickles crisp. The fries were much better this time, though I only ate a few due to my previous poutine gorge and being full from the large sandwich and drinks beforehand. Customer service at First Draft was great - our server was attentive but wasn't pushing us to order or move along. On our way, I flagged down a bus boy and asked if he could get us two large trash bags for the rain. He did, and they were a life-saver until we found ponchos (and, frankly, a boon even after - the poncho/garbage bag combo ended up being crucial). If you have time to kill, First Draft is first choice.

26.description: One of the most impressive tap-lists in the area.  Come in for a beer, and then plan to spend 30 minutes picking which one you want to actually have.

25.description: The manager contacted me and apologized about the inconvenience. I will try again soon.

12.description: Another visit, early Thursday afternoon, when the bar was very lightly patronized.  This time my lunch choice was a new item on the menu, cactus chili.  Ground beef, corn, and navy beans; the "cactus" part appeared to be not nopalito pads but rolled-up greenery which might have been taken for green onions, really more a garnish than a flavor element.  Mildly seasoned, with the spicery dominated by cumin rather than hot peppers.  Pretty tasty; I'd order it again.Onward to the beer.  I sampled six new items, including a flight of four samplers:- Saugatuck Neapolitan Milk Stout.  5.9%.  Opaque dark brown, light head.  Minimal nose, mostly bitter chocolate.  The taste is bitter chocolate, vanilla, and a definite strawberry note--certainly something I've never before encountered in a stout.  Creamy nitro mouth feel.- Three Floyds Lord Rear Admiral ESB.  6.4%.  Dark amber, light head.  Hoppy aroma.  Bittering hop taste, with a sour apricot note; long bitter fade.- Cahoots Brewing Amen Barleywine.  10%.  Cloudy red-brown, medium head.  Light nose with a hint of something fruity.  Malt-forward, bitter-chocolate and peach notes.  - Thr Bruery Autumn Maple.  10%.  Cloudy amber-bronze, light head.  Sweet, spicy nose, with just a touch of...chlorine???
