 In the style of a pumpkin seasonal, but actually brewed with yams rather than pumpkin among the fermentables.  I don't think that in a blind tasting my first reaction would have been "Ah, yes, yams," but, knowing they're there, I did detect (or imagine) a subtle difference from the familiar pumpkin.  Sweet pie-spice taste; I couldn't detect maple.- Crazy Mountain Lawyers, Guns and Money Barleywine.  10%.  Clear amber, light head.  "Cat pee" hop nose.  Good balance of sweet malt and bittering hops, with a slight salty note.  Less ethanol presence than the ABV figure would suggest.- Founders Devil Dancer.  12%.  A rather pretty red-amber, with a heavy head fading to "Belgian lace."  Ester and ethanol nose, with a bit of "fruit cocktail."  A solid malt base is nevertheless almost overwhelmed by intense bittering hops.  Here too ethanol is not as much of a flavor element as might be expected based on the wine-level ABV..

59.description: Great beer, whiskey and scotch selection! Service was great and the staff were really friendly. Just visiting Chicago but I love this place. The poutine fries was delicious!

21.description: Went here on a Monday night with my girlfriend. Half of their beers were not available and our waitress was nowhere to be found. After a while our mussels arrived and at least 20 percent of them were spoiled. The place has a charm and if their beers were available I'd recommend but my experience here was quite poor.

17.description: Great fried chicken sandwhich. The owner is great, as well as the staff. Adjacent parking lot. Great place to watch the game.  Fabulous beer selection.  Need I say more?

10.description: Visited here recently and we left very disappointed. My husband and I stopped in for a quick bite and a drink. It took about 20 minutes to get our first drink and an appetizer of hummus. Then, we waited almost an hour for our entrees, a sandwich and a salad. No one was really ordering food, and there wasn't much of a crowd, but all of a sudden four tables worth of food just come pouring out of the kitchen. Including one table that ordered their food maybe ten minutes before their food was delivered. To top it off, his sandwich was not cooked properly. Our waitress could tell we were disappointed and took it back. She came out abut five minutes later with a totally fresh sandwich. Not sure why it took an hour the first time. The manager was drinking at the bar. The servers and staff were sipping from Starbucks cups, standing around. And we never got a decent apology. It was our second time there after a very pleasant first trip. We won't be back and unfortunately this seems to be the case with several bars in the area: poor service and very overpriced bar food.

5.description: Great atmosphere, great staff and great beer/food!I loved the Brussels Sprouts and the Burgers are great.

3.description: What a great bar! I came here back in Nov 2015 for a quick lunch and a flight of good beer and I found both of them here. The beer selection is really great and they have a lot of dark, heavy, flavorful brews and I was quite impressed with the selection. My turkey sandwich was also very good and was a great compliment to the beer. The service was great and I would definitely recommend coming here if you like good beer!

35.description: Probably more like 3.5 stars. The beer selection was excellent.  The service was alright, there was only one person doing double duty handling tables and bartending.  We ordered burgers and pizza, the food was good but not amazing, the atmosphere is great, clean and a lot of televisions, definitely won't miss a game no matter where you sit.

19.description: We came here for drinks pre-dinner reservations to kill time, not expecting much. We definitely were surprised! Such a great little bar! Super great service and the bar food was amazing! We had fries and onion rings. The batter on the onion rings is top notch and the garlic aioli for dipping really sets them off. Try the vanilla bean Amber ale by pig minds brewing. Great little spot for snacks and drinks!

28.description: Great beer selection here covering just about all pallettes. Chicken wings were good, grilled after they were sauced so they were not soggy. Caesar dressing could use a little more lemon to cut the mayo base.I sat at the bar, which was the perfect place to watch a Blackhawk game. The bartenders, Amanda and Ashley rocked it, making great beer suggestions. I'll be back for the Stone Brewing event next week.

45.description: Four stars for huge beer list, knowledgeable staff, and beer cheese soup unlike any other.

33.description: This place has a great beer selection, really good food and for the sports fan an amazing array of screens that will allow you to never miss a moment of the excitement. I did have one mishap with my bill but the owners handle it and were more than awesome. This will be a spot ! frequent!!

43.description: I dare someone to try the Black Stout which contains 17% alcohol and you have to send me a pic(or it is not true) that you actually drank it and I WILL personally buy you 3 rounds of drinks and I'm by being sarcastic . Anyhow, the beer selection is quite enormous with many Local beers on tap, and they have Mikkeller beer which is a good highlight to have in tap. I have NOT tried the burgers but I hear good things about it but I figured one burger taste like any other burger but I will try it next time.I enjoy the theme of this tavern, big bar stools nice and clean bar and restaurant area. They have tvs to watch football/basketball/baseball and if any restaurant doesn't have a tv to watch sports they don't belong in Chicago... Plus Cubbies adding to World Series!

2.description: Stopped in here recently mainly because I was curious what happened to the "old Villains" space. The new owners stuck a sports bar in it and kept all the draft lines, adding some windows and removing the cheesy rock n' roll decor. Minor improvements, and they also put in a nice custom back bar. Service at the bar was a bit of a hassle. It took almost 20 minutes to get a drink when the bar was half empty. They were out of the first 2 beers I ordered, then weren't sure if I could order a beer smaller than a pint just to try it. After seeing a flight of beers on the bar, they remembered they do flights, so i'd have to order 4 beers at a time. I asked for 3 and a dealer's choice, which turned out to be Founders Project Pam, which was not good. Maybe they were new, i'll give the frazzled bartender the benefit of the doubt. Didn't try the food, but it looks like your average fried pub grub. The beer selection was good, and i'd return another time but my experience didn't make the greatest first impression. 3.5 stars.

18.description: Great beer selection here covering just about all pallettes. Chicken wings were good, grilled after they were sauced so they were not soggy. Caesar dressing could use a little more lemon to cut the mayo base.I sat at the bar, which was the perfect place to watch a Blackhawk game. The bartenders, Amanda and Ashley rocked it, making great beer suggestions. I'll be back for the Stone Brewing event next week.

41.description: This is my go to bar/restaurant at least once a week.  The staff is the best around.  Everyone who works at First Draft must have memorized the beer and food menu  because they are just THAT GOOD at giving  the best suggestions for the kind of drink or food one is in the mood for.  I'm always impressed with how fast the wait staff is considering the huge crowds that come in on big game days.  The bartending staff is beyond great!  They are the best.  The food is excellent which is hard to find at an establishment that has so many drink selections. I also find that even if it's crowded, the staff is very on top of the tables of people who are wrapping up soon and keeping the people waiting updated.  I've never had to wait more than 10 minutes on an extremely busy weekend to be seated.  Also a GREAT place to catch a game to watch.  They have an abundance of televisions.

52.description: Love this place. Its our after work hang out spot.  My friends love to come here because of the large variety of drinks that they have here.  I'm more of a foodie and I thought their food here was pretty delicious. So far I've tried the first draft burger, the chicken wings, fried pickles and the cheese curds. All delicious!  Service was good and they even allowed us to do separate checks for our group of 8.  They have specials on Tuesdays for half off chicken wings. Lots of TVs and good comfortable seating. I'm sure we will be back soon.

50.description: We ventured to this local establishment right around the corner from our hotel.  The place is small but loved the open doors along the south side of the building to allow the evening breeze to flow through.  Ordered the poutine and mac n cheese with bacon.  Both were flavorful and rich, but not over the top.  The beer selection is top notch.  Our waitress was super friendly and very knowledgeable about the beers being featured.  If you are a beer nerd or a foodie, definitely worth checking out!

4.description: We decided to hit up the First Draft on the way to the Bears game. Since we were staying in River North we decided it would be best to get a few drinks closer to the stadium. It is about 1.5 miles to the stadium but I wanted a good selection of craft beers and this place came up on yelp.It has an expansive list of craft beers that I have not had a chance to sample before so that made me happy and all at a good price.The food was good, but nothing spectacular as I had a fried chicken sandwich.If you are in the neighborhood and want good craft beer might as well check this place out.For more information and pictures check out our site : thegreatcubeescape.com

6.description: Came in here for a Sunday Morning BLoody mary and was treated to a good one. The place itself was clean and the large windows allowed for some great street watching. Why did i give this place 5 stars? Because the bartenders. 2 females behind the bar offered great conversation while we were there. i wish i could write more but like i said only stopped in for a Bloody Mary. Would recommend Sundays there if these ladies are behind the bar

22.description: Beer selection is great! Bartenders are friendly and quick. If you like social settings for sporting events, their tv layout is phenomenal. The only reason I am deducting a star is because the food is sub-par. I have eaten their twice and both times my food tastes like week old fry oil, that dirty taste is the worst.

15.description: This nice little cozy bar we found off Yelp!! It was our first time to downtown CHI and wanted something walkable (in the snow) from our hotel. Thanks to Yelp we found this perfect place. Everyone was friendly! OMG their poutine fries r to die for!!!! Totally would come back here if I'm ever in town. Btw they have 64+ beers on tap!!!

57.description: Great BLT and fries and great staff who helped me sort through their awesome brew selection!

20.description: I'd loved everything I've ordered here! It's in my neighborhood and I've gone in for casual dinners and ordered to-go- either way it is fantastic. I highly recommend the flatbreads!

36.description: Food was not tasty. The chicken in my sandwich was too hard, not sure if old or over fried. I asked them for a price adjustment because I couldn't eat a few parts of the chicken, and they gave me 10% discount off the sandwich, which came down to $1 decrease only! Otherwise it's a nice place with many screens and good service.

14.description: Great spot and great food. Been wanting to go here for a while and just got around to it tonight. Atmosphere was good and the beer list was more than anyone could ask for. There was a slight accident with our pizza (not the restaurants fault) and they made us a brand new one even though most of the other one was fine. They also have a really good special for when the Blackhawks and bills are playing!

28.description: Most horrible Starbucks customer service ever!Customer service stinks at this location! I asked for a drink (iced grande decaf non-fat latte), and this black medium height woman got it ALL wrong. I corrected her politely (and had to do it 3 times as she couldn't get it) so she responded: "I don't know what you want anymore" and threw her hands in the air. I don't mind walking another block or two, but this location will not get my business.Who hires crazy people like that to deal with customers face-to-face?! I have notified their corporate office about my horrible experience and hopefully something will be done.

1.description: This is a Starbucks, so I'm not going to bore you with details you can presume on your own. They get 4 stars for the simple fact that today, as I work on something that I find hard to concentrate on, they are playing BPM and I'm dancing in my seat. My thinking is clear and I'm fully productive. The volume is perfect, not too loud but also not so soft that I can hear what others are doing next to me. They would get 5 stars if the space was bigger, only one table where you don't have to share with others, otherwise you are at a stool. Thanks for the great music today guys!

39.description: This isn't about the company, this review is about this specific store and one of the guys that works there. I've worked for Starbucks for what seems to be a lifetime (almost 6 years). I have even worked at THIS store a few years back. I'm down in this area all the time because of school but I usually go to the one closer on Jackson and Wabash. I had some extra time before class started so I decided to check out the old store and reminisce. Bad idea. I ordered a Grande Soy Chai Tea Misto. My drink isn't that hard but I understand that it can be confused with a Chai tea latte. I said something when the Barista started putting in the Chai syrup instead of the tea bags. He apologized and told the other guy to ring me up while he made my correct drink. The guy that was ringing me up had the worst attitude. I'm almost positive he was high because the guy had to tell him several times what the drink was and he would just stare. I could tell he was having trouble figuring out what buttons to push so I said "it's a chai tea add soy". He gave me the look of death. Like "god forbid I tell him what to do." I handed him my card and when he gave it back to me, he threw it on the counter and walked away. ARE YOU SERIOUS!? You work at Starbucks buddy, you're not that cool. I will never come here again.

9.description: Barista pulls shot.... shortly later... "here's your double shot!"... "wait, but I ordered a triple shot"... "Oh, then, its a triple shot!".  HMMMMMM.....I should have known better... I'm not sure if I am more bitter about starbucks itself - or if the doubleshot that magically became a triple was just that bitter.I shall NEVER return... I'll sooner dive into the cal sag and take a gulp than ever come back to this place.

29.description: This Starbucks is pretty busy. Every time I go there's a line, but it moves pretty fast. Many employees taking care of customers, so that's a plus!

23.description: As a former Starbucks barista, I get what it feels like to have a line out the door and have the expectation of being a smiling, helpful employee behind the counter. This Starbucks gets it. They're insanely friendly (not in the fake way) and understand what it feels like to have a day that makes you feel like you've been run over by a bus. Regardless of when I go in, they are very prompt and my drinks always have the same delicious taste. Other Starbucks I've been to in the city don't have the same professionalism when it comes to the drink itself. The store manager at this location, or whomever the trainer is, has done a fabulous job at ensuring amazing store quality. Their Clover Brew preparation is also very accurate and ...of course, delicious. Compared to the other Clover store that's right down the street, this store is amazing. Outside of there never being enough chairs because of the traffic in the store itself, this is an amazing store.

5.description: Love this location! Great employees, and good drinks.

31.description: I am not a coffee drinker, but I do love coffee houses, because you can get something other than coffee and they are great places to just hang out or take a rest from your day. I went to this one during the Lit-Fest, and despite it being jam-packed, the service was great -- the staff was cheerful and pleasant. It was pretty hot the first day of the Lit-Fest, so Starbucks was a welcome site that day, indeed. I love that you can get a Frap with no sugar! Score! And then, they were handing out free samples of Via coffee with coupons on the street. Quite nice, indeed.

25.description: It's a Starbucks. For that I take away a star. I'm not a huge fan of their coffee: a bit bitter for my taste. And everything is over-priced. That being said, this particular shop is super-well run. The staff are friendly and helpful and things move quickly. It is small and seating is limitted. But if all you can find is a stool along a bar looking out the window, it's a busy corner and fine for people watching. You could do worse.

12.description: A solution:If you stop here during a random time of day, there will be tourists. Your process will be slowed down.If you stop here during morning rush, there will still be tourists, but the person who grabs the muffins and drip coffee will entertain their questions while you can expertly and quickly order your drink and go.#winning

37.description: Duuuuuuuuuuuude.Thissssss Sttttaaaaarrrrbbbuuuuucccckkkksssss isssss sooooooo slooowwww.Seriously. My more regularly-visited 'bucks on Lake and Jefferson knocks out my Americanos in like, under four minutes. This joint? More like seven if they don't forget to make it in the first place.

21.description: Its a very small store. If I go there on weekend, I cant get table for most time. but people here are very nice :)

16.description: after grabbing coffee here for a year i can finally say i've had enough. its an absolute shame because its incredibly convenient and i'm admittedly addicted to star bucks, but aquillia has made it impossible to be a patron. each and every time i've encountered her i have received the absolute most miserable customer service that i have ever experienced. the only way i can describe my experience with her is rotten. it's a shame because literally every other employee at this establishment is pleasant.i understand that people have bad days but she is consistently miserable. it's absolutely atrocious.

17.description: Its a very small store. If I go there on weekend, I cant get table for most time. but people here are very nice :)

10.description: I miss my neighborhood Starbucks!!I absolutely love the weekday morning staff, they're always so friendly, engaging, and they never mess up :PThey get super  busy but they get your order out quick. Miss you guys! Awesome staff and great location!

11.description: Never going here AGAIN. I have never received such an attitude from an entire staff! EVER. I have never wanted to leave a place as much as I did this place. The person who took my order did not say a word to me until she had to "$4.72" was all I was able to get out of her. The barista making the drinks was very close to mumbling what was ready and I could not quite understand him so I asked him when I heard my drink mumbled. I got a frown and a long drawn out "yeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeep"BAD ATTITUDES! ALL OF THEM!!

26.description: When it comes to Starbucks, you know what you're getting.  The menus at each franchise are just about identical, but there are distinct differences that make some branches more favorable than others.  This review is meant to reflect what makes this Starbucks unique more so than the company as a whole.This is my favorite Starbucks in the Loop.  For the true coffee fanatic, they offer Clover Brewed Starbucks Reserve coffees.  These are exceptional rare blends that cannot be purchased at most Starbucks franchises.  The Baristas competently handle this high-traffic location and make it all look easy.For frequent coffee drinkers, I also strongly recommend pursuing a Starbucks Gold Card if you do not already have one.  By simply reloading and reusing a gift card, you can easily reach Gold status.  By doing so you get free flavors, free soy milk, and a free drink after every 15.

27.description: 1. Nice BIG wood table seats at least 12 Starbucks fan.2. Great staff3. At least another 15 bar stools to work on high table against windowsgreat usage of space.

35.description: As of Monday, this Starbucks is closed for remodeling.  Watch for a new review once its back up and running!

8.description: This Starbucks is super tiny.  When there is a rush, the line is literally out the door!  It's not bad when it is warm out, but when it's cold the entire place fills with a sharp, icey gust whenever the door is opened.  There are not many places to sit, so I do not recommend coming here if you want to sit and enjoy a cup o' joe. There is a table in front of the door that seats six (coldest place to be here), a few barstools, and three small tables that will sit 1-2 people.The baristas here are hit or miss.  Some are extremely friendly and helpful, and some just don't know what's going on.  They don't really seem to work as a team here to fill orders when there is a long line.There's a very aggressive Streetwise vender who is usually standing by the front door, often opening it for people while asking for them to buy him stuff when they go in.  He starts cursing when turned down or ignored.  I know this isn't directly related to the Starbucks company, but it can make for an unpleasant trip to get coffee.

0.description: This Starbucks is honestly never too busy when I go in and the service is always friendly but very slow. Sometimes there's only one person behind the counter to take orders and make drinks so there might be a slight hold up, but usually when they get on drinks, they go flying out. They always have Coconut Milk in stock now since me going previously (twice) and them being out and having to give me a refund (which is very courteous). Overall very small Starbucks but very convenient especially with the order ahead option so you can swoop by while you're walking home or on your way out.

38.description: The people that work here are fantastic - so much so that I have to update this to a 5-star review.  I am one to respect great service and friendly attitudes, and this Starbucks has stepped up to the plate.

20.description: A solution:If you stop here during a random time of day, there will be tourists. Your process will be slowed down.If you stop here during morning rush, there will still be tourists, but the person who grabs the muffins and drip coffee will entertain their questions while you can expertly and quickly order your drink and go.#winning

19.description: It's a Starbucks so it's never bad. Its quite small but functional. The staff is fast and serviceable.

33.description: In this particular Starbuck you get a bunch of attitude with your coffee. They don't know how to grind coffee and when you ask for them to correct it, they roll their eyes and sigh audibly.  When you want to buy more than 2 cupcakes they frown and tell you that messes up their inventory. Go elsewhere if you have the choice.

2.description: This is a small, but very busy Starbucks in the South Loop. Like any Starbucks, they have blond, medium and bold  coffees. They offer all of the espresso drinks people are so fond of. (I stick to black, bold with nothing in it). And, they have the typical food selections that Starbucks has gotten into.They do have good service. The Baristas have always been pleasant when I've been there. The only downsides are it is small and there is little seating. Since it is fairly busy, it is not always easy to get a seat. And, there is one restroom only. Typically, there is a wait.I have never noticed a Clover machine, but see it referenced in other reviews. I will make sure to look for it next time I'm there.

34.description: This Starbucks is OK and my tea is always decent when I go here. But honestly, this needs to be called Kiddie Starbucks. Once the kids get out of school it takes forever to even get in the store, let alone order your drink. Between the baby strollers that's the size of a mini cooper and the book bags and cackling of already ultra hyped teens, this place is a zoo. I drink tea to relax and calm me but going here, I need a cup of coffee just to get in the store.

32.description: I live near this place, so it's MY Starbucks. I like it. The only way I would suggest for them to be improved is to have more space. It's a bit hard to enter there with my BOB stroller, especially when it's crowdy.But the baristas there are very sweet and friendly, I like them all.

18.description: Barista went absolutely out of her way to be amazing! The Starbucks new app was not working so I couldn't use my gift card to pay for a bag of coffee. Barista gave us the whole bag of coffee for FREE plus the other drinks we were getting. Love this place!

13.description: Ivan is the reason people started going to Starbucks. He makes this corporate store a local coffee shop!

4.description: Overpriced, undervalued.Barristas make no eye contact at any point when processing transactions. WiFi is 500kbps. Go to HERO if you're in the neighborhood and want good food and coffee.

24.description: In a nutshell - orders incorrectly filled on multiple (at least 10) occasions, inattentive, lackadaisical and rude staff.  Go somewhere else.In more detail - This is my first foray into Yelp writing.  If that makes you not trust me, that's fine; what I'd like it to reflect is that in general, I'm not a complaining person.  Most of the time I got to restaurants or coffee places and things go fine.  I do not nitpick, just place my order, usually enjoy it and move on with my life.Not so at the Starbucks at Dearborn and Harrison.I have been here about 15 times, having moved into the neighborhood a few months ago.  I would estimate that of those 15 times, on 10 of those occasions, they got my order wrong.  The biggest culprit is a middle-aged-ish white woman who seems every time to confront the register as though she has never used this device before in her life.  I have ordered the same drink nearly every time, and the price is different on nearly every occasion.Beyond the ordering process, at the barista end of things, seemingly random orders come up.  The Starbucks corporate procedure seems to call for the cashier and the barista orally repeating orders to one another.  I used to think this was annoying; after getting to see how this location works, I now understand the thinking behind the procedure.  When the order is wrong (and it usually is) I have no way of knowing that.  I therefore have to initiate a conversation with the barista each time, asking what the order is.  When it's wrong, he/she looks annoyed with me.  The drink costs more than $6, so I think I have the right to know I've gotten when I've ordered.  On a couple of occasions, it has taken the barista more than one try to get my order right.Furthermore - each time I am in there, there seems to be an attitude of "why hurry?"  In general, I don't mind this.  In fact, at many coffee shops, it seems fine, especially if the workers are friendly.  What these workers are generally doing, though, is not making friendly conversation but doing side-work they should clearly have time to do when no one is there (and this branch, except for weekend mornings, is never that crowded).  I've walked in on several occasions and it seemed as though my presence hadn't changed anything; they finish whatever they're doing before acknowledging me.  Again, I don't demand servitude, but I expect to be acknowledged.I'm sure this sounds grumpy, but I'm just trying to save you time and aggravation.  Walk over to one of the places that sell coffee on either Congress, State or Michigan.  There is a Caribou, a Panera, and probably another Starbucks inside the Barnes and Noble just up State.  Cafecito, on Congress, also makes espresso drinks.  Any of them will be better.

6.description: I recently moved into the area and this Starbucks is conveniently located next to my building. Very rarely do I have a bad experience at Starbucks. However, this location is operated with pure incompetence. The Baristas are very unfriendly and move at an extremely inefficient pace. But since this location is so close I've just learned to deal with the inefficiencies. However, today was the final straw. There was an indecisive family of three in front of me that was holding the line up. You know, the patrons that order the most difficult drinks and then stare at the pastries bar in pure confusion for another minute or two before placing an order for an overpriced donut. After standing in line for 5 minutes or so, I finally walked up and asked if anyone else could take my order as their were 5 baristas and only one cashier. One lady told me to stand back in line, which infuriated me. The manager comes out and yells, "get back in line sir!" We then exchanged some words and I walked out. I would expect this kind of service at the DMV, not a coffee establishment.

22.description: This starbucks is very close to where I live so I frequent the place.  I give it two stars instead of 1 because for being at such a busy location, I rarely see a line going out the door, coffee comes out quick, and they always have my favorite brew.  But this is not enough to keep me at a coffee shop.  As far as customer service goes, they are not even close to mediocre. I am rarely greeted with a smile which just makes me sad because I work in customer service and truly enjoy going places where I feel welcome.  Unfortunately, I don't feel a warm welcome at this starbucks.  I wish I did. The employees are rude and have an attitude problem.   And just a side note, my mother bought me the starbucks coffee mug for Christmas where I get free coffee all of January and I am just a little tired of this starbucks accusing me of coming in multiple times a day.  Um nope once again, it wasn't me. Apparently I have a twin.  I would love to find a coffee shop around here where I feel welcomed and can get to know the baristas a little more.

15.description: I do love the Pikes coffee Starbucks offers, one of the best black cup of coffee I have ever had, I really really can't stand the high maintenance customers that Starbucks attracts. I have waited in line for as long as 10-15 minutes just to get a Venti black coffee. This is not the fault of the staff, I lay the blame on the customers who think it's OK to tie up the baristas and cashier with some highly complicated coffee concoction for a pretentious palate they seem to own. I have walked out of this place on several occasions and settled for a 7/11 coffee across the street just because of the wait time I refuse to put up with on some days. This place would need about 20 people working behind the counter to keep the line moving with some of the idiotic orders I have witnessed.

7.description: When it comes to Starbucks, you know what you're getting.  The menus at each franchise are just about identical, but there are distinct differences that make some branches more favorable than others.  This review is meant to reflect what makes this Starbucks unique more so than the company as a whole.This is my favorite Starbucks in the Loop.  For the true coffee fanatic, they offer Clover Brewed Starbucks Reserve coffees.  These are exceptional rare blends that cannot be purchased at most Starbucks franchises.  The Baristas competently handle this high-traffic location and make it all look easy.For frequent coffee drinkers, I also strongly recommend pursuing a Starbucks Gold Card if you do not already have one.  By simply reloading and reusing a gift card, you can easily reach Gold status.  By doing so you get free flavors, free soy milk, and a free drink after every 15.

36.description: I cant believe I haven't reviewed this Starbucks yet. This is my GO TO Starbucks because#1 its close to my work place#2 they ALWAYS get my drink order rightWhat sucks is that they are usually busy so the wait can be a while, even though they are working as fast as they can. At least its good to know this Starbucks will never shut down. =)

30.description: So I have to preface this by saying I've recently relocated to Chicago from San Francisco and SF has great coffee places. That being said, this Starbucks is disappointing from even from a Starbucks point of view. - Location is small, even by San Francisco standards, and this is Chicago where everything in general seems to be bigger when it comes to sq. footage. - The service is a tad slow. It is a busy spot for its size but no where near as busy as other Starbucks I've been too and so I'm not sure why the service is a bit slow. - In the three times that I've gone in, they got a food item wrong and also a size of drink order wrong. - The workers are not very friendly or personable especially for a Starbucks.1 star - in a pinch, like when the heat index is 110 degrees, I will stop in to get something cold, no complaints there1 star - for the convenience to my apartment

3.description: Ah, the beans are burnt       Save the beans and burn a witch                 Go somewhere better

14.description: Always a pleasant experience at this location. The people who work here are extremely nice and welcoming. I haven't had a bad time here yet! 4/5 because it's very small. Better for passing through than sitting down!

58.description: Having been to the two locations in glenview and the now defunct wheeling location, I had to give the printer's row location a try.   I've come here several times for lunch and have not been disappointed.  The room is small, but the staff keep a good job turning tables, and I've rarely had to wait long to be seated.    Additionally the seats at the bar are apt and they have a great selection of rotating drafts on tap.  The menu is a bit limited compared to the other locations, but they still have a wide variety of HackneyBurger's and you really don't need to look much farther than those. Highlights:-onion rings (like at all hacnkeys)-Chips (a good change from the fries)-inside out burger (if Guy Fieri likes it, then its good by me)-price (reasonable for the area and I always leave full)I'd recommend for anyone looking for a casual business lunch or a relaxing weekend lunch with family or friends.

56.description: I have never been disappointed when going to Hackney's.  They have a great dining atmosphere and their food is always delicious and wonderfully prepared.  Whether it's a burger or a salad, I have yet to have any issue with my meal.Their bar staff is also really knowledgable and willing to give any recommendations.

29.description: I walk by here every June during the Printers' Row festival. It has always struck me as a convivial spot, though I had never stopped in for a drink or one of the famous burgers as there has always been a crowd inside and spilling onto the patio. Yesterday I came here for happy hour after turning in a book at the library. I knew I didn't want to elbow my way to a crowded bar and be jostled, so Hackeny's delivered perfectly. There is a long list of beers on draft, available in various ounce pours. Feeling overwhelmed, and not just wanting to go with a standard Blue Moon, I ordered a glass of the daily drink special- a red wine sangria. It was a taste of summer  in a glass and I appreciated the maraschino cherry which reminded me of an adult version of a kiddie cocktail. I will certainly keep an eye on the specials. In fact when I sat down at the bar I noticed posters being put up advertising half-price burgers during Bears games- home or away- starting Sept. 13.

42.description: Quirky place.  Kind of weird, the colors and decor scream a Mexican place for taco Tuesday, but it's American food and beer.  Good beer menu!  Plenty of choices for all palates.I had the Kobe beef burger, it tasted great!  Good fries too! We were here for a rehearsal dinner, a small one (only about 7-9 ppl), but after the entrees were served our server was no where to be found.  The more the dinner went on, the more I felt neglected..

23.description: I am so grateful for this neighborhood restaurant/bar! The staff are so nice, friendly, and willing to go above and beyond to assure you are satisfied with your experience. My favorite aspect of Hackney's however is that they regularly change their craft beer selections on tap! In a city filled with several standard options depending on where you go, I enjoy having Hackney's to provide the experience to sample several beers without having to change location every time. I admit....i get excited to go in just to see what my new options are! Great idea! Thanks! Oh and the food is always delicious with great specials that change regularly! Highly recommend!

47.description: Excellent service and management. Had a slight issue with the cooking temp of a bison burger and manager quickly took care of the issue. Their signature onion dish is worth the hype, and their outdoor seating was nice. Will definitely be back because of the managers actions as well as the tasty food and chill atmosphere. Cheers to excellent customer service and food/atmosphere.

8.description: Went here with a friend on Sunday for lunch. Food is good, but not excellent. I ordered the bison burger with black beans on the side. It could have used a little more seasoning.  My buddy ordered the blue cheese burger.  He said it was good.The beer list here is good. I was lame and had Budweiser.  Service was also good.

31.description: Talk about a disappointment! Has Hackneys been taken over by McDonald's???? The burger was dry & tasteless & certainly not cooked-t-order! The fries were cold & the onion rings, which are usually a treat, were greasy!Hackney's is NOT the Hackney's of old. Never again...at least at this location!

34.description: The Bison burger here is delicious. I've ordered it on two different occasions and I would get it again, along with a few new items of course. They mashed potatoes are as smooth as silk and paired with the bison burger, pure perfection. Their salads are also great options that are large enough for a full meal. Definitely not side salad portions. Well done!

16.description: I love how every time we walk in it feels like a family! Even when it's busy the staff is still totally on their toes with everything.Bison burger is probably my favorite option and their candy cane pie is to die for. I give mad props to the the staff at this restaurant for making it a excellent experience every time.

13.description: Nice Americana food, good beer selection. My favorite is the inside out burger. Service is always nice, fast, and friendly. Im not a fan of the onion rings, but everything else on the menu has always been good. The have a nice outdoor seating area that is across the street from an impromptu dog park, so you can watch the south loop dogs run and play in the park if that's your thing.

11.description: I am so used to the Hackney's in the 'burbs I had no idea there was one in the city!  I came here with my mom and my aunt after exploring the city of the architecture tour.  I thought the food was decently good.  I had a chicken club sandwich that I enjoyed.  I also ordered a Blue Moon margarita which I thought could be some cool margarita made with blue moon beer.  Sounds interesting, right?  Wrong.  Although it was tasty it was just a margarita that was blue.

39.description: We had a birthday lunch here, and everyone seemed to have enjoyed their meal. Reservations were easily made and they pulled tables together pretty quickly to accommodate our group of 10. Our waitress was helping me narrow down my decision, and so I went with the meatloaf. It was good, but it didn't really blow me a way. It was solid, and the mashed potatoes were super buttery but good. You definitely have to order the onion loaf as they are well known for it here. The sweet potato fries were tasty as well. I would like to come back and try one of the burgers.

37.description: a very good place with a very friendly atmosphere and great food.  I really recommend the chicken club quesadilla which was tasty as all get out.  The Hackney Burger was fantastic.  It is flavorful and you add bacon and guacamole and you end up with one of the best tasting burgers I have had in quite awhile.  It is an excellent place to come to and unwind.  Very recommended!

0.description: Coat Hooks: NoAlso: the bar has a nice bump-out that's good for groups.

38.description: It's high time I wrote a review for this place considering I average coming here once a week for the past 3 years. I mean any place you do that for is worthy of a 5 star. I've tried a lot of the menu. My favorites are mesquite chicken salad, grown up Mac and cheese, New Mexico chicken melt, fried onion rings, egg breakfast sandwich (with avocado), hackney burger, Reuben egg rolls, chili...I think the list would be far smaller if I told you what not to get and really all that comes to mind is the Mexican breakfast skillet and quiche. Everything else is super solid and tasty that I've tried. Also good beer list!!Great place, good food, fun patio. Worth a trip...or 20.

51.description: This is a convenient spot to meet people after work. There is an $8 lot a couple blocks away and close to the Red Line. It's a small place with tables pretty close together so expect a wait if you show up after 6 o'clock on a Friday. We ordered some chips and guac to share. The Burger was nothing spectacular but definitely above average. I liked the heaping pile of seasoned fries that came on the side. Their beer list was extensive enough to please most everyone. It's a great location and I look forward to coming back when it is warm enough to sit outside.

27.description: We have been visiting Hackney's Printer Row location for the last 6 years since we moved to the South Loop.  The food is always great as well as the service. We are typically here at least once every couple weeks. Sometimes at peak times you can have 15-30 minute wait i. Service is very good, even when busy.  Have never been disappointed in any of the menu choices. (Go to is the pretzel burger!)

32.description: Nice Americana food, good beer selection. My favorite is the inside out burger. Service is always nice, fast, and friendly. Im not a fan of the onion rings, but everything else on the menu has always been good. The have a nice outdoor seating area that is across the street from an impromptu dog park, so you can watch the south loop dogs run and play in the park if that's your thing.

54.description: The whole experience was average at best. Service was nothing special, the guacamole average, and the $17 burger was bland. I won't be going back.

48.description: Good place  to chill out with friends and have a good time. Never feel overwhelmed. Not your typical bar or hang out in the city. Very relaxing especially when sitting outdoors in the summertime. I would definitely recommend coming here.

44.description: First time there tonight. I was very impressed. Extremely friendly hostesses and waiter. Food was hot and correct. Great experience. I almost was impressed enough to bother the manager and tell him/her how pleasant the meal was, but it was a Fri night and figured I'd do my part with a simple review. I'll be sure to tell others about this place! I'll be back!

24.description: Wonderful draft selection.  Really should have a 4.5.  The fries were perfect and the bison burger was made exactly the way I asked.  Seating outside made for a perfect night.  Our server was excellent and a lot of fun.  I wish I could remember his name but it was the first week in September.  John?  Everyone had a great time.  Looking forward to the next visit.

7.description: Good beers and drinks all around.  Food is standard American fare, and onion rings are to die for.

49.description: Love sitting at the bar but almost never go there because there only are 10 seats tops. The food is not very good (although a million times better than Flavo's Tacos but that is a hurdle my Irish grandmother who can't cook at all can clear) but the bar seems to attract a great mix of ages.

40.description: I was very pleasantly surprised by the beer list and the old world charm here.  They had a lot of local (midwest) brews on tap, some of which I hadn't heard of.  The service was great as well.  The only thing that was a tad disappointing was the burger that I ordered.  While it was delicious, it was supposed to be a bleu cheeseburger with bleu cheese inside.  I didn't taste the cheese at all.  So, if you order that burger, I guess ask for extra bleu cheese?  I just feel like you should be able to taste the cheese if it's in the very title of the meal.  Call me crazy.  I would for sure come back here and try another burger, though!

53.description: Good food -may be too loud for conversation. They had a live band that was pretty good too.

30.description: I am so used to the Hackney's in the 'burbs I had no idea there was one in the city!  I came here with my mom and my aunt after exploring the city of the architecture tour.  I thought the food was decently good.  I had a chicken club sandwich that I enjoyed.  I also ordered a Blue Moon margarita which I thought could be some cool margarita made with blue moon beer.  Sounds interesting, right?  Wrong.  Although it was tasty it was just a margarita that was blue.

46.description: The server forgot our appetizer, so we went without. The $15 dollar margarita pitcher came with limes on the glasses that were so dry, we couldn't get a drop of juice out of them. There were like 10 more lime slices in the pitcher, and overall the taste was too sour for my liking. BUT, there was plenty of tequila in there. My boyfriend said his pretzel bun tasted syrupy, but his burger was otherwise good. My buffalo chicken sandwich was fair. The fries were dope.Our second server (shift switch?) was pretty slow on bringing the check. There were WAY too many drunk middle aged women there...at 6 PM on a Sunday. We were forced to sit at the bar due to unavailable seating, so..that's kinda our fault I guess.

1.description: Great place in Printers' Row that has something most places in this neighborhood lack - a NEIGHBORHOOD vibe. We only came here for drinks, but loved the atmosphere, service, and they make a great dirty martini. Cheers

55.description: The last time I came here service was great, for a tiny overcrowded dining the waiters move with great finess. I ordered the hot chocolate which came in a mug and cinnamon stick, while my friend ordered a apple cider which she loved. Then I ordered the chicken club, I'm weird and ordered it with pretzel bun and not cut and they made it perfectly. I did this other weird thing (they must love me wink wink) and ordered appetizers after dinner because I'm so original(cue eye roll) and the cheese curds were probably tied for my favorite cheese curds next to curly's at lambeau field in Green Bay. (Don't ask, and go bears). Anyway he spilt the check without a hint of anything and we left smiling. I've been here before that and am here now waiting for a table, so yea great service great food.

9.description: Good place for a beer and meal. I think it is a little bit overpriced for what it is.

26.description: Ordered delivery from here. Food was extremely sub-par. I appreciated that they separated all the side items from the main meal but the quinoa was very bland and the 'Cajun turkey burger' was just a turkey burger covered in Cajun spices poured on top.

25.description: Went to Hackney's on a week night with a reservation at 6:30 through Open Table. There was seating available so I found that the reservation might not have been needed. However, the outside sidewalk seating area is always full. Our server was friendly and knowledgable of the menu and offered the beer of the month, which he described as an old school IPA with a smooth finish for $4; which was exactly how he described. We started off with the chicken quesadilla appetizer. It was probably the best quesadilla with an American bar food twist I've ever had. Very large and had caramelized onions and bacon on it. Something about it just worked with all the flavors cooked together. I ordered the Bleu Cheeseburger substituted with a pretzel bun. It was just slightly over cooked to my request for medium rare, but still had the juicy flavor I was looking for. My mom got the Reuben sandwich, and the corned beef was delicious. Very tender and melt in your mouth. Prices were pretty average, but well worth it for what we got. I will definitely be returning to Hackney's.

12.description: Wonderful draft selection.  Really should have a 4.5.  The fries were perfect and the bison burger was made exactly the way I asked.  Seating outside made for a perfect night.  Our server was excellent and a lot of fun.  I wish I could remember his name but it was the first week in September.  John?  Everyone had a great time.  Looking forward to the next visit.

59.description: This place is warm and cozy. Very inviting. Good for travelers and locals alike. I had the spinach strawberry salad and it was delish!  We brought our toddler and everyone was super nice!

21.description: First: regular food is solid. Reliable. Fine. Second: Dollar Pie Friday. They purport to offer a slice of pie for a dollar. What they're actually selling is about 1/4 of a slice for a dollar. But their ads show a whole slice and nothing says "mini slice of pie for a dollar!" And then when we asked the manager about it, she didn't particularly care. When we asked to have it taken off the bill because the ads weren't clear, she snatched our plates off the table and said, "Ok, then I'll take these." Soooo....go somewhere else.

17.description: JUST KEEP ON WALKING!We've dined at Hackney's Printers' Row many times over the years.Usually we order their turkey or beef burgers, which are good.Our last two visits (and literally our last) were awful and left our stomachs churning.A couple of months ago we ordered  fish and chips (for a change), which were described as lightly battered. Really? Not!The breading was thick and greasy.We needed a fishing pole and hook to find the fish under all that mess.Our last visit (12/21/15) was another awful meal.Ordered the guacamole and chips. The guacamole didn't taste fresh, although it is madein-house. It was beyond bland. Not even worth eating.Next came the chicken pot pie. It was the size of a large, shallow dinner plate.It was steaming hot, so it obviously had been microwaved (something I could do at home).The thin crust was rubbery and the inside was more like a watery chicken soup.Again, to bland to eat.What a waste of money.If all other restaurants are closed, go to Hackney's for a burger.

10.description: Great burger joint with a very nice beer selection in printers' row.  I thought they used to serve the burgers on rye bread but the last time I came here, they did not. A good neighborhood bar that gets packed And does not take reservations, but good for casual get togethers if you don't mind a bit of a wait.

5.description: This bar has a really fun staff, and pretty good food. The five star rating though doesn't come from the food, but the environment and I really enjoyed the staff. It's a great place to chill! They have a cookie skillet that is to die for!

3.description: Wonderful lunch. I had a carry out Mesquite salad and it was delicious. I kept telling myself that it was too much to eat the entire thing but I could not stop myself. Everything from the tortilla strips to the spicy ranch just worked so well together. I will most definitely be stopping in to try something a little more substantial soon.

35.description: My wife and I both had the inside out burger. They were delicious and cooked to perfection. We had four in our party and had to split up and sit at 2 tables due to the small, but cozy outdoor seating space. We will definitely come back

19.description: I usually love Hackneys but I have no idea went wrong today. I ordered delivery (right around the corner). The box came open and the fries were ice cold, the cold slaw was not covered and was just diced cabbage - ick!  I called because $19.00 for cold fries and unsanitary cabbage is a big rip-off. The person I spoke with said she was sorry and would be right over in 5 minutes to fix it.  Never showed up. What is going on with the establishment that I used to like so much???

28.description: I would talk in my review about the food, but after being sat outside (right in front of their main window) by the host we waited over 25 minutes for our waitress to come. She never did, so we left.

45.description: I ordered the strawberry salad with tilapia and the tilapia sandwich. My order was delivered within 30 minutes and everything was great! We had no complaints. The blackened tilapia in both meals were hot like we dined in. Will definitely be back.

33.description: We live in the South Loop, but haven't been to Hackney's in a few years.  Not sure why.  Anyway, decided to go one late afternoon recently.  Their food has always been a little hit or miss, but it was always our go to place for a great steak sandwich.  Unfortunately, that is no longer on the menu.  We were happy to see that the onion loaf was still on the menu and ordered a half.  However, it was not what we remembered.  The loaf was crispy on the outside and mushy and undercooked on the inside.  We could taste the grittiness of raw batter.  The onions themselves weren't very sweet either.  Needless to say, we didn't finish it.  My husband had the Hackney burger and I had the pretzel burger.  They were not under seasoned .... they weren't seasoned at all!  My husband said his bread was soggy.  My "pretzel" bread was not really pretzel bread.  It tasted more like regular bread that was scored to look like pretzel.  The best part of our meal was the fries.  So sad this neighborhood staple has gone downhill.  We won't be back.

43.description: Went here with a friend on Sunday for lunch. Food is good, but not excellent. I ordered the bison burger with black beans on the side. It could have used a little more seasoning.  My buddy ordered the blue cheese burger.  He said it was good.The beer list here is good. I was lame and had Budweiser.  Service was also good.

2.description: First: regular food is solid. Reliable. Fine. Second: Dollar Pie Friday. They purport to offer a slice of pie for a dollar. What they're actually selling is about 1/4 of a slice for a dollar. But their ads show a whole slice and nothing says "mini slice of pie for a dollar!" And then when we asked the manager about it, she didn't particularly care. When we asked to have it taken off the bill because the ads weren't clear, she snatched our plates off the table and said, "Ok, then I'll take these." Soooo....go somewhere else.

18.description: This is a charming neighborhood bar. The bartender was a nice guy who gave us lots of attention. The burgers are very tasty and my dad remarked that the fish had too much batter and not enough fish. The salads are ood, nothing earth-shattering so if you go - order the burgers or the grown-up mac and cheese because my mom loved it and she knows best.The dining room is a little tight but it has a friendly atmosphere.

41.description: Awesome awesome draft beer selection, great burgers, and the best onion rings (served as a giant brick on the plate straight out of the fryer). The menu from top to bottom is solid, from the southwest salad to the fish tacos. We have been going to the two Hackney's locations on Lake and Harms in the suburbs my whole life, and it's great to have the Printer's Row location so close by. The fries are actually better here than in the burbs. It never lets us down. Are there better places? Sure. But Hackney's always hits the spot and you'll always have a good time, and their consistency with regards to both the food and service ensures we go back over and over. Thanks!

52.description: Pretty good. The waitstaff were all so friendly. It's nice to see ppl who actually want to be at work! I got the grown-up Mac and cheese which wasn't too bad. My friend got the inside out burger and said it was really good! Their "famous" fried onions weren't all that great. A little burnt, actually. But I'd recommend this place to a friend!

50.description: You know I really was impressed by this place. It had a cozy family restaurant feel that i dont usually get in the city. So i really liked that. They had lots of options on the menu and beer options as well. Good food, good service, good prices.

4.description: Their Tuesday happy hour specials are crazy cheap!  Half price apps (great guacamole) and $3 for all of their 12oz beers.  Goose Island Barleywine for $3, yes sir!  I'll be back!

6.description: MMMMMmmm.. sometimes, you just gotta have a good greasy meal.  I ordered some battered french fries and wow... they were incredible. Best I think I have ever tasted~! Top that with some ranch dressing and well.. YOU'RE IN HEAVEN.  Not THIS last visit, but a previous visit, I enjoyed a margarita (or 4) and they were pretty damn awesome as well. :)

22.description: This is a charming neighborhood bar. The bartender was a nice guy who gave us lots of attention. The burgers are very tasty and my dad remarked that the fish had too much batter and not enough fish. The salads are ood, nothing earth-shattering so if you go - order the burgers or the grown-up mac and cheese because my mom loved it and she knows best.The dining room is a little tight but it has a friendly atmosphere.

15.description: It's high time I wrote a review for this place considering I average coming here once a week for the past 3 years. I mean any place you do that for is worthy of a 5 star. I've tried a lot of the menu. My favorites are mesquite chicken salad, grown up Mac and cheese, New Mexico chicken melt, fried onion rings, egg breakfast sandwich (with avocado), hackney burger, Reuben egg rolls, chili...I think the list would be far smaller if I told you what not to get and really all that comes to mind is the Mexican breakfast skillet and quiche. Everything else is super solid and tasty that I've tried. Also good beer list!!Great place, good food, fun patio. Worth a trip...or 20.

57.description: I love this place. The food, staff, and atmosphere is really relaxed and nice. It's perfect for a date night or going to catch up with friends. It's about a block from where I live and it's definitely my go-to restaurant. Best part is, it isn't overpriced like SO many places in the loop.

20.description: This place is so cute. I love sitting outside when the weather is nice, and they have heaters on the patio for when it's chilly. I don't eat beef, but the black bean burger is amazing. It's so tasty!!! Good beer selection, and the staff is always attentive. This is a favorite spot in Printers Row. Everyone is always raving about the burger on the pretzel bun.

36.description: I was torn between 4 or 5 stars, but I have to give it 5 because of the VEGAN chocolate cake. Happy dance!!!

14.description: We had a birthday lunch here, and everyone seemed to have enjoyed their meal. Reservations were easily made and they pulled tables together pretty quickly to accommodate our group of 10. Our waitress was helping me narrow down my decision, and so I went with the meatloaf. It was good, but it didn't really blow me a way. It was solid, and the mashed potatoes were super buttery but good. You definitely have to order the onion loaf as they are well known for it here. The sweet potato fries were tasty as well. I would like to come back and try one of the burgers.

28.description: It's a little like walking into someone's clubhouse.  The liquid I tried was good. The customer experience was a little juvenile but decently friendly.  There are better shops close by. Just my opinion.

1.description: Friendly guy working behind the counter!  I forgot my ecig at home while in Chicago for vacation. They helped me out getting set up with everything I need to make it through the week!  Prices were reasonable.  Thank you!

39.description: Stopped in here the other day to pick up a vape set up and some ejuices.  Had a lovely time chatting and trying a bunch of the flavors.  Everybody was really nice and helpful, I'll definitely be coming back :)

9.description: 5 stars for the knowledgeable staff, the abundance of flavor testers, and being extemely dog friendly!

29.description: Bought an ecig from them and have repeatedly gone back for different flavors. I highly reccommend this place. They are knowledgeable and friendly even to a beginner!

23.description: I've been to many different vape shops (with lots of bad experiences) and I definitely got the most help here. I was looking for a new set up and had many questions, Mike helped me out and got me the perfect set up. Id recommend this spot to anyone needing info and quality products.

5.description: Extremely friendly staff, very helpful. Good selection, and finally found what I was looking for. Thanks guys!

31.description: Was referred from a friend to this shop.  After reading many reviews, I wasnt really sure what to expect.  My first visit was ok.  Although they staff was more interested in unloading boxes and chit chatting with other guests and workers, they finally got around to me after about a 10 minute wait in a pretty empty store.  That said, the gentleman who helped me, walked me through all the different types of pens they had and what would be best for what I was looking for.  I got my pen and my juice and I was on my way. I have been into the printers row store on numerous occasions and honestly I have never really felt welcomed when I walk into the store. First and foremost, the store is run by obvious stoners that are completely pre-occupied with how many smoke rings they can blow with their vaporizers.  And when you walk in to purchase something, its as if you are taking them away from their fun.  Ask them a question about something you are unsure about and they look at you like you are a moron.  Very uncomfortable experience overall.  I had gone back a half dozen times, each time hoping for a better experience and unfortunately it has only gotten worse.I refuse to give them another penny and have found several other shops, while a bit less convenient to get to, that offer a much better overall experience.To Smoque i say Meh... there is better places to get stuff out there.

25.description: Super chill place that I would 100% just go to to hang out, great people working there (who spontaneously dance I guess) and buying there, has an N64 hangout spot (KILLER INSTINCT? SOLD) and the employee Ross is super helpful, knowledgeable, and nice.Not to mention he's incredibly attractive.WINK WINK

12.description: I was relatively new to vaping with oils so I tried many places. I found that they have the best flavors, the best customer service and the most inviting atmosphere. They walk you through everything. You can try all the products before you buy it.  And can I say again how good their customer service is!  This will be the only place I go.

37.description: Love this place, always great help... I'm new to the vaping and they're always there to explain everything... At first thought the prices of liquid were a bit high, then ordered liquid online at multiple sites and nothing compares... Plus it's downtown, have to expect prices to be a bit higher! Won't go anywhere else again!

21.description: Ross is the man! Nicest guy and he helped me out with a new set up and showed me how to use everything. Environment was comfortable and they all really know their stuff.

16.description: Not too shabby, friendly helpful staff I even brought  friends in to get them started on vaping instead of cigarettes. Good to see a neighborhood Vape shop this helpful and convenient.

17.description: My boyfriend left his vape pen in an Uber while in town. We found this shop and we were really impressed with the service and selection. Ross was great!

10.description: My new favorite vape shop . My brother took me yesterday and I only had intended to only buy some juice and walked out with a whole new and better kit than I had . Ross was great and unlike most vape shops I've been to he was actually happy to help us . He also took the time to set up my brand new e-cigarette . The juice selection was awesome and they had flavors that were omg great , i will be back there soon

11.description: I'm a newbie to vaping so coming to Smoque I went in blindly. One of the employees, Ross, sat with me for an hour just to make sure I got exactly what I was looking for. Not to mention their amazing flavored they make themselves. I am definitely going to be a regular!

26.description: I always have a good experience coming here to get my usual favorite flavor juices. Recently I decided to upgrade my vape equipment and Ross walked me through the different units, did demonstrations, and got me all set up while answering my questions. Great service and I'm very happy with the new unit! Will definitely be back and would recommend Smoque to anyone.

27.description: Past reviewers stated that they felt unwelcomed, it's like walking into a clubhouse full of stoners.  They are spot on.  This shop operates like a hangout rather than a business.  Employees tries to ignore you as long as possible and when they finally do get you they have a serious attitude.  I am taking my business elsewhere.

35.description: I walked in without knowing anything about E-Cigs and the person, Mike, working there took the time to explain and demonstrate everything carefully and thoroughly with me.  I bought a kit with a bottle of juice and I felt it wad reasonable.  It is everything I had hoped for.  Outstanding service and product, I'm glad I found them.

8.description: Sales person was nice, but pushy. It was hard to find something simple. They talk in jargon and up sell you to something more complicated. Fine for the 26 year old hipsters who work there but not for everyone. The whole place has an attitude about it that rubbed me the wrong way.

0.description: I accompanied a friend in this store and asked a few questions about the product and a few things that were on the news.The sales assistants in this place are top friggin notch! They give honest answers and advised customers on their products based on what was needed not what was the coolest gadget.Besides the sales associates, I liked the fact that they sell products that help people to stop smoking gradually. I'm not a smoker, but my friends are very happy with their new e-cigarettes.

38.description: This is a great store for a starter or a veteran on the vape movement. I went in there to get a starter kit and some E Juice and walked out below $60 with a decent set up and 2 flavors. They have a wide variety of flavors that you can sample in shop before you buy. GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE - I was having issues with mine (twice) and they helped me out both times no questions asked. they have made a customer for life (as long as I love in this city)I highly recommend.

20.description: Very knowledgable staff. Great liquids. Very cool place to try liquids or just to hang out. Great service, pleasant atmosphere, friendly as well. I've got some pretty high standards and this place definitely met them with their liquid with everything.

19.description: Was here about 2 weeks ago and this shop is a cool laid back spot. Im completely new to vaping but Ross hooked me up. One of the coolest dudes you'll ever meet. Very knowledgeable and helpful. Comfortable and relaxing atmosphere and of course I gotta mention the throwback N64 lol. Will most definitely be back to try out new flavors.

33.description: Summary: Great customer service + decent prices.I visited here upon recommendation from my friend.1. Great experience when purchasing my first vaporizerBeing a noob and all, the staff were very patient with my questions. I was invited to check out all the flavors at the little flavor lounge area. I took me a while to pick my favorite flavor (cheesecake) and we provided to talk about the vaporizer itself. They were not pushy at all about trying to selling you the most expensive devices. They took time to figure out what I wanted and my budget. (Bigger battery vs smaller one, size of tanks, etc)2. Follow up visits were great/ Staff is coolI dropped by a few times after the initial visit to ask more questions/ buy more e-juice. They were always very friendly and helpful. Sasha is cool and very approachable. Stephanie is kind and also cool. The staff in general is pretty laid back and chill. I like the vibe the shop and staff exhibits.3. Great pricesI did simple price matches online and their prices are actually cheaper than a lot of online websites. It's unbelievable. I don't mind paying a little more just to support local businesses but their prices are already lower than online websites. You also can't beat the face to face customer service Smoque Vapours provide.4. Chill environmentThe decor is cool and you will usually see people just hanging out in the shop trying out flavors or simply just chatting.Support the local businesses!

2.description: I have been using e-cigarettes for about 2 years now - typically the ones that look like actual cigarettes with the rechargeable batteries and replaceable cartridges.  I decided that I wanted to trade up and get something better.  I googled places and found Smoque Vapours at 537 S Dearborn.  I went down there after work to check it out and found a very casual, inviting atmosphere.I was helped by Xalia, who walked me through everything, helped me make a decision, and let me try out some of their flavors.  She was extremely nice and helpful!  After I made my purchase, she worked with me to get everything right.  She explained how my new product would work and how I would need to maintain it.  She even assisted me over the phone the following day when I forgot something she had originally told me.  I am satisfied with all aspects of the service I received there, especially the friendly and knowledgable help I got from Xalia.  She answered all of my questions and made me feel extremely welcome despite not having much experience with these kinds of products.  I look forward to visiting them in the future!

34.description: Excellence in everything. Sure, you can beat their prices in outlying areas, but you can't beat the service and knowledge. Convenience in the city might cost a little more, but I'm good again. My aerotank bottom, apparently aero controller, snapped off. I had it pressed back on but couldn't vape at all. My coil died in the process, as well. Stopped in for help, again, and like always I leave happy. Bought more coils but they'll get used.

32.description: Love love love this store. I go all the time, they're super nice and tell me how to figure out my ecig because I don't know anything. They've really taught me a lot. I've never had a negative experience, and the flavor options are amazing. Great place...

18.description: Summary: Great customer service + decent prices.I visited here upon recommendation from my friend.1. Great experience when purchasing my first vaporizerBeing a noob and all, the staff were very patient with my questions. I was invited to check out all the flavors at the little flavor lounge area. I took me a while to pick my favorite flavor (cheesecake) and we provided to talk about the vaporizer itself. They were not pushy at all about trying to selling you the most expensive devices. They took time to figure out what I wanted and my budget. (Bigger battery vs smaller one, size of tanks, etc)2. Follow up visits were great/ Staff is coolI dropped by a few times after the initial visit to ask more questions/ buy more e-juice. They were always very friendly and helpful. Sasha is cool and very approachable. Stephanie is kind and also cool. The staff in general is pretty laid back and chill. I like the vibe the shop and staff exhibits.3. Great pricesI did simple price matches online and their prices are actually cheaper than a lot of online websites. It's unbelievable. I don't mind paying a little more just to support local businesses but their prices are already lower than online websites. You also can't beat the face to face customer service Smoque Vapours provide.4. Chill environmentThe decor is cool and you will usually see people just hanging out in the shop trying out flavors or simply just chatting.Support the local businesses!

41.description: Wow, what an awesome experience.  I am a very new person curious about the PV/Mod culture, I bought my first mod ever yesterday ( Provari Mini with Protank II ) and was disappointed with the ejuices I bought from the place I bought it from, so I searched google for 'vape' shops that sell juice near my work, and I found Smoque.The store is small but doesn't need to be any bigger.  The person working, Jared, was extremely helpful and told me all about the flavors that he personally creates in their  lab.  These flavors are miles better than the ones I bought from the other store.  Hearing how they are made, what they are made with and everything makes it that much more special.  I'm very satisfied with my curiosity and going through with such an expensive purchase of a Provari, I think this is gonna be a hobby I come to enjoy for many years to come.  I'll be hitting up Smoque regularly from now on.You can sample every single flavor, and some of them are just amazing.  Rootbeer was the one I was after, but I'll probably be picking up one of each over the next few months.

13.description: Ross gives the best advice to anyone that wants to learn about vapes. He know about new and older mods and can recommend the best device for the inevisual needs of a person.

4.description: Mike was very nice. Wasn't judgemental when I told him my "life story."  Pretty chill vibe with the regular crowd hanging out. Would recommend.

24.description: I really don't know what's up with the negative reviews here - it seems like the things that other people didn't like were the exact things that make me want to come to this place over and over again! First off all, when you walk into the place, it's less like a 'store' and more like you've just been invited to hang out at a friends house. I walked in and was immediately invited to have a seat on the couch and try the flavor selection, which by the way was amazing! They make their own liquids, and they have a nice selection to choose from. The strawberry cheesecake was my favorite followed by sweetyhearts as a close second. They allowed me to sit there as long as I wanted; there was never any pressure to buy or to hurry and finish trying the flavors. They would come over periodically to see if I had any questions and to see how I liked the product and offer suggestions. Ross was the main person helping me that day, and I must say that his customer service skills are impeccable. He was attentive from the time I walked in until I walked out (and I probably was there a good hour and a half). He helped me choose flavors and helped me select a new device (which took some time considering I'm a newbie to the vaping community and had lots of questions). He even assembled it for me once I purchased it. I will definitely be a repeat customer of Smoque, and would even just go back to chill and vape sometime.

6.description: One of the best vape shops I've been to in a while. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable. The entire shop's vibe is calming and inviting (extra points for an N64 running smash bros.). Have and will be coming here during my stay in Chicago.

22.description: Was here about 2 weeks ago and this shop is a cool laid back spot. Im completely new to vaping but Ross hooked me up. One of the coolest dudes you'll ever meet. Very knowledgeable and helpful. Comfortable and relaxing atmosphere and of course I gotta mention the throwback N64 lol. Will most definitely be back to try out new flavors.

15.description: The people were nice but the product was not entirely to my liking which is not their fault because I picked out the flavors, I would try again when I'm back in Chicago though.

40.description: Glad to have them in the SoLo! The staff & owner are friendly and knowledgable about their products.

7.description: Great flavor of e juice, Ross was fabulous the first time. This second time was a much less rewarding experience the girl seemed to have no knowledge of the juices or flavor profile and basically walked away with a have at it yourself attitude.  The cherry on top was mike the manager who had a atank attitude and basically told me u could leave without anything when I asked him to correct ms. Checkout girls error.  I will have to drive up north as proximity does not erase poor service

36.description: I went here since I work nearby and I had been ordering all my stuff online and was getting kinda fed up with waiting and not finding the same quality I was used to from the place in my old city. I dropped in one day to get something random, I can't even remember what I needed. Maybe coils?I got the stuff I needed in a pinch and went back home with a business card and a small chat with the person working. A couple weeks later I broke my battery and my back up is an old piece of junk. So I went in and picked up a battery, but then thought I should try some juice since I had the time and wanted to try another flavor. So I picked up a couple bottles of this and that and went home. Well, when I got home, the bottles I was given were wrong. I called the store immediately. After talking to them, they said I could bring it back so about a few days later when I was back in the neighborhood I stopped in. They exchanged it and gave me a little sample bottle. Awesome! Definitely wasn't expected but it was a great gesture. They'll have repeat business from me and the juice that I got that I originally wanted (haha) was fantastic and rich. Some of the best stuff I've had.

30.description: Love this shop. I'm glad that there is a place that is excited about their own products and isn't just hyping some bad juice and cheap mods. The e juice here is phenomenal and the amount of time that the staff takes to stop and explain every last detail to everyone that walks in is impressive. Vaping has become a hobby for me and I'm glad the staff can reciprocate that. Joining the forum of actual physical social interaction can be intimidating, but I found the staff here very accommodating to any concerns I had.  My all day vape last month was Peach Pineapple from their Drip LIne, couldn't get enough of it.

3.description: Awesome shop. The guys are super helpful and the prices are great. I'm going to love my new mod. Defenetally stop in and check out this shop, it's worth it.

14.description: Super chill place that I would 100% just go to to hang out, great people working there (who spontaneously dance I guess) and buying there, has an N64 hangout spot (KILLER INSTINCT? SOLD) and the employee Ross is super helpful, knowledgeable, and nice.Not to mention he's incredibly attractive.WINK WINK
